<SOS> active glucocorticoids gcs such as cortisol or corticosterone are a prerequisite for the induction of surfactant synthesis in the fetal lung <EOS>
<SOS> in fetal serum biologically inactive metabolites cortisone or 11 dehydrocorticosterone outweigh the active forms <EOS>
<SOS> in this study we demonstrate with organoid cultures of fetal rat lungs that the reductive side of 11 hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase 11 hsd regulates the intracellular activation of gcs <EOS>
<SOS> the inhibition of 11 hsd by the licorice extract glycyrrhetinic acid completely inhibits this central metabolism <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand gcs induce the reductive activity of 11 hsd and therefore they increase their own activation by positive feedback <EOS>
<SOS> in a community sample of <NUM> eldery aged <NUM> years and older from east and west germany diseases contacts with general practitioners and specialists the use of medicine attitudes regarding health and illness the subjective health psychic problems social support social integration social burden and socio demographic variables were assessed <EOS>
<SOS> based on these data the determinants for the contact of physicians and the use of medicine were analyzed <EOS>
<SOS> the results confirmed the frequency of multimorbidity in the elderly on average we found three different diseases at the same time for each person <EOS>
<SOS> in nearly 10 of the sample we found seven diagnoses existing at the same time <EOS>

<SOS> 55 8 took at least one medicine each day <EOS>
<SOS> the number of diseases existing at the same time was the most determining variable for the contact of physicians and the use of medicine <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore the elderly had more contact with physicians and took more medicine if they thought they were susceptible to diseases in a high degree and if they rated their own health as poor <EOS>
<SOS> fewer contacts with physicians and a lower use of medicine were found in those elderly that rated health behavior as little useful that had low control beliefs regarding their own health and that experienced only a low degree of health related limitations in their everyday life <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore we found a higher use of medicine if there was little social support <EOS>
<SOS> there were no significant age related or sex related differences regarding the contact of practitioners or the use of medicine <EOS>
<SOS> inflammatory bowel diseases ibd crohn is disease ulcerative colitis are chronic inflammatory and frequently relapsing diseases of the gut that ultimately lead to destruction of the intestinal tissue <EOS>
<SOS> recent evidence suggests that a pathologic activation of the mucosal immune system in response to antigens is a key factor in the pathogenesis of ibd <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore changes in cell migration and cytokine production appear to contribute to the perpetuation of ibd and the postoperative recurrence of crohn is disease <EOS>
<SOS> based on recent advances in our understanding of the pathogenesis of ibd several new therapeutic strategies are currently being tested in clinical practice including recombinant anti inflammatory cytokines ifn il 10 il 11 and inhibitors of cell adhesion molecules icam proinflammatory cytokines tnf il 12 and their receptors tnf il 6r <EOS>
<SOS> dysregulation of apoptosis may play a major role in the pathogenesis of systemic lupus erythematosus sle <EOS>
<SOS> a defective clearance of apoptotic cells or inappropriately high rates of apoptosis may lead to a pathologic accumulation of abnormal cell material with a secondary autoimmune response <EOS>
<SOS> experimental findings in apoptotic keratinocytes and c1q knock out mice suggest an important role of c1q in the clearance of apoptotic cell material <EOS>
<SOS> in addition there are several links between c1q and sle most the patients with c1q deficiency develop a sle like syndrome <EOS>
<SOS> sle itself often causes secondary c1q deficiency and autoantibodies to c1q are detected in almost all patients with active lupus nephritis <EOS>
<SOS> these observations suggest a central role of c1q in apoptosis and in the pathogenesis of sle <EOS>

<SOS> the benefits of biofix rods and screws are a reduction in costs since no secondary operation is needed prevention of stress shielding and thereby diminishing the risk of bone porosity <EOS>

<SOS> at the same time functional results were evaluated following the criteria of olerud and molander <EOS>
<SOS> two patients were withdrawn from the trial for non medical reasons <EOS>
<SOS> 22 patients 12 from the biofix group <NUM> from the ao group operated two or more years ago were contacted to see if any complications had occured since they were last seen <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> cases a biofix screw broke down just beneath the head during insertion <EOS>
<SOS> this did not result in an insufficient fixation of the fracture <EOS>
<SOS> there were no early post operative complications <EOS>
<SOS> the functional and rontgenological results in both groups were equal <EOS>

<SOS> there is however a possibility of development of tissue reaction to the resorbable material <EOS>
<SOS> in current textbooks of dermatology lichen amyloidosus is said to be a papular intensely pruritic type of amyloidosis of unknown aetiology <EOS>
<SOS> when this concept was developed there was no way of discriminating between the different types of amyloid <EOS>
<SOS> it is now known that amyloid in lichen amyloidosus is not derived from immunoglobulins or serum proteins as it is in systemic amyloidoses but from keratin peptides of necrotic keratinocytes <EOS>
<SOS> even several years ago chronic scratching was invoked as a possible cause of damage to keratinocytes in lichen amyloidosus <EOS>
<SOS> in support of this hypothesis four cases are presented <EOS>
<SOS> apart from amyloid in the papillary layer all biopsy specimens revealed histopathological signs of chronic scratching epithelial hyperplasia with hypergranulosis and compact orthokeratosis coarse collagen in vertical streaks in the stratum papillare such as are also found in prurigo nodularis and lichen simplex chronicus <EOS>
<SOS> lichen amyloidosus is considered to be a variant of these conditions <EOS>
<SOS> just as in prurigo nodularis and lichen simplex chronicus pruritus seems to be the cause and not a symptom of the papular skin lesions <EOS>
<SOS> consequently treatment of lichen amyloidosus should not be directed at removing amyloid but at improving the pruritus <EOS>

<SOS> with the introduction of each new technique for registering eye movements the question arises concerning whether these provide a reliable and accurate alternative for the <NUM> diagnosis of labyrinthine dysfunction when compared to the most commonly used electro oculographic technique <EOS>
<SOS> to answer this question we compared mean slow phase velocity spv using three different recording techniques electro oculography eog video oculography vog and infra red oculography irog during four different types of examinations <EOS>
<SOS> the examinations were the eye target tracking test ett horizontal and vertical optokinetic nystagmus okn tests and the rotating chair test of the horizontal vestibulo ocular reflex hvor <EOS>
<SOS> for the ett tests the vog provided consistently higher mean spv values with low variance presumably because of the accuracy and stability of the calibration <EOS>
<SOS> for the horizontal okn and vor rotating chair tests no significant differences were found between the mean spv obtained with the different recording techniques although the irog recordings were associated with a larger variance <EOS>
<SOS> vertical okn mean spv was consistently lower with irog and vog techniques presumably because of non linearities and resolution limitations inherent in these techniques <EOS>
<SOS> these results indicate that the eog technique despite its disadvantages of noise time to apply and variability of calibration still provides an inexpensive reliable and accurate means of measuring slow phase eye movements <EOS>

<SOS> degenerative changes have been considered to be a cause for spontaneous quadriceps tendon rupture <EOS>
<SOS> aim of this study is to investigate the microvasculature of the quadriceps tendon by injection techniques and immunohistochemical methods antibodies against laminin with regard to the pathogenesis of tendon degeneration <EOS>
<SOS> the blood supply of the quadriceps tendon arises from descending branches of the lateral circumflex femoral artery by branches of the descending geniculate artery and by branches of the medial and lateral superior geniculate arteries <EOS>
<SOS> blood vessels penetrate the tendon from the surrounding connective tissue and anastomose with a longitudinally orientated intraligamentous network <EOS>
<SOS> compared to the surrounding synovial layer the amount of vessels in the tendon substance is greatly reduced <EOS>
<SOS> the distribution of blood vessels within the quadriceps tendon is not homogenous <EOS>
<SOS> the anterior or superficial part of the tendon has a complete vascular network that extends from the musculo tendinous junction to the patella <EOS>
<SOS> within the deep portion of the quadriceps tendon there is an oval shaped avascular area which measures app <EOS>
<SOS> 30 mm in length and app <EOS>
<SOS> within this area the immunohistochemical proof of laminin is negative <EOS>
<SOS> an explanation for the absence of blood vessels may be compressive stress caused by the patellar groove which serves as hypomochlion for the quadriceps tendon when the knee is flexed <EOS>
<SOS> the occurrence of an avascular zone within the deep layer of the tendon that is directed to the joint cavity may explain the frequency of degenerative changes in this region <EOS>

<SOS> lesions of the acetabular labrum should be treated by correcting the causes <EOS>
<SOS> in a steep acetabulum where the femoral head brings the acetabular labrum under tension and traction the acetabulum should be rotated by triple pelvic osteotomy to slightly overcorrected acetabular measurements <EOS>
<SOS> severely diminished acetabular and femoral anteversion can also lead to tears and impingement of the labrum <EOS>
<SOS> then rotation of the femoral neck and or rotations of the acetabulum by triple osteotomy to 15 20 <NUM> ° of anteversion are indicated <EOS>
<SOS> our triple osteotomy technique differs from that of others mainly in the ischial osteotomy <EOS>
<SOS> it is performed from the posterior approach between the sciatic notch next to the ischial spine and the obturator foramen and is directed 20 30 <NUM> ° anteriorly from the frontal coronal plane <EOS>
<SOS> the osteotomies therefore are placed close enough to the acetabulum to allow free rotation but they do not interfere with the circulation of the acetabulum and the ligaments between the sacrum and ischium are left in normal tension <EOS>
<SOS> our normal values of the acetabular position were tested by correlating the measurements with the absence of pain <EOS>
<SOS> the optimum is reached with a ce angle and a vca angle of 30 35 <NUM> ° an angle of the weight bearing zone of 5 to 5 <NUM> ° and a migration index of 10 15 <EOS>
<SOS> overcorrections again caused pain and should be avoided <EOS>

<SOS> heparin induced thrombocytopenia type ii hit type ii is an immunoglobulin mediated drug induced side effect for heparin treated patients with thromboembolic complications <EOS>
<SOS> with an incidence of 1 3 mortality of <NUM> it and permanent disability for another <NUM> is a clinically relevant disorder <EOS>
<SOS> with heparin treatment or prophylaxis frequent platelet count monitoring is necessary <EOS>
<SOS> with hit type ii the thrombocytopenia is often a harbinger of thromboembolic complications in the venous or arterial system <EOS>
<SOS> if hit type ii is suspected further heparin exposure is to be stopped immediately and another anticoagulant therapy should be started <EOS>
<SOS> the two anticoagulant options in germany are discussed <EOS>
<SOS> at the same time the diagnosis should be confirmed by laboratory testing including testing for cross reactivity with danaparoid <EOS>
<SOS> further therapy depends on the symptoms <EOS>
<SOS> in the case of clinical relevance of this disorder we should think about prophylaxis strict indications for perioperative prophylaxis only use of low molecular weight heparin lmwh for routine prophylaxis use of lmwh for thrombosis treatment and early change to cumarine <EOS>
<SOS> a patented low temperature polymerization method for methylmethacrylate mma infiltrated bone marrow biopsies is described it has been developed from our previous mma technique and is a patented procedure <EOS>
<SOS> differences from the previous method are 1 removal of stabilizer from the mma monomer before its application 2 the use of a different starter 3 avoidance of o2 influence during polymerization by means of vacuum exchange with n2 and 4 polymerisation in a water bath to draw off residual heat <EOS>
<SOS> after this procedure all immunohistochemical reactions are possible provided that the previous fixation is adequate <EOS>
<SOS> the effects of different fixatives are reviewed briefly without detailed analysis <EOS>
<SOS> technically this plastic embedding can be performed at least as rapidly as the classic paraffin embedding after decalcification <EOS>
<SOS> the advantages over the latter method are 1 the cells can be better differentiated because semi thin sections can be made 2 the immunoreactions can also be performed on the basis of semi thin sections which means they can be interpreted more easily 3 morphometric analyses yield more reliable results because of the constant thickness of sections 4 osteological examination of bone trabeculae especially the search for mineralisation deficiencies is possible 5 the plastic embedding procedure is less dependent on individual instabilities in the quality of performance of the staff members involved <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore it is worth mentioning that the costs for additional equipment necessary remain below dm 100 00 including an excellent microtome <EOS>

<SOS> nosocomial pneumonia is still a common problem especially in intubated and mechanically ventilated patients <EOS>
<SOS> the endotracheal tube contributes substantially to the pathogenesis of pneumonia in these patients because it facilitates microaspiration and impairs host defense <EOS>
<SOS> common nosocomial pathogens like pseudomonas aeruginosa are known to produce exopolysaccharides and generate a complex biofilm structure which allows adhesion to abiotic surfaces and protection against antibiotic action <EOS>
<SOS> multiple studies have identified bacterial biofilm on the inner lumen of endotracheal tubes which represents a permanent source of infectious material <EOS>
<SOS> endotracheal tubes removed from patients with ventilator associated pneumonia are covered more frequently with biofilm than those of uninfected controls <EOS>
<SOS> it remains unclear whether this represents a source of infection or contamination <EOS>
<SOS> bacterial biofilm however may play an important role in recurrent pulmonary infections of the intubated and mechanically ventilated patient <EOS>

<SOS> the deformity in severe spondylolisthesis consists of two components the parallel anterocaudad slip of the spondylolisthetic vertebra and its tilt into kyphotic malposition <EOS>
<SOS> the influence of the two components is very different the anterocaudad slippage has not much impact on the sagittal profile of the spine and is easily compensated for by a slight increase in lumbar lordosis <EOS>
<SOS> the kyphotic deformity has a high impact on trunk imbalance and the sagittal profile <EOS>
<SOS> there are two compensation mechanisms hyperlordosis of the lumbar spine to its anatomical extremes and if that is not sufficient verticalisation of the sacral bone performed by contracture of the hamstrings and uprighting of the pelvis around the hip joints <EOS>
<SOS> the latter mechanism is followed by functional disadvantages <EOS>
<SOS> therefore correction of the kyphosis of l5 may be considered during operative treatment if the lumbosacral kyphosis angle delta is less than <NUM> <NUM> ° and the sacral inclination less than <NUM> <NUM> ° <EOS>

<SOS> however the multitude of analytical methods for ct measurements described in the literature do not lend themselves readily to comparison thus it is difficult to identify a clear method of choice <EOS>
<SOS> not every ct measurement is better than a physical examination <EOS>
<SOS> evidence of reproducibility and accuracy is a prerequisite for useful interpretation of the results <EOS>
<SOS> up to this point in the literature there are only reference values for the ulm ct method <EOS>
<SOS> one alternative is the mr scan which avoids radiological risks but the reproducibility and accuracy of the mri method are not as good as for the ct method <EOS>
<SOS> another alternative is ultrasound where recent advances in the measurement of torsion and length of the lower extremities have proven competitive with or superior to the accuracy of mri <EOS>

<SOS> this method furthermore is increasingly being used in preoperative planning of leg deformities in adults <EOS>

<SOS> the waves could be recorded again immediately after the mean arterial pressure was increased from <NUM> to <NUM> mmhg <EOS>
<SOS> the oesophageal temperature had dropped by <NUM> ° c at this time <EOS>
<SOS> the 2 channel electroencephalogram eeg showed no irregularities during this time period <EOS>
<SOS> a bilateral reversible apparently blood pressure dependent loss of waves i and ii during arterial hypotension despite a normal eeg has to our knowledge not been previously described in the literature <EOS>
<SOS> the isolated loss of waves i and ii with maintenance of waves ii iv and v is unusual <EOS>
<SOS> the literature contains reports of acoustic neurinoma patients in whom only wave v could be recorded <EOS>
<SOS> this is regarded as an indication of continued impulse conduction despite the loss of waves i to iv <EOS>

<SOS> assuming anatomic peculiarities in the blood supply to the generators of the baep waves a stenosis of the basilar artery could be considered as the cause of the bilateral reversible loss of waves i and ii <EOS>
<SOS> another potential source could be the induced hypothermia but this does not seem very likely because the patient is temperature was <NUM> ° c lower at the return of the waves than at their loss <EOS>

<SOS> thirty one patients 7 female <NUM> male underwent a trapezius transfer between march <NUM> and december <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> the average age was <NUM> years range 18 46 years <EOS>
<SOS> we performed the operations using a modification of saha is technique <EOS>
<SOS> with the patient in lateral decubitus position and protection of the opposite plexus a sagital skin incision is the first step followed by the preparation of trapezius and deltoid muscle as well as the bony parts of the shoulder acromion clavicle scapular spine <EOS>
<SOS> the deltoid origin is cut from the lateral third of the clavicle the acromion and the lateral half of the scapular spine <EOS>
<SOS> the next step is transection of the root of the acromion and the lateral clavicle <EOS>
<SOS> after elevation of the remaining trapezius insertions from the clavicle and scapular spine the proximal humerus is exposured by splitting the partly detached deltoid muscle longitudinally <EOS>
<SOS> then the acromion fragment and humerus are prepared for the bone to bone contact <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> <NUM> ° of abduction the acromion fragment with its trapezius insertion is transferred and fixed to the humerus with two 4 5 mm screws <EOS>
<SOS> finally the deltoid is sutured on the top of the trapezius and the skin is closed over two suction drains <EOS>
<SOS> postoperatively we immobilize the operated arm in an abduction support for <NUM> weeks <EOS>
<SOS> the physiotherapy program starts on the first postoperative day with active training of elbow hand and fingers and electrostimulation of the transferred trapezius muscle <EOS>
<SOS> six weeks after the procedure we take an x ray and start with progressive adduction of the arm <EOS>
<SOS> the preoperative subluxation of the humeral head was abolished in all cases <EOS>
<SOS> we achieved an average increase of active abduction from <NUM> <NUM> ° range 0 45 <NUM> ° preoperatively to <NUM> <NUM> ° range <NUM> <NUM> ° 80 <NUM> ° <NUM> year after the operation the increase of forward flexion was from <NUM> <NUM> ° range <NUM> <NUM> ° 85 <NUM> ° to <NUM> <NUM> ° range <NUM> <NUM> ° 90 <NUM> ° <EOS>
<SOS> all patients were satisfied with the improvement of stability and function of the operated shoulder <EOS>
<SOS> finally we can conclude that the trapezius transfer for flail shoulder gives a satisfactory outcome regarding shoulder function and stability as well as the subjective situation of the patients <EOS>
<SOS> we analyzed psychiatric and criminological data from <NUM> arsonists <EOS>
<SOS> the following criticisms of the definition of pyromania according to dsm ii r and idc 10 seem appropriate <EOS>
<SOS> first the categoric exclusion of aggressive motives does not seem very promising since approximately one fourth of arsonists whose firesetting is based on motives quoted in dsm ii r may also have an aggressive motive <EOS>
<SOS> second icd 10 gives being drunk and alcoholism as a criterion for the exclusion of pyromania <EOS>
<SOS> this seems untenable since the behavior classed as pyromania is largely a product of alcohol misuse <EOS>
<SOS> repeated firesetting resulting from being fascinated by fire etc may be less a disturbance of impulse control but rather the manifestation of a psychoinfantilism which supported by alcohol abuse extends into older age <EOS>
<SOS> the mean age of such arsonists is slightly above <NUM> years <EOS>
<SOS> the tendency for relapses after imprisonment seems to be low this tendency probably decreases spontaneously in older age <EOS>
<SOS> the mean age of arsonists with aggressive motives is a little below <NUM> years those setting fire with suicidal motives have a mean age of 35 deluded arsonists have a mean age of <NUM> years <EOS>
<SOS> concrete sexual motives are relatively rare <EOS>
<SOS> approximately <NUM> of arsonists have a purely aggressive motive <EOS>
<SOS> retaliation is a rare cause however since most of them do not even know the victims <EOS>
<SOS> one third of these persons set the fire in their own homes <EOS>
<SOS> most arsonists show a personality disorder with insecurity and narcissism predominating <EOS>
<SOS> data on firesetting are to be treated with caution since two thirds of all cases are newer resolved one fourth of cases concern minors and in central europe arsonists with rational motives are hardly ever referred to psychiatrists <EOS>
<SOS> a normal ciliary beat frequency of ciliated cells is necessary for the mucociliary clearance of the nose and paranasal sinuses <EOS>
<SOS> an in vitro investigation was performed to eval uate the influence of topical corticosteroids and antihistamines on the ciliary beat frequency of human nasal mucosa <EOS>
<SOS> the nasal sprays examined contained the corticosteroids budesonide or fluticasone propionate and the topical antihistamines azelastine or levocabastine <EOS>
<SOS> all tests were performed on cell cultures of human nasal mucosa during constant conditions <EOS>
<SOS> three of the four nasal sprays tested contained benzalkonium chloride as preservative <EOS>
<SOS> an irreversible cessation of ciliary movement was observed in all cells exposed to nasal sprays containing benzalkonium chloride in a <NUM> per cent solution <EOS>
<SOS> the nasal spray containing budesonide was benzalkonium chloride free and caused minor but fully reversible decreases in ciliary beat frequency after <NUM> min <EOS>
<SOS> as benzalkonium chloride can cause complete standstill of ciliary beat frequency in vitro in human nasal mucosa we recommend that this preservative should not be used anymore in topical nasal medications <EOS>

<SOS> it is well known that alterations to the oral cavity caused by dental prostheses may affect speech articulation although influences on the voice are not assumed <EOS>
<SOS> in addition to the vocal fundamental frequency vibrations of the vocal chords generate overtones <EOS>
<SOS> through the shape of the larynx and the upper airway resonances and antiresonances are formed and in this way overtones are amplified to a variable extent <EOS>
<SOS> nozzle changes caused by a dental prosthesis in the oral cavity may possibly influence overtones but influences on the vocal fundamental frequency seem unlikely <EOS>
<SOS> the influence of dental prostheses on the voice is demonstrated in a patient who owned two different dental prostheses <EOS>
<SOS> the fundamental frequency rose by up to five semitones during speech and his vocal range increased by up to four semitones when a thin denture was used instead of a normal denture <EOS>
<SOS> when the position of the mandible was checked by intraoral needle point placement a more rostral position of the mandible was recorded with the thin denture than with the normal denture <EOS>
<SOS> sagittal magnetic resonance tomography imaging also showed that the larynx was in a more cranial position <EOS>
<SOS> this change was presumed to be due to an upward movement of the larynx induced by the tongue which itself was found to be in a more cranial position with the thin denture <EOS>
<SOS> in this situation increased tension of the laryngeal muscles were believed to induce a rise in fundamental frequency shifting the voice range toward higher frequencies <EOS>
<SOS> these findings show that dental prostheses can cause vocal changes in individual cases <EOS>
<SOS> the etiology of this occurrence is still not clear <EOS>
<SOS> its consequences however should be known to the dentist ent surgeon and phoniatrist if patients notice changes in their voice after having altered or replaced their dentures <EOS>

<SOS> a long curved clamp was then passed from each groin to draw the limbs of the graft into the femoral incision <EOS>
<SOS> the distal anastomosis was then performed conventionally <EOS>
<SOS> results the laparoscopic abf was performed successfully in <NUM> of <NUM> cases <EOS>
<SOS> three times a conversion to open surgery was requested <EOS>
<SOS> one patient developed respiratory insufficiency requiring prolonged treatment on the icu <EOS>
<SOS> mean operative time was <NUM> <NUM> min the aorta was crossclamped for <NUM> <NUM> min <EOS>

<SOS> at follow up after <NUM> <NUM> months <NUM> patients were examined noninvasively in the vascular laboratory <EOS>
<SOS> all grafts were patent and the ischemic symptoms had resolved in <NUM> patients <EOS>
<SOS> one patient with recurrent claudication had severe stenosis of the left distal anastomosis <EOS>

<SOS> the basic idea of the collaborative family health care is nothing new <EOS>
<SOS> it has its roots in the bio psycho social model of medicine developed by george engel in the u s a and it has a long tradition in the german psychosomatic medicine <EOS>
<SOS> at a time of basic changes in our health care system caused by cost considerations owing to the cutting back of resources it is important to note that collaborative family health care combines aspects of theoretical models and pragmatic action orientation <EOS>
<SOS> the basic is a systemic view of illness and health <EOS>
<SOS> the doctor patient dyad is in this view enlarged to a treatment triad composed of the therapist the patient and his family to be able to bundle the whole potential at disposal i e <EOS>
<SOS> the treatment motivation of the patient the support of the family and the expertize of the therapist <EOS>
<SOS> a lot of studies support the resource saving potential of coopertive methods <EOS>
<SOS> however their realization is not possible without considerable learning processes of physicians psychotherapists and other <NUM> professionals <EOS>
<SOS> a potential has to be mobilized which affects by no means only the costs <EOS>
<SOS> the collaborative family health care offers new challenges to the professional culture of psychotherapists and new chances for influencing the world of medical health care <EOS>
<SOS> at a time of obviously reduced professional solidarity the iniitiatives of cfhc offer a possibility for physicians patients and their relatives to reach contentment through cooperation <EOS>
<SOS> interested colleagues are invited to collaborate in the german section of the cfhc <EOS>

<SOS> to determine whether abnormal collagen metabolism is a characteristic of fibromyalgia we have analyzed collagen metabolites in the urine and serum of patients with fibromyalgia <EOS>
<SOS> methods the diagnosis of fibromyalgia was made according to the american college of rheumatology criteria <EOS>
<SOS> urine and serum were collected under standardized conditions from <NUM> patients and <NUM> age and sex matched controls <EOS>
<SOS> pyridinoline pyd and deoxypyridinoline dpyd which represent products of lysyl oxidase mediated cross linking in collagen and are indicators of connective tissue and bone degradation respectively were analyzed by ion paired and gradient hplc method with fluorescence detection hplc <EOS>
<SOS> levels of hydroxypyroline hyp a collagen turnover marker were also measured <EOS>
<SOS> the findings were related to creatinine levels and the pyd dpyd ratio determined <EOS>
<SOS> the pyd dpyd ratios in the urine and serum and the hyp in the urine were significantly lower in patients with fibromyalgia than in healthy controls <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion decreased levels of collagen cross linking may contribute to remodeling of the extracellular matrix and collagen deposition around the nerve fibers in fibromyalgia and contribute to the lower pain threshold at the tender points <EOS>
<SOS> analysis of altered collagen metabolism either by histologic examination on biopsy or preferably by hplc analysis of collagen metabolites in urine or serum may aid to understand more about the pathogenesis of fibromyalgia <EOS>

<SOS> during alv a desired alveolar ventilation of <NUM> ml kg kg min was preset <EOS>
<SOS> all other ventilatory parameters were determined by the alv controller according to the instantaneously measured respiratory parameters <EOS>
<SOS> positioning induced a reduction of compliance from <NUM> to <NUM> ml cm h2o the respiratory time constant shortened from <NUM> to <NUM> s whereas physiological dead space increased from <NUM> to <NUM> ml <EOS>
<SOS> on average the ventilatory parameters selected by the alv controller resembled very closely those used with cmv <EOS>
<SOS> however an adaptation to individual respiratory mechanics was clearly evident with alv <EOS>
<SOS> in conclusion we found that the effects of positioning for nephrectomy are minor and may give rise to problems only in patients with restrictive lung disease <EOS>

<SOS> diskussion wells syndrome is probably more common than believed and should be included in the differential diagnosis of urticarial morphea like and bullous eruptions in childhood <EOS>

<SOS> classical insight therapy derived from freud and `maternal holding therapy derived from balint winnicott and others are two contrasting treatment techniques in psychoanalysis <EOS>
<SOS> the authors believe that each of these two techniques presupposes specific philosophical basic assumptions about the nature of human beings <EOS>
<SOS> the position of freud is that of the basically traumatic character of human experience <EOS>
<SOS> the contra position of the object relation psychologists stipulates the priority of love in human experience <EOS>
<SOS> these assumptions seem to be more latent than overt guidelines of therapeutical techniques and therefore their reconstruction and reformulation have important implications for psychoanalytical therapy <EOS>

<SOS> from its origin to its death the human organism is submitted to functional material and morphological changes that are perceptible <EOS>
<SOS> these changes permit classifying an individual as young adult old active or infirm <EOS>
<SOS> but this estimation is not always correct <EOS>
<SOS> some appear younger some older than expected from their chronological age <EOS>
<SOS> but what is ageing and how can it be measured <EOS>
<SOS> for this so called markers or biological markers of ageing are used which are measurable indicators of ageing in live organisms <EOS>
<SOS> a description of the complexity the asynchronous course and the biological variety and variability of biological age is less successful with a single indicator than with the inclusion of several markers in a multi factorial measuring system in a so called test battery <EOS>

<SOS> transactional analysis berne 1958 in its original concepts was intended to help even lay people to understand personal structures and psychodynamic processes <EOS>
<SOS> this intention lead some of the following authors to superficiality and a happy go lucky perspective <EOS>
<SOS> others most of all european transactional analysts went back to the roots of the original contents and aims and showed that they offer great clinical relevance for the understanding and treatment of a variety of disturbances <EOS>
<SOS> this article will illustrate these aspects using the borderline syndrome as an example <EOS>
<SOS> the structural model of egostates serves to describe the borderline structure concepts of the frame of reference and the script as patterns for the development and maintenance of the pathology the concepts of transactions games symbioses and passivity as indicators for the stable instability of the relationships and devaluations and grandiosities as examples of defence patterns <EOS>
<SOS> practical ideas about the therapeutic contract as a basis of various working agreements about methods of decreasing anxiety in therapeutic processes and about contact and attachment as a substrate for corrective experiences a healing atmosphere and dedramatisation of the process follow <EOS>
<SOS> the article ends with transactional analytic considerations of transference counter transference and how to deal with regression processes <EOS>

<SOS> the disturbance of generalized cheerfulness serene calmness disorder is an illness which is often recognised very late <EOS>
<SOS> it is characterised by a uniformity of psychic experience in the face of circumstances which would otherwise give cause for depressiveness despair great anxiety self accusations or aggression directed against others <EOS>
<SOS> early diagnosis and specific therapy may decisively improve life quality of the patients and may also prevent detrimental individual and social long term consequences <EOS>
<SOS> disturbances of microcirculation in coronary artery disease can be seen in the presence of critical stenosis of epicardial coronary arteries as a result of endothelial dysfunction in the absence of significant stenosis or during recovery of ischaemic myocardium after successful angioplasty of stenosed or occluded coronary arteries <EOS>
<SOS> diagnostic methods are morphologic morphometric analyses measurement of the global coronary reserve measurement of the regional coronary microcirculation scintigraphy positron emission tomography and laboratory analysis of haemorheological alterations plasma erythrocytes leucocytes <EOS>

<SOS> neutrophils are activated after successful angioplasty in acute myocardial infarction and even after elective angioplasty when measured in the coronary sinus <EOS>

<SOS> intracytoplasmic injection of sperm icsi extracted from testicular tissue tese represents the only possibility for men with non obstructive azoospermia to father a child <EOS>
<SOS> icsi is also the only treatment for men with obstructive azoospermia if microsurgery is not possible or not successful <EOS>
<SOS> however approximately only every fifth treatment cycle leads to a pregnancy <EOS>
<SOS> thus in most cases several treatment cycles have to be performed to achieve a pregnancy and therefore testicular biopsies have to be taken several times <EOS>
<SOS> cryopreservation of testicular tissue offers the possibility to store testicular tissue for several treatment cycles of in vitro fertilization ivf and to detach surgical sperm retrieval in the man and infertility treatment in the woman ovarian stimulation ovum pick up embryo transfer <EOS>
<SOS> for the man cryopreservation offers the advantage that only one testicular biopsy has to be performed for diagnostic reasons and for sperm retrieval <EOS>
<SOS> the advantage for the women is that infertility treatment is started only if testicular histology confirms spermatids at least in the testicular tissue <EOS>
<SOS> the cumulative pregnancy rate of ivf icsi tese cycles can be increased by cryopreservation of supernumerary pronuclear stage oocytes and embryo transfer after thawing in successive cycles <EOS>

<SOS> in europe saprophytic pulmonary aspergillosis represents the only mycotic infection relevant for thoracic surgery <EOS>
<SOS> from the pathogenetic point of view it is a colonization of preexisting lung or pleural cavities following other severe pulmonary diseases <EOS>
<SOS> the incidence amounts to 0 4 among patients in a special hospital for pulmonary diseases <EOS>
<SOS> concerning this review the diagnosis is based on histologic examination for all <NUM> patients we operated on between <NUM> and <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> preoperative proof of the fungal infection remains difficult <EOS>
<SOS> the majority of patients 77 are male <EOS>
<SOS> there is a correlation between cigarette smoking and abuse of alcohol on the one hand and the incidence of the disease on the other hand <EOS>
<SOS> a higher incidence of saprophytic pulmonary aspergillosis was found for people working in agriculture in the building trade and in paper mills <EOS>
<SOS> pulmonary tuberculosis and pneumonia were present in the past history in 47 of the patients <EOS>
<SOS> usually the tentative diagnosis is based on chest x ray especially if hemoptysis is present <EOS>
<SOS> major hemoptysis is the most severe and most dangerous complication caused by aspergilloma <EOS>
<SOS> clinical presentation and chest x ray findings are non characteristic <EOS>
<SOS> nowadays the typical x ray of pulmonary aspergilloma almost always localized in the upper lobes became a rare finding <EOS>
<SOS> if an aspergillus infection is suspected serologic methods are reliable and sensitive <EOS>
<SOS> a surgical procedure is absolutely indicated in patients with major hemoptysis in their history in case of disease progression or indeterminate mass and in order to avoid fungal dissemination <EOS>
<SOS> if a saprophytic aspergillosis is suspected according to radiologic findings clinical examination and patient is social history an operation is justified <EOS>
<SOS> relative surgical indications are hepatotoxic and carcinogenic effects of the mycotoxins <EOS>
<SOS> the lobectomy if necessary carried out as pleuro lobectomy is the adequate resection in most patients 68 <EOS>
<SOS> however this operation is technically demanding and it usually requires a longer operating time as compared to lobectomies for other underlying diseases <EOS>
<SOS> peri and postoperative complications occur in 60 of resections for pulmonary aspergilloma <EOS>
<SOS> a higher incidence of postoperative complications was found for smaller resections like segmentectomies or wedge resections as compared to lobectomies <EOS>
<SOS> persistent pleural space problems connected with a prolonged stay in the hospital remains the main problem <EOS>
<SOS> it requires a primary or secondary thoracoplasty in a number of patients <EOS>
<SOS> the operative mortality rate is 3 <EOS>
<SOS> a systemic antifungal therapy is not an appropriate treatment for saprophytic pulmonary aspergillosis and can even cause specific complications <EOS>
<SOS> introduction postoperative delirium is a common psychic disturbance occurring acutely after various surgical procedures and typically presenting with a fluctuating course <EOS>
<SOS> these patients recovery takes longer <EOS>
<SOS> in this study we analyze the incidence of postoperative delirium in patients undergoing vascular surgery and try to identify risk factors for its development <EOS>
<SOS> methods patients undergoing elective arterial operations were included <EOS>
<SOS> their medical history the specific vascular diagnosis and operation performed the medication and laboratory data were monitored <EOS>
<SOS> additionally the patients were preoperatively interviewed by a psychiatrist <EOS>
<SOS> intraoperatively the drugs infusions possible transfusions blood gases and pressures were monitored as were the times of surgery and anesthesia <EOS>
<SOS> postoperatively patients were seen daily by the psychiatrist and the surgeon for at least <NUM> days <EOS>
<SOS> postoperative delirium was diagnosed according to dsm iv criteria and mild moderate and severe delirium were distinguished <EOS>
<SOS> results fifty four patients entered the study <EOS>
<SOS> twenty one 38 9 developed postoperative delirium 11 mild <NUM> moderate <NUM> severe <EOS>
<SOS> patients with aortic operations developed delirium more frequently than those with non aortic procedures 55 5 vs <NUM> n <NUM> each <EOS>
<SOS> some preexisting diseases hearing disturbance increased the probability of postoperative delirium while age was not identified as a risk factor <EOS>
<SOS> general psychopathological and depressive disturbances increased the likelihood of postoperative delirium <EOS>
<SOS> patients who had a severe intraoperative course developed postoperative delirium more frequently <EOS>
<SOS> this was not seen in the absolute time of surgery or anesthesia nor in the intraoperative development of blood pressure or intraarterial gases which did not differ between patients with and without postoperative delirium <EOS>
<SOS> more reliable parameters were an increased intraoperative need for crystalloid volume intra or postoperatively decreased hemoglobin values hb <NUM> g dl and the development of acidosis that had to be treated <EOS>
<SOS> patients with delirium had serious complications more often 8 21 <NUM> vs 6 33 <NUM> and needed intensive care treatment longer 2 7 vs <NUM> days only aortic surgery <NUM> vs <NUM> days <EOS>
<SOS> conclusions postoperative delirium after vascular surgery is frequent <EOS>
<SOS> patients undergoing aortic surgery with specific concomittant medical disease psychopathological disturbances and a severe intraoperative course are at risk of developing postoperative delirium <EOS>
<SOS> this report summarizes our experiences with the subjective visual vertical svv as a clinical neuro otological tool <EOS>
<SOS> in the svv test patients have to orient a dim light bar in an otherwise dark surrounding earth vertical using a remote control <EOS>
<SOS> normal subjects in an upright position did not deviate more than <NUM> ° from true vertical <EOS>

<SOS> the somatosensory system of preterms and newborns differs substantially from adults <EOS>
<SOS> these differences are of considerable preclinical and clinical interest <EOS>
<SOS> maturation of a and c fibre synaptic connections in the dorsal horn and development of descending inhibition from the brainstem all take place postnatally in the rat <EOS>
<SOS> in early stages of development there is no definite spatial sepraration in the dorsal horn between the nociceptive and the non nociceptive system <EOS>
<SOS> in preterms but not in adults non noxious stimuli can induce central sensitization <EOS>
<SOS> many neurotransmitters and signalling molecules involved in pain pathways are expressed early in the developing nervous system but do not reach adult levels for a considerable period <EOS>
<SOS> more important receptors are frequently transiently overexpressed or expressed in areas during development where they are not seen in the adult and may have a different functional profile <EOS>
<SOS> the descending pain inhibitory system that provides an important protection against central sensitization developes later than the ascending nociceptive system <EOS>
<SOS> thus during a critical period of time the immature nociceptive system is highly vulnerable <EOS>
<SOS> for example neonatal circumcision in the absence of analgesia results in increased pain responses during subsequent routine vaccination months later <EOS>

<SOS> doctors belong to this group of people <EOS>

<SOS> the comparison shows that medical students do not have a more positive attitude toward the mentally ill in fact in certain areas they have an even more negative attitude toward the mentally ill than the general population has <EOS>
<SOS> we were not able to establish what effect teaching has with respect to changing attitudes <EOS>

<SOS> acute leptospirosis in europe weil is disease is a rare and in more than <NUM> of the cases undiagnosed febrile self limited disease <EOS>
<SOS> we report the case of a 39 year old sewerage worker who was admitted to our hospital with fever jaundice pain in his calves and acute renal failure <EOS>

<SOS> during the past decade the molecular mechanisms in the process of tumor progression including metastasis and angiogenesis have become better understood <EOS>
<SOS> cancer metastasis consists of multiple complex interacting steps <EOS>
<SOS> each of these steps is crucial and limiting since a failure to complete any one prevents the tumor cell from producing a metastasis <EOS>
<SOS> detachment from the solid tumor by loosening the intercellular junctions and proteolysis of the extracellular matrix enables tumor cells to enter blood and lymph vessels <EOS>
<SOS> the intravasation into the circulation is supported by the secretion of angiogenic factors which induce degradation of the basal membran in blood vessels <EOS>
<SOS> adhesion to endothelial cells extravasation from the circulation and induction of angiogenesis are further essential steps for completing the metastatic process <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore it is well known that once a tumor cell has entered circulation it will survive only by evasion of the immune system <EOS>
<SOS> the systematic identification of tumor antigens opens up new possibilities for immunotherapeutic approaches <EOS>
<SOS> hypogonadism is the main indication for testosterone substitution in the ageing male <EOS>
<SOS> the choice of the testosterone preparation should be based on the principle that serum levels of testosterone remain in the normal range and fast termination of therapy is possible <EOS>
<SOS> to date transdermal testosterone systems appear to be best suited for substitution therapy in the ageing male <EOS>
<SOS> future promising developments are testosterone gels and intramuscular testosterone undecanoate <EOS>
<SOS> any testosterone therapy in the ageing male has to be monitored closely especially regarding erythropoiesis and the prostate <EOS>

<SOS> in this retrospective study <NUM> patients with subtle lisfranc joint injuries were examined after a mean period of <NUM> months using clinical assessment radiography and dynamic pedographic gait analysis <EOS>
<SOS> the aims were to identify the factors leading to a mobile flatfoot deformity evaluate the functional and clinical outcome of these injuries and draw practical conclusions for initial management and subsequent intervention <EOS>
<SOS> all patients showed a mobile flatfoot deformity increased motion in the subtalar joint increased load on the hindfoot decreased load on the forefoot and a prolonged contact phase during the stance phase <EOS>
<SOS> radiographs revealed progressive osteoarthrosis in the joint and a residual displacement of the medial lisfranc joint <EOS>
<SOS> an unstable medial lisfranc joint results in the development of a mobile flatfoot <EOS>
<SOS> initial treatment of a subtly displaced lisfranc joint should consist of exact anatomical reduction and additional maintenance of the longitudinal arch of the foot <EOS>
<SOS> after failed initial treatment early arthrodesis of the midfoot is recommended as a salvage procedure for the foot <EOS>
<SOS> cross sectional imaging with ct and mri plays an indispensable complementary role to endoscopy in the pretherapeutic workup and staging of laryngeal neoplasms <EOS>
<SOS> adequate interpretation of the ct and mr images requires a thorough knowledge of the patterns of submucosal spread and familiarity with the diagnostic signs of neoplastic invasion as seen with each modality <EOS>
<SOS> in addition the radiologist should be aware of the implications of imaging for staging and treatment <EOS>
<SOS> both ct and mr imaging are highly sensitive for the detection of neoplastic invasion of the pre epiglottic space paraglottic space subglottic region and cartilage <EOS>
<SOS> the high negative predictive value of both ct and mri allows exclusion of neoplastic cartilage invasion quite reliably <EOS>
<SOS> the specificity of both ct and mri is however limited and both methods may therefore overestimate the extent of tumor spread <EOS>
<SOS> nevertheless both cross sectional imaging methods significantly improve the pretherapeutic staging accuracy of laryngeal tumors if used in addition to clinical examination and endoscopic biopsy <EOS>
<SOS> in the presence of a submucosal mass ct and mri play a key role for the diagnosis as they may characterize the lesion reliably depict its submucosal extent and guide the endoscopist to perform deep biopsies that allow a definitive histological diagnosis <EOS>

<SOS> organ culture storage leads to loss of hla dr positive corneal langerhans cells <EOS>

<SOS> among others spastic vasoconstrictions are one of the possible side effects usually affecting the lower extremities and sometimes leading to gangrene <EOS>
<SOS> the case of a <NUM> year old woman is presented who was suffering from migraine attacks since adolescence <EOS>

<SOS> after withdrawl of the drug the ulcers healed up entirely <EOS>

<SOS> in this article a model of quality assurance for inpatient psychotherapy is discussed which was developed in cooperation between researchers and clinicians <EOS>
<SOS> this model is based on the concept of internal quality assurance with external help <EOS>
<SOS> the heidelberg model of active internal quality assurance has three elements 1 <EOS>
<SOS> a qa inventory for routine monitoring 2 <EOS>
<SOS> rules for evaluating the outcome of every patient and 3 <EOS>
<SOS> a feedback model for communicating the results to the therapists quality circles <EOS>
<SOS> the focus of this model is the recognition of problematic results <EOS>
<SOS> it is mainly these results that will be discussed in our quality circles where the outcome of treatments from the perspective of the inventory and of the therapists are discussed <EOS>
<SOS> this feedback model and the quality circles will be explained with three examples of patients <EOS>
<SOS> the heidelberg model of active internal quality assurance will be seen as the basis of a concept of quality assurance which is aimed at assuring and improving the quality and rationality of the psychotherapeutic service <EOS>

<SOS> a pre term infant weighing <NUM> g gestational age <NUM> weeks developed an acute abdomen <EOS>
<SOS> intravenous lines had been inserted previously in the left silasticcatheter and right 24 g cannula saphenous veins in the neonatal intensive care unit <EOS>
<SOS> during surgical exploration a perforation of the terminal ileum was found <EOS>
<SOS> the operation consisted in partial resection of the perforated ileum with an end to end anastomosis and a double lumen colostomy <EOS>
<SOS> major blood loss during the procedure caused serious haemodynamic problems <EOS>
<SOS> despite transfusion of erythrocyte 100 ml thrombocytes 75 ml and albumin 50 ml the patient developed bradycardia and hypotension <EOS>
<SOS> administration of atropine adrenaline and calcium iv had no effect <EOS>
<SOS> the operation could be finished only with extrathoracic resuscitation <EOS>
<SOS> when the drapes were removed livid swollen lower limbs raised the suspicion of an acute thrombosis of the inferior vena cava <EOS>
<SOS> after insertion of a <NUM> g iv cannula into a vein of the right upper arm the circulation stabilised after rapid transfusion of <NUM> ml blood and <NUM> ml thrombocytes and resuscitation was successful <EOS>
<SOS> paediatricians and anaesthesiologists must consider the risk of thrombosis of the vena cava <EOS>
<SOS> if venous lines in the lower limbs are not visible to the anaesthesiologist during the operation venipuncture of veins of an upper limb is recommended before starting the surgical procedure <EOS>
<SOS> due to the high incidence of vena cava thrombosis caused by central venous lines and the difficulty of peripheral venipuncture in pre termintanty a safe venous line should be inserted if necessary by pre operative venesection <EOS>
<SOS> while complementary medicine and homeopathy is becoming an increasingly prominent part of the health care practices there is a lack of controlled studies concerning their effectiveness <EOS>

<SOS> 104 patients with ankylosing spondylitis entered a prospective randomized double blind study <EOS>
<SOS> during four weeks they received twice weekly either <NUM> ml of formica rufa d6 in combination with <NUM> ml of blood or <NUM> ml nacl intramuscular <EOS>
<SOS> before and after therapy mobility thoracic excursion and doctor is overall assessment were measured in addition to patient is health status using a german version of the arthritis impact measurement scales before and after therapy as well as four twelve and twentyfour weeks later <EOS>
<SOS> we were not able to detect any statistical difference between treatment and placebo group in any of the parameters measured <EOS>
<SOS> therefore the therapy under study may not be regarded effective <EOS>

<SOS> we report a truck driver with severe soft tissue contusion of both legs who developed atypical heparin induced thrombocytopenia hit after a thrombosis prophylaxis with unfractionated heparin despite a thrombosis the patient showed a systemic allergic reaction to heparin in combination with elevation of thrombocytes and positive heparin dependent antibodies <EOS>
<SOS> six days after the initial trauma deep vein thrombosis of the left lower leg was diagnosed and fasciotomy was performed preventing an imminent compartment syndrome <EOS>
<SOS> another <NUM> days later the patient developed exanthema of the trunk and upper extremities and urticaria on his face as well as severe headache <EOS>
<SOS> his platelet count increased from <NUM> 00 µl to <NUM> 00 µl <EOS>
<SOS> after exclusion of other causes for these symptoms a reaction to heparin dependent antibodies heparin platelet factor <NUM> complex was demonstrated <NUM> days later <EOS>
<SOS> thrombosis prophylaxis was changed to hirudin refludan and elevation of thrombocytes to <NUM> 00 µl was noted <EOS>
<SOS> shortly after rinsing of an intravenous line with less than <NUM> ie unfractionated heparin at day <NUM> after trauma the patient developed an anaphylactic shock which could be managed with cortisone <EOS>
<SOS> we suggest that in hit the thrombocytopenia may represent only one form of an allergic reaction to heparin <EOS>
<SOS> the cause of the thrombembolic event is an antigen antibody reaction to heparin taking place on the surface of the thrombocyte <EOS>
<SOS> this is similar in all forms of systemic reaction to heparin application even though the symptoms may vary <EOS>
<SOS> as thrombocytopenia may not be the main symptom of a heparin induced antibody reaction in our hospital only <NUM> of <NUM> patients with hit the disease should rather be named heparin allergy <EOS>
<SOS> we suggest a new classification of different pattern of heparin allergy types i iv <EOS>
<SOS> the new types i and ii are similar to hit types i and ii <EOS>
<SOS> type ii is the reaction of antibodies without decrease of thrombocytes and type iv the reaction of antibodies associated with systemic allergic symptoms <EOS>

<SOS> the postoperative course was followed prospectively <EOS>
<SOS> all patients were reinvestigated <NUM> months after surgery <EOS>
<SOS> results laparoscopic reversal of hartmann is procedure was attempted in <NUM> patients <EOS>
<SOS> one patient did not want the laparoscopic technique <EOS>
<SOS> in two cases 11 conversion to the conventional technique was necessary thus <NUM> patients were operated laparoscopically <EOS>
<SOS> median operative time was <NUM> <MOB> min <EOS>
<SOS> with the exception of three wound infections no immediate postoperative complications were noticed <EOS>
<SOS> patients convalescence was fast <EOS>
<SOS> first evacuation took place <NUM> 3 5 days after surgery complete oral nutrition <NUM> 3 5 days after surgery <EOS>
<SOS> duration of postoperative hospitalisation was <NUM> 5 12 days <EOS>
<SOS> one patient developed later a clinically significant anastomotic stricture which needed endoscopic dilatation <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion laparoscopically assisted hartmann is reversal is technically demanding but feasible <EOS>
<SOS> postoperative morbidity is low duration of hospitalisation short convalescence fast <EOS>
<SOS> thus good arguments exist for performing reversal of hartmann is procedures laparoscopically <EOS>
<SOS> mechanical ventilation is a well etablished strategy in intensive care medicine <EOS>
<SOS> icu trauma patients require analgesia and sedation mostly consists of benzodiazepines and opioids with increasing doses over time <EOS>
<SOS> the weaning period is complicated by the withdrawal syndrome showing tachycardia hypertonia tachypnea and restlessness <EOS>
<SOS> although treatment with clonidine can influence these symptoms tachypnea still remains the main problem in weaning patients from mechanical ventilation <EOS>
<SOS> adding sufentanil an opioid with greater effects on analgesia than on respiratory depression compared with fentanyl tachypnea can be reduced to normal frequency <EOS>
<SOS> in this way weaning management can be managed more easily for the benefit of both the patient and physician <EOS>
<SOS> in comparison with a group of <NUM> patients treated with clonidine alone <NUM> patients treated with clonidine sufentanil showed a shorter period from the start of spontaneous ventilation until extubation 4 8 vs <NUM> days and until discharge from the icu 7 7 vs <NUM> days <EOS>
<SOS> the number of reintubations caused by respiratory exhaustion decreased from <NUM> to <NUM> <EOS>

<SOS> furthermore the who suggested the developement and introduction of similar national preparedness plans <EOS>
<SOS> given the high mortality of severe sepsis and septic shock immunomodulation has been considered as an attractive adjunct therapy <EOS>
<SOS> many agents have been studied that have the therapeutic potential to interfere with cytokines and other pathways which are activated during sepsis <EOS>
<SOS> drugs having the properties to neutralize lipopolysaccharides have also been considered <EOS>
<SOS> so far all the large clinical trials with immunomodulating agents ha1a e5 anti tnf antibodies ilra have been shown to be of marginal or of no benefit <EOS>
<SOS> in certain trials results were indecisive or mortality was increased which led to discontinue the studies <EOS>
<SOS> in certain other trials like those on antibodies against tnf some positive effects were seen in subcategories of patients <EOS>
<SOS> thus new trials are on their ways <EOS>
<SOS> so far the results of early trials has forced investigators to re examine the concept of immunomodulation and to redefine strategies to optimally use agents in a way that benefits the host while not putting him at risk <EOS>

<SOS> recently two new halogenated volatile anaesthetics sevoflurane and desflurane have been approved for clinical use in germany <EOS>
<SOS> their low solubility in blood is the most important common property and this represents the most obvious difference from the inhalational anaesthetics currently used <EOS>
<SOS> extensive clinical and experimental evaluations have confirmed the superior pharmacokinetic properties predicted <EOS>
<SOS> both sevoflurane and desflurane provide more rapid emergence from anaesthesia permit easier titration of the anaesthetic dose during maintenance and offer more rapid recovery from anaesthesia <EOS>
<SOS> for sevoflurane there are additional advantages a pleasant odor negligible airway irritation and excellent pharmacodynamic characteristics that even provide cardiovascular stability comparable to isoflurane <EOS>
<SOS> a certain disadvantage and source of potential nephrotoxicity result from the metabolism of sevoflurane 2 5 to anorganic fluoride and degradation to compound a in carbon dioxide absorbents <EOS>
<SOS> the extensive clinical data reported to date have revealed no evidence that sevoflurane has adverse renal effects <EOS>
<SOS> new insight into the pathomechanism of nephrotoxicity associated with either production of fluoride or compound a may well support clinical experience <EOS>
<SOS> desflurane strongly resists in vivo metabolism and because of this it appears to be devoid of toxicity <EOS>
<SOS> nevertheless potential side effects may result from degradation in dry absorbents and subsequent release of co from its extreme pungency and irritating airway effects <EOS>
<SOS> thus desflurane is not recommended for induction of anaesthesia especially in children <EOS>
<SOS> the tendency for desflurane transiently to stimulate sympathetic activity especially at concentrations above <NUM> mac limits its application in patients with cardiac disease <EOS>
<SOS> the doctor in charge who is generally the medical director is liable if patients suffer harm through organizational faults within his or her department <EOS>
<SOS> even the suspicion that an error has arisen as the result of defective organization is enough for the person responsible that is to say the medical director to be liable <EOS>
<SOS> for this reason the doctor in charge must be in a position to recognize structural defects in organization and to correct these by means of staff training <EOS>
<SOS> every training measure must guarantee specialist standards this means that the work of doctors with no specialist training and those still in training and working under supervision is guaranteed to be of the same standard and performed with the same degree of meticulous care as that of a qualified specialist <EOS>
<SOS> a legally valid consent from the patient and documentation of the patient information must be accessible at all times <EOS>
<SOS> operations carried out by doctors in training must be supervised by a qualified specialist otherwise the doctor in charge is guilty of a defect in organization <EOS>
<SOS> because of staff shortages it often happens that inexperienced beginners often doctors doing their practical training are on call very early on <EOS>
<SOS> in the high risk specialty of obstetrics it is particularly important that doctors still undergoing practical training can call on an experienced colleague for help at all times <EOS>
<SOS> the changeover from day duty to emergency duty must be organized by the doctor in charge in such a way that the medical staff are rested and that adequate free time is guaranteed <EOS>
<SOS> there must be no friction when cooperation with other disciplines concerned is needed <EOS>
<SOS> each sector must know its own area of responsibility <EOS>
<SOS> the doctor in charge is resonsible for seeing that his or her staff members are familiar with the use of the medical equipment <EOS>
<SOS> uniform guidelines will make it possible for the medical director to train his her staff and prevent systematic organizational defects <EOS>

<SOS> furthermore every oral and maxillofacial surgeon in germany knows him because of the stromeyer hook which is used for elevation of zygomatic arch fractures <EOS>
<SOS> this special aspect as well as stromeyer is biography is presented in this article from the history of medicine <EOS>

<SOS> the duration of disease and of medical management increased <EOS>
<SOS> patients in later groups were younger and in better general condition <EOS>

<SOS> primary surgery for cd increasingly consisted of resection of solitary segments of gut in the case of recurrence of multiple minimal resections <EOS>
<SOS> the average total length of the resected intestine could be significantly reduced <EOS>
<SOS> the complication rate was equal in elective and emergency surgery <EOS>
<SOS> even among the uncommon aneurysms of the visceral arteries the aneurysm of the pancreaticoduodenalis artery is considered a rarity <EOS>
<SOS> etiologically numerous factors must be taken into account the most significant one being arteriosclerosis <EOS>
<SOS> the clinical presentation is unspecific and ambiguous <EOS>
<SOS> ct and above all intra arterial dsa allow for a diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> a generous consideration of indicating operative intervention even in asymptomatic patients is especially justified because of the imminent risk of rupture <EOS>
<SOS> the preferrable therapy consists of elimination of the aneurysm either conventionally by proximal and distal ligature of the pancreaticoduodenalis artery or endovascularly by embolization <EOS>

<SOS> background clinical courses of eight patients with urea cycle disorders deficiencies of carbamylphosphate synthetase 4 argininosuccinate synthetase 2 and argininosuccinate lyase 2 are described <EOS>
<SOS> methods therapy emergency treatment consisted of benzoate and arginine i v as well as peritoneal dialysis and or modified hemodialysis <EOS>
<SOS> chronic treatment comprised a low protein diet and substitution of essential amino acids of benzoate or phenylbutyrate and of branched chain amino acids <EOS>
<SOS> results within <NUM> hours after birth hyperammonemic coma with cerebral edema developed leading to developmental retardation later in life <EOS>
<SOS> four patients died between <NUM> weeks and <NUM> years of age <EOS>
<SOS> during follow up all patients suffered hyperammonemic derangements treated conservatively <EOS>
<SOS> phenylbutyrate had less gastrointestinal side effects than benzoate branched chain amino acids had favourable effects <EOS>
<SOS> one patient was treated conservatively since birth followed by a normal development <EOS>
<SOS> conclusions neonatal respiratory distress with alkalosis and rapid global deterioration should raise the suspicion of a urea cycle disorder <EOS>
<SOS> specific therapy as described can be life saving although most children exhibit marked developmental delay <EOS>
<SOS> sodium phenylbutyrate has fewer side effects than sodium benzoate <EOS>
<SOS> therapy prior to cerebral edema can prevent complications <EOS>
<SOS> pronounced osteoporosis of and surrounding the acetabulum commonly leads to early loosening of endoprosthetic hip replacements following implantation <EOS>
<SOS> large osseous defects in the subimplant bed are the result and the reason why multiple revisions of loosened acetabular cups have to be performed so often in rheumatic surgery <EOS>
<SOS> the defects extend from the cranial to the central ventral and dorsal anchorage losses may occur in addition to this <EOS>
<SOS> the anchorage of a new implant must be adapted to the individual circumstances <EOS>
<SOS> the new implant must be selected in accordance with point of surgical access the patient is general status and osseous regenerationability <EOS>
<SOS> in the optimum case osseous buildup of lost anatomical structures is the preferred method <EOS>
<SOS> if this is not possible special implants mostly custom made prostheses have to be incorporated <EOS>
<SOS> however the survival time of the implants is much shorter than in patients with degenerative diseases <EOS>
<SOS> in patients with progressive muscular dystrophy pmd invasive electrophysiologic studies can detect hidden intracardiac conduction disturbances <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of this study was a long term follow up of these patients <EOS>
<SOS> twelve consecutive patients 9m 3f age <NUM> <NUM> yrs without cardiac symptoms and with normal echocardiographic findings were included in the study <EOS>
<SOS> they suffered from different stages of pmd type erb n 4 becker kiener n 4 duchenne n 2 and landouzy déjerine n 2 <EOS>
<SOS> at the beginning of the study all patients underwent an invasive electrophysiologic study eps <EOS>
<SOS> the follow up of <NUM> yrs included regular clinical visits ecgs and holter recordings every <NUM> months as well as an echocardiography every <NUM> months <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> patients the eps revealed a hidden interatrial conduction disturbance ahrs acs <NUM> 18ms and in <NUM> pts an infrahisian conduction disturbance was found hv max <EOS>
<SOS> conduction defects were seen independently from the type of pmd and the stage of the disease <EOS>
<SOS> during the follow up the initially hidden interatrial conduction disturbance became evident in the surface ecg in <NUM> of <NUM> pts <EOS>
<SOS> one of them developed paroxysmal atrial fibrillation <EOS>
<SOS> five of <NUM> pts with an initially hidden infrahisian conduction disturbance developed an av block grade i ii and in one case additionally a bundle branch block <EOS>
<SOS> four of these pts whose pmd showed progression or who developed congestive cardiomyopathy needed pacemaker implantation because of a first degree av block bifascicular bundle branch block n 1 a mobitz ii second degree av block n 1 or a third degree av block n 2 <EOS>
<SOS> none of the pts with normal findings at the eps showed abnormal p waves an av block or an intraventricular conduction disturbance during the follow up <EOS>
<SOS> we conclude that intracardiac conduction disturbances especially infrahisian defects including high degree av blocks are a common finding in pts with pmd <EOS>
<SOS> therefore a regular cardiological screening including an ecg and a holter recording is reasonable in these patients <EOS>
<SOS> accidental hypothermia is defined as an unintentional decline in the core temperature below <NUM> °c and is caused by exposure to cold drugs endocrine dysfunction central nervous system disorders skin disorders and trauma <EOS>
<SOS> depending on the degree of hypothermia there is a progressive depression of metabolism in each organ system with specific alterations <EOS>
<SOS> bone is among the most common sites of metastatic disease in cancers of the breast prostate and lung <EOS>
<SOS> the decision about systemic therapy depends on the histology presence and extent of extraskeletal disease and the performance status of the patient <EOS>
<SOS> for patients with estrogen receptor positive breast cancer or prostate cancer hormonal treatment represents the treatment of choice <EOS>
<SOS> in estrogen receptor negative breast cancer and for patients who have failed hormonal therapy or have liver metastases chemotherapy should be initiated <EOS>
<SOS> all patients with small cell lung cancer should receive chemotherapy <EOS>
<SOS> bone metastases of differentiated thyroid cancers can be treated with radioisotopes <EOS>
<SOS> in non small cell lung cancer or renal cell cancer systemic chemotherapy should be confined to younger patients and patients in good general condition <EOS>
<SOS> radiologic assessment of responses of skeletal metastases to systemic therapy is often difficult <EOS>
<SOS> new approaches in measuring bone metabolites in urine might prove helpful <EOS>
<SOS> although most prenatally diagnosed anatomic malformations are best managed after birth we can presently offer prenatal therapy to an increasing number of fetuses with simple anatomical defects that have predictably devastating developmental consequences <EOS>
<SOS> a condition amenable to prenatal intervention must fulfill a number of conditions <EOS>
<SOS> it must be severe enough to warrant the risks associated with in utero treatment and must be reliably detectable before birth <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore the pathophysiology must be reversible by fetal intervention significantly improving the prognosis over postnatal treatment <EOS>
<SOS> current indication for prenatal intervention include decompression for obstructive uropathy temporary tracheal occlusion for congenital diaphragmatic hernia and tumor debulking for congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation of the lung and sacrococcygeal teratoma <EOS>
<SOS> prenatal repair of myelomeningocele is currently being developed but remains controversial since this is not a lethal malformation <EOS>
<SOS> maternal safety remains paramount in considering fetal intervention <EOS>
<SOS> the main associated risks are pre term labor and preterm premature rupture of membranes <EOS>
<SOS> to reduce maternal morbidity and the risk of prematurity minimally invasive fetoscopic techniques were developed and are increasingly employed <EOS>
<SOS> these developments will in all probability reduce the importance of open fetal surgery in the future <EOS>

<SOS> especially elderly patients with chronic illnesses are at increased risk of becoming colonized or infected with mrsa <EOS>
<SOS> this report focuses on epidemiology and therapy of mrsa and on the recommendations concerning management and prevention of spread of mrsa in hospitals and nursing homes <EOS>

<SOS> gas climatisation however markedly also will be influenced by the temperature loss at and corresponding water condensation within the hoses factors which are related to the technical design and material of the patient hose system <EOS>
<SOS> the objective of this prospective study was to investigate <NUM> how anaesthetic gas climatisation during minimal flow anaesthesia is influenced by the technical design of different breathing hose systems in clinical practice <EOS>
<SOS> 2 to investigate whether a sufficient gas climatisation also can be gained with higher fresh gas flows if that hose system is used proven beforehand to optimally warming and humidifying the anaesthetic gases <EOS>
<SOS> introduction undifferentiated embryonal sarcoma is a rare malignant tumour of the liver the incidence of which is highest in children between <NUM> and <NUM> years of age 14 1 <EOS>
<SOS> among the primary tumours of the liver in childhood it ranks in third place after hepatocellular carcinoma and focal nodular hyperplasia <EOS>
<SOS> embryonal sarcoma is much rarer in adults <EOS>
<SOS> to our knowledge only <NUM> cases have been published in the last <NUM> years <EOS>
<SOS> methods and results we now present the case of a 29 year old woman with spontaneous rupture of the liver caused by an undifferentiated sarcoma <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion this case report illustrates the possibility of an embryonal sarcoma being the reason for spontaneous rupture of the liver <EOS>
<SOS> the management of this case comprised primary tamponade interventional embolisation of the feeding artery and secondary resection under stable conditions <EOS>
<SOS> substance dependency is one of the most frequent disorders which can be treated successfully by psychotherapy <EOS>
<SOS> however reasons are discussed why psychotherapists probably hesitate in treating these patients <EOS>
<SOS> insufficient psychotherapeutic education concerning dependency structural problems expected difficulties with these patients or expected poor treatment outcome may be overcome as well as blind areas in healthprofessionals perception concerning dependency among their patients and themselves <EOS>
<SOS> though psychotherapy with addicts is sometimes exhausting the readiness of psychotherapists to treat patients with substance disorders is increasing <EOS>
<SOS> diagnosis nowadays is based on the distinction between drug depencency and drug abuse on the one hand and substance induced disorders on the other hand <EOS>
<SOS> readiness for change and motivation for treatment are basic objects of psychotherapy in these patients <EOS>
<SOS> therapeutic approaches to deal with this promising aspect of psychotherapy are presented <EOS>
<SOS> they are based on an empathic and clear therapeutic attitude <EOS>
<SOS> they can be easily implemented in different settings <EOS>
<SOS> at the end of the first part of this review in patient and outpatient settings for the treatment of substance disorders are outlined <EOS>
<SOS> this will be followed in the second part by an outline of different specific psychotherapeutic approaches <EOS>
<SOS> the following experimental study was conducted to develop biocompatible methods of osteosynthesis in fractures of the distal radius and to evaluate their stability <EOS>
<SOS> a model of dorsal wedge osteotomy in the distal radial metaphysis was used to develop the surgical technique and to test the stability of the alternative methods of osteosynthesis <EOS>
<SOS> the concept for this model was based on commercially available materials which were either biodegradable or osteoconductive <EOS>
<SOS> four different forms of biocompatible osteosynthesis were compared to combined kirschner wire osteosynthesis kwo our preferred method of treatment of unstable colles fracture <EOS>
<SOS> biocompatible osteosynthesis was achieved with an invasivity and stability comparable to that of kwo <EOS>
<SOS> in conclusion injection osteosynthesis exceeded the other biocompatible methods of osteosynthesis in all respects <EOS>
<SOS> regarding the recent developments in injectable materials for osteosynthesis it offers the best perspective for clinical application <EOS>

<SOS> in psychotherapy with patients who do not tolerate the conditions of the talking cure because they tend to act instead of verbalizing their experiences interactive entanglements are rather common <EOS>
<SOS> often this is a consequence of nonverbal gestural behavior that directs interaction in the therapeutic dialogue while the exchange of words has taken a back seat <EOS>
<SOS> the symbolic space of verbal understanding gets lost then <EOS>
<SOS> gestural behavior does not form an independent communication system as usage of body language suggests <EOS>
<SOS> instead as permanent concomitant of utterances it has primarily the function of regulating the interaction of patient and psychotherapist <EOS>

<SOS> this leads to the conclusion that phlebography should be done at the time of the preoperative examination if there are differences between the clinical and ultrasound symptoms <EOS>

<SOS> to date the effect of stimulus frequency spectra on mlr has not been completely known <EOS>
<SOS> by using masking with high pass filtered white noise in <NUM> normal hearing adults we measured the dependence of amplitude and latency of abr and mlr on filter frequency <EOS>

<SOS> the actuarial risk of cardiac arrest was 20 after <NUM> and 40 after <NUM> years <EOS>

<SOS> pacemakers were implanted in these patients <EOS>

<SOS> in our patients about 75 of the arrests can be attributed to graft vasculopathy and one quarter to acute rejection <EOS>
