<SOS> huntington is disease hd is member of a growing family of neurodegenerative diseases which are caused by a cag triplet expansion in the coding region of their respective genes <EOS>
<SOS> the results of the research of the last years is very suggestive of a common pathomechanisms of all these diseases even though their clinical appearance may be quite different <EOS>
<SOS> the development of new animal models by transferring the human gene defect into the mouse genome has led to the finding of so called intranuclear inclusion bodies <EOS>
<SOS> this new observation allowed to come closer to solving the problem how this genetic defect causes neurodegeneration <EOS>
<SOS> recent studies on transgenic hd mice could also demonstrate a possible connection between the genetic defect and glutamate exitotoxicity in the neurodegenerative process of hd which had been emphasized by earlier animal models of the disease <EOS>
<SOS> transgenic animal models of hd will have an important impact on the understanding of the disease mechanisms and may contribute to a faster development and testing of new therapeutic approaches <EOS>

<SOS> the dscc is best treated with micrographic surgery and wider safety margins than any other type and should be followed up very frequently <EOS>

<SOS> malignant melanoma is the most important differential diagnosis in both clinical and histologic examination of melanocytic nevi <EOS>
<SOS> uv exposure with an erythemagenic dose and mechanical irritation of melanocytic nevi are able to induce reversible morphologic changes which simulate malignant melanoma <EOS>
<SOS> these changes are associated with an increased expression of hmb 45 antigen <EOS>
<SOS> in addition an increased proliferation and repair activity is observed after uv exposure <EOS>
<SOS> the increased number of melanocytes located in suprabasal layers of the epidermis is accompanied by a change in keratinocyte adhesion molecule expression <EOS>
<SOS> the uv light is also able to influence the adhesive properties of melanocytes in vitro <EOS>
<SOS> therefore both keratinocyte derived factors and direct influence of uv on the melanocyte system are probably responsible for the morphologic changes <EOS>
<SOS> while these exogenously evoked changes are reversible the potential biologic relevance especially a possible role in the initiation of the carcinogenesis cascade reguires clarification <EOS>

<SOS> the treatment of osteonecrosis of the femoral head involves a continuum based on a radiographic spectrum of disease <EOS>

<SOS> for these types of lesions osteotomy has been tried by various authors with moderate success <EOS>
<SOS> for small or medium lesions that are post collapse various bone grafting procedures have been used <EOS>
<SOS> this approach should be tempered with a look at the articular cartilage if this is damaged or the lesion is large <EOS>
<SOS> limited femoral resurfacing can be used for hips that do not have acetabular involvement <EOS>
<SOS> if there is acetabular involvement total hip replacement remains the treatment of choice <EOS>

<SOS> hemangiomas of the skull base are rare neoplasms and are easily misdiagnosed as acoustic neuromas when occurring in the internal auditory canal <EOS>
<SOS> among these tumors ossifying hemangiomas are characterized histologically be newly formed bone tissue within their substance <EOS>
<SOS> we describe a 26 year old female patient who presented with left sided sensorineural hearing loss and tinnitus <EOS>
<SOS> t2 weighted magnetic resonance imaging demonstrated a bright space occupying lesion of the internal auditory canal with extension to the geniculate ganglion <EOS>
<SOS> bony erosions of the internal auditory canal were proved by high resolution computed tomography <EOS>
<SOS> a hemangioma was suspected preoperatively and was resected via a middle cranial fossa approach <EOS>
<SOS> histologically new bone formations were found in a cavernous hemangioma <EOS>
<SOS> in general radiologic findings can suggest a hemangioma of the internal auditory canal and help to differentiate it from acoustic neuroma <EOS>
<SOS> based on the histological findings of intratumoral bone formation the hemangioma in our patient was classified as an ossifying hemangioma <EOS>
<SOS> however reactive bone formation at the borders of a tumor in the internal auditory canal can also be mistaken as new intratumoral bone formation <EOS>
<SOS> myocardial ischemia results in myocardial dysfunction <EOS>
<SOS> recovery may be delayed stunning or persistent if perfusion remains reduced hibernation and ischemia may go on to necrosis thus contributing to chronic heart failure <EOS>
<SOS> in addition myocardium not directly affected by ischemia may undergo adaptive processes like hypertrophy and dilatation which may result in chronic left heart failure <EOS>
<SOS> this process is characterized by hemodynamic neurohumoral and progressive morphologic changes of the heart which are closely interrelated <EOS>
<SOS> hemodynamic changes basically consist of an increase in left ventricular filling pressure and a decrease in global ejection fraction and in most cases years after myocardial infarction in an increase in systemic vascular resistance and right atrial pressure <EOS>
<SOS> neurohumoral changes consist of an increase in plasma catecholamines atrial natriuretic factor and vasopressin and in an activation of the renin angiotensin system <EOS>
<SOS> plasma endothelin 1 was recently reported to be increased in patients with heart failure and prognosis was related to endothelin levels <EOS>
<SOS> diminished response of vessels to endothelium edrf no dependent vasodilatation suggests impairment of vascular endothelium in heart failure <EOS>
<SOS> local changes of cardiac neurohumoral systems could contribute to structural changes of the heart e g systemic activation to hemodynamic changes <EOS>
<SOS> structural changes of the heart are characterized by an increase in volume and thickness of surviving myocardium and an expansion of ischemic and necrotic myocardium <EOS>
<SOS> molecular control of these processes which include various cell types such as cardiomyocytes and cardiofibroblasts are currently an issue of intense research and could result in specific therapeutic importance <EOS>

<SOS> the aim of the study was to determine the success rate of these claims and the type of expert confirmed medical negligence so that strategies for avoiding such negligence can be offered <EOS>

<SOS> indeed family studies segregation analyses and twin studies have shown that genetic factors play an important role in disposition towards migraine but could not explain the entire aetiopathogenesis <EOS>
<SOS> the influence of extragenetic factors however remains mostly unknown <EOS>
<SOS> recent linkage analyses have provided evidence for genetic heterogeneity <EOS>
<SOS> a locus for familial hemiplegic migraine fhm the only known type of migraine that follows autosomal dominant transmission has been linked to chromosome 19p13 but genetic heterogeneity has also been shown i e different types of migraine could be excluded from this locus <EOS>

<SOS> the von willebrand is disease affects about 1 3 of the population and it is undiagnosed in most people <EOS>

<SOS> in von willebrands disease the patients have a quantitative or qualitative abnormality in the von willebrand factor vwf which has two major functions it serves by bridging between platelets and injury site in the blood vessel wall and it circulates as a complex with factor vii protecting it from rapid degradation <EOS>
<SOS> more than <NUM> different types and subtypes of vwd have been described but almost all patients can be classified as having <NUM> of the <NUM> most common types of vwd <EOS>

<SOS> however the connection between stroke and dental infections has hardly been examined so far <EOS>
<SOS> therefore we performed a case control study using a standardized questionaire and examination <EOS>
<SOS> we investigated <NUM> patients consecutive to a acute cerebral ischemia stroke and <NUM> age and sex matched nonstroke neurological patients as a control group <EOS>
<SOS> dental status was determined by a so called total dental index tdi which reflects primarily caries periodontitis periapical lesions devital and missing teeth as well as by a panoramic index pi <EOS>

<SOS> the results must now be verified in larger studies <EOS>
<SOS> as chronic dental infections are a common and also easily treatable factor their identification as a risk factor for stroke would be quite important in the field of preventive medicine <EOS>

<SOS> those such as aceclofenac tenidap and tolmetin which can stimulate matrix synthesis <NUM> <EOS>

<SOS> physiologically angiogenesis in adults is a controlled process which plays a role for example in wound healing <EOS>
<SOS> pathological angiogenesis is observed in tumor formation and represents a multifactorial process in which specific angiogenic factors as well as growth factors extracellular matrix proteins and cell adhesion molecules are involved <EOS>
<SOS> tumor growth is characterized by an imbalance in favor of angiogenic over angiogenesis inhibiting factors <EOS>
<SOS> some of the most frequently examined angiogenic factors are vascular endothelial growth factor acidic basic fibroblast growth factors and the platelet derived endothelial cell growth factor <EOS>
<SOS> the most important angiogenesis inhibitors are angiostatin and thrombospondin <EOS>
<SOS> to date the clinical relevance of tumor angiogenesis has been shown for several human tumors <EOS>
<SOS> for most urological tumors the grade of tumor vessel formation measured as microvessel density has been associated with metastases tumor growth and clinical course <EOS>
<SOS> the prognostic value of this feature of malignant growth seems to be higher than that of most of the classical and newer prognostic factors <EOS>
<SOS> systematic investigations of tumor angiogenesis are becoming increasingly relevant for diagnostic and therapeutic strategies and offer opportunities for the development of new specific therapeutic approaches in clinical oncology <EOS>

<SOS> during the last few decades traumatic injuries of the hip joint have significantly increased in number and traffic accidents have also increased <EOS>
<SOS> depending on the speed direction of the forces and the position of the femur at the moment of impact different patterns of injury occur <EOS>
<SOS> basically they are classified as hip dislocations dislocation fractures and acetabular fractures <EOS>
<SOS> these injuries have in common a high rate of concomitant lesions <EOS>
<SOS> several classification systems have been developed for these injuries <EOS>
<SOS> commonly stewart and milford is or levin is classification is used for dislocations and dislocation fractures <EOS>
<SOS> for acetabular fractures judet and letournel is classification and its newer version developed by helfet ao classification are generally accepted <EOS>
<SOS> fractures of the femoral head though included in these classifications are typically described by separate classifications like the one presented in <NUM> by pipkin <EOS>
<SOS> the multitude of injuries occuring in the hip joint requires vast knowledge of various operative approaches <EOS>
<SOS> no single approach exists that would permit the treatment of all injuries in an ideal fashion <EOS>
<SOS> approaches are either considered limited kocher langenbeck ilioinguinal iliofemoral when they permit access only to a restricted segment of the joint or extended extended iliofemoral maryland ruedi when they allow all around visualization of the hip joint <EOS>
<SOS> the choice of the best approach for an individual patient depends on the type of injury and also on patient variables like age preexisting disease and concomitant injuries <EOS>
<SOS> the decision is further influenced by the timing of surgery the kind of fracture stabilization intended and by complications typically seen with certain approaches <EOS>
<SOS> the indication for extended procedures is only seen in patients with complex injury patterns involving both the anterior and the posterior column or in delayed cases undergoing surgery more than <NUM> weeks after trauma <EOS>
<SOS> extended approaches permit excellent visualization of the fracture but the extent of the soft tissue trauma is reflected in a high rate of postoperative complications <EOS>

<SOS> insulinomas are rare tumors and account for <NUM> of all endocrine pancreatic tumors <EOS>
<SOS> they typically present as a solitary tumor but may occur in multiple sites e g <EOS>
<SOS> multiple endocrine neoplasia type i or as a malignant disease in <NUM> of cases and rarely as nesidioblastosis or islet cell adenomatosis <EOS>
<SOS> neuroglucopenic symptoms lead to the diagnosis inadequate high insulin and c peptide secretion with hypoglycemia in the fasting test confirm the diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> preoperative localization is not necessary prior to the first operation <EOS>
<SOS> the standard operation is enucleation or depending on size and location resection <EOS>
<SOS> the treatment of multiple tumors and islet cell hyperplasia with a high risk of recurrence is problematic <EOS>
<SOS> subtotal resection plus enucleation seems to be better than selective tumor resection <EOS>
<SOS> in malignant insulinomas mostly presenting with liver metastases aggressive surgical therapy with hepatectomy and debulking chemoembolization and systemic chemotherapy are the modalities of choice <EOS>
<SOS> mr spectroscopy is the only method for non invasive detection of various aspects of cardiac metabolism in humans <EOS>
<SOS> while the 1h nucleus of water and fat molecules is the signal source for mr imaging the mr spectroscopic technique allows for the study of a number of other nuclei such as 13c 19f 23na 31p 39k and 87rb <EOS>
<SOS> clinical applications presently are confined to the 31p nucleus <EOS>
<SOS> 31p mr spectroscopy allows the non invasive study of cardiac high energy phosphate metabolites atp and phosphocreatine <EOS>
<SOS> the phosphocreatine atp ratio is considered an index of the energetic state of the heart <EOS>
<SOS> possible clinical indications include heart failure valve disease and coronary artery disease <EOS>
<SOS> in heart failure the phosphocreatine atp ratio is reduced and correlates with clinical severity ejection fraction and prognosis <EOS>
<SOS> in mitral and aortic valve disease a reduced phosphocreatine atp ratio may indicate the optimum timing for valve replacement <EOS>
<SOS> in coronary artery disease a regional decrease of phosphocreatine during stress biochemical ergometry may indicate local ischemia <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore absolute quantification of high energy phosphates may allow diagnosis of myocardial viability <EOS>
<SOS> major technical developments leading to improved spatial and temporal resolution will be necessary to establish mr spectroscopy as a routine clinical tool <EOS>

<SOS> the introduction of perfluorochemicals into medicine and especially into the treatment of severe lung injury is a fascinating scientific task <EOS>
<SOS> many recall the famous experiments from clark et al <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> when he demonstrated liquidventilation with perfluorocarbons in the mammal species for the first time <EOS>
<SOS> after this hallmark perfluorocarbons were subsequently introduced in research of acute lung injury by the techniques of total and partial liquid ventilation tlv plv <EOS>
<SOS> perfluorocarbons saturated organofluorids have unique chemical and physical properties which made them attractive substances for intraalveolar application <EOS>
<SOS> the strong c f bindings in the perfluorocarbon molecules are responsible for their chemical stability biochemical inertness high capacity to dissolve respiratory gases low surface tension and high vapor pressures <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore the high density of the pfc lead to radio opacity and their distribution to dependent lung areas <EOS>
<SOS> the efficacy of pfc liquid applied by tlv plv has been demonstrated in numerous animal studies using different models of acute lung injury <EOS>
<SOS> currently several mechanisms of action of perfluorocarbon fluids in acute lung injury are discussed recruitment of atelectatic alveoli prevention of endexpiratory collapse of alveoli liquid peep redistribution of perfusion oxygen transport surfactant like effects and decrease of inflammation <EOS>
<SOS> since total liquid ventilation has been used only in experimental models of lung injury partial liquid ventilation has been introduced successfully into clinical trials phase i ii <EOS>
<SOS> however the results of the first randomised controlled study of plv in <NUM> adult patients suffering from severe respiratory failure ali ards showed no differences between plv and conventional treatment <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore the instillation of relatively large amounts of liquid into the lungs poses several technical challenges and may be associated with complications such as liquithoraces pneumothoraces and hypoxia <EOS>
<SOS> since mammal lungs are evolutionary specialised to gas exchange using atmospheric oxygen the application of liquids even if they transport respiratory gases very well is not physiologic <EOS>
<SOS> to overcome these unwanted side effects we developed a technique of perfluorocarbon vaporisation in analogy to the application of inhalation anaesthetic agents <EOS>
<SOS> after resolving some technical issues this application technique was used successfully in an animal model of acute lung injury <EOS>
<SOS> vaporisation of perfluorohexane in a concentration of <NUM> vol of inspired gas improved significantly oxygenation and lung compliance <EOS>
<SOS> though these results are promising mechanisms of action dose efficacy relation surfactant perfluorocarbon interaction or anti inflammatory effects of vaporised perfluorohexane are still unclear <EOS>
<SOS> these questions need to be clarified before this technique can be applied clinically <EOS>
<SOS> however the inhalation of vapor a technique already familiar to anaesthesiologists should avoid risks of large amounts of fluids in the bronchoalveolar space <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore this technique can be administered by established anaesthetic equipment with the advantage of exact dosing continuous monitoring and demand application in a way near to clinical routine <EOS>
<SOS> vdd pacing using a single pass lead for complete heart block is well described in adults but there are few reports of its use in children <EOS>
<SOS> we have used <NUM> different standard adult size single pass leads and <NUM> different pacemaker generators in <NUM> children and adolescents aged <MOB> years mean <NUM> years and weighing <NUM> to <NUM> kg mean <NUM> kg <EOS>

<SOS> in <NUM> patients the vdd system was their first pacing system <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> of the patients 1 6 previous systems had been used and simultaneous extraction of ventricular leads 10 and or atrial leads 5 was performed <EOS>
<SOS> all leads were introduced via a subclavian vein puncture using the extraction sheath when present and the atrial dipole was placed low in the right atrium to provide slack for further growth while maintaining atrial sensing <EOS>
<SOS> ventricular thresholds ranged from <NUM> to <NUM> v the minimal atrial amplitude was <NUM> to <NUM> mv and the maximum amplitude was <NUM> to <NUM> mv <EOS>
<SOS> there was one early micro displacement and the lead was repositioned <EOS>
<SOS> over a follow up period of 2 64 months mean <NUM> months all but <NUM> of the patients have maintained low ventricular pacing thresholds and adequate atrial signals for reliable pacing at rest and with exercise <EOS>
<SOS> during this time some have undergone considerable growth <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> patient atrial sensing was lost after cardiopulmonary bypass for additional cardiac surgery at <NUM> months and the pacemaker was programmed into vvir mode <EOS>
<SOS> one patient with coexisting congenital heart disease died suddenly at <NUM> years but the pacing system had no fault at autopsy <EOS>
<SOS> the standard adult size single pass lead provides a simple means to enable reliable atrial synchronous ventricular pacing in growing children with complete heart block <EOS>

<SOS> athletes who need high endurance capacity often use training at moderately high altitude <MOB> m to improve oxygen delivery and utilization because of a hypoxia induced increase of the red blood cell volume and adaptations at the muscular level <EOS>
<SOS> as maximal heart rates decrease at high altitude and plasma lactate levels for a given workload change during prolonged exposure to high altitude it can be difficult to control and adapt the intensity and duration of the work outs <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore maximal performance capacity decreases and therefore training intensity at high altitude is usually reduced compared to training at sea level <EOS>
<SOS> to avoid these disadvantages at high altitude a concept of living at moderately high altitude and training at lower elevations termed live high train low evolved opposing the conventional concept of live high train high <EOS>
<SOS> a third option using a hypobaric chamber live low train low is hardly used anymore for training athletes <EOS>
<SOS> studies on the effects of conventional high altitude training for the improvement of athletic performance often lack a rigorous controlled design and yield controversial results <EOS>
<SOS> regarding the new concept of live high train low there is only one controlled study on college athletes and it shows a minor advantage of this new approach compared to conventional high altitude training <EOS>
<SOS> however training concepts are especially important for elite competitive athletes and controlled studies with such individuals are very difficult to perform <EOS>
<SOS> therefore it appears that today we cannot answer the question of whether altitude specific physiologic factors or non altitude related benefits of training camps account for the success of individual athletes <EOS>

<SOS> as a net effect of ace inhibitors and at1 receptor antagonists on the renin angiotensin system ras cardioprotection due to vasodilative reduction of blood pressure afterload reduction antiproliferative reduced cell growth reduction of vascular andor ventricular remodeling reduced formation of extracellular matrix as well as antiadrenergic actions and due to the stimulating effect on natriuresis reduction of blood pressure preload reduction can be expected <EOS>

<SOS> to date an antithrombotic and profibrinolytic action could only be demonstrated for ace inhibitors <EOS>
<SOS> this effect has been discussed to be responsible for the improvement of long term prognosis in patients with coronary artery disease <EOS>
<SOS> despite the similar spectrum of action there exist important differences between ace inhibitors and at1 receptor antagonists that might underline the need of an individual use of these drugs the dual action of ace inhibitors on the ras and the kinin system bears many benefits but has been also shown to be accompanied by side effects mainly chronic dry cough in a relatively high percentage of patients thus leading to discontinuation of therapy in 8 14 <EOS>
<SOS> this respective side effect can be prevented by the use of at1 receptor antagonists <EOS>
<SOS> it has been discussed whether the incomplete action of ace inhibitors on at1 receptor mediated effects is at least in part responsible for the efficacy of this drug which is relatively high <MOB> as compared to other substances <EOS>
<SOS> due to their direct action at1 receptor blockers might also be of high effectiveness for the treatment of severe heart failure <EOS>
<SOS> a combination of the ace inhibitor mediated activation of the kinin system with the more specific blockade of at1 receptors by at1 receptor antagonists might be of benefit and is currently under investigation <EOS>
<SOS> finally it has been discussed that the incresed at ii concentration in case of at1 receptor blockade activates at2 receptor mediated mechanisms thus leading to an additive vasoprotective effect <EOS>

<SOS> at distinct time points during the intervention a cine loop of both ventricles was registered employing a mid short axis view <EOS>
<SOS> simultaneously oxygenation parameters as well as electrocardiographic data and intrathoracic co2 pressure were taken <EOS>
<SOS> wall motion analysis was done postoperatively <EOS>
<SOS> results with increasing duration of single lung ventilation significant regional and global biventricular hypokinesia was detected <EOS>
<SOS> this was accompanied by a decrease in pao2 and a marked increase in intrathoracic co2 pressure <EOS>
<SOS> these alterations disappeared after weaning from extracorporeal circulation and reconstitution of double lung ventilation <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion these results show that computer enhanced coronary artery bypass grafting leads to significant alterations in intraoperative biventricular myocardial function <EOS>
<SOS> this can be due to either an impact on oxygenation during single lung ventilation or due to intrathoracic co2 insufflation <EOS>
<SOS> however in our group these alteration showed only small clinical relevance <EOS>

<SOS> numerous methods are available for treating congenital dysplasia of the hip cdh <EOS>
<SOS> the important point seems to be the differentiation between dysplastic hip joints with and without displaced femoral heads <EOS>
<SOS> a historical review of the diagnosis of so called congenital dysplasia and dislocation of the hip and different indications for therapeutic maneuvers is given <EOS>
<SOS> generally a three step plan of treatment is recommended dislocated heads must be reduced after which retention is needed until the hip joint is stable <EOS>
<SOS> this is followed by maturation period until the nonossified hyalin cartilagineous performed acetabular roof is ossified <EOS>
<SOS> all hip joints regardless of age can be assigned to one of these phases <EOS>
<SOS> in all cases measures are taken to prevent ischemic necrosis of the femoral head <EOS>
<SOS> to prevent the residual dysplasia of the acetabulum roof and femoral head necrosis the reduction retention position should be more than <NUM> <NUM> ° flexion in the hip joint but not more than 45 50 <NUM> ° abduction <EOS>
<SOS> in each therapeutic phase there is a different biomechanical situation in the hip joint <EOS>
<SOS> the appropriate orthosis for treatment is chosen according to the particular biomechanical situation <EOS>

<SOS> a case of a patient with malignant acanthosis nigricans in association with carcinoma of the lung is reported documenting successful palliative treatment of the warty papillomatous thickening of the lips with electrocautery <EOS>
<SOS> molecular atmospheric oxygen contains two unpaired electrons in the unreactive triplet state and thus has to be activated in order to react with other biological molecules in the singlet ground state <EOS>
<SOS> these processes of activation include very reactive intermediates <EOS>
<SOS> therefore aerobic cells must cope with and to some extent also adapt to oxidative stress provoked for example by infection or intoxication where reactive intermediates of oxygen activation accumulate <EOS>
<SOS> depending on the strength of these impacts several symptoms indicate the deviation from normal steady state metabolism <EOS>
<SOS> most of these visible or measurable symptoms are connected with oxygen activation where principally a transition from heterolytic reactions two electron transitions to increased homolytic reactions one electron transitions is observed <EOS>
<SOS> homolytic reactions produce free radicals which are generally counteracted by a parallel increase of intrinsic radical scavenging processes or by compounds administered with food thus warranting metabolic control within certain limits <EOS>
<SOS> at advanced states of stress control may be gradually lost and chaotic radical processes dominate <EOS>
<SOS> finally cellular decompartmentalizations yield apoptotic lytic and or necrotic processes <EOS>
<SOS> every episode during this cascade is characterizable by the balance between pro and antioxidative capacities <EOS>
<SOS> antioxidants which in many cases are free radical scavengers or quenchers of activated states comprise a wealth of classes of organic molecules including phenolics probably as the most prominent ones <EOS>
<SOS> in this article mechanisms of oxygen activation and protection from oxidative damage are discussed <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore examples of antioxidative functions of a few important natural products are reported <EOS>

<SOS> at the end of the study no operation was required in 70 7 of the placebo treated children and in 78 1 of the children treated with homeopathic preparations <EOS>
<SOS> these results show no statistical significance <EOS>

<SOS> morbus parkinson is a progressive degenerative disease of the human central peripheral and enteric nervous systems <EOS>
<SOS> in the course of the disease not only the substantia nigra but also extranigral components of the motor system as well as numerous limbic system and autonomic centers undergo serious damage <EOS>
<SOS> accordingly parkinson is disease is a multisystem disorder <EOS>
<SOS> only specific types of projection neurons fall victim to it <EOS>
<SOS> the first manifestation of the pathological process which causes the disease are abnormalities of the neuronal cytoskeleton <EOS>
<SOS> intracytoplasmic inclusions evolving in the form of lewy bodies in perikarya and lewy neurites in the neuronal processes result in premature cell death of the affected neurons <EOS>
<SOS> on the basis of this selective neuronal vulnerability a categorization emerges of the pathological changes within the nervous system and corresponding functional impairments <EOS>

<SOS> osteomyelitis is an infection of the bone marrow caused by both non specific and specific agents <EOS>
<SOS> non specific endogenic osteomyelitis represents the most frequent form followed by the specific form caused by mycobacterium tuberculosis infection <EOS>
<SOS> typically the non specific form occurs in children and young adults and the sites most frequently affected are the distal and the proximal ends of the tibia and femur <EOS>
<SOS> in tuberculosis osteomyelitis is predominantly located in the vertebral bodies <EOS>
<SOS> in rare cases osteomyelitis can be caused by viruses fungi or echinococcus <EOS>

<SOS> histologically dense infiltration of leucocytes granulation tissue and bone sequesters can be seen <EOS>
<SOS> in tuberculosis granulomas with central necrosis epithelioid cells and giant cells of langhans type are characteristically found <EOS>
<SOS> most forms of acute osteomyelitis can be successfully treated with antibiotics leading to complete healing without complications <EOS>
<SOS> only a few reported cases develop into a secondary chronic form <EOS>

<SOS> however similar syndromes can be observed after lesions involving subcortical structures connected with the prefrontal cortex in neuronal networks <EOS>
<SOS> with respect to the different clinical pictures and underlying brain lesions prefrontal lobe dysfunction may be divided into a disorganized type caused by lesion of the dorsolateral prefrontal lobe and its connections a disinhibited type that can be observed following lesions of the orbitofrontal cortex and an apathetic type following lesions affecting the functional balance between the cingulum and the supplementary motor area <EOS>

<SOS> the measures taken in intensive care medicine are rated differently by the patients their family and personnel <EOS>
<SOS> a lack of understanding for intensive care therapy can lead to a negative attitude towards intensive care medicine which in turn makes an impression on public opinion and disturbs the reputation of the co workers in intensive care medicine <EOS>
<SOS> to form an objective view we carried out a survey of <NUM> co workers 11 physicians <NUM> from the nursing staff and <NUM> ancillary personnel regarding the medical technology the environment in the unit general medical questions and the extent of intensive care therapy <EOS>
<SOS> the length of employment in the intensive care unit ranged from 1 240 months median <NUM> months the ages ranged from <NUM> to <NUM> years median <NUM> years <EOS>
<SOS> of those questioned 73 <NUM> found intensive care medicine in its current form to be purposeful 100 of the physicians and only 57 of the nursing staff were of this opinion <EOS>
<SOS> only 9 of the physicians believed the equipment to be fear inducing for the patients in contrast 61 of the nursing staff believed this to be true <EOS>
<SOS> the noise level was rated as very disturbing by 65 of the nursing staff and 45 of the physicians <EOS>

<SOS> of the physicians 46 believed that the patients were comfortable <EOS>
<SOS> of the nursing staff 100 were of the opinion that for the deceased patients organ substitution therapy had continued too long <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand only 45 of the residents shared this opinion <EOS>
<SOS> the medical staff rated the intensive care measures as purposeful less disturbing for the patients and more effective than did the nursing staff <EOS>
<SOS> in many cases the nursing staff as a group exhibited a contrary and negative opinion <EOS>
<SOS> this could possibly be caused by insecurity lack of information and lack of successful experiences <EOS>
<SOS> next to patient outcome the competent explanation and information regarding the disease and prognosis and the recurrent communication within the intensive care team with respect to diagnostic and therapeutic measures are the deciding factors in the opinion formation regarding intensive care medicine <EOS>

<SOS> in patients with renal or hepatic failure the pharmacokinetics of opioids may be affected in several ways leading to the necessity to correct the dose <EOS>
<SOS> the liver is the major site for biotransformation of most opioids <EOS>
<SOS> the major metabolic pathway is oxidation <EOS>
<SOS> exceptions to this are morphine and buprenorphine which undergo primarily glucuronidation and remifentanil which is cleared by esther hydrolysis <EOS>
<SOS> the hydrophilic metabolites are predominantly excreted by the kidneys and may accumulate in patients with renal insufficiency <EOS>
<SOS> some metabolites such as morphine 6 glucuronide m6g or normeperidine are active opioid agonists <EOS>
<SOS> with high concentrations they may cause narcotic effects or respiratory depression <EOS>
<SOS> in addition special risks are known for normepridine that has been shown to exert neurotoxic effects with the risk of seizures <EOS>
<SOS> few cases of respiratory depression following the administration of codeine dihydrocodeine and tramdol have been reported <EOS>
<SOS> the elimination half life of these drugs was prolonged <EOS>
<SOS> lastly the disposition of methadone buprenorphine fentanyl sufentanyl and remifentanil appears to be unaffected in renal failure <EOS>

<SOS> having lost its touch with international pediatrics regained its high standard during the late forties and fifties and now develops in concordance with the changing needs and the advances of pediatrics in a highly industialoized nation <EOS>

<SOS> routine ecg however is not indicated in patients under <NUM> years of age who do not present with signs or history of preexisting cardiac diseases but should be performed on a routine basis in all patients over <NUM> years of age <EOS>

<SOS> in this paper we present a method for measuring the wear of the polyethylene inlay in knee joint endoprostheses from standard x ray images <EOS>
<SOS> our approach is to estimate the spatial position of the tibial and femoral components of the prostheses from their contours in the x ray image <EOS>
<SOS> when we know the exact shape of these two components we can calculate the minimal spatial distance between them which approximates the remaining thickness of the inlay <EOS>
<SOS> first results show that this approach might provide sufficient accuracy for the given task <EOS>

<SOS> a desinfection often irritates the vulvovaginal region of little girls so that for years we use estriol ointment only which is tolerated <EOS>
<SOS> excellently a single dose application being sufficient burning itching and discharge disappear and the vaginal epithelium gets more resistant because of the estrogen influence so that the healing process is accelerated <EOS>

<SOS> in adults infectious spondylitis is a rare but severe disease caused by a bacterial thrombus in tissue of reduced resistance <EOS>
<SOS> in conventional radiographs initial findings are a narrowing of the intervertebral space local osteoporosis and poorly defined erosive borders of the vertebral endplates <EOS>
<SOS> these changings can be found at least three to six weeks after the onset of disease <EOS>
<SOS> however in szintigraphy and mrt pathologic alterations are evident after ten to twelve days <EOS>
<SOS> thus early diagnosis and treatment becomes possible <EOS>
<SOS> in early stages of the disease a localized lysis surrounded by a reactive sclerosis appears in predisposed areas of the vertebral body subchondral anterobasal ventral central <EOS>
<SOS> apparently a soft tissue tumor is associated <EOS>
<SOS> sclerosis and reduction of the soft tissue tumor are the first signs of repair processes <EOS>
<SOS> after at least <NUM> weeks computed tomography can reveal typical sintering of the vertebral body and occasionally the development of a bony sequester <EOS>
<SOS> in addition mrt as well as ct can be helpful in the detection and localization of complications as abscesses or affection of the vertebral canal <EOS>
<SOS> the tuberculous spondylitis can sometimes cause difficulties in differential diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> clinical findings affection of several vertebral bodies large soft tissue tumors with appearance of calcification as well as not typical locations are strongly suggestive of tuberculous spondylitis but these findings are not specific of the disease <EOS>
<SOS> degenerative disorders such as erosive osteochondrosis or changings due to chronic dialysis e g amyloid or crystal arthropathies may cause even more problems in differential diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> typical for a blastomatous process is the integrity of the interverebral disc space which is a rare finding in spondylitis <EOS>

<SOS> we measured the ventilatory pattern and additional work of breathing wobadd at three different levels of inspiratory pressure support ips 5 10 <NUM> mbar above positive end expiratory pressure peep and in a new ventilatory mode automatic tube compensation atc in nine operative patients without lung injury nine patients ventilated for several following acute respiratory insufficiency ari <EOS>
<SOS> in atc endotracheal tube resistance is compensated automatically by means of closed loop control of the calculated tracheal pressure <EOS>
<SOS> pressure support in this mode i e airway pressure above peep is equal to the actual flow dependent pressure drop across the endotracheal tube ett <EOS>
<SOS> airway pressure rises at the beginning of inspiration and falls towards the end <EOS>
<SOS> as the tube resistance of ett seriously hinders expiration and can cause desynchronization between ventilator and patient airway pressure is reduced below peep during expiration in the same way as it is increased during inspiration <EOS>
<SOS> the result is a near constant tracheal pressure at peep both during inspiration and during expiration <EOS>
<SOS> this mode could be best termed as electronic extubation <EOS>

<SOS> any medical procedure must be legally authorized by the patient giving informed consent <EOS>
<SOS> this prerequisite is based on the right to self determination <EOS>
<SOS> otherwise a medical procedure is considered as physical injury <EOS>
<SOS> thus the way how a specific procedure is performed predominantly depends on the patient is will <EOS>
<SOS> the attending physician is duty is to find out this will which is especially important when old patients and patients incapable of giving valid consent are involved <EOS>
<SOS> before the procedure the physician has to have a confidential talk with the patient <EOS>
<SOS> he has to point out the best treatment possible considering the individual circumstances of the patient is life <EOS>
<SOS> the physician has to find out weather the patient is competent to refuse or consent to treatement <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore the consultation is an opportunity to diminish the patient is fear and to increase his confidence <EOS>
<SOS> the main problem treating old patients is that they often lack the mental ability for appreciation of the nature of the situation <EOS>
<SOS> one has to differentiate between the physiological mental decay and dementia or psychiatric diseases <EOS>
<SOS> in these cases a third party consent is necessary <EOS>

<SOS> many patients with acquired strabismus do not suffer from diplopia and confusion after an individually and age dependent interval <EOS>
<SOS> they inhibit the image of the deviated eye by binocular rilvary and particularly by the physiological ability to disregard visually disturbing stimuli <EOS>
<SOS> red cells platelet concentrates and fresh frozen plasma of a single donation contain leucocytes causing a lot of side effects <EOS>
<SOS> modern filtration and apheresis techniques lead to a reduction of residual leucocyte counts of 1x106 per unit <EOS>
<SOS> the best method to achieve controlled and validated conditions is the blood bank performed standardised prestorage filtration <EOS>
<SOS> this is an effective method to prevent cytokine mediated and leucocyte mediated febrile nonhaemolytic transfusion reactions fnhtr to prevent a primary immunisation to leucocyte and histocompatibility antigens to avoid transmission of viral infections by blood transfusion e g <EOS>
<SOS> cytomegalovirus cmv and to exclude in special cases bacterial septicaemia <EOS>
<SOS> in addition there are references to reduce the postoperative infections the rate of recurrence of a tumor and the postoperative complications in patients undergoing cardiac surgery <EOS>
<SOS> the use of leucocyte depleted blood components for special indications is meanwhile established <EOS>
<SOS> some european countries have made a decision for a general filtration of all blood components containing leucocytes <EOS>
<SOS> the authors recommend the general leucocyte depletion of blood components considering the german medical law amg and cost benefit ratio <EOS>

<SOS> inpatient client centered psychotherapy improved defensiveness in the case of initial self criticism and diminished it in the case of initial retentiveness <EOS>

<SOS> this paper concerns advances in the integration of psychotherapy in psychiatric education and clinical practice and whether they go along with increasing research activities <EOS>
<SOS> to find answers a survey on psychotherapy research was carried out in all german psychiatric hospitals and departments by means of a questionnaire <EOS>
<SOS> the results indicate that psychotherapy research is done nearly exclusively in university hospitals <EOS>
<SOS> about half of them had already published psychotherapy studies and two thirds of them are presently carrying out studies mostly including prospective randomized clinical trials <EOS>
<SOS> these studies cover the whole spectrum of psychiatric disorders substance abuse schizophrenic and affective disorders anxiety and obsessive compulsive and personality disorders <EOS>
<SOS> to improve psychotherapy research conditions further efforts are necessary to increase scientific exchange financial support and the integration of institutions outside the universities <EOS>
<SOS> there is little to suggest that the course of preeclamsia can be substantially affected by drug treatment <EOS>
<SOS> the vast majority of randomized studies do not indicate beneficial effects of antihypertensive treatment on proteinuria fetal heart rate abnormalities abruptio placentae and the incidence of preterm birth <EOS>
<SOS> there is also no definite effect on the development of superimposed preeclampsia hellp syndrome renal failure or eclampsia <EOS>
<SOS> moreover blood pressure lowering agents fail to improve uteroplacental perfusion but may have adverse effects on fetal growth <EOS>
<SOS> antihypertensive treatment is only indicated in severe hypertension 170 110 mm hg to reduce the risk of cerebral hemorrhage <EOS>
<SOS> dihydralazine injections may result in reduced placental blood flow and fetal distress <EOS>
<SOS> oral nifedipine offers some advantages in view of more potent vasodilator actions on uterine and fetoplacental vessels and a lower incidence of fetal distress <EOS>
<SOS> increasing evidence suggests that the mechanism of eclamptic seizure is cerebral vasoconstriction with resultant ischemia <EOS>
<SOS> cerebral vessels are particularly sensitive to magnesium which works by reversing cerebral vasoconstriction with resultant improvement in blood flow <EOS>
<SOS> controlled trials have shown magnesium to be superior to both placebo and phenytoin for the prevention of eclampsia <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore magnesium has been found to be more effective than diazepam and phenytoin in preventing recurrence of seizures in women with eclampsia <EOS>
<SOS> also the neonatal outcome favors magnesium which is now generally accepted as the drug of choice for the prevention and treatment of eclampsia <EOS>

<SOS> cardiomyocytes lose the ability to proliferate after birth <EOS>
<SOS> subsequently irreversible cellular damage e g during myocardial infarction causes loss of functional properties and cell replacement by fibrotic tissue <EOS>
<SOS> it is therefore not surprising that cell replacement strategies such as cardiomyocyte transplantation in damaged myocardium or scar tissue has gained widespread interest <EOS>
<SOS> in other species such as mice rats and dogs the technical feasibility of skeletal myoblast satellite cell and fetal cardiomyocyte engraftment into normal and diseased myocardium has been demonstrated by simple injection methods <EOS>
<SOS> repeatedly it has been shown that transplanted cells may survive for weeks within host myocardium and build intercellular connections such as grap junctions and desmosomes <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast grafthost connections have not as yet been convincingly demonstrated <EOS>
<SOS> hypothetically cell transplants might exhibit the following functional properties stabilization of diseased tissue to prevent structural remodeling carrier for recombinant proteins growth factors or drugs to induce molecular alterations of host myocardium and improvement of regional and global myocardial function due to active contractility <EOS>
<SOS> however clear evidence of coordinated contractility of transplanted cells and thus of a clinically relevant therapeutical use of cardiomyocyte transplantation as a replacement strategy for damaged host cardiac cells remains to be demonstrated <EOS>

<SOS> these factors determine the susceptibility of the lung for an acute or chronic course of disease <EOS>

<SOS> there is a world wide renaissance of neurosurgical treatments of parkinson is disease pd based on substantial progress in basic sciences <EOS>
<SOS> a model of parallel motor circuitry has identified potential targets for lesioning by clarifying the pathophysiological role of the basal ganglia in pd <EOS>
<SOS> the internal globus pallidus gpi is an essential player as it connects to thalamocortical projections and can be disinhibited by overactivity of the nucleus subthalamicus nst <EOS>
<SOS> lesioning of these targets has been successful in mptp damaged primates <EOS>
<SOS> there is clinical use of destructive as well as restorative and stimulative technics <EOS>
<SOS> pallidotomy and thalamatomy have evolved by the use of better neuroradiological and electrophysiological targeting <EOS>
<SOS> the first technic is used for treatment of rigidity hypokinesia and dyskinesias the latter one has proven to be efficient for tremor <EOS>
<SOS> dopaminergic reinnervation and increased dopaminergic output of the striatum has only been seen after transplantation of fetal cells this method however carries immunological and ethical problems <EOS>
<SOS> the continuous high frequency stimulation of basal ganglia is the newest technic it is highly adaptable to the patient is need and carries a low morbidity profile <EOS>
<SOS> thalamic stimulation is used for the treatment of tremor <EOS>
<SOS> the stimulation of nst and gpi are proposed for dyskinesias and on off phenomena <EOS>
<SOS> animal research further focuses on xenotransplantation and implantation of genetically transformed cells or pluripotent precursor cells <EOS>
<SOS> in summary neurosurgical procedures seem to be verey promising however longterm comparison studies are needed to define the best combination treatment s for the future <EOS>

<SOS> the medtronic thera thera i and kappa 400 pacemakers utilize a mode switching algorithm that switches from the dd r mode to the ddir mode in the presence on an atrial tachyarrhythmia <EOS>
<SOS> to accomplish this the pacemaker keeps track of a mean atrial rate mar which is a weighted index of the atrial rate <EOS>
<SOS> once the mar is greater than the programmed mode switch rate the pacemaker mode switches to the nontracking mode <EOS>
<SOS> because the algorithm weights faster atrial rates more heavily than slow atrial rates the algorithm is sensitive to a wide variety of atrial tachyarrhythmias including those with varying amplitudes <EOS>
<SOS> additionally the algorithm provides a long pvarp and a rate adaptive ra av interval <EOS>
<SOS> these not only help ensure that a wide range of atrial rates will be detected but may also limit the time the patient tracks at the upper rate before mode switching <EOS>
<SOS> in order to assess the effectiveness of the algorithm the thera i provides detailed diagnostics which provide information on the date time duration and rate of the mode switch episodes <EOS>
<SOS> additionally more detailed beat to beat information is provided for each episode which can help determine its appropriateness and can assist in making programming changes <EOS>

<SOS> atrial fibrillation is the most commonly encountered sustained arrhythmia in men <EOS>
<SOS> it is associated with a two fold mortality risk and an increased cost for health care providers <EOS>
<SOS> the relative inefficacy and the risks of pharmacologic approaches to atrial fibrillation therapy have contributed to increasing efforts to address atrial fibrillation with curative ablative strategies <EOS>
<SOS> ablation approaches for atrial fibrillation focus on two alternate strategies ablation of the substrate for initiation and ablation of the substrate for maintenance of atrial fibrillation <EOS>
<SOS> it has been demonstrated that atrial fibrillation may be initiated by repetitive atrial premature beats originating from a single focus <EOS>
<SOS> these ectopic foci can be mapped and ablated thereby removing the substrate for initiation of atrial fibrillation <EOS>
<SOS> most often these atrial premature beats arise from the pulmonary veins <EOS>
<SOS> a challenge in trying to ablate the trigger is actually having enough spontaneous activity from the said focus throughout the electrophysiologic study <EOS>
<SOS> to sidestep the need of mapping pure anatomic approaches are currently under investigation to electrically isolate the pulmonary veins from the atrial myocardium by circumferential lesions <EOS>
<SOS> in patients without a defined trigger for atrial fibrillation efforts were made to ablate the substrate for maintenance of atrial fibrillation <EOS>
<SOS> strong evidence exists that atrial fibrillation is the result of multiple coexisting reentrant wavelets requiring a critical myocardial mass to perpetuate <EOS>
<SOS> several working groups demonstrated that intraoperative compartmentalization of the myocardial tissue by surgical incisions or radiofrequency pulses is highly effective in preventing atrial fibrillation <EOS>
<SOS> currently attempts were made to reproduce the surgical technique using transveneous catheter based approaches <EOS>
<SOS> though our knowledge of ablation techniques and technical prerequisites is continuously increasing the difficulty to produce complete linear lesions in the left atrium and local thrombus formation at the ablation line are problems that are still not solved <EOS>

<SOS> controlling these changes for differences in baseline paramters the dementia specific reduction was about 1 5 hours compared to a non psychiatric control group <EOS>
<SOS> these clinically relevant changes in activity levels underscore the importance of these activity domains with regard to the development of diagnostically useful indicators at the early stages of dementia <EOS>
<SOS> time budget methods seem to be particularly useful to close the diagnostic gap with regard to the assessment of everyday competence indicators especially at early stages of the dementia illness <EOS>

<SOS> the causes seem to generate from familial or sporadic abnormalities mutations <EOS>

<SOS> atrial fibrillation is in 20 50 the most frequent dysrhythmia after coronary artery bypass grafting cabg and a possible cause for hemodynamical complications and prolongation off the medical treatment in patients <EOS>
<SOS> therefore the effect of blocking with metoprolol for prevention of supraventricular arrhythmias sva was investigated in a prospective and randomized trial <EOS>
<SOS> 200 patients after cabg were randomized in a drug and control group average age <NUM> years <NUM> male <NUM> female <EOS>
<SOS> patients of the drug group n 100 were treated with metoprolol 1mg kg bw beginning on day one after operation whereas patients of the control group n 100 received therapy only in case of occurrence of atrial fibrillaton <EOS>
<SOS> ecg blood pressure and electrolyte concentrations were measured regulary until the tenth day after surgery <EOS>
<SOS> reasons for exclusion were an ejection fraction 30 sa and av block or simultaneous application of epinephrine and metoprolol <EOS>
<SOS> there were no significant differences between the patients of drug and control group with respect to age sex ejection fraction previous medication number and type of bypass grafts cardiopulmonary bypass time and perioperative ischemic events <EOS>
<SOS> however a statistically significant difference was seen in the occurrence of supraventricular arrhythmias in both groups <NUM> patients of the therapy group 4 in contrast to <NUM> patients of the control 37 developed supraventricular arrhythmias during the postoperative observation period p<MOB> <EOS>
<SOS> both groups differed in total time of hospital stay by <NUM> days control group <NUM> <NUM> days drug group <NUM> <NUM> days which was statistically significant p0 05 <EOS>
<SOS> all patients of the drug group could be discharged with a stable sinusrhythm whereas <NUM> patients of the control group were discharged with persistent atrial fibrillation <EOS>
<SOS> the difference was statistically significant as well p0 01 <EOS>
<SOS> neither typical side effects of metoprolol nor av blocks bradycardia f60 min or symptoms of low blood pressure could be observed <EOS>
<SOS> the conclusion of this trial is a recommendation for a preventive application of 50mg metoprolol day after coronary artery bypass surgery which can reduce the incidence of sva as well as the hospital stay statistically significant <EOS>

<SOS> in this review we discuss ep studies in patients with thrombosis of basilar artery space occupying cerebellar infarction and supratentorial mass lesions of different aetiology <EOS>
<SOS> paclitaxel a potent anti tumor agent shifts the cytoskeleton equilibrium towards assembly of altered and extraordinarily stable microtubules <EOS>
<SOS> these cellular modifications lead to reduced proliferation migration and signal transduction <EOS>
<SOS> it is highly lipophilic which promotes a rapid cellular uptake and has a long lasting effect in the cell due to the structural alteration of the cytoskeleton <EOS>
<SOS> this makes paclitaxel a promising candidate for local drug delivery intended to address the proliferative and migratory processes involved in restenosis <EOS>
<SOS> in this article results of our in vitro and in vivo studies with paclitaxel are presented <EOS>
<SOS> cell culture experiments with monocultures of human arterial smooth muscle cells as well as cocultures with human endothelial cells showed that paclitaxel leads to an almost complete growth inhibition within a dose range of <MOB>µmol l even after a short 20 min single dose application <EOS>
<SOS> the comparison of an active semi active and passive delivery system porous balloon microporous balloon and double balloon favored the double balloon for the following in vivo experiments <EOS>
<SOS> tubulin staining and electron microscopy enabled visualization of paclitaxel induced vessel wall alterations <EOS>
<SOS> in the rabbit model locally delivered paclitaxel resulted in reduced neointima formation and enlargement in vessel size in the pig model however after stenting this inhibition was not significant <EOS>
<SOS> both reduced proliferation and enlargement in vessel size contribute to a preservation of vessel shape and are likely to be caused by a structural alteration of the cytoskeleton which is also supported by vascular contraction force experiments <EOS>
<SOS> atopic eczema is one of the most frequent dermatological diseases with a still increasing incidence <EOS>
<SOS> although its etiopathogenesis is still not completely understood a variety of triggering factors are known <EOS>

<SOS> this demonstrates how important both dermatological therapy and close cooperation with the field of psychosomatic medicine can be <EOS>
<SOS> identity development in adolescence may act as stressor triggering juvenile psychotic episodes <EOS>
<SOS> a model is being presented stating that self development in subjects with high vulnerability for psychosis leads to the establishment of an imaginary self consisting of phantasies and fictions without taking into account facts and social realities <EOS>
<SOS> the imaginary self stabilizes irritating self deficiencies thus leading to a vulnerability for depersonalisation and identity diffusion during actual turmoils of adaptation <EOS>
<SOS> biomaterials are defined as non living materials which are used in interaction with biological systems <EOS>
<SOS> especially in the field of urology biomaterials are applied in urinary diversion urinary incontinence erectile dysfunction and as cosmetic prostheses <EOS>
<SOS> biomaterial tissue interaction is caused by the physical and chemical characteristics of the biomaterial its degradation and the resulting protein denaturation <EOS>
<SOS> general requirements include biocompatibility and functionality and the avoidance of carcinogenic mutagenic toxic and allergic reactions <EOS>
<SOS> this ist most important when there is permanent contact between urine and epithelial tissue which may lead to biofilminfection and incrustation <EOS>
<SOS> continuous modification of known materials inauguration of new materials as well as the possibilities of tissue engineering will determine their development in the years to come <EOS>
<SOS> hitherto the question of an indication for psychoanalytic group psychotherapy has not been clarified sufficiently <EOS>
<SOS> in this paper under the premise that psychoanalytic group psychotherapy is a treatment mode in its own right the issue is investigated which patients might best profit from the group treatment method <EOS>
<SOS> it is pointed out that the group process itself contains a variety of therapeutic treatment factors which cannot be facilitated through psychoanalytic treatment of just one patient <EOS>
<SOS> first a series of diagnostic structural motivational and cognitive indication criteria are discussed <EOS>
<SOS> second the moments of a capacity for cohesion and aspects of social relatedness are considered as helpful tools for a formulation of an indication <EOS>
<SOS> as cohesion according to group treatment outcome research results has to be viewed as correspondent to the helpful therapeutic alliance in the context of group psychotherapy the quest for indication is inextricably linked to patient selection and setting conditions <EOS>
<SOS> the conclusion is that psychoanalytic group psychotherapy would preferably be indicated for those patients who suffer from constraints of emotional competence as stemming from developmental deficits <EOS>

<SOS> after single dose antibiotic therapy with <NUM> mg ciprofloxacin given immediately after catheterization no infectious complications occurred <EOS>

<SOS> most people with the metabolic syndrome die from thrombotic complications superimposed to degenerative arterial vascular lesions mostly myocardial infarction <EOS>
<SOS> type 2 diabetes is a risk factor per se for such complications but often clusters with dyslipoproteinemia hypertension and obesity <EOS>
<SOS> this is referred to as metabolic syndrome and often operates on a genetically programmed susceptibility which accelerates the pathogenesis of coronary artery disease in front of a much wider diabetes specific cardiopathy <EOS>
<SOS> from a pathophysiological point of view none of these associated risk factors explains the pathogenetic series of events leading to the precipitation of an occlusive thrombus at sites of complicated coronary plaques <EOS>
<SOS> in patients with the metabolic syndrome the coagulation system is switched towards a prethrombotic state involving increased plasmatic coagulation diminished fibrinolysis decreased endothelial thromboresistance and predominantly platelet hyperreactivity diabetic thrombocytopathy <EOS>
<SOS> some of these factors are associated with an increased coronary risk e g <EOS>
<SOS> fibrinogen pai 1 platelets but are also directly linked to the pathogenesis of atherothrombosis <EOS>
<SOS> altered cardiac remodelling together with adhesion and coagulation mechanisms appears suitable to explain decreased functional performance of infarcted organs decreased success of acute reduced fibrinolytic response no reflow phenomenon and longterm intervention strategies for vessel patency ptca cabg in diabetes <EOS>
<SOS> glucose adjustment alone will not adequately neutralize these complex mechanisms but in the situation of myocardial infarction eumetabolization with parenteral glucose insulin potassium infusion appears mandatory similar to non diabetics <EOS>
<SOS> on the longterm a multidimensional interventional repertoire is required particularly in patients with the metabolic syndrome including antihypertensive antidyslipoproteinemic and antithrombotic drugs customized according to the individual patients needs as assessed by early diagnostic measures early secondary prevention <EOS>
<SOS> the indication for operative treatment in spondylolisthesis results from pain progressive sliding and in up to <NUM> of the patients with progressive dislocation from radicular malfunction <EOS>
<SOS> the posterolateral fusion in situ is a safe procedure but the deformation remains and in spondyloptosis plastic deformation of the fusion mass can lead to further dislocation <EOS>
<SOS> with the external fixator as an instrument for reduction and the internal fixator for stabilization the reduction of even serious spondyloptosis and the recovery of a normal spine alignement and posture is possible with an acceptable neurological risk <EOS>
<SOS> therefore a concept of treatment is suggested which as a rule is aiming at the anatomical reduction of the dislocated vertrebra beside stabilization and nerveroot decompression <EOS>
<SOS> depending on the extent of the slip reduction and stabilization is to be performed in one two or three stages <EOS>
<SOS> an anterior or posterior fusion is sufficient in grade i dislocation <EOS>
<SOS> in grade ii v a combined posterior and anterior surgical proceedure is recommended <EOS>
<SOS> objectives this study was conducted to evaluate a modified technique of interskalene brachial plexus anaesthesia isb and postoperative catheter analgesia for shoulder surgery <EOS>
<SOS> the original method described by winnie bears some rare but life threatening complications inadvertent subarachnoid or intra arterial injection pneumothorax <EOS>
<SOS> objectives due to its low solubility and negligible metabolism desflurane is assumed to be especially suitable for application by low flow anaesthetic techniques <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of this clinical investigation was the development of a standardised dosing scheme for low flow and minimal flow desflurane anaesthesia <EOS>
<SOS> methods one hundred six asa status i ii patients were assigned to six groups according to the duration of the initial high flow phase fresh gas flow and fresh gas desflurane concentration <EOS>
<SOS> the median age height body weight and constitution of the groups was comparable <EOS>
<SOS> after an initial high flow phase using <NUM> l min the fresh gas flow was reduced to <NUM> l min minimal flow anaesthesia or <NUM> l min low flow anaesthesia <EOS>
<SOS> inspired nitrous oxide concentrations were maintained at 60 to 70 <EOS>
<SOS> using different standardised schemes of vaporizer settings inspired desflurane concentrations were applied in the range from 3 4 to 8 7 i e between <NUM> and <NUM> mac <EOS>
<SOS> inspired and expired desflurane concentrations were measured continuously by the side stream technique and recorded on line <EOS>
<SOS> venous blood samples were taken immediately prior to induction and <NUM> min after flow reduction for measurement of carboxyhaemoglobin cohb concentration <EOS>
<SOS> results in the 10 to 15 min initial phase during which a high fresh gas flow of <NUM> l min was used the inspired desflurane concentration reached values in the range of 90 95 of the fresh gas concentration <EOS>
<SOS> in low flow anaesthesia this concentration could be maintained without any alteration of the vaporizer setting whereas in minimal flow anaesthesia with flow reduction the fresh gas concentration had to be increased by 1 to 2 the quotient calculated by division of the inspired desflurane concentration by its fresh gas concentration q ci cf ranges between <NUM> and <NUM> in minimal flow and between <NUM> and <NUM> in low flow anaesthesia <EOS>
<SOS> if use was made of the wide output range of the desflurane vaporizer the inspired concentration could be increased rapidly by about 5 in <NUM> min although the flow was kept constant at <NUM> l min <EOS>
<SOS> compared with its value prior to induction 2 13 1 05 the cohb concentration decreased statistically significantly by about 0 7 during the 1st hour of minimal flow anaesthesia 1 42 1 01 <EOS>
<SOS> in no case was a cohb concentration observed that exceeded threatening or even toxic values although the soda lime was changed routinely only once a week <EOS>
<SOS> conclusions the pharmacokinetic properties of desflurane resulting in especially low individual uptake and the wide output range of the vaporizer facilitate the use of low flow anaesthetic techniques in routine clinical practice <EOS>
<SOS> even in minimal flow anaesthesia the duration of the initial high flow phase can be shortened to min <EOS>
<SOS> if the flow is reduced to <NUM> l min the inspired desflurane concentration achieved in the initial high flow phase can be maintained without any alteration of the vaporizer setting <EOS>
<SOS> in minimal flow anaesthesia however with flow reduction to <NUM> l min the fresh gas concentration has to be increased to a value 1 2 higher than the inspired nominal value <EOS>
<SOS> due to the wide dialling range of the desflurane vaporizer the amount of vapour delivered into the breathing system can be increased to about <NUM> ml min even at a flow of <NUM> l min <EOS>
<SOS> the large amount of agent that can be delivered into the system even under low flow conditions together with the very low individual uptake results in a time constant that is sufficiently short for the clinically required rapid increase in inspired desflurane concentrations <EOS>
<SOS> the short time constant of low flow desflurane anaesthesia improves the control of the anaesthetic concentration <EOS>
<SOS> if all measures are taken to safely avoid inadvertent drying out of the soda lime there is no evidence that low flow anaesthesia with desflurane is liable to increase the risk of accidental ca <EOS>

<SOS> the perforation of an arterial port a cath followed by duodenal fistula is an uncommon complication of regional hepatic chemotherapy <EOS>

<SOS> thrombosis of the hepatic artery or occlusion of the port device are the most common reasons for withdrawal of treatment in our series <EOS>
<SOS> based on our experience and the case report of a duodenal fistula we recommend angiography of the port system prior to each cycle of chemotherapy <EOS>
<SOS> background coenesthesias can be defined as disorders of body perception or body hallucinations projected in different parts of the body <EOS>
<SOS> patients complain of intractable pain or dysesthesia <EOS>
<SOS> these symptoms are reported even from organs where we usually have no perception <EOS>
<SOS> coenesthesia must be regarded as a symptom that can be observed in various psychiatric diseases e g schizophrenia <EOS>
<SOS> however in rare cases coenesthesias can be documented in neurological diseases e g intracranial tumors or infections <EOS>
<SOS> therefore accurate assessment of possible differential diagnoses is important <EOS>
<SOS> in late stages coenesthesias can easily be recognized because of their bizarre character <EOS>
<SOS> in early stages however patients often complain of intractable unlocalizable burning pain <EOS>
<SOS> they frequently undergo operations because of their great suffering <EOS>
<SOS> the drug treatment of first choice is neuroleptics but the results are unpredictable <EOS>

<SOS> we report the case of a 43 year old woman who had a cardiogenic shock due to an acute inferior myocardial infarction <EOS>
<SOS> her husband and a general practitioner living in the neighborhood initially performed cardiopulmonary resuscitation <EOS>
<SOS> a prehospital emergency physician found ventricular fibrillation when he arrived after <NUM> minutes <EOS>
<SOS> it was impossible to achieve stable rhythm by <NUM> attemps of defibrillation <EOS>
<SOS> therefore the patient was carried to our clinic under ongoing cardiopulmonary resuscitation <EOS>
<SOS> a cardiologist was informed with radio signal <EOS>
<SOS> percutaneous cardiopulmonary support pcps was implanted in the emergency department after <NUM> minutes of cardiac arrest <EOS>
<SOS> after stabilizing the hemodynamic situation by pcps 4 5 l min it was possible to transfer the patient to the catheterization laboratory <EOS>
<SOS> angiography revealed proximal occlusion of a dominant right coronary artery <EOS>
<SOS> after successful angioplasty it was possible to reestablish stable sinus rhythm by single defibrillation <EOS>
<SOS> by use of intra aortic balloon pump iabp the flow rate of pcps was reduced every two hours <EOS>
<SOS> after <NUM> hours of support pcps was explaned <EOS>
<SOS> iabp was needed for three days <EOS>
<SOS> the patient was discharged from hospital without any relevant neurological deficits after nine weeks <EOS>
<SOS> by using pcps it is possible to stabilize the patient is hemodynamic situation and to perform diagnostic and therapeutic procedures if other means of resuscitation do not suffice <EOS>
<SOS> the use of pcps in resuscitation is indicated in circulatory arrest if further therapeutic options seem promising <EOS>

<SOS> high endemic areas of viral hepatitis are asia africa latin america and the near middle and far east <EOS>
<SOS> viral hepatitis is also very important in health care workers <EOS>
<SOS> today viral hepatitis can be differentiated from type a to type e g based on immunological and molecular assays <EOS>
<SOS> while enterally transmitted hepatitis type a and type e only induce acute and rare fulminant disease hepatitis type b c and d often induce chronic progressive disease including liver cirrhosis with typical complications due to the portal hypertension and with a high rate of association with the development of primary liver cancer hcc <EOS>

<SOS> hypertensive diseases in pregnancy hdp are one of the most frequent causes of maternal death and perinatal mortality <EOS>
<SOS> however chronic hypertension without complications has a more favorable prognosis than preeclampsia <EOS>
<SOS> apart from a familial predisposition mutations of various genes may also be responsible among these apc resistance is of particular clinical significance <EOS>

<SOS> the result is an endothelial imbalance between vasoconstrictory aggregating and vasodilatatory antiaggregating compounds <EOS>
<SOS> the results of studies on the relevance of no synthase are controversial <EOS>
<SOS> currently neither reliable methods for the early detection nor certain preventative measures to avoid the disease are available <EOS>

<SOS> the goal of this evaluation study is to analyze the effects of a new gerontopsychiatric institution the gerontopsychiatric center gc a combination of a home based outpatient service a day hospital and a consulting office for elderly with mental disorders on the reorganization process of the treatment system from intramural toward extramural structures as experts of the government of the frg have been demanding for a long time <EOS>
<SOS> based on data of cross sectional and longitudinal studies two regional catchment areas the city of bielefeld without gc control region and the district of gütersloh with gc are compared and analyzed whether changes within the gerontopsychiatric system subsystem a the system of general medical treatment subsystem b or within the elderly care system subsystem c occurred <EOS>
<SOS> concerning subsystem a the results are that the gc has a strong impact on the intended shift from intra to extramural structures without selecting patients by diagnosis nor by severity degrees of their mental disorders in extramural treatment facilities <EOS>
<SOS> the home based outpatient treatment is especially successful for elderly with a functional psychic disorder <EOS>
<SOS> these patients had the highest scores in improvement of psychiatric symptoms as well as in reduction of their self care deficits within one year effects of the gc on subsystem b were evident soon after its establishment for example by the increasing cooperation between the gerontopsychiatric health services and general hospitals in the region with gc in which hospitals two fifths of all clinical gerontopsychiatric patients with a mental disorder as the main diagnosis icd 9 are treated <EOS>
<SOS> an effect of the gc on subsystem c is possibly the fact that in its region the rate of direct transfers of patients from the clinical gerontopsychiatric department into homes for the elderly is significantly lower than in the region without gc <EOS>
<SOS> in the field of psychoneuroimmunology it has become obvious that the immune system is governed by multiple influences from the central nervous system <EOS>
<SOS> one approach to verify these interactions can be seen in stress research <EOS>
<SOS> while the phenomenon of stress induced changes in immunological processes is widely accepted more recent studies focus on possible moderators and mechanisms of these responses <EOS>
<SOS> within this research strategy it became evident that catecholamine increases upon stress are of a major importance for the frequently observed mild leukocytosis <EOS>
<SOS> the present study was conducted to investigate whether the often observed stress induced increases in the number of peripheral lymphocyte subsets depends on the amount of epinephrine or norepinephrine release <EOS>
<SOS> moreover the question was addressed whether high or low catecholamine release is related to subjective ratings on discomfort <EOS>
<SOS> using a public speaking paradigm we were able to replicate previous findings of high increases in the absolute number of cd8 and cd56 cells in peripheral blood <EOS>
<SOS> moreover when dividing subjects into high and low catecholamine responders the amount of change was significantly larger in catecholamine responders irrespective of whether norepinephrine or epinephrine was used for grouping the subjects <EOS>
<SOS> however high and low catecholamine responders did not differ with respect to subjective ratings on discomfort <EOS>
<SOS> the data are discussed with respect to underlying mechanisms in catecholamine induced lymphocyte migration and possible reasons for the mismatch between objective and subjective indicators of stressor efficacy <EOS>

<SOS> endotracheal intubation was accomplished easily 9 and the patient was ventilated manually in a semi closed circle system until spontaneous ventilation resumed <EOS>
<SOS> enflurane 1 5 for <NUM> min 1 0 for <NUM> min and 0 8 until the diagnosis of mh was suspected was given in 33 o2 66 n2o <EOS>
<SOS> seventy minutes after induction it was noted that the spontaneous respiratory rate and minute volume had risen continuously from 10 min and <NUM> l min respectively to 20 min and <NUM> l min <EOS>
<SOS> attempts at deepening anaesthesia with repeated doses of fentanyl up to a total dose of <NUM> mg failed to reduce the hyperventilation <EOS>
<SOS> in spite of a high fresh gas flow of <NUM> l min and assisted manual ventilation the fio2 started to fall from <NUM> to <NUM> at <NUM> a m <EOS>
<SOS> the o2 n2o ratio was changed to <NUM> <NUM> 1 but the fio2 remained at <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> mh was suspected enflurane was discontinued and an arterial blood gas analysis was done table 2 <EOS>
