<SOS> the patient did not mention pain or uneasiness postoperatively <EOS>
<SOS> about <NUM> months later a muscle biopsy was done according to the european mh protocol 5 and the patient was found to be mheh <EOS>
<SOS> in this case five main reasons for the hypercarbia and mixed acidosis must be considered table 1 <EOS>
<SOS> firstly hypoventilation does not seem to be reasonable as the patient was ventilated with <NUM> to <NUM> l min which is within the range of <NUM> <NUM> mg kg min <EOS>
<SOS> secondly we can exclude shock and hypoperfusion because the patient had a normal blood pressure and heart rate within <NUM> <NUM> beats min his fingertips and skin were well perfused his body temperature was <NUM> <NUM> °c and there was no sign of muscle rigidity <EOS>
<SOS> thirdly a defect of the co2 adsorber as well as co2 admixture to the n2o and o2 ventilation gases can cause hypercarbia <EOS>
<SOS> we use two absorbers in sequence of which one is changed every day and found neither a change in colour of the indicator nor an abnormally raised temperature of the absorbers 11 <EOS>
<SOS> a postoperative check of the ventilator showed no defect in the o2 n2o supply and a correctly functioning anaesthesia apparatus <EOS>
<SOS> a malfunction of both co2 absorbers resulting in intraoperative hypercarbia could not explain a postoperative mixed acidosis lasting for more than <NUM> h anaesthesias performed at the same time using soda lime from the same canisters were totally uneventful <EOS>
<SOS> it is concluded that the hypercarbia and mixed acidosis were caused by hypermetabolism <EOS>
<SOS> a thorough postoperative examination by an internist did not reveal any thyroid pulmonary endocrine or circulatory reason for our intra and postoperative findings <EOS>
<SOS> iatrogenic factors like superficial anaesthesia or systemic side effects of adrenaline admixture to local anaesthetics can cause hypermetabolism without striking clinical signs but they do not cause mixed acidosis lasting longer than <NUM> h table 2 <EOS>
<SOS> the most suitable explanation in this case is an abortive form of mh <EOS>

<SOS> definition of the problem is it the brain that makes a human being a person <EOS>
<SOS> this anthropological question has been raised because of the findings of modern human brain research and there are severe ethical consequences anew if the appropriate anthropological answer is yes then all invasive research would be problematic because one would touch the basis of human essence <EOS>
<SOS> the problem is that the two major philosophical paradigms that offer an answer to the anthropological question dualism and monism have opposing concepts <EOS>
<SOS> arguments this paper argues that the error of these two paradigms is that they understand the human body and the human mind as res as things <EOS>
<SOS> the explanation of the human being as an interactive unit of body and mind is impossible in both paradigms <EOS>
<SOS> a third anthropological view that tries to make that understandable is the anthropology of the hebrew bible <EOS>
<SOS> it does assume the category thing while speaking about humans it presumes the category aspect <EOS>
<SOS> there is no hebrew word for mind in contrast to body or vice versa <EOS>
<SOS> the biblical language only knows terms for the unity of human beings seen under a certain aspect <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion here the body and thus the brain are important and necessary condition for human essence but this is not a sufficient explanation for the human personality <EOS>
<SOS> invasive research on the human brain is here neither generally forbidden nor tolerated one has to demonstrate in every single case whether the planned operation touches regions that are crucial for the personality of the human subject <EOS>

<SOS> in the present study we developed a method for accurate quantification of this misdirected reinnervation <EOS>

<SOS> biomechanical investigations of the mandible are difficult to perform due to a variety of conditions involved <EOS>
<SOS> for the appropriate reconstruction of biomechanical properties a geometrically correct body model has to be established which fits to complex in vivo conditions <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of our study was to evaluate the use of finite element models fem for the assessment of mandibular deformation under mechanical loading <EOS>
<SOS> explanted human mandibles n 5 were investigated by strain gauges to determine the individual strain distribution under mechanical loading <EOS>
<SOS> fem analysis based on a computed tomograph ct was performed and the results were matched with the test data <EOS>
<SOS> our study demonstrates only minor interindividual differences in the strain distribution for each load studied <EOS>
<SOS> the mechanical response in terms of deformation was found to depend mainly on gross geometrical properties and to a minor extent on the various other variables <EOS>
<SOS> at all positions the maximum principal strain was tensile the minimum principal strain was compressive and the absolute strain values were correlated with the magnitude of the applied force <EOS>
<SOS> ct based fem analysis revealed the utility of mathematical models to approximate simulated data our experimental results <EOS>
<SOS> hence fem analysis is a non invasive tool in the prediction of biomechanical behaviour of individual mandibles and therefore may help in trauma reconstruction and treatment planning <EOS>

<SOS> laparoscopic procedures have attained increasing importance in the diagnosis and therapy of carcinoma of the cervix in recent years table 1 34 <EOS>
<SOS> laparoscopic pelvic and para aortal lymphadenectomies are therefore performed to assess the operability of carcinoma of the cervix and for its staging <EOS>
<SOS> in the case of primarily operable tumours paraortal and pelvic lymphadenectomy is carried out by a laparoscopic procedure and when the lymph nodes are negative nodes and there is no intra abdominal metastasis the lymphadenectomy is combined with laparoscopically assisted vaginal hysterectomy <EOS>
<SOS> if laparoscopy discloses positive lymph nodes debulking can be carried out and the patient can be referred for radiotherapy <EOS>
<SOS> in addition laparoscopic procedures even in combination with radical cervicectomy for early invasive carcinoma of the cervix can mean conservation of the patient is fertility <EOS>
<SOS> in the case of primarily inoperable tumours laparoscopy can be used to assess the lymph node status and the intra abdominal tumour spread and to classify the patient is condition as potentially secondarily operable or inoperable <EOS>

<SOS> joints are innervated by nociceptive nerve fibres nociceptors which are only activated by tissue damaging stimuli <EOS>
<SOS> this activation causes pain in conscious humans <EOS>
<SOS> the sensory terminals of many nociceptors in the tissue are sensitized by inflammatory processes <EOS>
<SOS> under these conditions normally innocuous and non painful stimuli are sufficient to activate nociceptors and to elicit pain <EOS>
<SOS> the effect of inflammatory mediators such as bradykinin and prostaglandins is important for the process of sensitization <EOS>
<SOS> in addition to their sensory function many nociceptors have an efferent function <EOS>
<SOS> they evoke a neurogenic inflammation by the release of neuropeptides such as substance p and calcitonin gene related peptide into the tissue <EOS>
<SOS> the efferent function of nociceptors contributes to the generation of inflammatory lesions of the tissue <EOS>

<SOS> angiotensin converting enzyme ace inhibitors are established drugs for the treatment of patients with heart failure and hypertension <EOS>
<SOS> there is mounting evidence to suggest that ace inhibitors may be used for different indications as well <EOS>
<SOS> the rational for the use of ace inhibitors is to block the vasoconstrictive effects mediated by angiotensin ii <EOS>
<SOS> the hemodynamic profile of ace inhibitors is modified by additional effects such as interference with the degredation of bradykinin and accumulation of prostaglandin and nitric oxide no <EOS>
<SOS> thus ace inhibitors may be successful in preventing the negative effects of vasoconstriction on regional circulation <EOS>
<SOS> since vasoconstriction particularly of the mesenteric vasculature appears to be largely mediated by the renin angiotensin axis ace inhibitors are assumed to be effective in treating or avoiding gut mucosal hypoperfusion <EOS>
<SOS> the critically ill intensive care patient at risk of developing multiple organ dysfunction syndrome mods is still a major therapeutic challenge <EOS>
<SOS> intravenous preparations of ace inhibitors may broaden our therapeutic armamentarium for these patients <EOS>
<SOS> however several questions about the exact mechanisms of ace inhibitors such as the ideal substance and the optimal dose are still open <EOS>
<SOS> moreover further work needs to be done to definitely determine whether ace inhibitors may be helpful to prevent or treat micro circulatory catastrophe in these patients <EOS>
<SOS> the pharmacologic properties of ace inhibitors provide an exciting stepping stone for future research in this field <EOS>

<SOS> various risk scores have been developed for the assessment of operative risk in cardiac surgery <EOS>
<SOS> although risk stratification has been acknowledged as a useful tool to analyze trends in therapy and changes in patient populations its relevance in assessing the indication for surgery has been questioned <EOS>
<SOS> it was the goal of this prospective study to compare <NUM> common risk scores with regard to the predictive value for mortality in individual patients <EOS>

<SOS> early lethality was assessed within <NUM> days postoperatively <EOS>
<SOS> follow up was completed in <NUM> patients <EOS>
<SOS> with the exception of the ontario province risk score lethality in the high risk group was overestimated by all scores whereas lethality in low to moderate risk groups was underestimated by several scores <EOS>
<SOS> mean scores of surviving and deceased patients showed a broad overlap with high standard deviations <EOS>
<SOS> preoperative risk scores are effective tools for stratification of patient populations and the analysis of surgical outcome <EOS>
<SOS> with the aid of risk scores operative risk can be sufficiently predicted for patient populations or subpopulations <EOS>
<SOS> the euro score best predicted the outcome of our patients <EOS>
<SOS> however when the indication for surgery is to be determined in an individual patient risk scores should be only considered as an orientation in the decision process <EOS>

<SOS> purpose the temporomandibular joint is a place of motion where release of proinflammatory cytokines like interleukin 1 il 1 induces cartilage destruction via production of nitric oxide no <EOS>
<SOS> the purpose of this study was to evaluate the effects of continuous passive motion in the form of cyclic stretch on the synthesis of inducible nitric oxide synthase inos <EOS>
<SOS> methods articular chondrocytes were harvested from rabbit cartilage slices and cultured in f12 medium supplemented with 10 fetal calf serum <EOS>
<SOS> subsequently cells 105 ml per well were transferred to flexercell plates grown to 90 confluency and subjected to one of the following regimens 1 no mechanical strain 10 hz 20 elongation rate 2 rhil 1 1 ng ml 3 mechanical strain 4 mechanical strain and rhil 1 <EOS>
<SOS> the cells were exposed to cyclic stretch for <NUM> h thereafter cells were trypsinized and centrifuged on microscope slides in a cytospin centrifuge <EOS>
<SOS> the presence of inos was determined by indirect immunoperoxidase staining using polyclonal rabbit anti inos as primary antibodies and goat anti rabbit igg conjugated with horseradish peroxidase hrp as secondary antibodies <EOS>
<SOS> diaminobenzidine was used as substrate for hrp <EOS>
<SOS> total no production was spectrophotometrically measured in the supernatants of cultures using greiss reaction <EOS>
<SOS> all experiments were done in triplicates and the statistical significance was analyzed by student is t test <EOS>
<SOS> results cells with treatment <NUM> and <NUM> did not exhibit presence of inos <EOS>
<SOS> il 1 treated cells in group <NUM> exhibited intense peroxidase staining <EOS>
<SOS> cells in group <NUM> exposed to il 1 and mechanical stress showed staining with considerably less intensity <EOS>
<SOS> control cells treated with normal rabbit igg as a primary antibody did not exhibit peroxidase staining <EOS>
<SOS> the data were further confirmed by measurement of statistically significant differences of no levels in supernatants assessed in the four different treatment groups <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion our findings suggest that continuous passive motion exerts anti inflammatory effects on chondrocytes downregulating the quantity of inos positive cells <EOS>

<SOS> its characteristics make it suitable for implantation in patients with sensorineural hearing loss <EOS>

<SOS> acute oxalosis is an important disorder causing serious abnormalities <EOS>
<SOS> acute oxalosis may come about by ethylene glycol poisoning in recent years iatrogenic cases of acute oxalosis have also been described following iv treatments of naftidrofuryl a vasodilator <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore chronic asymptomatic intestinal oxalosis may turn symptomatic by a superimposed major load of oxalate <EOS>
<SOS> acute oxalosis results in acute renal failure in addition oxalate induced angiopathy may be associated with necrosis of affected tissue <EOS>
<SOS> the diagnosis of acute oxalosis requires a demonstration of oxalate crystals in the urine and in other affected tissues <EOS>
<SOS> in terms of therapy hemodialysis should be used promptly in cases of ethylene glycol poisoning and a worsening of the renal function <EOS>
<SOS> in cases of a secondary chronic intestinal oxalosis prophylactic measures such as maintaining an elevated urinary flow rate and prescribing oral calcium supplements will be helpful <EOS>
<SOS> generalized granuloma annulare is a rare variant of granuloma annulare affecting the trunk and extremities with a multitude of lesions <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast to localized granuloma annulare generalized granuloma annulare occurs in older patients shows a stronger association with diabetes and is characteristically chronic <EOS>
<SOS> like our 55 year old patient most patients present with papules and annular plaques less often macular or non annular lesions may be encountered <EOS>
<SOS> histology often fails to show necrobiotic or necrotic connective tissue changes demarcated by a palisading granuloma <EOS>
<SOS> instead there are diffuse dermal band like or nodular aggregations of histiocytes intermingled with some multinucleated giant cells and a predominantly lymphocytic infiltrate in the periphery <EOS>
<SOS> because of its special characteristics it has been suggested that generalized granuloma annulare might constitute a separate disease entity and that it should be classed among the primary cutaneous histiocytoses as a diffuse dermal histiocytosis <EOS>
<SOS> using immunohistochemistry to determine the macrophage phenotype of the lesional histiocytes we have shown that generalized granuloma annulare is not a cutaneous histiocytosis <EOS>
<SOS> neither ms 1 high molecular weight protein a new specific marker for cutaneous non langerhans cell histiocytoses nor cd1a the well known marker for langerhans cells and langerhans cell histiocytoses is expressed by the lesional histiocytes of our patient <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast the antigen expression pattern was diagnostic for non infectious granulomas and was highly similar to that in localized granuloma annulare <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast to the successful treatment of localized granuloma annulare reported with intralesional interferon 1 systemic treatment with interferon 2b 9x106 units three times a week was ineffective <EOS>

<SOS> in particular besides the external cuneate nucleus thick calibre neck muscle afferents project directly to the vestibular nuclear complex <EOS>
<SOS> this projection is most prominent in segments c2 and <NUM> and is sparse or absent in more caudal segments <EOS>

<SOS> macular amyloidosis ma and lichen amyloidosus la are the two major variants of the primary cutaneous amyloidoses which present with severe and therapy resistent itching <EOS>
<SOS> various therapeutic modalities such as antihistamines intralesional injection or topical application of corticosteroids etretinate uvb irradiation and dermoabrasion have been employed with variable success <EOS>
<SOS> recently in a few case reports authors have observed encouraging beneficial clinical effects by using topical dimethyl sulphoxide dmso <EOS>
<SOS> in our study <NUM> patients with either ma or la or biphasic amyloidosis were treated with a 50 solution of dmso in water <EOS>
<SOS> 9 of them showed marked clinical improvement at the end of 6 20 weeks of treatment <EOS>
<SOS> degranulation and depletion of the mast cells by dmso is the most probable explanation for the rapid improvement of itching beginning within the first week of therapy <EOS>
<SOS> remarkable flattening of the lichenoid papules which was obtained within <NUM> weeks of treatment is interpreted as a result of the improvement of itching and the related scratch effect <EOS>
<SOS> histological examination after treatment revealed no disappearance of amyloid deposits in the papillary dermis <EOS>
<SOS> in the follow up period relapses of itching and papules were observed <EOS>
<SOS> therefore further studies are needed to find out the optimal procedure of therapy <EOS>
<SOS> as early as 1974 brian advocated the prone position for ventilated patients 5 <EOS>
<SOS> he suggested that this position might enhance ventilation of the dorsal parts of the lungs thereby improving oxygenation <EOS>
<SOS> these considerations have been confirmed by several experimental and clinical studies 1 6 13 17 <EOS>
<SOS> better secretion removal decreased intrapulmonary shunting and an increased frc are thought to be responsible for the observed improvement of oxygenation <EOS>
<SOS> however the prone position never became very popular in the clinical treatment of the adult respiratory distress syndrome ards <EOS>
<SOS> routine performance of thoracic ct scans in ards patients demonstrated preferential distribution of pathological densities in the dependent lung areas <EOS>
<SOS> the prone position therefore could possibly benefit these patients as shown by two recent studies 8 11 <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of our study was to evaluate the influence of repeatedly turning the patient to the prone position on gas exchange and thoracic ct findings in multiple trauma patients <EOS>
<SOS> seven ventilated intensive care patients with severe ards murray score 2 5 9 quotient 0 7 4 mean airway pressure 18 cm h2o thoracic ct scan showing dorsal atelectases were included in the study <EOS>
<SOS> patients were turned from the supine to the prone position at 12 h intervals using an air cushion bed mediscus austria <EOS>
<SOS> redistribution of dystelectatic or atelectatic dependent lung areas was verified by means of repeated thoracic ct scans figs <EOS>
<SOS> the patients were intermittently turned for <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> days <EOS>
<SOS> the course of gas exchange is shown in figs <EOS>
<SOS> initially improvement of the respiratory quotient could only be achieved during prone positioning from the 2nd day in the supine position as well <EOS>
<SOS> intrapulmonary shunting showed a similar trend figs <EOS>
<SOS> no significant changes in cardiovascular parameters could be observed <EOS>
<SOS> control thoracic ct scans showed uniform reduction of atelectases in dependent lung areas figs <EOS>
<SOS> the inspiratory fraction of oxygen could be reduced significantly as of the 2nd day fig <EOS>
<SOS> constant levels of positive end expiratory pressure and tidal volume were associated with decreasing mean and plateau airway pressures fig <EOS>
<SOS> repeatedly turning the patient to the prone position produced long lasting improvement of arterial oxygenation which persists up to the end of the weaning process <EOS>
<SOS> this is in good accordance with other studies 1 2 6 8 11 13 17 however this is the first study to report an observation period of more than <NUM> days of repeatedly turning the patient <EOS>
<SOS> these positive effects on gas exchange can be attributed to sudden improvement of the ventilation perfusion ratio within the lung areas that become dependent after turning to the prone position <EOS>
<SOS> due to reduced hydrostatic pressure 11 and relative hyperventilation 7 16 previously collapsed alveoli are recruited in the lung areas that become non dependent after turning to the prone position <EOS>
<SOS> after a gynecological operation under therapy with unfractionated and low molecular weight heparin a <NUM> year old patient developed right sided ascending pelvic thrombosis with multiple pulmonary embolism and infarction pneumonia septic toxic circulatory failure and thrombocytopenia <EOS>
<SOS> heparin associated thrombocytopenia hat type ii was diagnosed <EOS>
<SOS> because of contraindications against thrombolysis a cava filter was implanted heparin therapy was stopped and anticoagulation with recombinant hirudin was started <EOS>
<SOS> inspite of this an arterial thrombosis of the a femoralis superficialis developed and had to be treated surgically <EOS>
<SOS> from this time on no further thromboembolic complications were noticed <EOS>
<SOS> overlapping coumarin therapy was begun <EOS>
<SOS> due to ubiquitous coumarin necrosis rapid progressive toxic circulatory failure with disseminated intravascular coagulation dic developed two days after terminating hirudin therapy necessitating high dose catecholamine therapy <EOS>
<SOS> a second course of hirudin resulted in complete restitution of the coumarin necrosis without the need for re operation <EOS>
<SOS> subsequent coumarin therapy which was gradually increased over two weeks was without further complications <EOS>
<SOS> thus hirudin appears to be a new and safe alternative to a therapy with the heparinoid danaparoid in hat type ii with fulminant thromboembolic complications and especially in coumarin necrosis with critical septic toxic circulatory failure and dic <EOS>

<SOS> the gaseous radical nitric oxide no is catalyzed by conversion of l arginine to l citrulline by one cytokine inducible form inos which becomes active only within hours after the inducing event and by two constitutively expressed forms endothelial enos and neuronal nnos which are regulated by the cytosolic concentration of free ca2 <EOS>
<SOS> brain nnos is physiologically present in discrete populations of neurons which are all excited by glutamate via the ionotropic n methyl d aspartate nmda receptor which controls a ca2 channel <EOS>
<SOS> after its diffusion into the extraneuronal space no may activate in neurons which as a rule do not stain for nos soluble guanylyl cyclase and formation of cgmp as an intracellular messenger <EOS>
<SOS> beyond that no is important as a feedback regulator of glutamatergic excitation <EOS>
<SOS> no as a nitrosylating agent enhances disulfide bonding of vicinal sulfhydryl thiol groups of the redox modulatory site of the nmda receptor complex and thereby down regulates its ca2 channel activity <EOS>
<SOS> histochemically studies have revealed the presence of large number of nos containing neurons in the magnocellular and parvocellular subdivisions of hypothalamic nuclei <EOS>
<SOS> numerous studies conform to the view that no participates in the control of many different neurosecretory processes especially of the corticotropin releasing hormone crh neurosecretory system <EOS>
<SOS> the redox modulatory site of the nmda receptor appears therefore as a critical structure in the control of the hypothalamic pituitary adrenocortical hpa axis <EOS>
<SOS> moreover glucocorticoids augment neuronal excitotoxicity by increasing the expression of glutamate receptors and inhibition of glutamate reuptake <EOS>
<SOS> in attempting to explain the many conflicting results obtained in studies with no it may be worthwhile to consider that the actual redox environment of distinct loci of the brain may determine the final function of no acting either as a transmitter or neuromodulator or in the worst case causing neurodestruction <EOS>
<SOS> it seems likely that any kind of stress by altering the ratio of reduced vs oxidized thiols within the central nervous system influences neuronal excitability with no working either as an amplifier or as a feedback regulator of neuronal excitation or inhibition which may alter acutely or chronically among others the homeostasis of a given neurosecretory system <EOS>

<SOS> discoid meniscus is one of the commonest anatomical variations of the meniscus <EOS>
<SOS> there is at the moment no consensus on the aetiology of discoid meniscus <EOS>
<SOS> according to watanabe three types can be differentiated the complete form the incomplete form and the hypermobile wrisberg form <EOS>
<SOS> discoid meniscus frequently remains asymptomatic and thus requires no treatment <EOS>
<SOS> partial meniscectomy is recommended for treatment of the stable form while for the unstable forms total meniscectomy is generally regarded as the treatment of choice since the instability means that rupture of residual meniscus would be possible <EOS>

<SOS> humeral shaft fractures can be treated either conservatively or operatively <EOS>
<SOS> plating of the humerus is the established operative method but recently interest has also been focussed on intramedullary nailing <EOS>
<SOS> fifty nine cases of humeral fractures treated with intramedullary nailing seidel marchetti vicenzi prévot from january <NUM> to december <NUM> 44 fractures after trauma <NUM> pathological fractures <NUM> pseudarthroses <NUM> re fracture <EOS>
<SOS> closed reduction in 55 59 cases <EOS>
<SOS> one infection soft tissue 2 48 pseudarthrosis indication for nailing pseudarthrosis <EOS>
<SOS> no iatrogenic palsy of the radial nerve <EOS>
<SOS> functional postoperative treatment in all <NUM> cases of humeral fractures after adequate trauma <EOS>
<SOS> one poor functional result periarticular ossification after retrograde nailing possibly connected with long term respiratory treatment after trauma <EOS>
<SOS> treatment of humeral shaft fractures by intramedullary nailing is favoured in our clinic low complication rates excellent or good functional results limited approaches small scars <EOS>
<SOS> proximal fractures should be treated by the seidel nail stable interlocking of the proximal fragment very distal fractures need prévot nailing reaming of condylar canals <EOS>
<SOS> all other fractures of the humeral shaft can be treated by each of the implants used in our clinic <EOS>
<SOS> pathological fractures are an excellent indication for intramedullary stabilization <EOS>
<SOS> these patients benefit from stable fixation without intense surgical trauma <EOS>
<SOS> pseudarthrosis according to our limited experience seems to require plating plus bone grafting <EOS>
<SOS> plating is also recommended if revision of the radial nerve becomes necessary <EOS>
<SOS> 2 4 of vascular injuries need operative reconstruktion <EOS>
<SOS> in polytraumatized patients the rate is even <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> arterial vascular repair should precede venous reconstruction and orthopaedic stabilization due to limb threatening ischemia <EOS>
<SOS> penetration or blunt vascular trauma result either in acute blood loss ischemia or compartmental compression <EOS>
<SOS> reperfusion syndrom leads to vital threat of patient <EOS>
<SOS> clinical assessment measurement of limb pressures using a doppler device and use of duplex ultrasonography are reliable adjuncts in the rapid evaluation <EOS>
<SOS> arteriography is rarely indicated and should be spared for patients with abnormal physical examination <EOS>
<SOS> minimizing ischemia 6 8 h is an important factor in maximizing limb salvage <EOS>
<SOS> vascular repair include direct anastomosis or lateral suture repair mostly combined with primary shortening of the extremity <EOS>
<SOS> in most cases autogenous vein graft is required <EOS>
<SOS> rethrombosis arteriovenous fistula and pseudoaneurysms are possible complications <EOS>
<SOS> stabilisation of the fracture has priority over vascular reconstruction <EOS>
<SOS> the initial steps to success are surgical debridement adequate bony stabilization mostly by external fixation revascularisation of vascular injury immediate fascial decompression and early soft tissue reconstruction <EOS>
<SOS> the best results are obtained when a multidiciplinary approach is used combining expertise in orthopedic surgery vascular surgery and plastic surgery <EOS>
<SOS> in secondary prevention statins are cost effective and even more cost effective than other lipid lowering drugs <EOS>
<SOS> statins are especially favorable in patients with previous myocardial infarction compared to those with angina pectoris <EOS>
<SOS> for secondary prevention of coronary heart disease statins should be administered generously <EOS>
<SOS> in primary prevention statins are effective but not cost efficient <EOS>
<SOS> unfavorable results have to be expected especially in premenopausal women younger patients and in those with a low risk factor profile <EOS>
<SOS> for population based primary prevention only dietary measures can be advocated however apart from a serious lack of compliance their efficiency has not yet been proven <EOS>
<SOS> preventive measures have their own prize in general they are considered not to prevent coronary heart disease but retard it <EOS>
<SOS> therefore such therapeutic interventions can be assumed not to reduce but rather to increase the direct medical costs <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore successful prevention of coronary heart disease leads due to life prolongation to an increase in people out of work and in disabled patients due to age and or disease <EOS>
<SOS> therefore an increase especially of the indirect costs for unemployment pension nursing homes etc <EOS>

<SOS> mrsa mrse infections are a major problem in hospitals and although in orthopaedic units the incidence is low awareness of this problem is necessary <EOS>
<SOS> once a mrsa strain has been isolated the strict use of the hygiene precautions has to be applied to avoid epidemic spread of the strain <EOS>
<SOS> the patient has to be isolated <EOS>
<SOS> the staff has to use gloves and gowns whilst treating the patient <EOS>
<SOS> a antimicrobiel hand wash solution has to be used after taking off the gloves and before leaving the isolation room <EOS>
<SOS> patient and staff have to be informed about the pathogenity and the way of infection spread so that infection precaution rules are fulfilled <EOS>
<SOS> antibiotics should only be used in clinically well defined cases and the overall use of antibiotics should be reduced to lower the incidence of mrsa e isolates <EOS>
<SOS> the problems of an mrsa case and its successful treatment are demonstrated <EOS>

<SOS> the microphone was positioned beneath the skin of the auditory canal such that it completely covered the microphone membrane <EOS>

<SOS> an essential feature of the known procedures for the analysis of the ecg signal is the splitting of the ecg into individual parameters which are subsequently processed in defined decision trees neuronal networks or statistical procedures to diagnostic information <EOS>
<SOS> the correctness of the diagnostic statements thus substantially depends on the suitable selection and the exact determination of the individual criteria <EOS>
<SOS> the analysis algorithm and the expert knowledge are closely linked due to the procedure <EOS>
<SOS> this paper presents a new procedure or the evaluation of signals of medical sensor systems by the example of the ecg <EOS>
<SOS> unlike the methods used up to now this procedure is not based on an ever more profound splitting of the ecg signal into individual features <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore analysis algorithm and knowledge base are separated from each other <EOS>
<SOS> the consideration underlying the procedure is that two ecgs whose leads show identical or very similar signal patterns indicate identical or at least very similar cardiological diagnoses <EOS>
<SOS> as this assumption is the basis of medical experience it should be possible to compare the signal patterns of the leads of an unknown ecg with those of the leads of the reference ecgs from a database and to draw conclusions for the diagnosis of the unknown ecg <EOS>
<SOS> for this purpose those ecgs are searched in an ecg database whose leads show greatest agreement with the signal pattern of the unknown ecg <EOS>
<SOS> the function of the method was established with the aid of the ecg signal database cardiodat with <NUM> ecgs for the diagnostic groups infarcts and healthy reference persons from a data inventory of <NUM> ecgs <EOS>
<SOS> it can be seen from the results that the presented procedure which is based on signal pattern recognition is a new approach to deriving diagnostic information from the ecg signal at least for the diagnostic group of myocardial infarcts <EOS>

<SOS> during a 4 week ambulatory cardiacc rehabilitation program <NUM> patients with coronary artery disease cad <NUM> men and <NUM> women 53 6 10 2 years performed 30 5 2 9 exercise units <EOS>
<SOS> before and after the rehabilitation program exercise capacity was assessed by bicycle ergometry <EOS>
<SOS> there was a significant p0 001 increase in the maximum exercise capacity at the end of the program <MOB> 32 3 vs 121 9 37 3 w <EOS>
<SOS> physical work capacity on the <NUM> mmol lactate level improved p0 001 from 72 2 23 5 to 86 4 25 8 w on the <NUM> mmol l level p0 001 from 83 5 23 2 to 97 4 26 4 w and on the <NUM> mmol l level p0 001 from 93 1 23 0 to 106 6 26 1 w despite enhanced performance heart rate remained unaltered on the 2 0 2 5 and <NUM> mmol l lactate level <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore ergometric performance on predefined heart rate levels was significantly p0 001 increased 85 min from 56 0 24 1 to 65 8 24 5 w 90 min from 62 0 27 3 to 71 2 26 w 95 min from 67 2 26 4 to 77 5 27 6 w 100 min from 71 1 29 6 to 80 6 28 1 w 105 min from 69 8 26 2 to 81 9 28 2 w and 110 min from 73 6 28 9 to 90 4 29 4 w the results demonstrate that physical performance in patients with cad was improved by our novel ambulatory cardiac rehabilitation program <EOS>
<SOS> this improvement included an increase in maximum as well as endurance work capacity furthermore this increase was accompanied by a decrease in resting and exercise heart rates <EOS>
<SOS> the results demonstrate an absolute increase of physical performance more importantly an increase of physical performance at defined lactate levels in the presence of unchanged heart rates mediated by the rehabilitation program <EOS>
<SOS> thus this increase was independent of motivational factors in the patients and or the investigators during the re exercise test <EOS>
<SOS> on the contrary our data demonstrate that it is based on an improvement of aerobic endurance capacity associated with a therapeutically beneficial significant decrease of heart rate for a defined workload <EOS>
<SOS> the effects were independent of pharmacological influences e g receptor antagonists <EOS>
<SOS> these findings are of clinical importance with respect to reduction of myocardial oxygen consumption in patients with cad <EOS>

<SOS> the separation of whole blood into components is the state of the art in transfusion of allogeneic blood <EOS>
<SOS> the main reasons are the negative effects of the buffy coat and the need for ffp <EOS>
<SOS> nevertheless especially in germany whole blood is being rejected more and more even as autologous blood <EOS>
<SOS> however most of the negative effects of the buffy coat do not apply to autologous blood <EOS>
<SOS> additionally these patients usually do not develop coagulation disorders and therefore do not need plasma as a hemostatic component <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand separation into components of autologous blood leads to an increase of costs and to logistic problems that restrict autologous blood predeposit to a few institutions <EOS>
<SOS> therefore we have reviewed the literature in order to find a scientific basis for this <EOS>
<SOS> we analysed all articles listed by medline during the last <NUM> years that dealt with the quality of whole blood or red cell concentrates <EOS>
<SOS> in addition all references were included that contributed relevant information to the topic <EOS>
<SOS> a total of <NUM> original articles abstracts reviews letters or editorials were analysed that referred to standard preparations and storage media <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> papers the in vivo red cell survival was studied <EOS>
<SOS> 28 of which fulfilled the prerequisites to be included into a meta analysis <EOS>
<SOS> the following in vitro parameters were also evaluated ph potassium load of the units atp and dpg concentration of the red cells <EOS>
<SOS> whole blood resuspended in cpda 1 and red cell units stabilized in cpda 1 or additive solutions with a different buffy coat or leucocyte content have comparable ph values and red cell 2 3 dpg and atp concentrations at the end of the approved storage time <EOS>
<SOS> the potassium load of a whole blood unit appears to be higher than red cell concentrates but this is to some extent caused by the higher plasma content of whole blood and is not thought to be a clinically relevant problem for patients receiving only a few units <EOS>
<SOS> a number of studies demonstrate that dependent upon the leucocyte content of a red cell unit leucocyte metabolites and enzymes are released and accumulate during storage <EOS>
<SOS> a detrimental influence on the integrity of the red cell membrane was found in several in vitro studies <EOS>
<SOS> nevertheless a significant improvement in red cell survival by leucocyte reduction was detected by only one group <EOS>
<SOS> undoubtedly non hemolytic febrile transfusion reactions nhftr are generally caused by an antibody antigen interaction due to the transfusion of allogeneic buffy coat <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand there is some evidence that non specific immunological mechanisms such as the release of histamine or cytokines are also capable of causing nhftr <EOS>
<SOS> thus these reactions are expected to occur in autologous blood transfusion <EOS>
<SOS> however so far there are no data about the frequency and severity of these reactions and whether they are more likely to emerge after transfusion of blood units with a particular preparation <EOS>
<SOS> blood transfusions can cause septic complications due to bacterial contamination of the transfused units <EOS>
<SOS> these fatal but rare complications may be reduced by pre storage filtration of blood but there is no indication that buffy coat reduction is effective <EOS>
<SOS> three cases with septic complications have been reported after autologous transfusion in two of which red cell concentrates at least one was free of buffy coat had been used <EOS>
<SOS> thus there is no justification for the conclusion that the risk of septic complications is increased by transfusion of whole blood <EOS>
<SOS> after all whole blood and red cell concentrates exhibit only minor differences in relevant in vitro parameters <EOS>
<SOS> hence a higher incidence of adverse effects following the transfusion of autologous whole blood compared to autologous red cell concentrations is unlikely <EOS>
<SOS> therefore the <NUM> h in vivo recovery is considered to be the most valid criterion to assess the quality of red cell preparations <EOS>
<SOS> physical therapy can support geriatric rehabilitation in contributing to better health status mobility and quality of life <EOS>
<SOS> however the central focus of this contribution is not on illness specific aspects of physical therapy but on power and stamina training <EOS>
<SOS> these two training methods are of special importance for geriatric rehabilitation since most patients are admitted due to related problems and these two methods do imply specific risk factors for the rehabilitation process <EOS>
<SOS> the spectrum of physical adaptation processes supported by power and stamina training is described and scientifically evaluated <EOS>
<SOS> even in higher age groups positive training effects are possible <EOS>
<SOS> adequate usage of these training methods contributes to increased competence and a minimization of risks in daily life <EOS>

<SOS> contrast enhanced 3d mr angiography permits comprehensive assessment of the arterial system in the chest abdomen und lower extremities <EOS>
<SOS> the method combines intravenous bolus application of a non nephrotoxic paramagnetic extracellular contrast agent with the acquisition of a fast 3d data set <EOS>
<SOS> high contrast between the vascular lumen and surrounding tissues inherent three dimensionality and the ability to collect image data in the chest and abdomen under apnea conditions all contribute to excellent image quality <EOS>

<SOS> the indications for magnetic resonance imaging mri on prosthetic heart valve recipients remain critical <EOS>
<SOS> a generalized contraindication for mri is doubtful <EOS>
<SOS> some diagnostic questions such as interests in pathologies of the posterior cranial fossa spinal abscesses and internal derangements for the knee strongly recommend the advantages of mri versus all other radiological diagnostic techniques <EOS>
<SOS> mri can directly affect patients with prosthetic valves in three ways by 1 movement or dislodgment of the prosthesis 2 heating and 3 arrhythmias induced by electric currents and indirectly by distortion of the image and its subsequent misinterpretation <EOS>
<SOS> present literature that concerns the safety considerations of current values appears to be incomplete <EOS>
<SOS> therefore a survey of twenty five valve manufacturers with regard to compatibility safety or contraindication for mri on their respective prosthetic heart valves was performed in <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> those manufacturers who distribute most of the valves in europe confirmed the safety of mri <EOS>
<SOS> however some gave their assurances based on inadequate data or assigned all responsibility to the physician <EOS>
<SOS> some companies did not give any assurance for mri safety or failed to respond to our enquiry <EOS>
<SOS> two valve manufacturers warned against performing mri on certain prostheses <EOS>
<SOS> based on our <NUM> questionnaire the technical issues the clinical circumstances the prerequisites and criteria for and the definition of safety standards for mri on prosthetic heart valve recipients are presented in this paper <EOS>
<SOS> argyrophilic grain disease agd is a frequently occurring degenerative illness of the aging human brain <EOS>
<SOS> it is accompanied by progressive pathological alterations of the cytsokeleton which are traceable to an abnormal phosphorylation of the microtubule associated tau protein <EOS>
<SOS> histologically it is possible with the help of suitable staining techniques to identify pathognomonic spindle shaped cellular inclusions argyrophilic grains <EOS>
<SOS> these cellular inclusions display a typical cortical as well as subcortical distribution pattern <EOS>
<SOS> the goal of the present study is the retrospective evaluation of the clinical findings from <NUM> individuals with neuropathologically demonstrable agd related changes of the brain <EOS>
<SOS> nearly one half of the cases 49 was classifiable as demented in accordance with dsm iv criteria <EOS>
<SOS> moreover the frequency of the dementia increased significantly in relation to the growing severity of the agd associated pathological cytoskeletal degeneration <EOS>
<SOS> these results confirm the assumption that agd can cause degenerative changes ranging from cognitive impairment all the way to dementia <EOS>
<SOS> they also underscore the necessity of further prospective studies pertaining to the clinical aspects of this still enigmatic disease <EOS>

<SOS> the benefits of epidural analgesia are well known but it is not well understood which types of urologic surgery benefit most from epidural analgesia <EOS>

<SOS> an epidural infusion of local anaesthetic combined with an opioid and adrenaline was given for a period of 5 7 days <EOS>
<SOS> there was no difference between the groups with respect to the effectiveness of the analgesia and patients perception of the treatment <EOS>

<SOS> in four patients the epidural analgesia had to be stopped because of catheter migration <EOS>

<SOS> epidural analgesia works well in terms of analgesia mobilization and patient satisfaction bearing in mind the potential side effects and complications <EOS>
<SOS> it can be recommended for lumbotomy and long transperitoneal operations however not for extraperitoneal interventions in the lower abdomen such as radical prostatectomy <EOS>

<SOS> following morphometry significant correlations were calculated between number of cd61 megakaryocytes including their precursors with fiber density <EOS>
<SOS> this finding is in line with the close functional relationship between megakaryopoiesis and fibroblasts regarding the complex pathomechanism of myelofibrosis <EOS>
<SOS> the latter was observed in about 28 of patients already at diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> in a similar way the frequency of cd68 macrophages was correlated with the amount of ret40f nucleated erythroid precursors implicating an involvement of this cell lineage in iron turnover hemoglobin synthesis and degradation of the expelled nuclei from normoblasts <EOS>

<SOS> this simplified staging system was correlated with corresponding sets of hematological data <EOS>
<SOS> sequential biopsies in <NUM> patients with monotherapy by ifn hydroxyurea hu or busulfan bu revealed a fibrogenic effect of ifn in contrast to a fiber reducing property of hu <EOS>
<SOS> the dynamics of myelofibrosis and changes of major cell lineages during treatment were readily demonstrable by calculating corresponding indices <EOS>
<SOS> these included the ratios between quantitative differences of corresponding variables at repeated examinations and time <EOS>
<SOS> thus in patients with complete hematological remission following ifn administration regeneration of erythropoiesis was found to be accompanied by an increase in the total number of cd68 macrophages including activated subpopulations <EOS>
<SOS> histological subgroups showed a transition from a nonfibrotic granulocytic and megakaryocyte pattern to the myelofibrotic subtype in about 40 of patients <EOS>
<SOS> this change was opposed to a numerical reduction in the myelofibrotic subtype which occurred in <NUM> patients 36 but predominantly in those under hu therapy <EOS>
<SOS> in conclusion the striking heterogeneity of bone marrow features in cml warrants a careful morphological evaluation of trephine biopsies and appropriate means of processing to achieve relevant correlations with clinical data and thus allows a more elaborate insight into the dynamics of the disease process <EOS>
<SOS> computer aided analysis of the results of the intrathecal infusion test using our mathematical computation leads to simplification of this investigation and therefore normal pressure hydrocephalus is more easily diagnosed <EOS>
<SOS> simultaneous measurement of resistance and compliance during a single investigation allows the exertion of the patients to be minimized <EOS>

<SOS> the intrathecal infusion test is a reliable diagnostic method for measuring resistance and compliance in patients suspected of having normal pressure hydrocephalus <EOS>

<SOS> in a prospective study conducted from <NUM> september <NUM> to <NUM> june <NUM> on <NUM> polytraumatized patients average iss <NUM> points simple femoral stem fractures a 1 to b 3 of the ao classification were stabilized by elastic plate osteosynthesis using biological technique <EOS>
<SOS> while cautiously preserving the periosteal and muscle connections to the bone a plate is inserted as a bridge without any interfragmentary compression <EOS>

<SOS> during the obstructive apnea the muscles showed significantly lower amplitudes than before the apnea <EOS>

<SOS> in contrast to the slow phase of the cervical ripening process in late pregnancy dilatation of the cervix during parturition requires the rapid formation and action of catabolic enzyme systems leading mainly to collagen degradation and changes in its architecture but also to degradation of other fundamental matrix proteins <EOS>

<SOS> interleukin 1 il 1 is a major agent in the pathophysiology of periarticular bone resorption in rheumatoid arthritis and in osteoporosis <EOS>
<SOS> because the use of recombinant cytokines and growth factors is limited due to their short half lives techniques are needed to get a permanent release of these therapeutic proteins <EOS>
<SOS> the rational of this study was to show that retroviral transduction of human osteoblastic cells is possible in vitro using the marker gene lacz and the potentially therapeutic gene encoding for human interleukin 1 receptor antagonist protein il 1ra <EOS>
<SOS> different transduction techniques were combined to improve the rate of transduction in vitro <EOS>
<SOS> methods osteoblastic cells were isolated from human spongious bone and cultured in vitro <EOS>
<SOS> the galactosidase lacz gene and the cdna of il 1ra were introduced into the isolated cells by retrovirus mediated gene transfer <EOS>
<SOS> lacz activity was determined by xgal staining il 1ra was measured quantitatively by elisa <EOS>
<SOS> results the transfer of retroviral il 1ra led to il 1ra expression of <NUM> to 10089pg irap 500 cells 48h <EOS>
<SOS> by combining different techniques to improve transduction the x gal staining established a rate of transduction of 60 <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion our results demonstrate that retroviral transduction of human osteobalstic cells is possible in vitro and leads to high levels of the synthesized transgene product <EOS>
<SOS> the rate of retroviral transduction can be accelerated in vitro <EOS>

<SOS> since the ct scan did not show any fractures of the posterior skull base we discuss a traction nerve injury as a possible mechanism <EOS>
<SOS> injuries of the colon and retroperitoneum are rarely observed after blunt abdominal trauma and occur in about <NUM> <NUM> of the patients <EOS>
<SOS> the majority of complications are due to initial misdiagnoses and a delay in treatment <EOS>
<SOS> lesions of the pancreas and duodenum are the most frequent diagnoses in the retroperitoneal space while major vascular traumata or urogenital injuries are rare <EOS>
<SOS> retroperitoneal hematoma are most likely due to pelvic fractures <EOS>
<SOS> the survival of patients after colon or retroperitoneal injuries depends on the severity of concomitant organ trauma the time of diagnosis and a situation adapted therapeutic strategy <EOS>
<SOS> the treatment of the typical caudal retroperitoneal hematoma following pelvic fractures is conservative in most patients <EOS>
<SOS> early pelvic stabilization e g with external fixation is recommended in these patients <EOS>
<SOS> central retroperitoneal hematoma in the supra or inframesocolic space should be treated surgically as major vascular injuries are most likely in these patients <EOS>
<SOS> duodenal or pancreatic injuries need surgical exploration in the majority of patients the therapeutic spectrum ranges from simple sutures to pancreatoduodenal resection <EOS>
<SOS> the treatment of colon injuries depends on the degree of peritonitis and the severity of concomitant trauma <EOS>
<SOS> early diagnosed injuries are suitable for primary repair while deviation stomata or a hartmann procedure with or without resection should be offered to patients with delayed diagnoses peritonitis or severe concomitant diseases <EOS>
<SOS> long lasting procedures should be abandoned in the emergency situation in these severe cases laparotomy should be aimed towards primary damage control and followed by definite surgery after stabilization of the patient <EOS>
<SOS> surgery of the great veins inevitably began with the surgical treatment of injuries often involving the femoral vein <EOS>
<SOS> because of the famous case presented by roux in 1813 the prevailing opinion until almost the end of the nineteenth century was that ligation of the vein made death inevitable but that the only way to control severe hemorrhaging from a vein was to ligate the femoral artery <EOS>
<SOS> zaufal is principle 1880 consisted in the ligation and resection of great veins of the body and limbs in order to prevent sepsis in suppurative processes <EOS>
<SOS> this surgical method was still being used in the first half of the twentieth century in patients with perforated appendicitis or puerperal fever <EOS>
<SOS> in the limb the congestion induced in the vein had a positve effect on the healing process <EOS>
<SOS> the surgical treatment of leg and pelvic deep vein thrombosis was initially 1931 aimed at achieving decompression in compartment syndromas <EOS>
<SOS> the first thrombectomy was performed in 1937 but several operations with a successful outcome were reported at the 61st annual meeting of the german society of surgery in the following year <EOS>
<SOS> bilateral glomus jugulare tumors are rare <EOS>
<SOS> however their treatment should preserve not only the function of the facial nerve but also the caudal cranial nerves and the middle ears in order to avoid bilateral hearing losses <EOS>
<SOS> further venous cerebral drainage has to be ensured in order to avoid cerebral hypertension and hemorrhagic infarction after bilateral jugular ligations <EOS>
<SOS> in the case presented bilateral glomus jugulare tumors required super selective angiography and embolization <EOS>
<SOS> complete tumor removal on both sides was then possible by a transmastoid transcervical approach without any further functional deteriorations <EOS>
<SOS> middle ear function was preserved on both sides by temporary ventral translocation of the posterior wall of the auditory meatus <EOS>
<SOS> as the sigmoid sinus and internal jugular vein had been ligated during initial previous surgery venous drainage was tested one year later by angiography and compression of the remaining internal jugular vein <EOS>
<SOS> a sufficient collateral circulation was found and permitted surgery on the second side <EOS>
<SOS> intoxication is the monotone reaction of the cns to consumed psychoactive substances <EOS>
<SOS> intoxication like conditions may also occur without taking drugs <EOS>
<SOS> we then use the term ecstasy <EOS>
<SOS> intoxication can follow typical or atypical course <EOS>
<SOS> the main symptoms are disturbances of consciousness and orientation and additionally changes of mood affect drive and initiative train of thought and self control <EOS>
<SOS> the diagnosis of intoxication differs from the diagnosis of psychosis because the latter continues its own course occurs in the absence of psychoactive substances in the organism and always lasts longer than an intoxication <EOS>

<SOS> androgenetic hair loss is the most frequent reason for the topical application of hair growth promoting agents <EOS>
<SOS> such preparations should arrest or even reverse androgen induced hair follicle regression as well as prolonging the hair cycles especially of the shortened anagen phase and thus protect from increased hair loss <EOS>
<SOS> true evidence of drug effects on hair growth is problematic since trichograms the method chiefly applied by the manufacturers fail to reveal every factor involved in the follicular activity especially the duration of anagen stage <EOS>
<SOS> for example an increase in the anagen rate does not always reflect a lengthening of the anagen stage but may also be due to shortened hair cycles <EOS>
<SOS> accordingly drug effects on hair growth should be investigated by methods that analyse the cell cycle kinetics <EOS>
<SOS> for this approach dna flowcytometry of the outer root sheath in plucked anagen hairs and of complete anagen hair bulbs taken by micropreparative techniques from scalp biopsies offers a reproducible method for quick and reliable evaluation of hair growth <EOS>

<SOS> paraneoplastic neurologic syndromes pns are rare disorders of the nervous system that cannot be ascribed to metatastases or to destruction of vital systemic organs by the tumor or its treatment <EOS>
<SOS> most frequently pns occur in association with small cell lung breast or ovarian carcinomas <EOS>
<SOS> the most frequent pns is lambert eaton myasthenic syndrome which at the same time has the highest predictive value concerning an underlying carcinoma <EOS>
<SOS> pns have been classified mostly under anatomical aspects but now are increasingly categorized according to specific antibodies <EOS>
<SOS> in certain neurologic syndromes sensible and autonomic neuropathy cerebellitis limbic encephalitis opsoclonus myoclonus syndrome stiff man syndrome neuromyotonia subacute amaurosis specific autoantibodies are highly predictive for a neoplasm <EOS>
<SOS> pathogenic relevance of these autoantibodies has been demonstrated only for antibodies against 1 voltage gated calcium channels vgcc in lambert eaton myasthenic syndrome 2 voltage gated potassium channels vgkc in neuromyotonia and 3 recoverin in cancer associated retinopathy <EOS>
<SOS> the present article deals with the neurological symptoms of pns associated tumors and the relevance of specific antibodies for the diagnosis and pathogenesis of pns <EOS>
<SOS> ewing is sarcoma is a very rare tumor which has however attracted much oncological interest since the dramatic improvement of its prognosis under chemotherapy <EOS>
<SOS> its histogenesis has been discussed controversially for a long time including a possible origin in immature reticulum myogenous endothelial and undifferentiated mesenchymal cells <EOS>
<SOS> repeated reports have also suggested a possible neuroectodermal genesis <EOS>
<SOS> convincing arguments however have only been brought forward during recent years since it was found that ewing is sarcoma and malignant peripheral neuroectodermal tumor share a common chromosome translocation 11 22 <EOS>
<SOS> in the meantime this hypothesis has been strengthened by numerous cell biological analyses <EOS>
<SOS> there seems to be no clear border between ewing is sarcoma and malignant peripheral neuroectodermal tumors with definite neural differentiation <EOS>
<SOS> histological differential diagnosis of ewing is sarcoma has been improved by immunohistological methods <EOS>
<SOS> in most cases they can be distinguished from lymphoma leucocyte common antigen b and t markers and embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma muscle specific actin desmin without problems <EOS>
<SOS> apart from that it is possible nowadays to obtain antibodies against the mic 2 protein which is preferably expressed in ewing sarcoma <EOS>
<SOS> the diagnostics of ewing is sarcoma and the malignant peripheral neuroectodermal tumor have considerably been enriched by the fact that the specific chromosome translocation t 11 22 can be proved molecular biologically <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast to the cytogenetic evidence it is not necessary to establish cell cultures <EOS>

<SOS> managed care i e the integration of health insurance and delivery of care under the direction of one organization is gaining importance in the usa health market <EOS>
<SOS> the initial effects consisted of a decrease in insurance premiums a very attractive feature for employers <EOS>
<SOS> managed care promises to contain expenditures for health care <EOS>
<SOS> given the shrinking public resources in germany managed care seems attractive for the german health system too <EOS>
<SOS> in this review the development of managed care the principal elements forms of organisation and practical tools are outlined <EOS>
<SOS> the regulation of the delivery of care by means of controlling and financial incentives threatens the autonomy of physicians the physician must act as a double agent caring for the interest for the individual patient and being restricted by the contract with the managed care organisation <EOS>
<SOS> cost containment by managed care was achieved by reducing the fees for physicians and hospitals and partly by restricting care for patients <EOS>
<SOS> only a fraction of this cost reduction was handed over to the enrollee or employer and most of the money was returned with profit to the shareholders of the managed care organisations <EOS>
<SOS> the preeminent role of primary care physicians as gatekeepers of the health network led to a reduced demand for specialist services in general and for university hospitals and anesthesiologists in particular <EOS>
<SOS> the paradigm of managed care i e to guide the patient and the care giver through the health care system in order to achieve cost effective and high quality care seems very attractive <EOS>
<SOS> the stress on cost minimization by any means in the daily practice of managed care makes it doubtful if managed care should be an option for the german health system in particular because there are a number of restrictions on it in german law <EOS>

<SOS> background in the past the main problem of transscleral cyclophotocoagulation was related to the energy dosage of the individual effect <EOS>
<SOS> since the target tissue is not directly observable no information about the coagulation process was available to the surgeon <EOS>
<SOS> high inter and intraindividual variations of the tissue properties often led to under or overdosage <EOS>
<SOS> underdosage is therapeutically useless while overdosage causes the so called popeffects which may induce severe damage to the eye <EOS>
<SOS> in the past most scientific or routine studies on heart rate variability hrv were done using commercial holter ecg devices with traditional magnetic tapes <EOS>
<SOS> all methods to calculate parameters of hrv are based on the measurement of time intervals between successive sinus cardiac beats in practice rr intervals <EOS>
<SOS> hence results of hrv calculation depend on the quality of primary data acquisition <EOS>
<SOS> however technical standards on accuracy of rr interval acquisition in magnetic tape and digital solid state holter ecg systems do not exist as yet <EOS>
<SOS> therefore in a laboratory investigation accuracy of hrv parameter calculation after traditional standard tape with and without real time analysis and digital solid state data acquisition was compared in three commercial holter ecg systems ela medical e oxford medilog excel o and medset cardiolight m <EOS>
<SOS> a computer based ecg simulator was used to synthesize a test signal consisting of artificial p qrs complexes of fixed rate quartz stabilized sinus rhythms <EOS>
<SOS> two channel analog tape and digital 24h recordings of the fixed rate test signal were performed simultaneously <EOS>
<SOS> the influence of recording technology on accuracy of rr interval measurement and consequently on time domaine hrv was shown by comparing five standard 24 h time domain parameters <EOS>
<SOS> as expected in the three holter systems the analog tape recordings showed a higher technically induced artificial rr variability <EOS>
<SOS> the sdnn values e 9 38ms vs 2 68ms p0 001 o 3 89ms vs 0 97ms p0 001 m 10 47ms vs 2 89ms p 0 001 sdnn index values e 8 22ms vs 0 90ms p0 001 o 3 75ms vs 0 90ms p0 001 m 7 81ms vs 1 49ms p0 001 and rmssd values e 10 39ms vs 2 16ms p0 001 o 10 05ms vs 1 88ms p0 001 m 8 62ms vs 1 69ms p0 001 were significantly lower if acquisition was done by digital solid devices in all systems sdann m 9 83ms vs 5 37ms p0 001 in the medset system too <EOS>
<SOS> the used method is a possible way to validate commercial holter ecg systems for hrv analysis <EOS>
<SOS> clinical significance of artifical hrv seems to be low <EOS>

<SOS> although there are a variety of therapeutic modalities none of them gives satisfactory results <EOS>
<SOS> the effects of sclerotherapy in the treatment of telangiectasia with a small diameter are poor <EOS>

<SOS> however hyperpigmentation frequently developed after treatment <EOS>
<SOS> in post treatment biopsies occlusion of the vessels was found <EOS>
<SOS> based on these results we recommend a combined therapy for leg venectasia <EOS>
<SOS> larger diameter vessels should be treated with sclerotherapy while finer telangiectasia can be treated with the flashlamp pumped pulsed dye laser <EOS>

<SOS> amniotic fluid is a major factor of the intrauterine environment and deviation from the normal volume is associated with an increased perinatal morbidity and mortality <EOS>
<SOS> polyhydramnios occurs in <NUM> to <NUM> of pregnancies <EOS>
<SOS> it may be due to a number of congenital anomalies an abnormal karyotype maternal diabetes rh disease or intrauterine infections potentially requiring non invasive or invasive measures <EOS>
<SOS> however the most common indication for prenatal intervention due to polyhydramnios is the twin twin transfusion syndrom tts <EOS>
<SOS> treatment of polyhydramnios may focus on correction of the causative lesion or symptomatic relief through drainage of amniotic fluid <EOS>
<SOS> maternal administration of cyclooxygenase inhibitors represents a further non invasive therapeutic option <EOS>
<SOS> indomethacin sulindac or nimesulide reduce the fetal urine output thus decreasing amniotic fluid volume over time without the risks associated with invasive procedures <EOS>
<SOS> however potentially serious ductal constriction as well as a delay in the onset of amniotic fluid reduction have limited its application <EOS>
<SOS> percutaneous amniotic fluid drainage may provide immediate reduction of intrauterine pressure but is associated with a complication rate of <NUM> to <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> the hemodynamic characteristics of monochorionic pregnancies complicated by tts have led to the development of endoscopic laser coagulation of placental vascular anastomoses as a definitive treatment <EOS>
<SOS> treatment is only required in a small minoritiy of pregnancies with polyhydramnios <EOS>
<SOS> mild cases can be managed expectatively <EOS>
<SOS> intrauterine pressure increases with an excessive increase in amniotic fluid volume afi <NUM> mm or mvp <NUM> mm leads to the elevation of intrauterine pressure <EOS>
<SOS> complications such as preterm premature rupture of membranes and preterm labor may lead to premature delivery <EOS>
<SOS> the main goal of prenatal treatment of polyhydramnios is thus the improvement of fetal outcome through prolongation of gestation and or the alleviation of maternal symptoms <EOS>
<SOS> with the recent developments in computer technology and the improvements in modern neuroimaging frame based stereotactic guidance for open microsurgical procedures has been increasingly replaced by neuronavigation also called frameless stereotaxy <EOS>
<SOS> it allows transfer of individual patient is images onto the operative field to assist the neurosurgeon intraoperatively in defining the tumor margins or identifying functionally important brain areas <EOS>
<SOS> the different localization techniques employed are articulated position sensing arms infrared or ultrasound systems working with the principle of satellite navigation and robotic systems integrated with the operating microscope <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> operations performed with different systems arm based robotic and infrared the method proved to be helpful enabling fewer invasive procedures to be performed <EOS>
<SOS> with a mean deviation of <NUM> <NUM> mm for intraoperative localization the accuracy was only slightly worse than in frame based stereotaxy with deviations below <NUM> mm <EOS>
<SOS> neuronavigation was most helpful for operations on deeply seated lesions skull base tumors and lesions in brain areas with high functionality <EOS>
<SOS> the major disadvantage is the use of preoperative data for navigation leading to inaccuracies when anatomical structures are altered during the operation by resection of tumors or shift of intracranial soft tissue <EOS>
<SOS> intraoperative magnetic resonance imaging mri might be a solution for this problem <EOS>
<SOS> with the method of intraoperative mri developed in our department it has already been possible to update neuronavigation with images reflecting intraoperative changes in anatomy <EOS>
<SOS> therefore neuronavigation is definitely a method with growing importance in operative routine and it will also spread into other surgical specialties <EOS>
<SOS> severe pain of mucositis induced by cytostatic conditioning therapy in bone marrow transplantation bmt patients generally requires continuous parenteral opioid treatment <EOS>
<SOS> cognitive and psychological disturbances are frequent complications subsequent to bmt and may result from cerebral opioid side effects <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of the study was to evaluate the efficiency of continuous morphine in mucositis pain and the side effects in bmt patients <EOS>
<SOS> particular emphasis was placed on the question of whether reaction times which are usually measured to estimate opioid effects upon vigilance are influenced by pain induced cognitive impairments in pain patients <EOS>
<SOS> methods while in hospital <NUM> bmt patients were examined daily with the aid of a mucositis scale subjective visual analog scales vas for pain and mood parameters a german version of the mcgill pain questionnaire mpq and a mental performance task battery and the morphine given was documented <EOS>
<SOS> mental performance tests were simple auditory reaction time and choice reaction time <EOS>
<SOS> seven patients also performed a sternberg memory search test in which they had to use yes and no response keys to match visually presented test letters to a previously memorized set of letters <EOS>
<SOS> practice and baseline data were collected within the first week before bmt <EOS>
<SOS> results the intensity and duration of mucositis differed from patient to patient resulting in different pain intensities and mpq scores <EOS>
<SOS> prolongation of the choice reaction time averaged over the period of mucositis treatment correlated significantly with residual pain intensity spearman rs 0 88 p 0 01 but not with morphine dose rs 0 35 p 0 33 <EOS>
<SOS> for the sternberg memory search test greater correlation coefficients resulted between reaction time and morphine dose rs 0 86 p 0 014 than between reaction time and residual pain intensity rs 0 61 p 0 15 <EOS>
<SOS> in turn pain intensity unlike morphine dose was significantly correlated with high scores in the mood parameters for depression passivity and tiredness <EOS>
<SOS> conclusions it is concluded that both pain and morphine can impair cognitive performance but that these mental stressors seem to differ according to qualitative criteria <EOS>
<SOS> whereas pain might slow reaction time by distracting a patient is attention particularly in low mental demand tasks morphine could interfere with more specific cognitive processes such as short term memory operations that are required in more complex tasks <EOS>
<SOS> the case of a 63 year old man with a widespread retroperitoneal tumor and two tumor nodules in the left testis is described <EOS>

<SOS> thoughtful coagulation studies and a tumor search program is recommended in these cases <EOS>
<SOS> brain stem gliomas occur mainly in childhood and are localized in the mesencephalon pons and medulla oblongata <EOS>
<SOS> diagnosis is a domain of mri requiring t2 t1 and km <EOS>
<SOS> ct shows hemorrhage and calcification well <EOS>
<SOS> the criteria are the primary site size tumor growth brain stem enlargement delineation intralesional structure exophytic components and enhancement <EOS>
<SOS> secondary criteria are herniation hydrocephalus and liquorgenic seeding <EOS>
<SOS> in ct glioma are hypodense in mri hyperintense in t2 and hypointense in t1 <EOS>
<SOS> enhancement is seen in 25 60 and does not allow differentiation of tumor vs nontumor or gradings <EOS>
<SOS> factors influencing poor outcome are high grade a short history cranial nerve involvement severe brain stem enlargement pontine site diffuse growth and recurrency <EOS>
<SOS> the 5 year survival rate is 30 after radiation focal tumors 85 diffuse 20 <EOS>
<SOS> most frequent are symptoms of brain pressure cerebellum cranial nerves and pyramidal tract <EOS>
<SOS> there is no agreement on whether biopsy is necessary or not <EOS>
<SOS> a diagnosis of tumor is highly suggestive if classical mri findings fit the clinical history <EOS>

<SOS> for more than a century peritoneal adhesions are being recognized as frequent sequelae following abdominal surgery <EOS>
<SOS> intraoperative lesions of the mesothelial lining by abrasion ischemia dissication and foreign bodies result in complaints intestinal obstruction female infertility and problems during reoperations <EOS>
<SOS> the global increase of life expectancy and surgical procedures are leading to rising incidences of adhesion related complications and subsequent socio economic implications <EOS>
<SOS> as of today there is no safe and efficient prophylaxis available <EOS>
<SOS> scientific efforts should be aimed at a liquid substance for single intraperitoneal application which significantly reduces postoperative adhesions at reasonable cost without adverse effects on blood coagulation and wound healing <EOS>
<SOS> even today the name of f d von recklinghausen is often mentioned in connection with primary and secondary hyperparathyroidism <EOS>
<SOS> he was one of the first physicians and scientists to render outstanding services to the classification of structural changes of bones and in many aspects his work remains valid today <EOS>
<SOS> he succeeded through precise and comparative studies in making the disease and symptoms of primary hyperparathyroidism known and thus distinguishing it from other known structural bone diseases <EOS>
<SOS> he also described the phenomenon of bone remodeling which has become relevant today again <EOS>
<SOS> although his written macroscopic and microscopic observations include meticulously precise differentiations which make it difficult to study them today they are still of interest in order to follow his basic ideas <EOS>
<SOS> this article does not constitute a comprehensive biography but it contains a description of f d von recklinghausen is important work on bone pathology against the background of the main stages of his life <EOS>

<SOS> thrombolytic therapy of pulmonary embolism with recombinant tissue type plasminogen activator rt pa has proved to be an established method but intra and postoperatively there is a high risk of bleeding complications <EOS>
<SOS> a 50 year old female with familiar hypophosphatasia and suspected deep venous thrombosis was undergoing osteosynthesis of a femoral fracture <EOS>
<SOS> intraoperatively petco2 suddenly dropped paco2 rose and circulatory arrest occurred <EOS>
<SOS> cpr was started immediately with closed chest cardiac compression and intravenous application of catecholamines <EOS>
<SOS> while continuing cpr surgery was stopped the wound was sealed provisionally and the patient was transferred to the icu <EOS>
<SOS> because of suspected massive pulmonary embolism thrombolytic therapy with rt pa in a total dosage of <NUM> mg was begun <EOS>
<SOS> 2 25 hours after the onset of circultory arrest and <NUM> hours after the beginning of thrombolysis the patient is hemodynamic patterns under high dosage catecholamines were satisfactory <EOS>
<SOS> the bleeding after thrombolysis and coagulopathy required massive blood transfusions <EOS>
