<SOS> with the increasing use of cross sectional echocardiography in patients with overt or suspected pulmonary thromboembolism in the emergency rooms more and more right atrial thrombi are detected <EOS>
<SOS> these are so called transitthrombi from the venous system on their way to the pulmonary arteries and they are a severe presentation of thromboembolic disease <EOS>
<SOS> they appear as an imminent pulmonary embolism and usually coexists with an already massive embolism <EOS>
<SOS> in patients were a right atrial thrombus is associated with a patent foramen ovale paradoxical arterial embolism has been observed <EOS>
<SOS> right sided heart thrombi have a high mortality rate and need immediate treatment <EOS>
<SOS> in our hospital we have seen <NUM> patients with right atrial thrombi and pulmonary embolism in a period of <NUM> years <EOS>
<SOS> three patients had cardiac arrest with a massive pulmonary embolism seven patients presented with a submassive embolism <EOS>
<SOS> all patients were treated immediately after echocardiographic diagnosis without pulmonary angiography <EOS>
<SOS> in about half of the cases transesophageal echocardiography was done additionally for diagnosis and monitoring <EOS>
<SOS> therapeutic options were thrombectomy fibrinolysis or anticoagulants <EOS>
<SOS> we treated one of our patients with thrombectomy eleven patients with fibrinolysis and two patients with anticoagulants <EOS>
<SOS> the era of modern anaesthesia in germany began on january 24th <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> this day professor in ordinary johann ferdinand heyfelder anaesthetized a patient with sulphuric ether in the clinic of surgery and ophthalmology of the university of erlangen <EOS>
<SOS> by march 17th 1847 heyfelder had performed <NUM> surgical procedures under ether <EOS>
<SOS> the operations in majority were teeth extractions and a few more complex operations such as the treatment of a harelip or of lip cancer or the resection of the shoulder joint <EOS>
<SOS> heyfelder described in detail <NUM> of these inhalations in a little book entitled the experiments with sulphuric ether <EOS>
<SOS> this monograph published in march 1847 represents one of the first complete dissertations on sulphuric ether in the german literature <EOS>
<SOS> in a special chapter he analyzed the development of various physiological and psychological parameters during etherization <EOS>
<SOS> heyfelder also examined blood and urine of some etherized patients and reported that he did not find any important or specific alterations <EOS>
<SOS> in 1847 heyfelder was probably the first to apply salt ether in man <EOS>
<SOS> after <NUM> administrations he concluded that salt ether acted more quickly but shorter than sulphuric ether <EOS>
<SOS> advantageous were its application without problems and ease of induction <EOS>
<SOS> disadvantageous were its high volatility its price and the difficulty of getting it in a pure form <EOS>
<SOS> from december 1847 on heyfelder started to use chloroform <EOS>
<SOS> he was now able to perform more major operations for example the total resection of the hip joint <EOS>
<SOS> in his book the experiments with sulphuric ether salt ether and chloroform he describes a great number of anaesthetic administrations using these <NUM> agents <EOS>
<SOS> in his summary heyfelder concluded that chloroform was undoubtly superior to sulphuric ether mainly because it was a quicker acting and longer lasting agent and leads to deeper narcosis <EOS>
<SOS> moreover its application was much easier for it needed no special apparatus <EOS>
<SOS> however because of its great anaesthetic potency heyfelder particularly demanded great caution in the application of chloroform <EOS>
<SOS> explicitely he expected an assistant for chloroformizations whose only duty was to supervise the inhalations and the patient a forerunner of the modern specialized anaesthesiologist <EOS>
<SOS> background to evaluate the publication rate of abstracts presented during the german anaesthesia congress dak in medline listed journals in comparison to the publication rate of abstracts presented during the meeting of the european society of anaesthesiologists esa <EOS>
<SOS> the uniform development of the human embryo as described by classic human embryology has been confirmed by sonoembryological studies <EOS>
<SOS> in particular the embryonic brain is suitable for transvaginal ultrasound examination because the large cystic cavities of the brain can easily be imaged <EOS>
<SOS> sonoembryology not only describes normal embryonic anatomy and normal relations and proportions of organs but also the development of structural abnormalities <EOS>
<SOS> approximately one third of all congenital anomalies originate from the central nervous system cns <EOS>
<SOS> based on normal sonoembryology and on recent experiences with early cns anomalies we recognize some sonographic signs of an early cns anomaly 1 apparent dysmorphology of the brain or the head 2 altered appearance of the cerebral ventricles with disproportion of the brain compartments where the amount of fluid is either greater or less than normal 3 in the early fetal period choroid plexuses that are too small to fill the ventricle from the medial to the lateral wall 4 irregular contour of the spine back 5 extra cns anomalies <EOS>
<SOS> in the following survey normal sonoembryology of the cns is described and cns anomalies of the early pregnancy are discussed <EOS>
<SOS> telomerase is an enzyme that elongates telomeric repeats the specialized structures at the ends of chromosomes that provide genomic stability and compensate for the physiologic process of telomere shortening <EOS>
<SOS> it has been implicated in cellular senescence immortalization and carcinogenesis <EOS>
<SOS> over 85 of human tumours and 95 of non melanocytic skin cancers show telomerase activity in contrast to the corresponding normal tissues <EOS>
<SOS> this suggests that telomerase activity may play an important role in carcinogenesis <EOS>
<SOS> recent evidence shows that telomerase is active not only in embryonal and germ line tissues but also in some normal tissues <EOS>
<SOS> in the skin this activity has been traced to the stem cell bearing epidermal basal cell layer possibly reflecting the presence of telomerase competent stem cells <EOS>
<SOS> these findings require a reconsideration of our interpretation of telomerase activity in tumours of the skin and other tissues <EOS>
<SOS> as a causal relationship linking telomerase activity and cancer has yet not been demonstrated some caution is warranted <EOS>
<SOS> the established criteria of auditory brainstem responses abr such as jv latency ji v interpeak latency and interaural differences of <NUM> latency or amplitude have been found to be sensitive for detecting tumors of the cerebellopontine angle if a response is present <EOS>
<SOS> however the abr can be absent in cases of acoustic neuromas because of desynchronization even though pure one audiometry indicates that responses should be present <EOS>
<SOS> this retrospective study compared the abr and pure tone thresholds in <NUM> cases with cerebellopontine angle tumors and a control group of <NUM> cases with sensory hearing losses in order to quantify threshold discrepancies <EOS>
<SOS> the average deficit of the objective abr threshold doabrt to the subjective pure tone threshold for those frequencies between 1 6 khz was <NUM> db for the control group abr and pure tone thresholds very close and <NUM> db for the tumor group abr threshold much higher than the pure tone threshold <EOS>
<SOS> abr thresholds <NUM> db higher than the high frequency pure tone thresholds were found in 40 6 of the tumor group and in none of the control group <EOS>
<SOS> thus deficits of the abr threshold 30 db can be considered to be an additional criterion for detecting retrocochlear disease and increases abr sensitivity for tumor detection even if responses are absent <EOS>

<SOS> superficial leptomeningeal hemosiderosis is a rare disease of the central nervous system <EOS>
<SOS> chronic bleeding into the subarachnoid space causes deposition of hemosiderin in glial cells and subsequent damage to adjacent brain tissue <EOS>
<SOS> there is a characteristic predilection for the cerebellum and eighth cranial nerve <EOS>
<SOS> accordingly among a variety of symptoms cerebellar ataxia and sensorineural hearing loss progressing to total deafness commonly occur <EOS>
<SOS> to date the hearing loss has been believed to be purely neural <EOS>
<SOS> we present a case of superficial hemosiderosis in a patient with total deafness who was successfully provided with a cochlear implant <EOS>
<SOS> audiometry demonstrated total bilateral cochlear hearing losses but with preserved function of the eighth cranial nerve <EOS>
<SOS> these findings make us conclude that in contrast to current opinion superficial hemosiderosis can initially damage the cochlea alone <EOS>
<SOS> thus patients with total deafness due to this disorder may benefit from cochlear implantation <EOS>
<SOS> all patients require careful audiometric assessment including promontory stimulation <EOS>

<SOS> to determine this experimentally closed bone fracture right lower leg and or soft tissue trauma 2 5 cm midline laparotomy were induced prior to hemorrhagic shock mean arterial bp of <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> mm hg for <NUM> min in male c3h hen mice <EOS>
<SOS> all animals were killed at <NUM> h after initiation of the experiment and the spleens were collected aseptically <EOS>
<SOS> more significant depression of splenocyte il 2 and il 3 release occurred with the combined insult than after bony injury or tissue trauma alone with hemorrhage <EOS>

<SOS> in the management of acute major vessel occlusion the use of fibrinolytic agents such as recombinant tissue plasminogen activator rt pa urokinase or streptokinase is widely accepted <EOS>
<SOS> today the spectrum of indications for thrombolytic drugs comprises acute myocardial infarction lung embolism ischaemic stroke deep vein thrombosis and acute arterial occlusions of the lower limbs <EOS>
<SOS> in view of the histopathological and clinical features of retinal vessel occlusion fibrinolysis aimed at early restoration of blood flow appears to be a promising therapeutic approach <EOS>
<SOS> basically it is of some concern that the systemic administration of fibrinolytic agents is associated with a haemorrhagic risk <EOS>
<SOS> since this includes cerebral haemorrhage or gastrointestinal bleeding the choice of an appropriate intravenous thrombolytic therapy in a non life threatening situation such as central retinal artery occlusion crao or central retinal vein occlusion crvo should be based on minimising the risk of adverse events <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore the fibrinolytic treatment of choice should be able to produce rapid and complete restoration of retinal capillary and arterial or venous blood flow and maintain patency long enough for retinal salvage to take place <EOS>
<SOS> in this article we review several studies of fibrinolytic therapy in patients with retinal vessel occlusion to determine whether this treatment is likely to improve major clinical outcomes <EOS>
<SOS> moreover we review the large scale trials of fibrinolysis in myocardial infarction and acute ischaemic stroke to evaluate safety and efficacy of various thrombolytic regimens <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore we report on our results of fibrinolytic therapy with low dose rt pa in patients with retinal artery occlusion and ischaemic central retinal vein occlusion <EOS>
<SOS> in light of the fact that the occurrence of bleeding complications constitutes a dose dependent problem we conclude that the use of low dose regimens should be the ideal approach to fibrinolysis in retinal vessel occlusion <EOS>

<SOS> the lumbosacral junction is exposed via a mini laparotomy using a special soft tissue spreader <EOS>
<SOS> interbody fusion is described with autogeneous bone grafts <EOS>
<SOS> preliminary experience with <NUM> patients treated between <NUM> and <NUM> show that peri and postoperative morbidity is low <EOS>
<SOS> clinical as well as radiological results are comparable to the standard techniques <EOS>
<SOS> spectrum as well as rate of complications so far do not differ from those described in the literature for non microsurgical approaches <EOS>
<SOS> the posterior cruciate ligament pcl is the strongest ligament of the human knee joint <EOS>
<SOS> its origin is at the lateral wall of the medial femoral condyle and the insertion is located in the posterior part of the intercondylar area <EOS>
<SOS> the posterior cruciate ligament consists of multiple small fiber bundles <EOS>
<SOS> from a functional point of view one can differentiate fiber bundles with an anterior origin and fiber bundles with a posterior origin at the femur <EOS>
<SOS> the anterior fibers insert in the anterolateral part of the tibial insertion zone <EOS>
<SOS> these fibers become tense when the knee is flexed <EOS>
<SOS> the posterior fibers insert in the posteromedial part of the tibial insertion and become tense when the knee is extended <EOS>
<SOS> the main part of the posterior cruciate ligament consists of type i collagen positive dense connective tissue <EOS>
<SOS> the longitudinal fibrils of type i collagen are divided into small bundles by thin type ii collagen positive fibrils <EOS>
<SOS> in the center of the middle third region the structure of the tissue varies from the typical structure of a ligament <EOS>
<SOS> in this region the structure of the tissue resembles fibrocartilage <EOS>
<SOS> oval shaped cells surrounded by a metachromatic extracellular matrix lie between the longitudinal collagen fibrils <EOS>
<SOS> the femoral origin and the tibial insertion have the structure of chondral apophyseal enthesis <EOS>
<SOS> near the anchoring region at the femur and tibia there should be various mechanoreceptors which might have an important function for the kinematics of the knee joint <EOS>
<SOS> the blood supply of the pcl arises from the middle geniculate artery <EOS>
<SOS> the ligament is covered by a synovial fold where the terminal branches of the middle and the inferior geniculate artery form a periligamentous network <EOS>
<SOS> from the synovial sheath the blood vessels penetrate the ligament in a transverse direction and anastomose with a longitudinally orientated intraligamentous network <EOS>
<SOS> the distribution of blood vessels within the pcl is not homogeneous <EOS>
<SOS> we detected three avascular areas within the ligament both fibrocartilaginous entheses of the pcl are devoid of blood vessels <EOS>
<SOS> a third avascular zone is located in the central zone of fibrocartilage of the middle third region <EOS>

<SOS> postoperative pacemaker implantation had been performed in <NUM> pts <NUM> of <NUM> pts were receiving antiarrhythmic medication <EOS>
<SOS> after placing a quadripolar transesophageal catheter atrial and ventricular signals were recorded and atrial stimulation performed <EOS>

<SOS> modern obstetrics must try to maintain high safety standards for both mother and child and at the same time satisfy the general desire of women for natural birth <EOS>
<SOS> standards of safety are based on early recognition of high risks allowing early intervention to prevent serious complications <EOS>
<SOS> a considerable number of diagnostic and therapeutic measures recommended on a prophylactic basis and therefore widely used are responsible for the medical technical image associated with modern obstetrics <EOS>
<SOS> the benefits of most of these prophylactically recommended activities are unproven or low relative to the unavoidable side effects and the costs associated with widespread application <EOS>
<SOS> there is good scientific proof that routine application of fetal heart rate monitoring during labor and delivery is associated with an increase in the rate of cesarean sections as well as operative vaginal deliveries without any clear benefit to the newborn in terms of a decrease in mortality or morbidity <EOS>
<SOS> in a population of healthy women with uncomplicated pregnancies the prevalence of perinatal mortality or morbidity is so low that even with meta analysis of several studies the numbers remain too small to show significant differences for these rare events <EOS>
<SOS> in high risk cases the routine application of fetal heart rate monitoring throughout labor and delivery is undisputed and leads to a significant drop in morbiditiy and mortality of the baby <EOS>
<SOS> with careful selection of pregnant women a combination of electronic fetal heart rate monitoring and auscultation during certain segments of the first stage of labor provides adequate surveillance <EOS>

<SOS> epileptic seizures may alter autonomic functions <EOS>
<SOS> this is especially the case with complex focal seizures of temporal lobe origin and grand mal <EOS>
<SOS> most frequently such seizures cause ictal tachycardia sometimes tachypnea probably caused by the propagation of epileptic discharges to autonomic cerebral structures <EOS>
<SOS> ictal bradycardia and asystole are rare phenomena <EOS>
<SOS> however they may be life threatening <EOS>
<SOS> their differentiation from primary cardiac arrest is possible by the use of ictal eeg and ecg registration <EOS>
<SOS> postictal serum prolactin measurement does not differentiate syncope from seizure <EOS>
<SOS> however a postictal increase of creatine kinase is only measured after epileptic seizures and not after syncope <EOS>
<SOS> treatment of such epileptic seizures includes an optimization of anticonvulsant drug therapy and the implantation of a cardiac demand stimulator <EOS>
<SOS> there is growing evidence that ictal asystole is a cofactor in sudden unexplained death in epileptic patients <EOS>

<SOS> cpr was initiated in the remaining <NUM> patients who comprise the study population defined as 100 <EOS>
<SOS> all patients who were admitted to a hospital were followed using a second protocol <EOS>
<SOS> cpr in the field was successful in <NUM> 30 4 patients who were then admitted to a hospital <NUM> of these died within the first <NUM> h four patients 1 8 could be discharged from hospital alive and were still living <NUM> year later <NUM> with a lasting neurological deficit fig <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> 69 6 cases resuscitative attempts were unsuccessful in the field <EOS>

<SOS> intraarticular bleeding and muscle bleeding occur spontaneously or as a result of trauma in hemophilia a or b <EOS>
<SOS> the most common sites for hemarthrosis are the knees joints elbows and ankles joints <EOS>
<SOS> resorption of intraarticular blood induces reactive hemophilic synovitis <EOS>
<SOS> hyperplasia of the synovium can be followed by recurrent bleedings <EOS>
<SOS> these early reactions can change to a chronic synovitis and cause cartilage damage finally resulting in a complete destruction of the joint <EOS>
<SOS> since <NUM> <NUM> adults and <NUM> children with a hemophilia a or b were treated at the center for hemophilic disorders frankfurt in an interdisciplinary approach <EOS>
<SOS> consequent prophylactic treatment with factor substitution can prevent the incidence of severe hemarthrosis <EOS>
<SOS> minor joint bleedings are treated by adequate factor substitution temporarily non weight bearing of the extremity application of ice packs and physical therapy <EOS>
<SOS> more severe joint hemorrhages should be aspirated in order to reduce the acute synovitis <EOS>
<SOS> this is followed by a consequent physical therapy joint and soft tissue techniques and anti inflammatory drugs <EOS>
<SOS> the goal is a sufficient muscular balance of the joint the improvement of the coordination and the proprioception <EOS>
<SOS> the chronic synovitis is less painful and poorly responses to conservative interventions <EOS>
<SOS> local ice application sytemic and local anti inflammatory treatment support the physical therapy <EOS>
<SOS> soft heel shock absorber elastic and semi rigid bandages prevent recurrent bleeding episodes by shock absorption and decrease of synovial impingement <EOS>
<SOS> synovectomy is indicated in cases of chronic persistent synovitis <EOS>
<SOS> radiosynoviorthesis rso which is an alternative in certain cases has been performed with great success in <NUM> cases in our hospital <EOS>
<SOS> in advanced arthropathy joint mobilization should be the emphasis of the physical therapy <EOS>
<SOS> bandages crutches and ortopaedic shoe devices improve the walking capacity <EOS>

<SOS> continuous administration of 6 mg naloxone to antagonize the supposed effect of the morphine had no effect <EOS>
<SOS> the patient is condition was not normalized until a single dose of <NUM> mg flumazenil was administered <EOS>
<SOS> for the time being especially in the case of elderly patients we recommend that strict indications are adhered to when intrathecal administration of morphine is considered and that less than <NUM> mg morphine is given <EOS>

<SOS> in contrast to the often debated nyha classification the determination of peak oxygen uptake peak vo2 by cardiopulmonary exercise testing allows an objective assessment of the exercise capacity of patients with congestive heart failure chf <EOS>
<SOS> however cardiopulmonary exercise testing is a time consuming and costly diagnostic tool which requires sophisticated equipment and specially trained personell <EOS>
<SOS> exercise capacity can also be determined by the <NUM> minute walk test <EOS>
<SOS> this test simply measures the distance covered by strong walking on a hallway level within <NUM> minutes <EOS>
<SOS> the <NUM> minute walk test is a submaximal exercise test which is associated with much smaller increments in heart rate blood pressure and plasma catecholamines than cardiopulmonary exercise testing <EOS>
<SOS> it is characterized by a very small intraindividual variance <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore it can be easily performed and due to low logistic and personal requirements it is very cost effective <EOS>
<SOS> the results of the <NUM> minute walk test as well as of cardiopulmonary exercise testing are influenced by extracardial exercise limiting disorders such as pulmonary diseases <EOS>
<SOS> independent from the etiology of chf the results of the <NUM> minute walk test are closely related to peak vo2 <EOS>
<SOS> in serial exercise testing the distance covered within <NUM> minutes allow to predict the individual peak vo2 <EOS>
<SOS> like peak vo2 the <NUM> minute walk test has been shown to be a predictor of morbidity and mortality in chf with its predictive value being independent from left ventricular ejection fraction and other potential prognostic parameters <EOS>
<SOS> in chf patients a walking distance <NUM> m is associated with a one year mortality of up to 50 whereas the one year mortality in patients reaching a walking distance <NUM> m amounts to only a few percent <EOS>
<SOS> in addition the hospitalization rate of patients reaching a walking distance of <NUM> m is several fold higher than in those with a walking distance <NUM> m like cardiopulmonary exercise testing the <NUM> minute walk test allows to control the efficiency of specific treatments and to monitor the natural course of the disease <EOS>
<SOS> the <NUM> minute walk test is thus a cost effective alternative to cardiopulmonary exercise testing in chf patients <EOS>
<SOS> however neither the <NUM> minute walk test alone nor the results of cardiopulmonary exercise testing alone are sufficient for selecting patients e g for cardiac transplantation as each individual case requires a synopsis of all relevant facts and parameters <EOS>

<SOS> the effects of glycerol are discussed in detail <EOS>
<SOS> glycerol can lead to a transition of crystalline lipid structures within the horny layer lipids into liquid crystalline states <EOS>
<SOS> especially if applied in oil water emulsions it improves the hydration of the horny layers better than urea <EOS>
<SOS> in addition if facilitates the dissolution of desmosomes within the superior layers of the horny layer enhancing desquamation <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore by using glycerol the mechanical properties of the skin can be influenced long term used leads to increased elasticity <EOS>
<SOS> the roughness of the horny layer is reduced which can be explained by the abrasive and or the hydrating effect <EOS>
<SOS> glycerol used in o w emulsions also protects against the influence of tensides or noxious lipophilic agents <EOS>
<SOS> presumably a flux from the base of the epidermis towards its surface triggers the regeneration of the barrier <EOS>
<SOS> finally <NUM> glycerol can lead similarly to urea to an improvement in active agent penetration as has been proven for hexylnicotinate <EOS>

<SOS> atrial tachyarrhythmias significantly reduce quality of life in a surprisingly large number of patients <EOS>
<SOS> the safe and effective treatment of atrial tachyarrhythmias is being intensively studied <EOS>
<SOS> internal electrical cardioversion of atrial fibrillation has been shown to be an effective non pharmacological treatment option <EOS>
<SOS> cardioversion therapy has been applied in the absence of a clear understanding of the mechanisms governing the process <EOS>
<SOS> recent measurements of atrial transmembrane potentials using sophisticated optical mapping techniques reveal that internal cardioversion shocks cause changes in repolarization time that favor annihilation of wave fronts <EOS>
<SOS> thus mechanisms of atrial cardioversion appear to be similar to ventricular defibrillation <EOS>
<SOS> further studies are needed to determine whether cardioversion mechanisms differ for chronic atrial fibrillation compared to acute atrial fibrillation <EOS>

<SOS> facial trauma is frequent and mainly caused by motor vehicle accidents <EOS>
<SOS> due to this main etiologic factor trauma to the facial skeleton is often associated with serious injuries commonly involving the brain chest or abdomen <EOS>
<SOS> as a consequence the initial clinical management of these patients includes control of hemorrhage and immediate assessment of life threatening injuries including the maintenance of the airways <EOS>
<SOS> patients presenting with facial trauma are initially evaluated with a systematic clinical examination because many fractures can be accurately diagnosed by inspection and palpation alone <EOS>
<SOS> in these cases plain film radiographs serve only for confirmation and documentation of the diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> in many other cases accompanying and extensive soft tissue swelling may clinically obscure fractures <EOS>
<SOS> a complete and accurate evaluation of these patients requires additional radiological imaging methods <EOS>
<SOS> a series of plain films may be generally sufficient but in most of the cases they can be regarded as initial screening methods for more thorough diagnosis with computed tomography ct <EOS>
<SOS> in trauma patients ct is the imaging method of choice because it shows more fracture lines and displaced fragments than any other imaging modality <EOS>
<SOS> ct delineates soft tissue and bony structures and can localize and even characterize foreign bodies <EOS>
<SOS> a complete and accurate characterization of the fracture type and potentially associated complications is mandatory for the appropriate treatment and can only be achieved by careful radiological ct evaluation <EOS>

<SOS> background rarely an additional brown is syndrome develops spontaneously in cases of posttraumatic bilateral superior oblique palsy <EOS>
<SOS> surgical measures are controversial and problematic <EOS>
<SOS> metastasis formation is a multistep process that requires tumor cells to progress through many different stages <EOS>
<SOS> one of the first steps is a disturbance of the epithelial integrity through a decrease in intercellular homotypic adhesion <EOS>
<SOS> proteolysis of the extracellular matrix as well as increased locomotion leads to intravasation and dissemination of the tumor cells <EOS>
<SOS> in the target organs metastasizing cells adhere to the endothelium extravasate and form metastases <EOS>
<SOS> finally neoangiogenesis is required for the initiation as well as the growth of the metastases providing the tumor cells with both nutritive agents and growth factors <EOS>
<SOS> this leads to the conclusion that anti proteolytic and anti angiogenic substances could provide effective therapeutic approaches for the control of metastatic growth <EOS>
<SOS> whether or not this goal can be accomplished by synthetic or endogenous drugs must still be demonstrated by basic and definitive clinical research <EOS>

<SOS> type i and type ii diabetes are the most common types of diabetes <EOS>
<SOS> the ratio of type i to type ii diabetes is about <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> type i diabetes is caused by an absolute insulin deficiency and is therefore referred to as insulin dependent <URL> disease becomes manifest clinically in childhood or adolescence juvenile diabetes although manifestation in adulthood is being increasingly observed <EOS>
<SOS> morphologically a subtotal <NUM> to total loss of beta cells in the pancreatic islets occurs <EOS>
<SOS> lymphocytic insulitis which disappears after the beta cells have been totally destroyed is pathognomonic of type i diabetes <EOS>
<SOS> this insulitis is an expression of an autoimmune event that is triggered by a multitude of factors <EOS>
<SOS> an important factor appears to be a genetic predisposition hla dr3 dr4 dq8 in connection with as yet unknown environmental factors e g viruses <EOS>
<SOS> autoantibodies such as islet cell cytoplasmic antibodies ica insulin autoantibodies iaa and or autoantibodies to the gaba synthesizing enzyme glutamic acid carboxylase gad are already detectable in a prediabetic phase although it is not possible to predict the time of clinical manifestion <EOS>
<SOS> the course of the disease is dependent on age <EOS>
<SOS> young children require insulin therapy sooner than juveniles or adults <EOS>
<SOS> this article summarizes data from recent studies on the prevalence diagnosis and therapy of the obstructive sleep apnea syndrome osas in children <EOS>
<SOS> the prevalence of this disorder in 4 6 year old children is 0 7 <EOS>
<SOS> leading clinical sign in 90 of patients is habitual snoring but this is rather nonspecific as 60 of patients investigated for habitual snoring do not have osas <EOS>
<SOS> other signs such as daytime sleepiness failure to thrive profuse nocturnal sweating or mouth breathing are equally nonspecific <EOS>
<SOS> the diagnosis therefore has to be confirmed by polysomnography where osas is suggested by the occurrence of 5 obstructive apneas hypopneas per hour of sleep in conjunction with a co2 of 50 mmhg for 8 of sleep time and or 1 desaturation to 90 h <EOS>

<SOS> the design of controlled clinical trials on prevention and therapy of arrhythmic events is a difficult task <EOS>
<SOS> in particular in icd trials false estimations and omissions have occured that can compromise the interpretation of a trial <EOS>
<SOS> identification of crucial issues that should be regulated in a study protocol in order to minimize the risk of failure <EOS>
<SOS> evaluation of the weaknesses of completed antiarrhythmic trials <EOS>
<SOS> problems in the specification of indications and in the estimation of the effective sample size cannot be solved by the inclusion of mixed populations but require the establishment of development programs <EOS>
<SOS> further crucial points are the appropriate choice of control and the identical concomittant treatment and observation of the groups to be compared <EOS>
<SOS> technical mistakes as imprecise definitions arbitrary decisions during the course or at termination of a trial unclear responsibilities or an unscheduled flow of information can be avoided if these potential problems are anticipated in the trial protocol <EOS>
<SOS> a prospective approach that anticipates problems at the time the study protocol is drafted is preferable to a reluctant reactive approach during the course of the trial <EOS>

<SOS> the operative realignment of mechanical axis deviations mad is necessary to prevent early joint degeneration and to reach normal load bearing <EOS>
<SOS> modern types of external fixation systems allow an alignment of the mechanical axis to exact degrees <EOS>
<SOS> predominantly this are corrections of angular deformities <EOS>
<SOS> in some cases the analysis of the mad does not show any angular deformity but a parallel staggering of the mechanical axis lines of a bone <EOS>
<SOS> such parallel staggering of the mechanical axis lines is defined as a translation deformity of the bone <EOS>
<SOS> in combined deformities with angulation and translation the centre of deformity can be established proximal or distal out of the limit of the bone <EOS>
<SOS> in translation deformities the realignment of the mechanical axis requires a parallel re staggering made by a translation osteotomy or by a counterangulated double osteotomy <EOS>
<SOS> in complex deformities with angulation and translation the translation requires a separate corrective planning <EOS>
<SOS> by using external fixator systems to perform acute or progressive corrective osteotomies the position of the axis of correction of angulation aca in relation to the n cora of the deformity has to be considered <EOS>
<SOS> if aca position is not conform with the n cora position relevant geometric effects in relation of length and translation occur <EOS>
<SOS> these geometric effects to corrective osteotomies can be calculated by using simple trigonometric formulas or graphical methods <EOS>
<SOS> possibilities to compensate translation and length effects are shown by using unilateral external fixator systems <EOS>

<SOS> the papular purpuric gloves and socks syndrome ppgss was first described in <NUM> by harms et al <EOS>
<SOS> the syndrome is characterised by fever an itchy erythema with edema confluent papules and purpura of the hands and feet in a gloves and socks distribution <EOS>
<SOS> the skin lesions may be associated with purpura and superficial erosions of the oral mucosa <EOS>
<SOS> viral infections in particular parvovirus b19 are the most likely trigger <EOS>
<SOS> in the present case ppgss developed after taking trimethoprim sulfamethoxazole <EOS>
<SOS> since the patient developed identical symptoms after accidental re challenge with the same drug this case strongly suggests medications as another factor in the pathogenesis of ppgss <EOS>
<SOS> most fractures of the clavicle heal well with nonoperative treatment <EOS>
<SOS> on rare occasions malunited clavicular fractures are associated with a pattern of disability that includes not only pain but also functional or neurovascular impairment <EOS>
<SOS> in these cases clavicular osteotomy and correction of the deformity should be considered <EOS>
<SOS> in four patients with a malunited fracture of the clavicle following nonoperative treatment we performed a clavicular osteotomy for deformity <EOS>
<SOS> in all four patients the clavicular fracture healed with shortening associated with pain and ipsilateral glenohumeral dysfunction <EOS>
<SOS> the deformity was not associated with neurovascular dysfunction <EOS>
<SOS> in preoperative x ray studies the shortening of the malunited clavicle was between <NUM> and <NUM> cm in comparison to the contralateral clavicle <EOS>
<SOS> all patients underwent an extension osteotomy of the clavicle with interposition of an autogenous iliac crest bone graft <EOS>
<SOS> the follow up was <NUM> <NUM> years postoperatively <EOS>
<SOS> the functional outcome was evaluated using the constant murley and the ucla score <EOS>
<SOS> all patients had immediate pain relief following osteotomy and correction of the deformity <EOS>
<SOS> the shoulder function rapidly improved and the functional outcome was good in three out of the four patients <EOS>
<SOS> if there is associated functional impairment in malunited clavicular fractures extension osteotomy combined with autogenous bone grafting may produce predictably good results <EOS>

<SOS> necrotizing pancreatitis is still associated with considerable morbidity and mortality <EOS>
<SOS> formerly surgical treatment with early and extensive pancreatic resection has been the standard <EOS>
<SOS> improvements in our understanding of the pathogenesis of the disease and progress in the field of intensive care therapy have made conservative therapy the initial standard in the treatment of necrotizing pancreatitis <EOS>
<SOS> a considerable percentage of patients with sterile necrosis can be managed with low morbidity and mortality by conservative treatment without operation <EOS>
<SOS> nevertheless surgical treatment is indicated in patients with infected necrosis and in sterile necrosis if multiorgan failure persists over a limited period of time despite maximum intensive care therapy <EOS>
<SOS> pancreatic resection should be abandoned for surgical treatment of pancreatic necrosis as results with regard to morbidity mortality and long term outcome are unsatisfactory <EOS>
<SOS> today the surgical standard is careful digital necrosectomy which must be followed by either postoperatve drainage repeated open lavage or continuous closed lavage <EOS>
<SOS> in experienced hands all three procedures provide similar results with regard to morbidity and mortality <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of quality management in rheumatology is to improve care and outcome in patients with rheumatic diseases <EOS>
<SOS> this can be achieved by means of prospective long term observation of the patient with regular documentation of clinical radiological biochemical and functional data using certain validated scoring methods das radiological score adl score hanover or health assessment questionnaire sf36 etc <EOS>
<SOS> long term observation and documentation including radiographs have been performed in the rheumatology hospital in ratingen for <NUM> years without even knowing the term quality management <EOS>
<SOS> quality management in a hospital for rheumatic diseases begins with certain structural prerequisites possibility of direct admission of a patient to the hospital by the family physician outpatient clinic to investigate and to follow patients over a long period of time multidisciplinary team with specialists in rheumatology orthopedic surgery physiotherapy ergotherapy special care psychological and social services close cooperation with specialists in neurology dermatology ophthalmology etc department of radiology special laboratory facilities for internal diagnostics and treatment <EOS>
<SOS> the hospital needs a training program for the qualification of rheumatologists and orthopaedic surgeons <EOS>
<SOS> the hospital staff should closely cooperate with the doctors in private practice who admit patients and should continously support patient organizations <EOS>
<SOS> the quality of outcome is influenced by the process quality which depends on the following factors selection training and motivation of the hospital staff supervision of clinical assessment and documentation by senior physicians daily x ray demonstrations and case reports interdisciplinary case demonstrations at least every week in addition to daily consultation team reports regular education including review of actual literature for physicians education programs exchanging knowledge with physiotherapists and nurses and regular education programs for patients <EOS>
<SOS> process quality can only be achieved by an interdisciplinary approach and regular communication between all participants including the patient whose opinion must be noted and regarded <EOS>
<SOS> as far as possible the same doctor who treats the patient in the hospital should follow her him in the outpatient clinic <EOS>
<SOS> the quality of outcome can be improved by regular reinvestigation of the patient with control of medication side effects efficacy documentation of clinical biochemical radiological and functional data <EOS>
<SOS> decisions for further treatment have to be based on these follow up data <EOS>
<SOS> a standardized follow up and documentation system for all rheumatology units with prompt feedback could definitely improve the quality of rheumatologic care in germany <EOS>

<SOS> all patients received general endotracheal anaesthesia <EOS>

<SOS> patients were ventilated with oxygen in air fio2 0 4 <EOS>
<SOS> the intraabdominal pressure during the surgical procedure ranged from <NUM> to <NUM> mm hg <EOS>
<SOS> thirty minutes after releasing the capnoperitoneum kp co2 elimination v co2 oxygen uptake v o2 and respiratory quotient rq were measured every minute for <NUM> h by indirect calorimetry using the metabolic monitor deltatrac according to the principle of canopy <EOS>
<SOS> assuming an unchanged metabolism the co2 resorption v co2 at any given time t can be calculated from v co2 t v co2 t rq preop v o2 t <EOS>
<SOS> it was thus necessary to define the patient is metabolism on the day of operation <EOS>
<SOS> the first data were collected before surgery and after introduction of the arterial and venous cannulae for a 15 min period <EOS>
<SOS> measuring point <NUM> was determined after exsufflation of the kp and emptying of the remaining co2 via manual compression by the surgeon at the end of surgery <EOS>
<SOS> patient is tracheas were extubated and metabolic monitoring started <NUM> min after release of the kp for <NUM> min <EOS>
<SOS> simultaneously a nasal side stream capnometry probe was placed and the peco2 and respiratory frequency rf were obtained by the capnomac ultima datex and registered every minute as well <EOS>
<SOS> values were averaged over four periods of <NUM> min each <EOS>
<SOS> an arterial blood gas sample was drawn at the end of every 15 min period <EOS>
<SOS> postoperative pain was scored by a visual analog scale and completed by a subjective index questionnaire on general well being <EOS>
<SOS> all data were analysed by the friedman or wilcoxon test p0 05 was considered significant <EOS>
<SOS> the findings do not indicate co2 resorption in the postoperative period after laparoscopic cholecystectomy tables <NUM> and 3 fig <EOS>
<SOS> arterial co2 as well as peco2 were elevated postoperatively 45 mm hg vs <NUM> mm hg intraoperatively while v co2 and v o2 were unchanged when compared to the preoperative measuring period <EOS>
<SOS> the postoperative rf was comparable to preoperative values <EOS>
<SOS> calculated co2 was lower than <NUM> ml min and within accuracy of measurements <EOS>
<SOS> the postoperative pain index ranged between <NUM> and 4 and <NUM> <NUM> mg piritramid was administered <EOS>
<SOS> all patients feld tired immediately after the operation but scores improved slightly at the end of the 60 min period of metabolic monitoring <EOS>
<SOS> there is no significant resorption of co2 from the abdominal cavity later than <NUM> min after releasing the kp <EOS>
<SOS> up to this time any co2 remaining in the abdominal cavity after careful emptying by the surgeon has been resorbed and exhaled <EOS>

<SOS> these findings argue against the notion that smp must be mediated by a reflex change in the pattern of sympathetic discharge <EOS>
<SOS> in general they underline the fact that autonomic effector disturbances may give little information about underlying nerve traffic <EOS>

<SOS> in <NUM> years <NUM> patients with a total of <NUM> painful ear nodules chondrodermatitis helicis have been treated as follows <EOS>

<SOS> the rest of the nodule or any other nodules are carbonized by means of the argon laser also with local anaesthesia including the surface of the cartilage under the nodules <EOS>
<SOS> there have been no cases of postoperative inflammation or infection <EOS>

<SOS> for determination of training intensity a vo2 between <NUM> and 70 of peak vo2 and or training heart rate between <NUM> and 80 of peak heart rate was used <EOS>
<SOS> there was also a wide range for frequency between <NUM> and <NUM> times per week and duration of training between <NUM> and <NUM> min per session <EOS>
<SOS> for aerobic exercise training only continuous training methods were applied <EOS>

<SOS> after only three weeks of training the improvement in aerobic capacity was similar to that reported after longer training periods using continuous methods <EOS>
<SOS> to determine work rate for work phases of interval training a special steep ramp test was developed <EOS>
<SOS> by analysis of acute physical responses to this testing procedure and to the interval training both were proven to be tolerable in chf patients even if their ejection fraction is as low as 13 or peak cardiac index not greater than <NUM> l m2 min and peak vo2 less than <NUM> ml kg min <EOS>
<SOS> therapeutic choice in laryngeal carcinoma is influenced by the nature of the tumor and a variety of factors involving the patient and physician <EOS>
<SOS> small t1 and exophytic t1 t2 tumors are suitable for radiotherapy <EOS>
<SOS> limited lesions t1 t2 can be cured by functional endoscopic resection techniques or external partial laryngectomies <EOS>
<SOS> extensive tumors large t2 t3 are treated by total laryngectomy or by primary irradiation especially in the case of a good response to induction chemotherapy <EOS>
<SOS> when radiation treatment fails surgery succeeds in more than half of the cases <EOS>
<SOS> tumors infiltrating or transgressing the laryngeal framework t4 can only be cured by total laryngectomy followed by radiotherapy <EOS>
<SOS> subtotal or circular ablation of the adjacent pharynx or esophagectomy needs repair with visceral or myocutaneous grafts <EOS>
<SOS> lymphatics are preferentially treated with the same modality as used in the primary disease <EOS>
<SOS> inconspicuous lymphatics should be treated electively in most cases with the exception of early glottic cancer <EOS>
<SOS> induced hypotension is defined as a reduction in mean arterial blood pressure to 50 60 mm hg in normotensive subjects <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of induced hypotension is to decrease intraoperative blood loss decrease the need for blood transfusions and improve operating conditions <EOS>
<SOS> most studies indicate that induced hypotension can decrease intraoperative blood loss by 50 in many surgical procedures however some studies report that blood loss is not significantly reduced <EOS>
<SOS> current methods of induced hypotension are based on the use of rapid and short acting vasodilators as primary agents nitroprusside nitroglycerine urapidil supplemented by volatile anesthetics isoflurane and or blockers esmolol to improve effect reduce dosage and prevent side effects reflex tachycardia tachyphylaxis rebound hypertension <EOS>
<SOS> proper positioning of the patient and controlled ventilation aid in reducing blood loss <EOS>
<SOS> major risks of induced hypotension are a reduction in blood flow i e <EOS>
<SOS> ischaemia of vital organs brain myocardium and elevation of intracranial pressure in neurosurgical patients <EOS>
<SOS> thus major contraindications of induced hypotension are severe coronary artery disease hypertension combined with arteriosclerosis of cerebral vessels and increased intracranial pressure in patients with cerebral disease <EOS>
<SOS> complications are rare in otherwise healthy patients but may be higher in elderly patients and those with underlying organ dysfunction <EOS>
<SOS> therefore careful assessment and selection of patients together with consideration of the potential complications appropriate choice of drugs and invasive beatby beat monitoring are essential for the safe practice of induced hypotension <EOS>
<SOS> abstract <NUM> empirical results stemming from infant research have contributed extensively to the understanding of coping with psychosocial stress and vulnerability for psychosomatic symptoms in later life <EOS>
<SOS> the interaction and the emotional exchange between caregiver and child in the first months of life lead to representations of interactions that will be the base for the quality of attachment <EOS>
<SOS> the mutual regulation of the caregiver infant pair enables the child to acquire a psychic capacity to regulate physiological requirements <EOS>
<SOS> this selfregulatory function determines the potential of the later adult to react to distress in a symbolic way using words or more in a somatic way by developing psychosomatic symptoms <EOS>
<SOS> first experiences with the treatment of psychosomatic patients with respect to the new findings about self regulation are reported <EOS>
<SOS> a 31 year old pregnant woman had to undergo emergency abdominal surgery due to acute intestinal obstruction <EOS>
<SOS> the patient is preoperative history demonstrated multiple allergies as well as abdominal trauma several years before <EOS>
<SOS> the physical examination including sonography of the two fetuses showed no pathological signs <EOS>
<SOS> anaesthesia was induced intravenously with the operating table tilted to the left side using routine precautions pre oxygenation and rapid sequence intubation and was maintained unproblematically <EOS>
<SOS> about <NUM> min after the onset of surgery hypotension tachycardia and a drop in oxygen saturation appeared <EOS>
<SOS> volume substitution and the application of vasoactive drugs failed to stabilise the haemodynamic situation <EOS>
<SOS> elevation of the pregnant uterus and increased left tilzing of the operating table did not lead to improvement <EOS>
<SOS> the development of eyelid edema led to the diagnosis of an anaphylactic reaction <EOS>
<SOS> the patient was treated successfully with epinephrine antihistamines and corticosteroids prednisolone <EOS>
<SOS> the suspicion of latex related allergy was verified postoperatively by radio allergen sorbent test rast and prick and scratch tests <EOS>
<SOS> the mean arterial blood pressure is decreased during the first two trimesters of pregnancy and increases to preconceptional values during the last weeks of gestation <EOS>
<SOS> the heart rate increases during the whole course of pregnancy <EOS>
<SOS> during late gestation fewer patients show an increase in diastolic blood pressure and heart rate in the standing position <EOS>
<SOS> a fall in heart rate was only seen in this period <EOS>
<SOS> a fall in mean arterial blood pressure during standing is not related to the blood pressure in the supine position during the whole course of pregnancy <EOS>
<SOS> the hypotensive symptoms are twice as frequent during early pregnancy compared to late pregnancy <EOS>
<SOS> headaches fatigue and cold extremities are the most usual complaints <EOS>
<SOS> the frequency and intensity of these three symptoms decrease during gestation <EOS>
<SOS> blood pressure in the supine position is reduced in symptomatic pregnant women <EOS>
<SOS> however the occurrence of these symptoms is not correlated to the fall in blood pressure in the standing position <EOS>
<SOS> the birth weight is not influenced by blood pressure in the supine position but depends on the fall in blood pressure during standing <EOS>
<SOS> pregnant women with a more pronounced fall in blood pressure give birth to newborns with a lower birthweight <EOS>
<SOS> these results imply a hitherto unknown cause of intrauterine growth restriction <EOS>
<SOS> the combination of saltwater baths and subsequent ultraviolet irradiation is an effective treatment for psoriasis and atopic dermatitis <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of the present study was to determine the photosensitizing properties of two commercially available bath salts original salt from the dead sea and sodium chloride <EOS>
<SOS> to address this issue test areas on the volar aspects of the forearms were soaked with salt solutions for <NUM> minutes prior to ultraviolet b uvb irradiation <EOS>
<SOS> the salt concentrations tested were 1 3 5 and 15 <EOS>
<SOS> tap water followed by uvb and uvb alone served as controls <EOS>
<SOS> erythema was determined by visual and photometric measurement and delayed tanning was assessed by colorimetry <EOS>
<SOS> erythema obtained by wetting the skin prior to uvb irradiation was more pronounced than erythema induced by uvb alone <EOS>
<SOS> the most prominent erythema was yielded by tap water uvb <EOS>
<SOS> the salts had a differing photosensitizing capacity and the strongest erythema was produced by the 5 solutions <EOS>
<SOS> there was only a moderate influence on delayed tanning by bathing the skin prior to irradiation <EOS>
<SOS> the results from the present study indicate that soaking the skin with salt solutions or tap water increases skin sensitivity to subsequent uvb irradiation <EOS>
<SOS> this may contribute to the effectiveness of salt water baths followed by uv irradiation and may account for an increased sunburn risk after bathing <EOS>

<SOS> cor triatriatum dexter is a rare congenital malformation in which a membrane divides the right atrium into two chambers <EOS>
<SOS> the membrane represents a persistence of the right sinus venosus valve rsv <EOS>
<SOS> normally the rsv regresses between the 9th and 15th week of gestation as the cephalic portion forms the crista terminalis and the caudal portion develops into the eustachian and thebesian valve <EOS>
<SOS> any failure in the regression process may result in remnants of rsv as a simple muscle bar a chiari network or a fenestrated or unfenestrated membrane cor triatriatum dexter <EOS>
<SOS> we describe a patient with cor triatriatum dexter in whom diagnosis was made several years after successful valvulotomy procedure for severe congenital valvular pulmonary stenosis <EOS>
<SOS> apoptosis and proliferation are important regulators of normal development and homeostasis in the bone marrow <EOS>
<SOS> therefore dynamics of hematopoiesis is mainly defined by these two parameters <EOS>
<SOS> however since only few data are available from previous studies we performed a retrospective analysis to elucidate some aspects of this complex pathomechanism <EOS>
<SOS> a total of <NUM> patients with chronic myeloproliferative disorders cmpds and corresponding reactive bone marrow lesions were enrolled into this study <EOS>
<SOS> apoptosis was detected in bone marrow tissue by the isel technique and topoisomerase ii <NUM> expression was demonstrated by the monoclonal antibody ki s1 <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore by determination of the proliferating cell nuclear antigen labeling pcna index we were able to calculate the proportion of cells in the g2 m phase because both nuclear antigens are expressed in different phases of the cell cycle <EOS>
<SOS> patients with imf pv and et revealed a normal range of apoptosis whereas in chronic myeloid leukemia cml a significant increase could be observed <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand imf and pv were characterized by a raised proliferative activity <EOS>
<SOS> dynamics of hematopoiesis was assessed by calculation of the so called hematopoietic turnover index <EOS>
<SOS> in cml and reactive lesions no alterations of this parameter were detectable but imf and pv showed a significant increase <EOS>
<SOS> survival analysis disclosed a relevant worsening of life expectancy for patients with reduced apoptosis and proliferation <EOS>
<SOS> in conclusion our in situ results confirm and extend previous experimental data on hematopoietic cell kinetics <EOS>
<SOS> in this context a greater regenerative capacity of hematopoiesis may be reflected by an increased rate of apoptosis and or proliferation and therefore is associated with a more favorable outcome <EOS>

<SOS> hemoglobin solutions and fluorocarbon emulsions are evaluated as artificial oxygen carriers <EOS>
<SOS> the efficacy of hemoglobin solutions with respect to o2 transport and especially the effective o2 release to tissues has been demonstrated in a number of situations such as extreme hemodilution and hemorrhagic shock <EOS>
<SOS> the hemoglobin molecule could be stabilized by genetic and chemical modifications <EOS>
<SOS> this results in a clinically utilizable intravascular half life of about 8 24 h an adequate o2 affinity and a lack of nephrotoxicity <EOS>
<SOS> a degree of vasoconstriction must be mentioned as the persistent side effect of the hemoglobin solutions evaluated here <EOS>
<SOS> in spite of this hemoglobin solutions are also well tolerated in humans <EOS>
<SOS> fluorocarbon emulsions are compounds with a very high gas solubility and are therefore well suited for the transport of o2 and co2 <EOS>
<SOS> the capacity for the release of o2 to the tissues is especially excellent <EOS>
<SOS> this was demonstrated under extreme hemodilution during extracorporeal circulation and also under reanimation <EOS>
<SOS> perflubron the most important representative of the fluorocarbon emulsions has also been successfully used in man and is well tolerated <EOS>
<SOS> the introduction of artificial oxygen carriers to clinical practice will greatly change transfusion medicine and also the acute care of trauma patients <EOS>
<SOS> launch is expected within the next few years <EOS>

<SOS> fetal surgery is defined as the intrauterine surgical correction of malformations that endanger the unborn child is life in prenatal stages of development or lead to death or severe damage of the child postnatally <EOS>
<SOS> such surgery is a clinical reality now <EOS>
<SOS> indications for intrataurine surgical procedures also exist for head and neck abnormalities especially in the upper respiratory tract <EOS>
<SOS> these include exposure and temporary obstruction of the fetal trachea for correction of pulmonary hypoplasia in cases with congenital diaphragmatic hernias prenatal tracheotomy in cases of laryngeal atresia for the correction of lethal pulmonary overdistension and resection of embryonic tumors that obstruct the respiratory tract <EOS>
<SOS> the relatively high surgical risk resulting in particular from preterm labor occurring postoperatively may be reduced by employing minimally invasive techniques <EOS>
<SOS> endoscopic procedures render opening of the uterus unnecessary and are of particular importance <EOS>
<SOS> in part of the procedures only endoscopic surgery has led to therapeutic success rates justifying its clinical use <EOS>
<SOS> further reduction of the operative risk suggests prenatal interventions even in cases with non lethal conditions <EOS>
<SOS> more diseases of the head and neck may thus be included in the spectrum of indications <EOS>
<SOS> one example is prenatal correction of a cleft lip and palate which until now has only been performed in animal experiments <EOS>
<SOS> the particular characteristics of fetal wound healing allow this to take place without scarring up to a certain stage in pregnancy <EOS>
<SOS> this offers the prospect of a surgical correction that is invisible externally and avoids growth impeding scars <EOS>
<SOS> the particular ethical and legal aspects of fetal surgery are discussed <EOS>

<SOS> effects of anaesthesia and analgesia on postoperative morbidity and mortality remain controversial <EOS>
<SOS> numerous studies have demonstrated that epidural anaesthesia and pain relief by epidural analgesia reduces perioperative stress responses and thus may reduce postoperative morbidity and mortality <EOS>
<SOS> in patients undergoing vascular surgery epidural anaesthesia diminished postoperative hypercoagulability <EOS>
<SOS> these patients may benefit from less thromboembolic complications as well as a reduced risk of a re operation <EOS>
<SOS> however regional anaesthesia does not affect cardiopulmonary morbidity or overall mortality significantly in most clinical studies <EOS>
<SOS> one reason for this disappointing finding may be the missing integration of improved postoperative pain relief into general surgical care <EOS>
<SOS> a multimodal therapeutic approach which consists of preoperativ patient information sufficient analgesia early mobilisation and enteral feeding may solve this discrepancy <EOS>
<SOS> therefore prospective controlled studies are needed to assess the influence of this perioperative approach on outcome <EOS>

<SOS> investigation of changes in normal veins which result in the formation of varicosis led to examination of elastic properties and histomorphological alterations in the region of the extracellular matrix in the vessel wall of the long saphenous vein in normal and varicose veins <EOS>
<SOS> the rigidity of varicose veins was higher than that of normal veins there was no difference between the varicose vein above a competent valve and the normal vein below this competent valve <EOS>
<SOS> the matrix proteins demonstrated an increase in total fibres whereas the elastic fibres were reduced and fragmented explained the rigidity of varices <EOS>
<SOS> these results suggest that the role of the venous valves in the development of varicose veins is secondary to changes of the vein wall <EOS>

<SOS> low density lipoproteins are heterogeneous in particle size density and physical as well as chemical properties <EOS>
<SOS> regarding size and density ldl can be divided into two main profiles ldl pattern a with elevated concentration of large buoyant ldl particles and ldl pattern b with increased concentration of small dense ldl particles <EOS>
<SOS> the latter is particularly expressed in insulin resistance and is associated with elevated serum triglycerides and reduced concentrations of hdl and particularly hdl2 cholesterol <EOS>
<SOS> the ldl profile of increased concentration of small dense ldl particles has shown to be associated with an increased risk of cardiovascular events <EOS>
<SOS> the ldl profile is partly genetically determined but can be improved by non pharmacological exercise diet and pharmacological intervention <EOS>
<SOS> it remains to be confirmed whether the ldl subfraction profile is an independent lipid risk factor besides hdl2 cholesterol and triglycerides but it is certainly a valuable indicator assessing metabolic cardiovascular risk <EOS>

<SOS> guanine nucleotide binding proteins g proteins function as transducers of information across the cell membrane by coupling receptors to effectors <EOS>
<SOS> a large number of g protein linked receptors funnel extra cellular signals as diverse as hormones growth factors neurotransmitters and primary sensory stimuli through a set of g proteins to a small number of second messenger systems <EOS>
<SOS> the g proteins act as molecular switches with an on and off state governed by a gtpase cycle <EOS>
<SOS> by virtue of its high affinity and specificity for guanine nucleotide binding and its intrinsic gtpase activity the subunit of the g protein g plays the critical role in regulation of the effectors by their corresponding g protein <EOS>
<SOS> mutations of g may result in either constitutive activation or loss of expression mutations <EOS>
<SOS> given the variety of functions subserved by g protein coupled signal transduction it is not surprising that abnormalities in g protein coupled pathways can lead to diseases with manifestations as dissimilar as blindness hormone resistance precocious puberty and neoplasia <EOS>
<SOS> for a given defect in a g protein coupled pathway the extent of the manifestations will also be determined by the cellular distribution of the affected component <EOS>
<SOS> defects in components expressed exclusively in a single cell type will cause more a focal disorder than defects in a widely expressed component particularly in germline mutations e g albright is hereditary osteodystrophy whereas somatic mutations of genes encoding even an ubiquitously expressed component can cause focal disease when the somatic mutation itself is focal e g mccune albright syndrome <EOS>
<SOS> mivacurium is a short acting nondepolarising muscle relaxant of the benzylisoquinoline type that undergoes rapid breakdown by plasma cholinesterase <EOS>

<SOS> the ensuing dur 25 i e time from injection to 25 recovery of control twitch tension is three times as long as with succinylcholine <EOS>
<SOS> the principal side effects of mivacurium are facial flushing and a transient fall in blood pressure due to moderate histamine release following doses 3 4 times the ed95 <EOS>
<SOS> in patients with end stage liver or renal disease as well as those with atypical plasma cholinesterase the duration of action of mivacurium is prolonged <EOS>

<SOS> the operability of a liver tumour depends on its three dimensional relation to the intrahepatic vascular trees which define autonomously functioning liver sub segments <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of our study was to establish a computer based three dimensional volumetric operation planning system for the liver <EOS>
<SOS> methods using data from routine helical ct scans the three tissue subclasses of liver parenchyma liver vessels and liver tumour were segmented semiautomatically <EOS>
<SOS> a dedicated segmenting tool was established using region growing algorithms in combination with an intelligent border finder <EOS>
<SOS> visualisation is performed by the heidelberg raytracer <EOS>
<SOS> the vascular trees are visualised as 3d graphs <EOS>
<SOS> pseudoconnections between portal and hepatic venous trees are separated automatically <EOS>
<SOS> security margins are calculated and the system presents a virtual resection proposal <EOS>
<SOS> results the 3d anatomy of the liver can be visualised in high quality resulting in good depth perception <EOS>
<SOS> dependent liver parenchyma can be recognised automatically on the basis of the vascular trees <EOS>
<SOS> the system offers a individualised resection proposal including the tumour security margin and dependent liver parenchyma <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion three dimensional presentation of the individual liver anatomy of a given patient facilitates the perception of the pathology <EOS>
<SOS> virtual reality combined with artifical intelligence allows calculation of complete resection protocols which can be quantified and modified interactively <EOS>
<SOS> this will make operation planning more objective patient selection may be improved and in cases of difficult tumour localisation different resection strategies may be tested <EOS>
<SOS> thus virtual reality in liver surgery will improve teaching surgical training and planning <EOS>
<SOS> it may lead to improved surgical care <EOS>

<SOS> reperfusion injury has become a scientific problem of increasing importance in part because of recent developments of thrombolytic therapy <EOS>
<SOS> the mechanisms of reperfusion injury following focal cerebral ischemia however are not known in detail <EOS>
<SOS> recent studies strongly suggest that reactive oxygen species ros and calcium overload play an important role in reperfusion injury and that pharmacological interventions against calcium or free radical mediated damage could extend the therapeutic window in cerebral ischemia reperfusion <EOS>
<SOS> the mediators involved are known to induce a mitochondrial permeability transition pt during the reperfusion period which is associated with uncoupling of mitochondrial respiration loss of mitochondrial membrane potential and a burst production of ros leading to cellular death <EOS>
<SOS> the mitochondrial pt is considered to be a key process in reperfusion injury following cerebral ischemia as also observed in other organs such as heart and liver <EOS>
<SOS> pharmacological modulation of mitochondrial permeability changes have the potential to reduce tissue damage due to reperfusion <EOS>

<SOS> stiffness of the intact model was tested under compression 600 n torsion 25 nm and shearing forces 250 n without preload <EOS>
<SOS> the results were compared to the stiffness following simulation of plif with two bak cages and plif with two harms cages and additional posterior screw rod osteosynthesis <EOS>
<SOS> plif with two bak cages resulted in a loss of stiffness in compression torsion and shearing <EOS>
<SOS> plif with two harms cages and posterior osteosynthesis resulted in an increase of stiffness in compression torsion and shearing <EOS>

<SOS> results preoperatively we found a low general giqli score mean <NUM> points which increased <NUM> weeks postoperatively <MOB> points <NUM> months <MOB> and <NUM> year mean <NUM> points significantly and is now comparable to the healthy population <MOB> points <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion it is our opinion that the efficacy of the treatment of gastroesophageal reflux disease with required nissen fundoplication can also be documented and discussed by using qol <EOS>
<SOS> introduction serous cystadenomas of the pancreas are rare tumors and thought to be almost always benign <EOS>
<SOS> methods we report our experience in the diagnosis and surgical treatment of <NUM> patients with these tumors <EOS>
<SOS> results between october <NUM> and december 1998 <NUM> patients with cystic tumors of the pancreas underwent surgical resection in <NUM> cases 11 women <NUM> man a serous cystadenoma 10 micrcocystic <NUM> oligomacrocystic was found <EOS>
<SOS> only <NUM> 50 patients had symptoms <EOS>
<SOS> the mean tumor size was <NUM> <MOB> cm <EOS>
<SOS> ultrasound ct and mrt usually could detect the mass but differentiation with other cystic lesions was not reliable <EOS>
<SOS> all tumors were resected <NUM> whipple procedures <NUM> distal pancreatectomies and <NUM> segmental resection were performed <EOS>
<SOS> no patient died after surgery and none had to be reoperated on <EOS>
<SOS> conclusions because of the difficulty in reliably differentiating benign and malignant lesions of the pancreas we believe that cystic tumors of the pancreas should be resected <EOS>
<SOS> we examined the prevalence of hiv associated cutaneous disorders as well as the frequency and efficiency of uv radiation in hiv infected patients by evaluating the clinical records of <NUM> patients seen between and <NUM> and <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> 41 patients were treated with uvb radiation and <NUM> patients with uva1 radiation while three patients received puva therapy <EOS>

<SOS> the staff at interventional radiological procedures is exposed to high levels of ionizing radiation <EOS>
<SOS> this applies especially to measures at cardiac catheterization laboratories <EOS>
<SOS> in this study the annual radiation exposure to the staff was estimated by measuring the dose rate under characteristic conditions <EOS>
<SOS> it could be shown that the resulting radiation exposure was strongly dependent on the radiation protection measures and is also dependent on the operation conditions of the x ray tube <EOS>
<SOS> the effective dose for the physician wearing a lead apron and thyroid shield was detremined to about <NUM> msva <EOS>
<SOS> without a thyroid shield an effective dose of about <NUM> msva resulted <EOS>
<SOS> this corresponds to approximately the natural background radiation of about <NUM> msva in the federal republic of germany <EOS>
<SOS> from the number of procedures performed we could derive an effective dose of approximately 1 2 µsv per application for the physician averaged over all types of procedures <EOS>
<SOS> further it could be shown that the readings of the film badges usually worn by the staff underestimate the effective dose by approximately a factor of two <EOS>
<SOS> this is because the film badges do not include the contribution of the unshielded parts of the body to effective dose <EOS>
<SOS> from the estimated annual effective dose a lifetime dose of <NUM> msv was estimated for a 40 year working career <EOS>
<SOS> the corresponding lifetime risk for induced fatal cancer due to radiation exposure was determined to 0 3 applying the icrp risk factor of <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> 10 2 sv 1 <EOS>
<SOS> considering the ncrp recommendations for a safe occupation working in a cardiac catheterization laboratory can be considered as safe when applying all radiation protection measures <EOS>
<SOS> however changing the protection measures and modifying the parameters of the x ray tube can lead to strong changes of the radiation exposure and the resulting risk estimation <EOS>
<SOS> treatment of pulmonary hypertension is an important issue in intensive care <EOS>
<SOS> one therapeutic regimen involves the intravenous administration of prostacyclin pgi2 <EOS>
<SOS> this however is accompanied by diminished hypoxic pulmonary vasoconstriction reduced arterial oxygenation and systemic vasodilation <EOS>
<SOS> thus its clinical usefulness is limited <EOS>
<SOS> however the inhalation of vasodilators such as nitric oxide no or nebulized pgi2 causes a selective pulmonary vasodilation in ventilated alveoli and improved gas exchange without any systemic vasodilation <EOS>
<SOS> it has therefore gained importance for the treatment of pulmonary failure associated with high shunt fractions <EOS>
<SOS> however the inhalation of vasodilators may have adverse effects in the case of no toxic side effects are predominant methb nox whereas in the case of pgi2 technical problems in terms of dosing and administration safety are of major interest <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore some patients do not respond to the treatment <EOS>
<SOS> in some individuals a reduction in pulmonary hypertension can be seen while others lack even pulmonary vasodilation <EOS>
<SOS> the exact pathophysiological mechanisms remain to be investigated <EOS>
<SOS> the treatment of infrarenal aortic aneurysms by means of transluminally placed endovascular prostheses reflects significant progress in the field of vascular surgery <EOS>
<SOS> in the case of infrarenal aortic aneurysm it is possible to achieve technically successful implantation of such a prosthesis in well over <NUM> of cases <EOS>
<SOS> the rate of clinical success meaning lasting effective exclusion of the aortic aneurysm cannot yet be definitively determined since no long term results are so far available <EOS>
<SOS> secondary leaks are observed in at least <NUM> of all patients making a further therapy necessary endorepair conversion embolization <EOS>
<SOS> further development of endovascular prostheses will include optimization of the aortal iliac attachment of the prostheses a better configuration and the development of long lasting materials that can be used for endovascular prostheses <EOS>
<SOS> the frequency of postspinal headaches after accidental puncture of the subarachnoid space with <NUM> <NUM> g tuohy needles is reported at <NUM> 85 <EOS>
<SOS> a case of postspinal headache syndrome persisting over a period of <NUM> weeks following epidural anaesthesia during labour is described <EOS>
<SOS> a 30 year old women had severe postspinal headache for <NUM> weeks after epidural anaesthesia during labour <EOS>
<SOS> conservative therapy for <NUM> days and <NUM> days of bedrest followed by cristalloid infusions during a 3 week hospital stay and a subsequent 3 week period of bedrest at home did not lead to lasting pain relief <EOS>
<SOS> intracranial haematoma and other abnormal processes were excluded by cct <EOS>
<SOS> a pathologic eeg was not confirmed by cranial mrt <EOS>
<SOS> a lumbar epidural blood patch of <NUM> ml of autologous blood was performed at l3 4 <EOS>
<SOS> the patient stayed in bed for <NUM> h after <NUM> h free of pain the patient complained of recurring headache <EOS>
<SOS> after a further <NUM> h of bedrest she had recovered <EOS>
<SOS> because of lumbar pain <NUM> days after the epidural blood patch a mrt was performed which showed the blood at l4 to s3 in the epidural space <EOS>
<SOS> the diagnosis of a cerebrospinal fluid leakage was based on the history and the main symptom of postspinal headache the pain onset in the supine position <EOS>
<SOS> such possible treatments as diminishing subarachnoidal pressure by bedrest increasing cerebrospinal fluid production by infusions increasing epidural pressure by epidural infusions and closing the cerebrospinal fluid leakage by epidural blood patch are discussed <EOS>
<SOS> the average success rate with the epidural blood patch is 93 <EOS>
<SOS> volumes ranging from <NUM> to <NUM> ml are discussed for the autologous blood <EOS>
<SOS> we chose <NUM> ml of blood to take account of the possibility that blood might settle in the wide sacral space <EOS>
<SOS> we were able to document the position of the blood patch as l4 to s3 on mr tomography the injection site was l3 4 <EOS>
<SOS> most patients are free of headache <NUM> h after epidural blood patch <EOS>
<SOS> our patient had to be confined to bed for another <NUM> h because of recurring headache <EOS>
<SOS> the blood patch alone was not immediately sufficient to prevent all further cerebrospinal fluid leakage <EOS>
<SOS> probably more than one subarachnoidal puncture had been made during the difficult epidural anesthetic procedure <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand the leak was probably only diminished because of the blood patch descending down to the wide sacral space <EOS>
<SOS> the combination of the large volume blood patch which diminished the leakage and conservative treatment which narrowed the transdural pressure difference was successful the 6 week postspinal headache was cured <EOS>
<SOS> prolonged postspinal headache should be treated by epidural blood patch <EOS>
<SOS> the use of over <NUM> ml cannot be generally recommended although in this case most of the blood patch of <NUM> ml was localized caudally <EOS>
<SOS> careful monitoring for side effects is necessary with blood volumes larger than <NUM> ml <EOS>
<SOS> if there is no immediate relief conservative therapy with <NUM> <NUM> h of bedrest is recommended <EOS>
<SOS> if the headache persists a second blood patch should be performed with the volume and the probable caudal spreading of the first taken into account <EOS>

<SOS> the histologic determination of the degree of tissue anaplasia and grade of malignancy of gliomas is based upon qualitative histological features nuclear pleomorphism mitoses endothelial proliferation tumor necrosis <EOS>
<SOS> this grading approach is influenced by the subjective interpretation of the pathologist especially concerning the weighting of criteria scant moderate pronounced <EOS>
<SOS> an observer independent approach seems to be feasible by abandoning the concept of parameter weighting in favor of an binary approach noting only the presence or absence of these structure parameters <EOS>
<SOS> this grading procedure is recognized in the revised who classification of brain tumors for common type astrocytomas ste <EOS>
<SOS> anne mayo system sams <EOS>
<SOS> our results indicate that a similiar approach is also suitable for grading purposes of oligodendrogliomas and mixed gliomas <EOS>
<SOS> our recent investigations on glioma grading showed both for astrocytomas and oligodendrogliomas that a two tiered grading scheme distinguishing only low grade and high grade cases was prognostically relevant <EOS>
<SOS> for all glioma entities the onset of tumor angiogenesis with endothelial proliferation and contrast enhancement in ct and mri seems to be the key criterion indicating irreversible tumor progression to the high malignancy grade <EOS>
