<SOS> cases of female patients who suppose having been sexually abused by their fathers during early childhood and wish to explore and work on healing this trauma are being discussed <EOS>
<SOS> as a result of projection and counter transference the therapist developes feelings of distrust disbelief and of being involved in a hysterical theatre performance so that this sort of therapy is very difficult to conceive and carry out <EOS>
<SOS> in this contribution an attempt is being made to understand these patients and to examine their psychodynamic background as well as the deeper meaning of their above mentioned theatrical efforts <EOS>
<SOS> on the basis of these cases we can put the following psychodynamic hypotheses 1 the incest phantasy is a narcissistic attempt 2 the incest phantasy is a symbolic representation 3 in the sense of a symbolic wish fullfillment included in the parent child interaction <EOS>
<SOS> after this an attempt is being made to examine in various therapeutical scenes the role of these phantasis during the transference procedings and finally to develope diagnostic criteria with which these patients can be differentiated from others with definitely witnessed sexual abuse cases so that consequently treatment techniques can be devised in future <EOS>

<SOS> nasopharyngeal carcinomas npc belong to the most frequent malignant tumours in certain parts of the world e g south east asia while they occur infrequently in western <NUM> europe <EOS>
<SOS> the association of npcs with epstein barr virus ebv a transforming human herpes virus is well established <EOS>
<SOS> the current who classification recognises two major npc histotypes non keratinising npc and squamous cell npc <EOS>
<SOS> ebv is invariably present in non keratinising npcs and the viral oncoprotein lmp 1 latent membrane protein 1 is expressed in some cases <EOS>
<SOS> the tumour cells of non keratinising npcs show phenotypic features which are inducible by lmp 1 in <NUM> vitro <EOS>
<SOS> these may contribute to the development of the lymphoid stroma which is characteristic of this tumour type <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore the virus is detectable in nasopharyngeal carcinoma in situ <EOS>
<SOS> thus the virus is likely to be involved in the pathogenesis of <NUM> non keratinising npcs <EOS>
<SOS> by contrast the association of squamous cell npcs with ebv <NUM> displays a geographical variability <EOS>
<SOS> it appears therefore that squamous cell npcs are a heterogenous group of tumours distinct from non keratinising npcs <EOS>

<SOS> we report three patients with severe guillain barré syndrome gbs <EOS>
<SOS> on clinical examination no sensory deficit was elicited <EOS>
<SOS> electromyography emg and motor nerve conduction velocity ncv studies were indicative of an axonal lesion <EOS>
<SOS> in two patients we found total peripheral conduction block without volitional emg activity <EOS>
<SOS> sensory ncv and cortical median nerve evoked potentials remained normal <EOS>
<SOS> sural nerve biopsy revealed unequivocal alterations of sensory nerve fibers some in the form of primary demyelination <EOS>
<SOS> therefore these cases must bei classified as combined motor sensory syndromes despite the clinical and electrophysiological findings <EOS>
<SOS> although total denervation of the extremity muscles occurred causing tetraparalysis this manifestation appears to be attributable to the secondary axonal variant <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast to positive reports in literature immunomodulatory treatment proved ineffective in all three cases <EOS>

<SOS> hence in a prospective comparative clinical trial started in <NUM> we have treated <NUM> male diabetics suffering from dnpu with the same daily doses of netilmycin administered either in systemic venous infusions svi n 21 three times day or in rvp n 24 once day <EOS>
<SOS> after <NUM> consecutive days of treatment ulcers had closed in <NUM> of the <NUM> patients treated with rvp as against <NUM> of the <NUM> treated with svi <EOS>

<SOS> there is hardly any other discipline that illustrates the conflict between the freedom of science and research that is to say ultimately what is medically possible and human dignity and the protection of life or in other words what can be justified in ethical or legal terms so clearly as reproduction medicine <EOS>
<SOS> the topics involved in this conflict cover a broad spectrum ranging from in vitro fertilization with subsequent implantation of the embryo through the problems of multiple pregnancy and selective feticide the many questions raised by assisted fertilization and especially by anonymous sperm donation and the controversial techniques of preimplantation diagnosis and cryopreservation to the legal aspects of prenatal diagnosis some of which have already been the subjects of cases decided in the supreme courts <EOS>
<SOS> in a good many of these sectors it is difficult to reconcile what doctors can do and what it is admissible for them to do so that it is hardly surprising that there is often no general consensus <EOS>
<SOS> against this backdrop objective discussion is all the more important and the notes in this paper which necessarily touch on only some of the matters at issue are intended to stimulate such discussion <EOS>
<SOS> in mr imaging similar to computed tomography diagnosis of metastatic lymph node disease is based on lymph node sizes and thereby it is non specific <EOS>
<SOS> superparamagnetic iron oxide as a potential contrast medium for mr lymphography accumulate in normal lymph node tissue after endolymphatic interstitial and in case of very small particles after intravenous injection <EOS>
<SOS> no accumulation occures in lymph node metastases <EOS>
<SOS> lymph node metastases can be detected by all three injection techniques <EOS>
<SOS> it has been shown experimentally that in particular small metastases can be detected in normal sized lymph nodes <EOS>
<SOS> however mr lymphography also has inherent methodologic problems as there may occure an uneven distribution of the contrast medium between different lymph node groups <EOS>
<SOS> the experimental results with endolymphatic interstitial and intravenous mr lymphography as well as first clinical results with intravenous contrast medium injection are presented and discussed <EOS>

<SOS> all optically active molecules have at least one asymmetric atom in common which is attached to four ligands that can have different three dimensional positions <EOS>
<SOS> therefore it can be concluded that the resulting isomers are chemically identical in all respects except for the direction with which they rotate plane polarized light <EOS>
<SOS> when the isomer and its corresponding enantiomer are present in equal proportions they are called racemic mixture a mixture that does not rotate polarized light since the optical activities of the two isomers cancel each other <EOS>
<SOS> although the isomers are chemically identical other optically active molecules can interact with these isomers in a geometrically specific way termed stereoselectivity <EOS>
<SOS> the human body comprises a chiral environment due to optically active proteins thus it is not surprising that enantiomeric drugs exhibit different pharmacological properties when used as pure optical isomers <EOS>
<SOS> till today most modern anaesthetics have been optical isomers which are mainly used as racemic mixture 1 1 mixture <EOS>
<SOS> for financial reasons pure isomers were only used for research purposes but nowadays the wide clinical use of pure isomers is financially feasible due to new production techniques <EOS>
<SOS> the terms eutomer and distomer were chosen to indicate the more or less potent form of the drug <EOS>
<SOS> the clinical use of pure isomers is only of advisable if there are significant differences between eutomer and distomer in desired or side effects <EOS>
<SOS> among the modern anaesthetics ketamine isoflurane bupivacaine and atracurium exhibit an asymmetric carbon <EOS>
<SOS> for most drugs the separation in pure isomers will reduce side effects <EOS>
<SOS> for volatile anaesthetics this question is still unanswered since experimental and clinical results are inconsistent so far <EOS>
<SOS> the high prevalence of aspirin intolerance in asthmatics and patients with nasal polyps as well as reports of familial clustering suggest a genetic disposition of this disease <EOS>
<SOS> our study aimed at obtaining further evidence of hereditary factors in this disease <EOS>
<SOS> we included <NUM> unselected patients from <NUM> families with aspirin intolerance and rhinosinusitis in this study <EOS>
<SOS> controls were recruited from individuals treated in our ent clinic for diseases other than aspirin intolerance n 52 <EOS>
<SOS> the application of a tryptophan free amino acid mixture tryptophan depletion test induces a rapid and substantial lowering of both total and free plasma tryptophan <EOS>
<SOS> consequently the brain serotonin content and also cerebral serotonin function are decreased <EOS>
<SOS> this method provides a paradigm to study the role of serotonin in the pathobiology of depressive disorders and their treatment modalities <EOS>
<SOS> untreated depressed patients show few behavioral effects during tryptophan depletion <EOS>
<SOS> in depressed patients during an antidepressant or light therapy induced stable remission a transient depressive relapse was induced by tryptophan depletion <EOS>
<SOS> healthy subjects with a genetic risk for affective disorder show worsening of their condition induced by tryptophan depletion <EOS>
<SOS> these findings indicate the relevance of altered brain serotonin function in the pathophysiology of affective disorders and strengthen the importance of serotonin in the mechanism of action of antidepressants <EOS>
<SOS> since recently published studies revealed some evidence that the serotonergic system is directly involved in the pathophysiology of various psychiatric syndromes besides depression it seems to be reasonable to evaluate the validity of the tryptophan depletion test also in non depressed patients <EOS>
<SOS> several common chronic pain syndromes come to the attention of the rheumatologist demanding for differentiation from fibromyalgia fm although they are often associated with it <EOS>
<SOS> they may mimick fm by 1 the occurance of wide spread pain 2 the chronicity of complaints 3 the preponderance of females in some of these and 4 the lack of objective data to be derived from imaging techniques and laboratory tests <EOS>
<SOS> pain is produced by the disturbance of normal function dysfunctional syndromes masi ref <EOS>
<SOS> recognition requires examination of the locomotor system under biomechanical auspices both at rest and during movement in order to diagnose hyper and hypomobility syndromes treatment of these conditions is guided by principles to improve biomechanical function <EOS>
<SOS> in addition the skin needs to be examined to detect panniculosis also called cellulitis which may be mixed up with fm due to its preferential occurance in peri or postmenopausal women <EOS>
<SOS> it is concluded that the aforementioned differential diagnosis needs to be considered appropriately in coinciding fm and all studies dealing with fm <EOS>

<SOS> in this study the beam characteriwstics affecting the build up and skin dose for 6 and 18 mv photons are analyzed <EOS>

<SOS> exit dose measurements were carried out for the graphite patient supporting assembly table top <NUM> cm thick piece of wood and the <NUM> cm thick patient supporting perspex base frame for head and neck treatments <EOS>
<SOS> it was observed that the dmax decreased slightly with field size as with other accelerators <EOS>
<SOS> for both photon energies the surface dose was observed to increase with increase in field size <EOS>
<SOS> it was also noticed that the dose in the build up region increases slightly when the polycarbonate secondary blocking tray is introduced with the increase in surface dose <EOS>
<SOS> the data show that the tray pertubation factor tpf at surface decreases steadily with tray surface distance for both photon beams for all field sizes <EOS>
<SOS> it was noted that the tpf was more when the polycarbonate tray was introduced at shorter tray surface distances for both energies <EOS>
<SOS> at tray surface distances above <NUM> cm the tpf almost remained close to unity for 6 mv photons for all field sizes whereas the continuous decrease in tpf could be noted for 18 mv photon beams even after the tpf rewached unity <EOS>
<SOS> the increase in surface dose with field size for both photon energies is due to the electron scattering from the intervening materials <EOS>
<SOS> the use of wedge filters absorbs low energy scattered electrons siginificantly and hence the relative surface dose rsd is always less than unity <EOS>
<SOS> the increase in dose enhancement percentage with graphite compared to perspex supporting assembly indicates that the electron backscatter is proportional to the atomic number of the medium <EOS>

<SOS> cardiogenic shock is the leading cause of death in patients hospitalized with acute myocardial infarction <EOS>
<SOS> the typical delay from the onset of acute infarction to the development of cardiogenic shock and well defined risk factors allow for an early identification of patients at risk <EOS>
<SOS> immediate restoration of coronary artery patency by thrombolysis or ptca can prevent cardiogenic shock in a number of these patients <EOS>
<SOS> patients presenting with frank cardiogenic shock should be approached with diagnostic vigor in an attempt to identify a treatable lesion <EOS>
<SOS> several non randomized studies suggest that ptca is superior to thrombolysis in patients with shock and ongoing ischemia <EOS>
<SOS> however aortic counterpulsation may enhance reperfusion rates achieved by thrombolytic therapy in patients with cardiogenic shock <EOS>

<SOS> ventricular assist devices can be used in selected patients with refractory shock as a bridge to cardiac transplantation <EOS>

<SOS> although most of them are very rare knowledge about their reproducible clinicopathological features is important to avoid diagnostic pitfalls <EOS>
<SOS> these lesions include bacillary angiomatosis a vasoproliferative pseudoneoplastic infection of immunocompromised patients caused by rochalimaea henselae tufted angioma a variant of lobular capillary haemangioma characterised by a cannon ball distribution of multiple lobules composed of packed capillaries and pericytes microvenular haemangioma a cutaneous haemangioma composed of thin walled and irregularly branching blood vessels which dissect dermal collagen sinusoidal haemangioma a distinctive variant of cavernous haemangioma which may be located in the subcutaneous breast tissue and then may be confused with well differentiated angiosarcoma hobnail haemangioma targetoid haemosiderotic haemangioma a benign vascular tumour with a distinctive clinical targetoid appearance and a hobnail cytomorphology of the prominent endothelial tumour cells retiform haemangioendothelioma a very recently characterised low grade angiosarcoma occurring most commonly in the extremities of adolescents which is characterised by arborising blood vessels arranged in a retiform pattern and lined by hobnail like prominent endothelial cells kaposi like infantile haemangioendothelioma a borderline malignant tumour of infants mimicking kaposi is sarcoma histologically epithelioid angiosarcoma a highly aggressive tumour in the spectrum of epithelioid vascular lesions which stains positively for endothelial and epithelial immunohistological markers benign lymph angioendothelioma progressive lymphangioma a benign slowly growing macule or plaque which has to be distinguished from well differentiated angiosarcoma and kaposi is sarcoma and lymphangiomatosis of the limbs a poorly recognised angiomatosis occurring in young patients and limited mainly to the limbs with a favourable prognosis <EOS>

<SOS> experimental animal models of ventricular arrhythmias have been developed to investigate the mechanisms of arrhythmogenesis in man <EOS>
<SOS> ventricular arrhythmias associated with ischaemia and infarction often cannot be elucidated by clinical studies on patients because those arrhythmias are potentially lifethreatening and their occurrence is unpredictable <EOS>
<SOS> because of additional experimental procedures and techniques that can be used in the animal laboratory such as microelectrode recording of transmembrane action potentials and high density optical and electrical activation mapping animal models have provided information that cannot be obtained from clinical studies <EOS>
<SOS> studies on animal models have provided new ideas and hypotheses that have been tested in clinical studies and that have been found to be true for clinical arrhythmias <EOS>

<SOS> the authors report a rare recently diagnosed and atypical mishap during one lung ventilation olv via a double lumen tube dlt and left sided thoracotomy an ipsilateral pneumothorax during ventilation of the right lung <EOS>
<SOS> this occurred in a 63 year old patient with chronic obstructive airway disease who was scheduled for urgent repair of a descending thoracic aortic aneurysm <EOS>
<SOS> anaesthesia and surgery were uneventful until aortic cross clamping release <EOS>
<SOS> the common presentation of increased intrathoracic extrapleural pressure owing to a pneumothorax in patients with mechanically ventilated lungs is a rapid decrease in oxygen saturation followed or paralleled by haemodynamic deterioration <EOS>
<SOS> although the above presentation could be seen in this case the diagnosis of a tension pneumothorax was delayed twice <EOS>
<SOS> first symptoms were initially obscured by haemodynamic changes resulting from a head down tilt and aortic declamping <EOS>
<SOS> second since the lack of consolidation after aortic declamping focused attention on the airway problems complications resulting from the use of a dlt were primarily considered <EOS>
<SOS> in particular since breathing sounds were detectable initially malposition or torsion of the dlt had to be excluded by fibre optic bronchoscopy which involved a further delay <EOS>
<SOS> finally two observations led to the diagnosis of a right sided tension pneumothorax 1 bullae of the contralateral lung detected during thoracotomy 2 the finding that ventilation of both lungs and the left lung subsequently increased arterial sao2 and mixed venous oxygen saturation svo2 and the circulatory status but ventilation of the right lung caused a deterioration <EOS>
<SOS> chest radiography and insertion of a chest tube with drainage of air thereafter validated our hypothesis <EOS>
<SOS> the time course of oxygen desaturation during olv and tension pneumothorax was as severe as expected the time course of haemodynamic deterioration however appeared quicker and had more impact than expected <EOS>
<SOS> assuming that mediastinal deviation was not hindered by contralateral intrathoracic pressure during thoracotomy we believed that circulation should be depressed later or to a lesser extent in patients with an intraoperative pneumothorax <EOS>
<SOS> yet during thoracotomy decrease in cardiac filling and output during tension pneumothorax in olv obviously results primarily from the immovability of the mediastinum owing to mediastinal fixation and is at least as decisive as the contralateral intrathoracic pressure in closed chest patients <EOS>
<SOS> in summary a tension pneumothorax during one lung ventilation and thoracotomy is a rare but disastrous complication during the use of a dlt which has not to our knowledge been reported previously <EOS>
<SOS> we recommend that tension pneumothorax be added to the list of complications and problems during olv by the use of a dlt especially in patients with structural lung diseases <EOS>

<SOS> introduction the goal of this study was to compare contrast enhanced t1 weighted flash and turbo flash sequences with conventional spin echo sequences as a basis for planning high precision radiotherapy <EOS>
<SOS> methods a total of <NUM> consecutive patients with different intracranial tumors and a disrupted blood brain barrier were studied <EOS>
<SOS> t1 weighted flash turbo flash and conventional spin echo images were evaluated after controlled 30 s infusion of <NUM> mmol kg body weight of gd dtpa <EOS>
<SOS> the evaluation of the three sequences included the measurement of the signal and contrast to noise ratios the visual inspection of the tumors and artifacts and the measurement of tumor size <EOS>
<SOS> results the signal and contrast to noise ratios were significantly p <MOB> lower for flash and turbo flash than for conventional spin echo sequences <EOS>
<SOS> however visual inspection of the contrast enhancing tumors revealed in <NUM> and <NUM> of <NUM> lesions on flash and tu rbo flash images respectively good or very good tumor visibility when compared with conventional spin echo images with a reduction of imaging time by a factor of 7 8 <EOS>
<SOS> flash and turbo flash sequences were more prone to susceptibility artifacts conventional spin echo sequences more to pulsation artifacts in the posterior fossa <EOS>
<SOS> tumor sizes were comparable in all three techniques <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion at present conventional spin echo images are superior to fast flash and ultrafast turbo flash sequences as a basis for accurate target volume definition in high precision radiotherapy <EOS>
<SOS> however fast flash and turbo flash images may be a practicable alternative to conventional spin echo images for tumors in the posterior fossa or in patients unable to tolerate a stereotactic fixation device <EOS>
<SOS> despite some limitations turbo flash sequences enable fast dynamic mr imaging combined with an acceptable morphology which may be sufficient for target volume planning in high precision radiotherapy <EOS>

<SOS> nucleotides are low molecular weight biological compounds that play major roles in almost all biological processes <EOS>
<SOS> cell nucleic acids and nucleotides are continuously synthesised degraded and salvaged <EOS>
<SOS> the body is pools derive from three potential sources synthesis de novo salvage recycling of preformed bases and the diet <EOS>
<SOS> it is generally accepted that de novo synthesis of both purines and pyrimidines from amino acid precursors is capable of supporting the cellular needs for nucleic acid synthesis <EOS>
<SOS> when protein intake is decreased or in situations in which there are a high demand of nucleotides synthesis after gut injury after surgical trauma sepsis rapid growth pregnancy or newborn infants etc <EOS>
<SOS> some tissues with a rapid turnover gut and immune system may increase the salvage of exogenous nucleotides coming from the diet <EOS>
<SOS> therefore nucleotides may become conditionally essential nutrients <EOS>
<SOS> this article discusses the possible beneficial effects of dietary nucleotides on small intestine maturation and recovery and gut microflora lipid and hepatic metabolism and on the immune system <EOS>
<SOS> human milk is the best source of nucleotides for young infants and the nucleotide nucleoside profile of it shows a substantial predominance for pyrimidines as compared to purines <EOS>
<SOS> moreover pyrimidine nucleotides seem to be better preserved in breast milk during storage in the breast and during digestion in the small intestine and they are more absorbed and incorporated into tissue rna as compared to purine ones <EOS>
<SOS> additional research should be done to improve the design of nucleotides supplemented infant formulas <EOS>
<SOS> this includes 1 to investigate in vivo if the incorporation of dietary nucleotides in tissue rna is enhanced in situations of stress or rapid growth and 2 to study the biological effects of individually administered purine and pyrimidine nucleotides <EOS>
<SOS> parkinson is disease pd causes significant expense for the national health care system due to its chronic progressive course the duration of the disease the high prevalence and the devastating prognosis <EOS>
<SOS> in germany more than dm <NUM> million are spent for drugs to alleviate parkinsonian symptoms <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of this study was to calculate the economic burden of pd by assessing direct medical costs <EOS>
<SOS> forty patients suffering from idiopathic pd were interviewed at an office of neurological specialists and at an outpatient movement disorder clinic about their use of health care resources <NUM> months prior to the study <EOS>
<SOS> the total annual costs reported were dm 14 500 consisting of dm <NUM> for drug therapy and dm <NUM> for other medical services including hospital inpatient care dm 5600 outpatient care dm 700 medical sundries dm 1100 and physiotherapy dm 600 <EOS>
<SOS> the costs were positively correlated to the extent of the disease hoehn and yahr stage hy and the occurrence of motor fluctuations dyskinesias we found that both drug therapy expenses and total medical costs doubled from hyi to hyiv <EOS>
<SOS> the rarely employed s c therapy with apomorphine additionally increased the costs of drug therapy in hyv <EOS>
<SOS> the occurrence of fluctuations dyskinesias also increased medical expenses by approximately a factor of two <EOS>
<SOS> indirect burden due to increased days off of work unemployment and earlier retirement are also significant in parkinson is disease <EOS>
<SOS> this study oncludes that a treatment which could prevent or retard disease progression as well as a treatment that delays or reduces motor complications would not only ameliorate the situation of patients suffering from pd but would also lead to significant reductions in cost for the national health care system <EOS>
<SOS> the cryopreservation of human ovarian tissue is essentially intended to maintain fertility and endocrinological function in female cancer patients and female patients at increased risk of early menopause <EOS>
<SOS> after having been frozen and subsequently thawed the tissue can ideally be transplanted to its original site where it leads to spontaneous fertilisation <EOS>
<SOS> heterotopic transplantations are also discussed as autografts or xenotransplants in scid mice <EOS>
<SOS> in addition to the use of whole tissue the isolation of individual follicles and their in vitro maturation ivm are discussed <EOS>
<SOS> as in the case of heterotopic transplantation of ovarian tissue pregnancy can only be achieved in these cases by in vitro fertilisation of the matured oocytes <EOS>
<SOS> although considerable progress has already been made in both directions these are still at the present time experimental processes that require further in depth investigation prior to widespread clinical application <EOS>
<SOS> in addition to its use following the cryopreservation of ovarian tissue ivm of immature oocytes also plays a significant role in promoting current methods of assisted reproduction <EOS>
<SOS> the successful maturation of immature oocytes could lead to improved assessment of the oocytes obtained by follicular puncture and to a reduction in the incidence and risk of ovarian stimulation <EOS>
<SOS> ivm is therefore expected to broaden the spectrum of individual treatment regimens as in the case of pcos patients for instance increasing treatment efficacy by the additional acquisition of immature oocytes or by rescuing ivf cycles with unintentionally immature oocytes <EOS>

<SOS> in both groups emergence was very rapid <EOS>

<SOS> mild to moderate shivering was noted in 40 of all patients 9 cases following isoflurane <NUM> following propofol <EOS>
<SOS> conclusions using the manufacturer is recommended dosages emergence after remifentanil anaesthesia is more rapid with <NUM> mac isoflurane than with <NUM> mg kg min propofol <EOS>
<SOS> these results are most probably due to the different pharmacological properties of both co anaesthetics especially the applied dosages and to different interactions with remifentanil <EOS>

<SOS> the aim of this prospective and randomized study was to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a reduced shock strength in transvenous implantable defibrillator therapy <EOS>
<SOS> so far clinical data concerning the safety margin of the shock energy in icd therapy do not exist <EOS>
<SOS> the shock energy tested during long term follow up in this study was twice the intraoperatively measured defibrillation threshold dft <EOS>
<SOS> a total number of <NUM> consecutive patients representing a typical cohort of icd patients were evaluated <EOS>
<SOS> all patients received a non thoracotomy lead system cpi endotak 0070 0090 and a biphasic cardioverter defibrillator with the ability to store episodes cardiac pacemakers inc ventac tm prx ii prx ii <EOS>
<SOS> the intraoperative defibrillation threshold dft was evaluated in a step down protocol 15 10 8 <NUM> j and hat to be 15 j for inclusion into the study <EOS>
<SOS> the lowest effective energy terminating induced ventricular fibrillation had to be confirmed and was defined as dft augmented defibrillation threshold <EOS>
<SOS> the dft value was tested immediately after successful implantation at discharge and after a follow up period of one year <EOS>
<SOS> prior to implantation the patients were randomized into two groups <EOS>
<SOS> the energy of the first shock in the study group was programmed at twice dft and in the control group at the maximum energy output 34 j <EOS>
<SOS> the efficacy of the first shock and its reproducibility in dft testings and in spontaneous episodes during long term follow up of the study group were compared to those in the control group <EOS>
<SOS> a dft value was found to be 15 j in <NUM> of <NUM> patients 94 <EOS>
<SOS> the dft in the study group was 9 6 3 2 in control group 10 1 35 j <EOS>
<SOS> the prohability of successful defibrillation at dft level after one year was 84 <EOS>
<SOS> the success rate of the first shock meant to terminate induced ventricular fibrillation vf was 99 5 in the study group 217 of <NUM> episodes and 99 in the control group 201 of <NUM> episodes <EOS>
<SOS> during follow up of 24 9 months spontaneous episodes in the study group 83 86 96 5 monomorphic ventricular tachycardias mvt and 38 40 95 vf episodes were converted successfully by the 2x dft shock <EOS>
<SOS> in the control group the first shock was successful in 151 156 96 8 spontaneous mvts and in 30 33 91 vf episodes <EOS>
<SOS> the efficacy of the first shock was not influenced by clinical data such as the underlying cardiac disease left ventricular function ongoing antiarrhythmic therapy with amiodarone or the number of spontaneous episodes per day or by the dft itself <EOS>
<SOS> at a mean follow up of two years there was no significant difference between the two groups concerning the incidence of sudden cardiac death 2 4 in the study group vs 3 8 in the control group <EOS>
<SOS> in conclusion programming the first shock with the icd lead system used in this study at 2x dft is as efficient as a shock energy of <NUM> j in order to terminate induced and spontaneous episodes of vt vf <EOS>
<SOS> thus the safety of icd therapy is not impaired when programming the shock energy at the 2x dft value <EOS>

<SOS> acute respiratory distress syndrome ards is rare but beset with a high mortality rate <EOS>
<SOS> in recent years however a trend towards higher survival rates has been observed <EOS>
<SOS> high inspiratory oxygen concentrations large tidal volumes and high peak inspiratory airway pressures applied during mechanical ventilation have been identified as harmful to the lung and can contribute to the progression of ards <EOS>
<SOS> this had led to reconsideration of the sequelae of ventilatory therapy <EOS>
<SOS> mechanical ventilation and other adjunctive strategies in ards have changed from the conventional approach aiming at normalisation of physiological ventilatory parameters to an elaborated approach that intends to protect the ventilated lung prevent oxygen toxicity recruit the infiltrated atelectatic and consolidated lung and reduce the anatomical and alveolar dead space <EOS>
<SOS> this new approach consists of various forms of pressure controlled mechanical ventilation with peep and permissive hypercapnia body position changes and inhalation of nitric oxide <EOS>
<SOS> should these procedures fail to improve impaired gas exchange extracorporeal membrane oxygenation is an additional therapeutic option <EOS>
<SOS> none of these therapeutic procedures however has been tested against traditional standard treatment in a classical randomised controlled trial <EOS>
<SOS> the following review focuses on the latest insights into the pathophysiology diagnosis and treatment of ards <EOS>

<SOS> we describe a patient who was admitted to hospital because of hypoglycemic convulsions at the age of <NUM> months <EOS>
<SOS> diagnostics revealed that the hypoglycemic episodes were caused by glycogen synthase deficiency <EOS>
<SOS> glycogen synthase deficiency its a rare cause of fasting hypoglycemia in childhood associated with normal production of ketone bodies <EOS>
<SOS> it is characterized by supranormal increase of glucose and lactate in blood after a meal or an oral glucose tolerance test <EOS>
<SOS> diagnosis is confirmed by demonstration of a reduced activity of glycogen synthase in liver tissue and lately also by identification of pathogenic mutations in the glycogensynthase gene gys2 gene <EOS>
<SOS> hypoglycemic episodes can be prevented by offering frequent protein rich meals during the day and a late evening meal with uncooked corn starch <EOS>

<SOS> procalcitonin is the propeptide of calcitonin devoid of hormonal activity <EOS>
<SOS> normally procalcitonin is produced in the c cells of the thyroid gland <EOS>
<SOS> in healthy humans procalcitonin levels are undetectable 0 1 ng ml <EOS>
<SOS> during severe generalized infections bacterial parasitic and fungal with systemic manifestations procalcitonin levels may rise up to <NUM> ng ml <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast severe viral infections or inflammatory reactions of non infectious origin do not or very moderately increase procalcitonin levels <EOS>
<SOS> the exact site of procalcitonin production is not exactly known but even large amounts of procalcitonin released during infections do not lead to an increase in plasma calcitonin level or activity <EOS>

<SOS> procalcitonin is a propeptide of calcitonin <EOS>
<SOS> it is usually not detectable in healthy volunteers but appears in high concentrations in the serum of patients with severe bacterial parasitic or fungal infection <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast procalcitonin levels do not or only moderately increase during viral infections or during non infectious systemic inflammatory states <EOS>
<SOS> because of these properties procalcitonin has been proposed to serve as a marker of severe infections and sepsis <EOS>
<SOS> increased procalcitonin levels have recently been shown to indicate the severity of systemic infection with increasing specificity <EOS>
<SOS> normally procalcitonin is produced in the c cells of the thyroid gland <EOS>
<SOS> the origin of the high levels of procalcitonin in septic conditions is not fully understood <EOS>
<SOS> although procalcitonin has drawn attention as a marker of severe systemic infections a recent study suggests it may also be a mediator of sepsis <EOS>
<SOS> more studies are needed to uncover the nature and pathophysiological role of this molecule <EOS>

<SOS> dissociation with induced depersonalisation derealisation and personification of objects as only good or only bad is the central coping mechanism during and after a traumatic experience <EOS>
<SOS> unassimilated memories of traumata have a retraumatizing effect and call for defence through eating disorders substance abuse self harming behaviour or social acting out <EOS>
<SOS> against this psychodynamic background we describe a method of trauma therapy which uses experiences of hypnotherapy and of guided affective imagery <EOS>

<SOS> in the final phase there is a return to resource oriented creativity and concrete life planning <EOS>

<SOS> introduction results of animal experiments have demonstrated that the osseous integration of non cemented prostheses can at the very least temporarily be impaired by the application of non steroidal antiphlogistic agents such as diclofenac <EOS>
<SOS> it is the objective of this study to examine whether there is a direct influence of diclofenac used in usual clinical dosages 3 times <NUM> mg daily on bone cells and their progenitor cells which would explain the observed slow integration of the prostheses <EOS>
<SOS> methods to investigate this cultivated human in vitro osteoblasts and stromal bone marrow cells were incubated with increasing doses of the medications <EOS>
<SOS> our study focused on the effect of diclofenac application on proliferation and functional metabolism in both cell lines <EOS>
<SOS> the measurable maximal plasma concentration 2h after the application of one tablet voltaren <NUM> reached 1 6µg ml <EOS>
<SOS> this correlated with diclofenac concentrations between <NUM> and <NUM> ml found in our experiments <EOS>
<SOS> the detected values were correlated to the control group 0 µg ml diclofenac <EOS>
<SOS> results the drug effect upon osteoblasts was higher than on progenitor cells <EOS>
<SOS> the proliferation of in vitro stromal bone marrow cells compared to untreated cells was found to be decreased <EOS>
<SOS> we observed a decrease to 82 at a diclofenac concentration of <NUM> µg ml osteoblasts exhibited a decrease to 97 5 at the same concentration <EOS>
<SOS> the dna synthesis increased to 118 in stromal bone marrow cells in osteoblasts to 144 <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast we detected a neglectible decrease to 92 in the collagen synthesis of osteoblasts compared to untreated cells <EOS>
<SOS> the synthesis of osteocalcin by osteoblasts increased to 119 <EOS>
<SOS> the alkaline phosphatase activity was found to be decreased to 88 in stromal bone marrow cells and increased in osteoblasts to 11 <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion temporary inhibiting effects on osseous integration in non cemented prosthesis by diclofenac could be caused by a disturbance in the anabolic bone metabolism exhibited by an increase of osteoblastic osteocalcin expression <EOS>
<SOS> osteocalcin as a known negative regulator of the osteoneogenesis is most likely inhibiting the collagen matrix deposition <EOS>

<SOS> the e a ratio was significantly decreased at the end of surgery iv <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast <NUM> was increased immediately after cpb but decreased after sternal closure iv <EOS>
<SOS> cardiac index and heart rate both increased after cpb <EOS>
<SOS> the results of the present study demonstrate that diastolic dysfunction occurred immediately after cpb as indicated by an increase in the time constant of myocardial relaxation <EOS>
<SOS> however <NUM> improved rapidly to pre cpb values <EOS>

<SOS> acute exercise is followed by a mobilization of white blood cells mainly induced by increased levels of catecholamines and cortisol <EOS>
<SOS> nk cells react the most intensive they can increase fivefold after intensive exercise <EOS>
<SOS> additionally a weak acute phase reaction occurs <EOS>
<SOS> most of these changes normalize during twenty four hours <EOS>

<SOS> to achieve septoplasty without compromising the surgical goal of attaining a straight and solid septum even in cases of marked deviations or severe post traumatic deformities we now use a new technique in which the septal reconstruction includes the placement of a resorbable implant as a compound graft <EOS>
<SOS> for this purpose the entire septal cartilage is removed and the severely deviated part is divided into straight sections that are reconnected to each other to form a straight and solid plate <EOS>
<SOS> as connecting material we use a polydioxanon pds foil <EOS>
<SOS> the sections of cartilage are sutured to the foil with pds suture material <EOS>
<SOS> the compound graft thus constructed consists of the septal cartilage and resorbable alloplastic material and is reimplanted into the nose <EOS>
<SOS> the pds and suture material are usually resorbed within <NUM> months excluding long term complications <EOS>
<SOS> during the past <NUM> years this method was used in treating <NUM> patients <EOS>
<SOS> the surgical goal was attained in every case and no immediate or long term complications occurred <EOS>
<SOS> this method of combining septal cartilage with a resorbable implant leads to a better significant correction of even severe septal deviations <EOS>

<SOS> evidently a tight control of the concentration and function of these receptors is of prime importance for maintaining and regaining homeostasis after stressful challenges <EOS>
<SOS> here we describe a novel mechanism revealing a rapid upsurge in mr density in the hippocampus a limbic structure highly involved in hpa axis regulation after an acute psychologically stressful challenge <EOS>
<SOS> this rise in mr is accompanied by a stronger mr mediated inhibitory control of the hpa axis <EOS>
<SOS> thus an acute stressful experience results in a reorganization of the hpa axis involving a principal role of the hippocampal mr <EOS>
<SOS> this novel mechanism may be of significance for increasing our understanding of the etiology of stress related disorders <EOS>
<SOS> the wide variety of therapeutic effects make neuroleptics potent drugs in the treatment of pain <EOS>
<SOS> until now there has been no proof of their analgesic potency in spite of this fact neuroleptics are used to treat chronic pain states on the assumption that they do have analgesic potency <EOS>
<SOS> a metaanalysis was performed and <NUM> publications reviewed <EOS>
<SOS> thirty four the majority of the studies are case reports retrospective analyses or non randomised cohort studies <EOS>
<SOS> most of these reports attest to a positive effect <EOS>
<SOS> however only ten out of fifteen studies with a higher statistical study power describe a possible analgesic effect <EOS>
<SOS> none of the studies could differentiate between the effects of analgesia and sedation of the drugs used <EOS>
<SOS> the metaanalysis provides no evidence of intrinsic analgesic properties of neuroleptics for their use as adjuvant analgesics <EOS>
<SOS> studies into the pathophysiology of acute ischaemic stroke have indicated that treatment options are likely to be optimised when early signs of stroke are recognised and treatment is initiated within <NUM> hours from symptom onset <EOS>
<SOS> for most patients there is a long delay between the onset of symptoms and the start of therapy <EOS>
<SOS> many factors are responsible for this time delay signs and symptoms often go unrecognised by patients relatives and bystanders and stroke is not given a high priority by medical staff <EOS>
<SOS> although a small number of stroke patients is treated as emergency and attended to by the emergency medical services within this time window this number could easily be increased by intensified public and emergency personnel education <EOS>
<SOS> for the future we hope that emergency medical services ems will be able to initiate therapies which must be administered within the first few hours of acute stroke <EOS>
<SOS> standard of care by the ems personnel includes maintenance of oxygenation treatment of cardiac arrhythmia and hypertension as well as hyperglycemia and hyperthermia <EOS>
<SOS> early notification by the emergency medical services about stroke patients would enable stroke teams to be present at admission thus improving the likelihood of a better outcome for patients <EOS>
<SOS> a decrease in compliance of the ascending aorta caused by prosthetic replacement or wrapping may lead to a partial loss of the arterial windkessel function <EOS>
<SOS> the following study investigated the effects of this intervention on aortic input impedance <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> pigs the wall of the ascending aorta was wrapped with a prosthesis <EOS>
<SOS> this approach was chosen to minimize additional influence of extended operative procedures on the ascending aorta like extracorporal circulation cardioplegia or blood loss <EOS>
<SOS> flow and pressure were recorded before and after the intervention and following fourier transformation the aortic input impedance was calculated <EOS>
<SOS> mean pressure mean flow and total peripheral resistance were unaltered while there was a significant increase in blood pressure amplitude and characteristic impedance in response to the wrapping procedure <EOS>
<SOS> thus it becomes obvious that even the loss of elastic properties of the ascending aorta only leads to an increase of left ventricular load <EOS>

<SOS> microcallus formations are demonstrable in nearly all cancellous bones by means of suitable preparation techniques <EOS>
<SOS> histologically these structures are immature fibrous bone formed in local overloaded parts of the trabeculae <EOS>
<SOS> using a preparation technique that allows combined two and threedimensional analysis <NUM> normal human spines and <NUM> osteoporotic spines were investigated for microcallus <EOS>
<SOS> microcallus formations occur frequently in people over <NUM> years of age <EOS>
<SOS> they are mainly localized in the lower thoracic and lumbar spine and occur significantly more frequent in females than in males <EOS>
<SOS> the number of microcallus formations depends more on the microarchitecture of the cancellous bone than on individual trabecular parameters <EOS>
<SOS> in about <NUM> of cases microfractures are demonstrable in the centre of the microcallus formation <EOS>
<SOS> in noninvasive studies the bone mass could be misinterpreted due to microcallus <EOS>
<SOS> although it indicates instability of the bone structure microcallus formation is not a purely negative mechanism <EOS>
<SOS> it stabilizes and regenerates the bone tissue <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore complete new trabeculae can be formed due to bridges of microcallus between residual trabeculae <EOS>
<SOS> osteoporosis is not the result of an inability to form microcallus <EOS>

<SOS> for reconstruction of the distal articular surface covered screw osteosynthesis was done <EOS>
<SOS> at the next step intramedullary nails were inserted and were statically locked proximally and distally <EOS>
<SOS> from january <NUM> to february 1994 the reamed ao standard nail was used <EOS>
<SOS> after introduction of the unreamed tibial nail utn all fractures were treated by this implant <EOS>
<SOS> full load on the operated leg was allowed after <NUM> weeks <EOS>
<SOS> union of the fracture was assessed by standard radiological and clinical criteria <EOS>
<SOS> misalignment was defined as more than <NUM> <NUM> ° of angular rotation <EOS>

<SOS> there were no deep infections <EOS>

<SOS> a leg shortening was found in <NUM> cases but it was less than <NUM> cm in every case <EOS>
<SOS> therefore surgical correction was not done <EOS>
<SOS> patients were reviewed at intervals of 2 6 and <NUM> weeks and after 6 and at least <NUM> months <EOS>
<SOS> all <NUM> patients were finally reviewed after an average time of <NUM> months range 12 38 <EOS>
<SOS> bone fusion was reached <NUM> weeks range 9 21 after the operative treatment <EOS>
<SOS> a specific assessment of the ankle symptoms was made using the score of olerud and molander 1984 <EOS>

<SOS> a satisfactory result was attained with <NUM> patients and just <NUM> patients were found to be unsatisfactory <EOS>
<SOS> although proximity of distal tibia fracture to the ankle makes the treatment more complicated than for fractures of the tibial diaphysis closed intramedullary nailing combined with covered screw fixation is a good alternative to open reduction and plate fixation <EOS>
<SOS> the major advantages are closed procedure and simplified interlocking techniques <EOS>
<SOS> therefore closed intramedullary nailing combined with covered screw fixation is a safe and effective method of managing this type of fracture <EOS>

<SOS> lactic acid bacteria lab are a group of gram positive organism which have in common a fermentative metabolism with lactic acid as the major end product <EOS>
<SOS> except for bifidobacteria the lab are phylogenetically closely related <EOS>
<SOS> they directly contribute to human well being as they are the most important germs in the production process of fermented foods which constitute one fourth of our diet <EOS>
<SOS> they are furthermore an essential component of the mucosal flora and especially of the intestinal flora <EOS>
<SOS> the genus streptococcus contains highly pathogenic species which can be clearly differentiated from the useful germs <EOS>
<SOS> the intestinal flora contains such species of the genus lactobacillus that are also important in food fermentation and species which are strongly adapted to the intestines and therefore can be found exclusively in this ecological niche <EOS>
<SOS> a special status characterises bifidobacteria and enterococci <EOS>
<SOS> the former are located in a separate phylogenetic branch and also occur virtually exclusively in the intestines <EOS>
<SOS> enterococci are rather ubiquitous participate in indigenous food fermentations are found in the mucosal flora and are counted as opportunistic pathogens <EOS>
<SOS> to influence the intestinal flora and to achieve health promoting effects lab are isolated from the intestinal flora grown and employed either as pharmaceutical preparations or additions to food usually fermented milk <EOS>
<SOS> these bacteria are termed probiotics <EOS>
<SOS> the exposition of consumers to high numbers of germs belonging to one or a few species needs an evaluation of their safety for human health <EOS>
<SOS> in this process the traditional experience with the safe nature of the species can serve as an important criterion <EOS>
<SOS> in front of this background lab in probiotics can be considered to be especially safe nevertheless some restrictions have to be made <EOS>
<SOS> generally the germs used should not contain genes encoding transmissible resistance to antibiotics <EOS>
<SOS> in addition they should not produce biogenic amines e g <EOS>
<SOS> histamine tyrosine or phenylethylamine and should not degrade mucine <EOS>
<SOS> the assessment may also include the following absence of a potential for deconjugation of bile salts induction of platelet aggregation and binding to fibrinogen and fibronectine <EOS>
<SOS> these examinations may be required as certain lab have been identified in clinical isolates <EOS>
<SOS> the isolates were however obtained in the most majority of cases from debilitated patients <EOS>
<SOS> the germs were components of the body flora as well as of the environment organisms deliberately employed in food fermentations or probiotics have never been isolated <EOS>

<SOS> only the lumen may be visualized using contrast radiography of the coronary arteries however <EOS>

<SOS> in those angiographic visualization of the coronary arteries was unable to produce an unambiguous finding despite typical clinical symptoms yet intravascular ultrasound could detect considerable arteriosclerotic wall changes <EOS>

<SOS> so now the recommendation is exercise of moderate intensity lasting <NUM> min at least <NUM> times a week corresponding to an energy consumption of about <NUM> kacl day or <NUM> kcal week <EOS>

<SOS> he started from considerations of egopathology sexuality and the analysis of resistance and character patterns <EOS>
<SOS> characterological and bodily attitudes were understood as defence patterns against emotions which function not only psychologically but also bodily <EOS>
<SOS> thus he began to mobilize repressed affects through working on muscular tensions and bodily expressions <EOS>
<SOS> that way their meaning in the person is history could be understood and a self healing process restarted <EOS>
<SOS> this approach to release constrained energy is still valid for neoreichian schools such as bioenergetics biodynamics biosynthesis and others whose understanding of human nature and of healing processes is similar to those of other schools of humanistic psychotherapy <EOS>

<SOS> the most common hereditary disorders of hemostasis in this respect appear to be deficiencies of antithrombin ii protein c and protein s and activated protein c resistance mutations of factor v <EOS>

<SOS> epidurography with contrast medium is used to verify the correct poition of an epidural catheter and to detect malpositioning <EOS>
<SOS> there is great variability in the distribution of contrast medium according to the individual morphology of the epidural space and the way it is injected <EOS>
<SOS> results of investigations of the anatomy of the spinal canal and epidural space performed with anatomic specimens epiduroscopy and conventional and computed tomographic ct epidurography are sometimes contradictory <EOS>
<SOS> we have performed ct epidurography in approximately <NUM> patients to date <EOS>
<SOS> insights regarding the distribution of contrast medium in the epidural space can help to interpret conventional epidurographies and to explain special features such as the rail road track phenomenon or the plica mediana dorsalis <EOS>
<SOS> patients scheduled for major abdominal operations were studied <EOS>
<SOS> catheters were introduced into the thoracic epidural space on the day before the operation <EOS>
<SOS> conventional epidurographies were performed routinely after insertion of the catheters with a mobile x ray apparatus usually in the recovery room using <NUM> ml iopamidol solutrast <NUM> m <EOS>
<SOS> selected patients good mental state and stable psychic condition after written consent and with approval of the local ethical committee were investigated with ct epidurography using the same contrast medium partly diluted <EOS>
<SOS> from among the ct scans performed until now five characteristic images are presented and compared to conventional epidurographies <EOS>
<SOS> when small volumes 5 ml of iopamidol were injected slowly we regularly observed a railroad track phenomenon in the ap images of conventional epidurographies <EOS>
<SOS> after rapid injection of larger volumes 10 <NUM> ml the spread was more homogeneous and sometimes outline a lighter zone of contrast distribution in the midline <EOS>
<SOS> ct epidurography in these cases 5 out of <NUM> patients revealed a plica mediana dorsalis <EOS>
<SOS> in the majority of the ct scans of the thoracic epidural space its anterior ventral compartment was unfilled by contrast medium <EOS>
<SOS> according to the findings of several investigators dura mater and ligamentum longitudinale posterius have grown together so that an epidural space does not exist in ventral thoracic segments of the spinal canal <EOS>
<SOS> in lower thoracic and lumbar segments both structures are separate and a wide anterior epidural space was present and filled with contrast medium <EOS>
<SOS> in other cases the dorsal and dorsolateral epidural space was completely filled but the contrast medium stopped behind the spinal nerves and surrounding dural sheaths as if these structures together with the connective tissue strands between them formed a membrane that spread in a frontal plane <EOS>
<SOS> a railroad track phenomenon is interpreted in the literature as the x ray correlate of contrast medium spread in the subdural space indicating an incorrect catheter position <EOS>
<SOS> according to conventional epidurographies and confirmed by ct scans this feature is also seen regulary in cases with correct catheter position <EOS>
<SOS> small volumes of iopamidol spread preferentially into the wider parts of the epidural space between the gaps of the vertebral arcs whereas the dura mater and periosteal layers touch at the inner side of the pedicules and laminae allowing the existence of only a potential epidural space <EOS>
<SOS> this rhythmic widening and narrowing of the epidural space is the explanation of the railroad track in ap contrast epidurographies <EOS>
<SOS> ct epidurography is a valuable tool to provide better insight into the morphology of the epidural space when filled with fluid contrast medium local anaesthetics complementing findings using epiduroscopy and anatomic specimens <EOS>
<SOS> it stands to reason that this time and cost expensive method can never replace conventional epidurographies but can help to interpret them properly <EOS>

<SOS> there were <NUM> 27 subjects with pd who also had symptoms of cerebrovascular disease <EOS>

<SOS> in order to improve functional results creation of a colonic j pouch in conjunction with a coloanal anastomosis cpa was proposed <EOS>
<SOS> two different operation techniques exist i double stapling with the anastomosis close to the dentate line and ii intersphincteric resection with the anastomosis located immediately at the dentate line <EOS>
<SOS> a long rectal remnant after double stapling leads to urgency in <NUM> of the patients due to stool retention in the atonic remnant <EOS>
<SOS> no propulsive motility patterns were recorded from the pouch which is emptyed passively by upper colonic peristalsis <EOS>
<SOS> therefore colonic pouches should be fashionned of descending colon and should not exceed a length of <NUM> cm in order to prevent stool fragmentation <EOS>
<SOS> under these conditions the average stool frequency is reduced from 2 6 d after caa to 1 3 d after cpa <EOS>
<SOS> this effect is maximal during the first postoperative months but is still significant after <NUM> years <EOS>
<SOS> colonic pouch construction also leads due to better blood supply and prevention of pelvic hematomas to a significant decrease of the anastomotic insufficiency rate from 10 0 after caa to 5 4 after cpa <EOS>
<SOS> therefore creation of a colonic j pouch should be combined with coloanal reconstruction if the oncologic situation allows a sphincter preserving procedure <EOS>

<SOS> women in methadone maintenance programs lived in more stable socioeconomic conditions than opiate addicted women without methadone substitution <EOS>
<SOS> moreover they cared significantly better for their babies 81 3 of the methadone mothers visited their children on a regular basis and 90 9 cared adequately <EOS>
<SOS> the data emphasize the need in future research to look more closely at the role of methadone treatment programs in the development of opiate exposed babies <EOS>

<SOS> the microporous material expanded polytetrafluorethylene eptfe is suitable for tracheal reconstruction <EOS>

<SOS> primary infection with human herpesviruses <NUM> and <NUM> hhv 6 and hhv 7 during early childhood causes permanent latent infection usually without any ill effects only a small percentage of primary infections will lead to exanthem subitum <EOS>
<SOS> like other herpesviruses hhv 6 and hhv 7 can be reactivated at any time if host defence mechanisms become defective e g <EOS>

<SOS> hhv 6 can be reactivated under such conditions and cause a variety of clinical problems such as exanthems along with interstitial pneumonia or hepatitis for example <EOS>

<SOS> pulmonary artery catheterization pac is widely used for monitoring and optimization of hemodynamic therapy in critically ill patients <EOS>
<SOS> despite its widespread use there is no clear evidence that morbidity and mortality can be reduced by this approach <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast it has been suggested that pac might increase mortality <EOS>
<SOS> available data do not allow the definitive omission of pac in medical intensive care nor do they justify its widespread use <EOS>
<SOS> possible reasons that might affect outcome are catheter related complications and often misinterpretation due to insufficient knowledge about pac <EOS>
<SOS> open questions on the influence of pac on outcome variables in critically ill patients have to be answered by conducting randomized controlled trials <EOS>
<SOS> beforehand knowledge about pac has to be improved <EOS>
<SOS> as a consequence pac should be performed whenever a specific hemodynamic question arises that cannot be answered by clinical judgement or by less invasive means <EOS>
<SOS> it is important that the investigator be experienced in catheter placement and data interpretation to avoid harm to these critically ill patients <EOS>

<SOS> two groups of <NUM> patients each with disseminated intravascular coagulation in association with septic disease were treated with low molecular weight heparin <NUM> lmw heparin in different dosages group i 1 5 5 ie kg body weight bw per hour group ii 8 15 ie kg bw <EOS>
<SOS> we studied the levels of d dimer thrombin antithrombin ii complex tat prothrombin fragments <NUM> and <NUM> ptf and global tests of coagulation like prothrombin time pt activated partial thromboplastin time ptt thrombin time tt and platelet count plasminogen activation pa and fibrinogen concentration to estimate the success of heparin therapy in the two groups <EOS>

<SOS> however only the last three parameters were sensitive enough to show different effects of variable dosages of lmw heparin <EOS>

<SOS> in patients with acute or chronic myocarditis arrhythmias are a common and often the only clinical symptom in the natural course of the disease <EOS>
<SOS> the potentially malignant tachy and bradyarrhythmias are of particular significance in the differential diagnosis of sudden cardiac death in myocarditis <EOS>
<SOS> factors responsible for the increased incidence of cardiac arrhythmias are structural changes parameters of ventricular dynamics and vascular changes <EOS>
<SOS> on the one hand inflammatory processes in the cardiac myocytes and interstitium can lead directly to fluctuations in membrane potential <EOS>
<SOS> fibrosis and scarring of the myocardial tissue and secondary hypertrophy and atrophy of the myocytes favor the development of ectopic pacemakers late potentials and reentry as a result of inhomogeneous stimulus conduction <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore parameters of ventricular dynamics such as increased wall tension increased myocardial oxygen consumption and diminished coronary reserve in the case of disturbed systolic or diastolic left ventricular function also contribute to the increased incidence of arrhythmias <EOS>
<SOS> lastly vascular factors can further increase the arrhythmogenicity of the inflamed myocardium through the disturbance of micro and macrovascular perfusion and the resulting myocardial ischemia <EOS>
<SOS> non invasive rhythmological evaluation by <NUM> h holter ecg measurement of ventricular late potentials and heart rate variability can be used for orienting risk stratification of the at risk patient with myocarditis <EOS>
<SOS> programmed atrial and ventricular electrophysiological stimulation also has a relatively high predictive value for spontaneous ventricular tachyarrhythmias <EOS>
<SOS> it should be emphasized that at the present time optimal electrophysiological parameters with a high predictive value do not exist <EOS>
<SOS> in a selected patient population immunosuppressive therapy in addition to conventional antiarrhythmic therapy can lead to the reduction or complete suppression of spontaneous and inducible arrhythmias <EOS>
<SOS> nevertheless in the interim further precautionary antiarrhythmic measures such as serial antiarrhythmic treatment vt ablation and aicd implantation are necessary in patients with malignant cardiac arrhythmias <EOS>
<SOS> right ventricular myocardial biopsy for demonstration or exclusion of myocarditis is an important additional examination which can improve the differential diagnosis and treatment of patients with cardiac arrhythmias of unclear etiology <EOS>
<SOS> aim to investigate the distribution of collagens in experimental microvascular surgery <EOS>
<SOS> material and methods autografts 4 mm of the left common carotid artery in <NUM> wistar rats were harvested up to <NUM> weeks after surgery <EOS>
<SOS> the specimens were investigated immunohistochemically for the demonstration and distribution of collagen ii and iv <EOS>
<SOS> results the demonstration and distribution pattern of collagens was a function of the accuracy of each single suture <EOS>
<SOS> in the intima the organisation and amount of collagen iv was directed to the lumen and dependent on the distance and vitality of the vessel segments <EOS>
<SOS> the media had in its axis direction the lowest reparative potential for regenerating the continuity break <EOS>
<SOS> the adventitia formed a thick cuff around the anastomosis in which collagen ii and iv positive vasa vasorum had grown in a circular fashion <EOS>
<SOS> the marked myointimal hyperplasia in the area around the anastomosis and in the entire autograft was made up of collagen positive extracellular matrix <EOS>
<SOS> conclusions our results support the demand for a careful and atraumatic suture technique in microvascular surgery <EOS>
<SOS> the identification of collagens in rat vessels is a valuable tool for studying wound healing in experimental microsurgery <EOS>

<SOS> in this paper the question is considered to what extent the patient is and analyst is perception and tolerance of both aggressive and destructive elements of the analytic relationship can be increased <EOS>
<SOS> successful interpretation enables the patient to feel enact and comprehend animosity in the transference and experience that the relationship can continue <EOS>
<SOS> the concept of primary aggression developed in freud is speculation on death instinct is discussed in its clinical function of relief <EOS>
<SOS> the metapsychological concept of primary aggression facilitates work on aggressive and especially destructive developments of the relationship <EOS>
<SOS> freud is and subsequently eissler is examination of the reciprocity of destructiveness and narcissism opened plausible clinical avenues to explain the compensation of defence mechanisms against mankind is vulnerability in the face of mortality <EOS>
<SOS> the concept of primary aggression is obviously of greater relevance than frustration aggression models since the former does not view the patient as mere victim of his biography but as a subject with the potential to enact his own destructiveness <EOS>
<SOS> since aggressiveness is often concomitant with fear and suppressed guilt interpretation plays a decisive role in relieving the superego strain more confrontation may involve the analyst in the role of the persecutor <EOS>
<SOS> sudden and violent feelings of hate towards the analyst require careful treatment of the patient is irritation <EOS>
<SOS> interpretation of genetic causes of animosity often prove to be countertransference resistance interpretation in transference however is viewed as profitable <EOS>
<SOS> finally those dangerous and destructive phases of treatments are discussed which compel the analyst to protect the setting <EOS>

<SOS> a differentiation is made between patient information on findings and diagnosis patient information on avoidance of known dangers and patient information on the risks involved in a particular intervention that has been selected <EOS>
<SOS> if no information is given on the risks inherent in a patient is condition and how she must proceed in order to ensure that they do not come about this is considered to be a treatment error and in these circumstances the intervention is then legally seen as bodily harm <EOS>
<SOS> information on the risks involved in an intervention must be given in good time which generally means on the day before the operation <EOS>
<SOS> an exception is made to this rule for day surgery <EOS>
<SOS> the patient must be informed about treatment alternatives when the method selected is not the method of choice or when there is an alternative offering equivalent chances but risks of a different kind <EOS>
<SOS> such information is given to the adult patient who is capable of legal transactions <EOS>
<SOS> in the case of minors or of patients who are not capable of legal transactions their legal representative is responsible for receiving the information and making decisions <EOS>
<SOS> in the case of unconscious patients everything depends on presumable consent to the operation <EOS>
<SOS> if a patient later cites lacks in the information supplied to her to support a claim for compensation in a situation where it would be unwise to refuse an operation she must elaborate plausible grounds for being in conflict over the decision even following appropriate information <EOS>

<SOS> besides medical and sociodemographic data two personality factors self efficacy and locus of control were found to predict postoperative pain <EOS>
<SOS> self efficacy describes the expectations of a person to successfully execute the behavior required to produce behavioral outcomes <EOS>
<SOS> locus of control in the extreme case is a personality factor which is represented by an internal orientation in which the individual believes that rewards are brought about by his own action versus an external orientation in which the individual believes that rewards are the result of powerful others or chance factors and fate <EOS>
<SOS> we postulate that the two personality factors correlate with postoperative parameters of pain and that there are also multiple correlations between them <EOS>

<SOS> the global fears of affected patients can be divided into three main categories of problems stepwise mastering of these problems may help to maintain or restore an acceptably high quality of life according to the who guidelines for palliative medicine <EOS>
<SOS> in light of the anxiety felt by physicians and others caring for this patient group palliative psycho oncology must offer patient centered holistic care in which the psycho oncologist is not an isolated therapist but rather a member of a team made up of physicians nurses religious workers psychologists ergotherpists physiotherapists social workers and especially family members <EOS>
<SOS> together this group of health professionals and family members caring for the affected patient form a group that itself receives care as needed <EOS>

<SOS> the rapid development of recombinant dna technology and our enhanced understanding of the genetic basis of human disease has facilitated the development of new molecular therapeutic modalities termed gene therapy <EOS>
<SOS> gene therapy involves the transfer of functional genes into somatic cells and their expression in target tissues in order to replace absent genes correct defective genes or induce antitumoral activity in the tumor bearing host <EOS>
<SOS> currently an increasing number of gene therapy strategies are being investigated in experimental and clinical trials <EOS>
<SOS> despite substantial progress a number of technical and logistical hurdles must still be overcome before gene therapy can be safely and effectively applied in the human patient <EOS>
<SOS> since gene therapy involves complex cell processing and can be time consuming and costly simplifications or even alternative approaches will be necessary in order to establish this therapy as suitable for clinical use <EOS>
<SOS> this report reviews various gene therapy stategies and gene delivery techniques currently under clinical or experimental investigation <EOS>
<SOS> special emphasis is given to cytokine gene therapy using gene modified tumor vaccines for cancer treatment <EOS>

<SOS> during the first two weeks anterior procedures are contraindicated <EOS>

<SOS> all organs could be affected <EOS>

<SOS> atherosclerosis is a complex multifactorial disease of the arterial wall dependent on genetic disposition and multiple other risk factors <EOS>
<SOS> there are probably several candidate genes that determine the individual susceptibility of the vessel wall to develop atherosclerosis <EOS>
<SOS> in recent years a growing number of gene polymorphisms associated with an elevated risk of myocardial infarction has been identified <EOS>
<SOS> these genes and gene clusters play a crucial role in lipid metabolism regulation of blood pressure and clotting <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast to rare monogenetic diseases with severe clinical signs and symptoms e g <EOS>
<SOS> familial hypercholesterolemia genetic polymorphisms are relatively frequent <EOS>
<SOS> due to their frequency there is a high probability that one individual carries several alleles predisposing to coronary heart disease <EOS>

<SOS> several experimental studies and randomized clinical trials demonstrate a decrease of local tumor control with increasing overall treatment time of fractionated radiotherapy <EOS>
<SOS> proliferation or clonogenic tumor cells most likely is the major mechanism underlying this phenomenon <EOS>
<SOS> important progress in radiation oncology might therefore be expected from inhibition of proliferation of clonogenic cells during radiation treatment <EOS>
<SOS> possibilities to minimize the time factor are briefly discussed <EOS>
<SOS> inhibition of proliferation of clonogenic tumor cells during irradiation by simultaneous chemotherapy by inhibition of signal transduction pathways that stimulate proliferation or by pharmacological inhibition of angiogenesis are scientifically interesting but currently not proven to be effective to counteract the loss of local tumor control with increasing overall treatment of fractionated irradiation <EOS>
<SOS> at present the only established approach is to complete radiotherapy within a short overall treatment time e g by accelerated fractionation and by prevention or compensation of unscheduled treatment gaps <EOS>

<SOS> the term ecstasy includes a group of different methylenedioxyamphetamines which produce hallucinogenic activity stimulation and the so called entactogenic effects <EOS>
<SOS> entactogen is usually translated as producing a touching within or creating an internal contact and refers to the special psychotropic effect of this substances <EOS>
<SOS> entactogens have been reported to make users aware of previously unconscious feelings and experiences <EOS>
<SOS> the entactogenic effect is the most typical of the psychedelic effects n 3 4 methylenedioxyamphetamine mdma <EOS>
<SOS> mdma induces euphoria and acts stimulating but the most common effect of mdma is a heightened sense of closeness with other people <EOS>
<SOS> the negative effects especially depression and a general sense of anxiety may endure after the acute phase of ecstasy <EOS>
<SOS> ecstasy is not a novel substance <EOS>
<SOS> however the rapid spread connected with the arising techno scene and the increasing prevalence of ecstasy use world wide is unprecedented <EOS>
<SOS> cisatracurium one of the ten stereoisomers of atracurium is an intermediate long acting non depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent <EOS>
<SOS> cardiovascular reactions have been described after administration of cisatracurium or vecuronium in surgical patients <EOS>
<SOS> after approval by our institutional review board <NUM> patients asa i ii were randomly assigned to three groups to either receive 3xed95 or 5xed95 of cisatracurium or 3xed90 of vecuronium prior to intubation as a bolus <EOS>
<SOS> after oral premedication with <NUM> mg lormetazepam anaesthesia was induced with thiopental 4 12 mg kg and maintained with o2 n2o and isoflurane 1 5 2 <EOS>
<SOS> six minutes after administration of thiopental patients received the muscle relaxant <EOS>
<SOS> six minutes later <MOB> mg fentanyl was given and the trachea was intubated <EOS>
<SOS> heart rate hr and blood pressure bp were monitored every minute <EOS>
<SOS> changes of heart rate or blood pressure 20 compared to baseline were defined as clinically significant <EOS>
<SOS> after application of the study drug median values of blood pressure and heart rate were stable <EOS>
<SOS> for each muscle relaxant there were several patients who had statistically significant cardiovascular changes <EOS>
<SOS> after 3xed95 cisatracurium <NUM> of <NUM> patients exhibited haemodynamic changes 20 2 exhibited hypotension and <NUM> tachycardia while in the high dose cisatracurium group <NUM> of <NUM> patients demonstrated a tachycardia that was predetermined to be statistically but not clinically significant <EOS>
<SOS> in the vecuronium group <NUM> of <NUM> patients sustained statistically significant hypotension and <NUM> patient had statistically significant tachycardia <EOS>
<SOS> the frequency of all individual cardiovascular changes after the application of the muscle relaxant was not dose dependent <EOS>

<SOS> autolyzed antigen extracted allogenic aa bone is an osteoinductive preparation of completely demineralized bone matrix <EOS>
<SOS> it has been clinically applied for years <EOS>
<SOS> in an experimental study in rabbits we evaluated the influence of cortical bone and periosteum on the amount of bone formation following augmentation with aa bone <EOS>
<SOS> two implants of standardized size were placed on the femoral bone of rabbits <EOS>
<SOS> a cell excluding ptfe membrane was wrapped circularly around the femur as well as the anterior implant shielding the implant from the surrounding periosteum <EOS>
<SOS> the posterior implant was exposed directly to the periosteum while being shielded from the cortical bone by the membrane <EOS>
<SOS> thus two compartments were created selectively preventing contact between the periosteum or cortical bone and the implants <EOS>
<SOS> for each compartment the area and volume of the induced new bone were evaluated by computerized radiograph analysis and quantitative ct pqct scans <EOS>
<SOS> implantation of aa bone led to new bone formation in both compartments <EOS>
<SOS> contact of the periosteum and the implant led to an almost fourfold increase in bone volume <EOS>
<SOS> although bone formation showed interindividual variations the difference of both compartments was highly significant using the student is t test for paired samples p <MOB> <EOS>
<SOS> the data show that periosteum is the primary source of new bone formation in augmentations with osteoinductive materials as it is rich in inducible progenitor cells and is well vascularized <EOS>
<SOS> in osseous augmentations with aa bone the periosteum should be preserved in order to achieve a close contact of the osteoinductive implant <EOS>
<SOS> shielding from the periosteum e g by cell excluding membranes leads to significantly less bone formation following implantation of aa bone and should therefore be avoided <EOS>

<SOS> a 38 year old man presented with an intracranial extra axial tumour at the base of the left posterior fossa which proved to be a meningeal melanocytoma <EOS>
<SOS> meningeal melanocytoma is a rare benign melanotic tumour of the leptomeninges occuring predominantly in the posterior fossa or the upper spinal cord in adults <EOS>
<SOS> it shows characteristic cytologic features with isomorphic epitheloid or spindle shaped cells often with prominent nucleoli and a variable content of intracytoplasmic melanin <EOS>
<SOS> it usually lacks signs of malignancy such as high mitotic rate necroses or infiltrative growth and shows a low labeling index in proliferation marker studies <EOS>
<SOS> its immunohistological profile with s 100 protein vimentin and hmb 45 positive tumour cells is similar to that of primary or metastatic malignant melanoma <EOS>
<SOS> this differential diagnosis is crucial because of the totally different therapeutic and prognostic implications <EOS>
<SOS> therefore everyone dealing with surgical neuropathology should be familiar with the rare but clinically important diagnosis of meningeal melanocytoma <EOS>
