<SOS> objective patients in a surgical intensive care unit icu have a high incidence of nosocomial infections which often lead to septic shock and death <EOS>
<SOS> since calculated antibiotic treatment is often difficult it was recommended to obtain routine nose throat swabs in order to have a better idea of the causative agent when a systemic inflammatory response occurs in a given patient <EOS>
<SOS> methods in <NUM> patients of our cardio surgical icu routine nose throat swabs were taken three times a week and tested for micro organisms and resistance to antibiotics <EOS>
<SOS> of these <NUM> patients developed clinical signs of systemic inflammation and additional blood cultures were obtained <EOS>
<SOS> antibiotic treatment was achieved to cover the microbes from the nose throat swabs or a calculated dosage was given to patients whose swabs had tested negative <EOS>
<SOS> results of the <NUM> patients with systemic inflammation <NUM> had blood cultures positive for microbes <EOS>
<SOS> of these <NUM> patients <NUM> received a calculated antibiotic coverage based on their positive nose throat cultures prior to the return of the blood cultures from the lab <EOS>
<SOS> however in only <NUM> of the <NUM> patients were routine swabs and blood cultures positive with the same microbes <EOS>
<SOS> while positive routine swabs are quite specific for sepsis when there is a systemic inflammatory response routine swabs are not a suitable screening tool due to their low sensitivity <EOS>
<SOS> conclusions routine nose throat swabs led to earlier specific antibiotic treatment in only 22 of our patients with clinical signs of systemic inflammation <EOS>
<SOS> in addition in almost 40 of the cases organisms detected in the routine swabs and blood cultures were not identical <EOS>
<SOS> as a result we feel that routine swabs are only of limited value in instituting earlier specific antibiotic treatment in septic patients <EOS>

<SOS> the most suitable treatment can then be adapted to the individual circumstances of the patient i e age general condition and overall severity of traumatic impairment <EOS>

<SOS> the larger the intact roof arc the better the prognosis <EOS>
<SOS> together with the x ray controls following axial and facultative lateral extentions the indication for conservative treatment can be confirmed <EOS>
<SOS> early active motion of the injured limb followed by walking exercises with partial weight bearing are important aspects of nonoperative treatment <EOS>
<SOS> conservative treatment is recommended in non displaced fractures or in fractures with little displacement transverse fractures of the lower region or severely comminuted acetabular fractures with no possibility of reconstruction <EOS>
<SOS> our clinical and radiological follow up of <NUM> patients with acetabular fractures from the years <MOB> showed that the majority were treated conservatively approx <EOS>
<SOS> the functional result after an average observation period of more than <NUM> months was good or excellent based on the merle d aubigné score <EOS>
<SOS> we feel it is important to look at operative and conservative treatment of acetabular fractures as two complementary non competitive therapeutic methods <EOS>
<SOS> the choice of treatment should be based on an exact diagnosis considering fracture type the individual circumstances of the patient and application of the necessary diagnostic facilities <EOS>
<SOS> conservative treatment can lead to excellent long term results <EOS>

<SOS> methods our study group consisted of <NUM> disabled clbp patients 44 female <NUM> male average age <NUM> years who underwent a multidisciplinary 8 week daily treatment program of functional restoration with behavioral support instruction endurance training strength exercises behavioral and treatment to facilitate return to work therapy <EOS>
<SOS> initially these patients where compared with <NUM> asymptomatic persons 44 female <NUM> male average age <NUM> years <EOS>
<SOS> the patients were investigated before and after treatment and at intervals of <NUM> and <NUM> months <EOS>
<SOS> the reliability of the functional measurements was evaluated by interrater comparison <EOS>
<SOS> physical assessment included a medical examination mainly diagnosis of radicular or nonradicular pain changes in the lumbar spine revealed by x ray studies according to herron and turner 50 rating of physical impairment according to waddell 117 flexibility length of hamstrings muscles slr test of power and endurance of trunk movement by standardized exercises according to the swiss group of spring 102 and isokinetic measurements lido back tests of lifting capacity lido lift and in part of general endurance on a cycle ergometer case <NUM> marquette <EOS>
<SOS> results physical findings showed that mobility was reduced substantially in patients suffering from back pain due to reduced slr shortened hamstrings and decreased spinal mobility <EOS>
<SOS> patients also demonstrated significant reductions in their ability to perform lifting tasks in comparison to healthy individuals <EOS>
<SOS> the results of trunk flexion showed no significant differences between patients and the control group whereas the ability to perform trunk extension was much better in the control group <EOS>
<SOS> in principle we found the same results with isokinetic measurements as in the exercises without machines <EOS>
<SOS> cardiovascular endurance was also much better in the control group than it was in the back pain patients <EOS>
<SOS> at the end of the treatment program all physical deficits were improved significantly <EOS>
<SOS> in many cases performance was comparable with that of the control group <EOS>
<SOS> with time however training effects gradually decreased <EOS>
<SOS> the success of treatment return to work absence from work pain reduction use of medical care was independent of the functional status of the patients before and after treatment <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion study results showed that physical capacity in disabled patients with low back pain is substantially reduced in comparison to persons who do not suffer from back pain <EOS>
<SOS> the only exception was in trunk flexor strength and endurance in which measurements did not differ between the patients and the control group <EOS>
<SOS> however even clbp patients with long term pain and severe physical illness can successfully improve their physical condition by participating in an active treatment program <EOS>
<SOS> back extensor muscle training has to be included in physical therapy <EOS>
<SOS> because of loss of condition during the time after treatment regular monitoring of patients and their home training programs is necessary <EOS>
<SOS> overall treatment of clbp has to include physical training and psychosocial treatment to achieve satisfactory results <EOS>
<SOS> the dynamic behavior of the ossicular chain is very complex and is frequency dependent <EOS>
<SOS> to date this has still not been fully investigated or understood <EOS>
<SOS> there remains a lack of measurement procedures to pick up the motion of the ossicles and ear drum simultaneously with sufficient resolution <EOS>
<SOS> the presented paper reports simultanous measurements with laser doppler vibrometry at two points of the ossicular chain of cadaver specimens <EOS>
<SOS> motions not observed were derived using mechanical simulation models on a computer and then evaluating appropriate mathematical equations <EOS>
<SOS> using a sound stimulus the displacement velocities of the umbo and stapes footplate were measured and the corresponding transfer functions were derived by fourier transform <EOS>
<SOS> results were used for verification of the computer models <EOS>
<SOS> in the current investigations these models were refined and allow for the detailed investigation of the dynamic behavior of the ossicular chain facilitating the optimal design of passive and active middle ear implants <EOS>
<SOS> problem postoperative nausea and vomiting remains an important problem <EOS>
<SOS> many risk factors have been identified however the importance of postoperative analgesic technique and patient expectation remain poorly defined <EOS>
<SOS> reactive oxygen species ros are probably not only unintended toxic side products of oxygen metabolism in mammalian cells they also have several important physiologic functions including antimicrobial killing regulation of cellular proliferation and growth and regulation of vascular tone <EOS>
<SOS> ros are generated within the vessel wall by several mechanisms including a vascular type of a nad p h oxidase <EOS>
<SOS> ros formation can be stimulated by mechanical stress environmental factors the peptide angiotensin ii cytokines native low density lipoproteins ldl and in the presence of catalytic metal ions <EOS>
<SOS> their ability to modify ldl react with endothelial derived nitric oxide subsequently forming peroxynitrite and amplify the expression of various genes important for leukocyte recruitment within the arterial wall are the basis of the oxidant injury theory of atherosclerosis <EOS>
<SOS> in animal studies antioxidant therapy probucol butylated hydroxytoluene n n diphenylendiamide vitamin e superoxide dismutase have been successfully used to prevent fatty streak formation and to restore impaired nitric oxide dependent vasorelaxation <EOS>
<SOS> in man antioxidant therapy e g supplementation with vitamin e clearly increased the resistance of ldl to oxidative modification <EOS>
<SOS> case controlled and prospective clinical studies suggest a relation between baseline antioxidant plasma levels and or antioxidant supplementation and risk of cardiovascular events <EOS>
<SOS> in one secondary prevention trial randomized blinded placebo controlled vitamin e supplementation reduced significantly the risk for non fatal myocardial infarctions <EOS>
<SOS> before general recommendations can be made results of further large scale trials should be awaited <EOS>

<SOS> reflex sympathetic dystrophy rsd is a syndrome affecting an extremity after a minor trauma or operation <EOS>
<SOS> at the moment there is no consensus about the pathogenesis of rsd <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> paul sudeck suggested that the signs and symptoms of rsd may be provoked by an exaggerated inflammatory response to injury or operation of an extremity <EOS>
<SOS> his theory found no disciples as most physicians believe that rsd is initiated by an hyperactive sympathetic system <EOS>
<SOS> we performed various clinical and experimental investigations including the effects of antiinflammatory treatment <EOS>

<SOS> erectile failure after radical prostatectomy is a common postoperative disorder <EOS>
<SOS> however nerve sparing technique provides in about 50 60 erections sufficient for sexual intercourse <EOS>
<SOS> damage to the cavernous nerves or vascular injuries are responsible for erectile dysfunction <EOS>
<SOS> alprostadil is most commonly used for self injection monotherapy or in combination with other vasoactive drugs <EOS>
<SOS> intraurethral administration of alprostadil failed to reproduce promising early results <EOS>

<SOS> negative pressure devices and penile prosthesis can be considered as alternative therpeutic options <EOS>
<SOS> autologous n suralis transplantation during radical prostatectomy might further improve erection rates in the near future <EOS>
<SOS> pregnancy causes substantial changes in the cardiovascular system cardiac output 40 50 and blood volume 40 increase whereas systemic peripheral resistance and arterial pressure decrease <EOS>
<SOS> the rise in progesterone and estrogen levels accompanying pregnancy stimulates the renin angiotension aldosterone system <EOS>
<SOS> increased prostaglandin production follows renin activation simultaneously the arterial vessels show diminished angiotension sensitivity <EOS>
<SOS> the result is pronounced vasodilatation <EOS>
<SOS> heart disease remains the most important nonobstetric cause of maternal death <EOS>
<SOS> the physiological changes in the cardiovascular system during pregnancy influence cardiac diseases in different ways <EOS>
<SOS> pregnancy labor and delivery appear to be well tolerated in gravidae with an atrial septal defect ventricular septal defect and patents ductus arteriosus <EOS>
<SOS> sometimes congestive heart failure occurs and appropriate medical therapy is necessary <EOS>
<SOS> pregnant women with uncorrected cyanotic congenital heart disease eisenmenger is syndrome tetralogy of fallot constitute a high risk group because of right ventricular insufficiency and hypoxic attacks <EOS>
<SOS> the consequences for anaesthesia in parturients with congenital heart disease are discussed <EOS>
<SOS> the symptoms of acquired mitral or aortic stenosis are aggravated by the physiological changes in the cardiovascular system during pregnancy the clinical symptoms of valve insufficiency are ameliorated by vasodilatation <EOS>
<SOS> peripartum cardiomyopathy clinically shows similar features to idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy <EOS>
<SOS> the basis of treatment is the same as that of congestive heart failure with the therapeutic spectrum ranging from diet to heart transplantation <EOS>
<SOS> women with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy tolerate pregnancy labor and delivery surprisingly well <EOS>
<SOS> vaginal delivery is possible but epidural anaesthesia is contraindicated <EOS>
<SOS> hypertensive disorders associated with pregnancy are classified into three groups chronic treatment and preeclamptic hypertension <EOS>
<SOS> whereas chronic and transient hypertension do not affect the outcome of pregnancy appreciably pre eclampsia presents a potential danger to mother and fetus <EOS>
<SOS> pre eclamptic hypertension is accompanied by low cardiac output and plasma volume <EOS>
<SOS> an upregulation of angiotension receptors enhances vascular reactivity with the consequence of high peripheral resistance <EOS>
<SOS> for antihypertensive therapy hydralazine methyldopa and magnesium sulfate are the drugs of choice <EOS>
<SOS> a generalised recommendation of anaesthesia for the pre eclamptic gravida cannot be made because both general and epidural anaesthesia have risks of severe side effects <EOS>

<SOS> it is instrumental in delineating the relationship between bony lesions and the adjacent anatomy <EOS>
<SOS> therefore this technique allows precise evaluation of the intricate details of the oral cavity <EOS>
<SOS> using it distinct characterization of pathology including infectious metabolic congenital and neoplastic lesions can be obtained <EOS>
<SOS> the histopathology of bone marrow in primary myelodysplastic syndromes mds is described with reference to the fab classification <EOS>
<SOS> variants such as hypoplastic thrombocythemic and fibrotic mds are recognized from their histopathology and must be incorporated in the fab classification <EOS>
<SOS> the clinical significance of hypoplastic thrombocythemic and fibrotic variants is illustrated by the survival rates and leukemic transformation in these patients <EOS>
<SOS> histopathological classification according to the fab system corresponds with cytological classification as proven by the distribution of the subtypes blood values leukemic transformation rates and survival times <EOS>
<SOS> finally it is even possible to elaborate a prognostic score for survival based on histological features of diagnostic biopsies which emphasizes the importance of histopathological examination of bone marrow in mds patients <EOS>

<SOS> the intended dynamic group therapy until the unity almost unknown in west germany represented the most important form of therapy in the former gdr <EOS>
<SOS> its development its conception of the relevant relationship between group dynamic and psychoanalytic concepts and in particular its reception of psychoanalytic concepts are discussed <EOS>
<SOS> this raises the question of defining the position of this therapy form with the focus on the controverse about its proximity to psychoanalytic therapeutical concepts <EOS>
<SOS> even if we take into account that in the gdr there were very reduced possibilities to articulate psychoanalytic and particularly drive concepts in our view the intended dynamic group therapy cannot be considered as a psychoanalytical form of therapy <EOS>
<SOS> it represents a specific therapeutical development of the former gdr which is strongly oriented at social norms <EOS>
<SOS> it is first of all oriented at the attitude change reached by the group that means at the manifest conscious behaviour of the patient and therefore focusses at the normative level of behaviour regulation in groups in the sense of interactional group therapy <EOS>
<SOS> the authors view this form of therapy as a historical compromise in the field of psychotherapy under the circumstances of the former gdr and in this way they take into account both its advantages and its weaknesses <EOS>

<SOS> intramuscular injections of botulinum toxin bt induce a localized long lasting paresis of the target muscle that can be graded by the bt dose administered and that is free of major side effects <EOS>
<SOS> with this profile bt can be used for symptomatic treatment of various disorders caused by pathological muscle hyperactivities <EOS>
<SOS> these disorders occur frequently in patients in institutions for neurological rehabilitation <EOS>
<SOS> they are difficult to treat with conventional methods can cause major suffering and induce substantial costs for our health care system <EOS>
<SOS> in the present study we therefore sought to delineate the use of bt in rehabilitative neurology <EOS>
<SOS> regardless of the etiology of the particular muscle hyperactivity syndrome five main indication groups are identified 1 improvement of function of the hyperactive muscles 2 relief of pain in the hyperactive muscles 3 improvement of patient care 4 avoidance of sequelae in joints tendons ligaments and teeth 5 various special indications <EOS>

<SOS> persistent atrial fibrillation af is associated with shortened action potential duration apd and reduced atrial refractoriness <EOS>
<SOS> remodeling of ion currents responsible for ap morphology has been proposed as a major mechanism in persistent af <EOS>
<SOS> in the present study we investigated the activity of the cardiac l type ca2 channel and the mrna transcription of the cardiac l type ca2 channel subunits in patients with persistent af compared to patients in sinus rhythm sr <EOS>
<SOS> right atrial appendages of <NUM> patients in sr and of <NUM> patients with af were used for myocyte isolations to record l type ca2 currents ica l by the patch clamp technique <EOS>
<SOS> right atrial appendages of <NUM> patients in sr and of <NUM> patients with af served as sources for determining the mrna expression of the l type ca2 channel 1c 2 a and b c subunits by semiquantitative rt pcr <EOS>
<SOS> ica l density was reduced by 70 p 0 001 in af patients compared to the sinus rhythm group <EOS>
<SOS> cell sizes expressed as cell capacitance were identical in both groups <EOS>
<SOS> mrna expressions of the 1c subunit and the b c subunits were reduced in af patients by 18 9 p 0 05 and 77 7 p 0 005 respectively while mrna transcriptions of the 2 and the a subunits were not significantly different between sr and af patients <EOS>
<SOS> a decrease in the availability of functional l type ca2 channels in af patients due to reduced 1c subunit and substantial lack of b c subunit transcription seems to contribute to the shortening pf apd and refractory periods in af thereby favoring increased atrial excitation rate and perpetuation of af <EOS>

<SOS> coil embolisation of the persistent ductus is a quick safe and cheap method to close a ductus and has clear advantages compared to an operation <EOS>
<SOS> the volume of preoperative screening investigations for outpatient anaesthesia ranges from few selectively ordered investigations to extensive routine diagnostic procedures <EOS>
<SOS> it seem appropriate to reevaluate benefit and efficacy of routine preoperative assessment programs <EOS>
<SOS> the purpose of preoperative diagnostic is to assess the risk of anaesthesia and surgery for the patient <EOS>
<SOS> as shown by a number of studies preoperative screening investigations seldom disclose new pathological findings of clinical relevance <EOS>
<SOS> abnormal laboratory results in otherwise healthy patients rarely alter the anaesthetic management of the patient and are not related to perioperative complications <EOS>
<SOS> extensive use of costly diagnostic procedures considerably increases health care budgets <EOS>
<SOS> a more selective approach to order preoperative investigations promises considerable savings <EOS>
<SOS> to achieve costeffective evalulation an efficient organisation of properative assessment must be established to avoid costly delay and on day of surgery cancellations <EOS>
<SOS> there is no medicolegal obligation to perform routine diagnostic testing <EOS>
<SOS> the anaesthetist must be sufficiently informed in time to assess the perioperative risk of the patient and to alter anaesthetic management as necessary <EOS>
<SOS> according to the presented studies a clinical history and a thorough physical examination represent an effective method of screening for the presence of disease <EOS>
<SOS> careful medical history evaluation and physical examination can avoid extensive investigations in apparently healthy individuals and the latter should only be ordered if indicated <EOS>

<SOS> incidence and clinical significance of cardiopulmonary complications of acute cerebral lesions are still unclear <EOS>
<SOS> neurogenic pulmonary edema npe is characterized as an acute protein rich lung edema occurring shortly after cerebral lesions associated with an acute rise of intracranial pressure <EOS>
<SOS> npe is infrequently diagnosed usually in association with head trauma <EOS>
<SOS> pathophysiological mechanisms include a rise of the pulmonary vascular hydrostatic pressure either due to sympathetic innervation with pulmonary vasoconstriction or increased left atrial pressure following systemic arterial hypertension or an increase in pulmonary capillary permeability <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast to npe cardiac complications are frequently observed most consistently in patients with subarachoid hemorrhage <EOS>
<SOS> typical ecg changes are repolarization abnormalities similar to those observed in coronary heart disease and cardiac arrhythmias <EOS>
<SOS> the ck mb may be slightly elevated echocardiographic findings show a depressed left ventricular function <EOS>
<SOS> pathological examination reveals myofibrillar necrosis <EOS>
<SOS> cardiac complications are explained with overactivity of the sympathetic innervation and high levels of circulating catecholamines <EOS>
<SOS> for adequate treatment close cardiac monitoring is required in all patients with acute cerebral lesions <EOS>

<SOS> this review summarizes briefly pathophysiology clinical definitions pathogenesis risk factors diagnostic procedures and principles of therapy and prophylaxis of ischemic stroke <EOS>
<SOS> ischemic stroke is defined as a localized lack of cerebral perfusion mainly due to cardioembolic or arterial embolic occlusion of cerebral arteries or hemodynamic or microangiographic reduction of cerebral blood flow <EOS>
<SOS> we focused on pathophysiological mechanisms with potential clinical relevance as the role of oxygen and glucose concentration the therapeutic time window the role of excitatory neurotransmitters ca2 influx free radicals and the development of ischemic brain edema <EOS>
<SOS> based on this data the need of an urgent initiation of diagnostic workup and therapy is emphasized <EOS>
<SOS> this includes the early basic management with monitoring of blood pressure ecg oxygen and blood glucose concentration and the balance of the water and electrolyte supply <EOS>
<SOS> since specific therapeutic and prophylactic interventions are based on an exact diagnosis with respect to the pathogenesis the need of an urgent diagnostic workup including clinical examination laboratory baseline vascular ultrasound cranial ct scan ecg and echocardiography is emphazised <EOS>

<SOS> nedocromil sodium and cromolyn sodium are non steroidal anti inflammatory drugs for the treatment of asthma <EOS>
<SOS> although they are chemically different there are many similarities in their mechanism of action <EOS>
<SOS> in provocation tests they have equal efficacy on some tests allergen exercise but nedocromil sodium has greater effect on neuronal mechanisms such as so2 challenge <EOS>
<SOS> very few studies compared the two drugs <EOS>
<SOS> in children only one study was done showing that twice daily nedocromil is as effective as four times daily cromolyn sodium <EOS>
<SOS> thus twice daily administration is one advantage of nedocromil the other being proven effect of steroid sparing which has not been shown with cromolyn sodium <EOS>
<SOS> both drugs are recommended as first line agents in mild persistent asthma <EOS>

<SOS> the definition of endocrine disrupters is not very sharp <EOS>
<SOS> at present all non physiologic substances which bind to steroid receptors are defined as endocrine disrupters of which the best studied are estrogenic in nature <EOS>
<SOS> many pesticides or insecticides or their metabolites have estrogenic activity and pollute our surface water <EOS>
<SOS> here they may cause severe estrogenization of aquatic life <EOS>
<SOS> only traces of these substances are demonstrable in drinking water <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand weak estrogens present in plastic ware may be ingested by men and therefore be potentially harmful for human health <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand many plants produce socalled hyto estrogens particularly soy products are rich in phyto estrogens but their high consumption in asian populations are most likely the reason for reduced occurrence of breast cancer <EOS>
<SOS> many plant extracts used for human medication also contain phyto estrogens and are beneficial in the treatment of climacteric complaints <EOS>
<SOS> hence not all endocrine disruptors must be harmful to human health in fact some of them clearly phyto estrogens may have beneficial effects <EOS>

<SOS> the author advocates the development of an epidemiological rapid reaction scheme epidemiological fire brigade in which public health physicians at the county state and federal level cooperate in a gradual response to outbreak situations according to actual demand <EOS>

<SOS> indications for adding on antidepressants lithium carbamazepine benzodiazepines and other drugs are discussed as well as treatment of negative symptoms depression and management of treatment resistant symptoms <EOS>
<SOS> psychotherapy needs to regard the possibilities of the patient <EOS>
<SOS> in the context of a stable long term relationship the patient is supported in experiencing himself as a subject capable of action <EOS>
<SOS> effectiveness of cognitive treatments to date is limited <EOS>
<SOS> the best results are achieved by social skills training <EOS>
<SOS> social therapy which aims at the improvement of functional aspects of the patient is of paramount importance <EOS>
<SOS> improved possibilities for work rehabilitation are contrasted by difficulties in financing long term social rehabilitation <EOS>
<SOS> interventions based on the ee concept are highly effective but are rarely used <EOS>
<SOS> programs that merely convey information without targeting behaviour modification are ineffective <EOS>
<SOS> the functions of facilities of treatment in the community are explained the integrative role of case management is stressed <EOS>
<SOS> the effect of a locally applied peppermint oil preparation on tension type headache was examined in the design of a randomized placebo controlled double blind crossover study for the first time <EOS>
<SOS> the preparation was tested against both the reference substance acetaminophen and to the corresponding placebo <EOS>
<SOS> the liquid test preparation contained <NUM> g of peppermint oil and ethanol 90 ad <NUM> test preparation li 170 lichtwer pharma berlin the placebo was a <NUM> ethanol solution to which traces of peppermint oil were added for blinding purposes <EOS>
<SOS> the reference preparation contained <NUM> mg acetaminophen the placebo tablet was identical to the verum in size and appearance <EOS>
<SOS> the study included the analysis of <NUM> headache attacks of <NUM> patients of both sexes ranging between <NUM> and <NUM> years of age suffering from tension type headache in accordance with the ihs classification <EOS>
<SOS> four headache episodes per patient were treated in a double blind randomized crossover design <EOS>
<SOS> each headache attack was treated by the application of <NUM> capsules of the oral medication 100 mg of acetaminophen or placebo and the cutaneous application of the oil preparation peppermint oil or placebo solution <EOS>
<SOS> the oil was spread largely across forehead and temples which was repeated after <NUM> and <NUM> minutes <EOS>
<SOS> using a headache diary the headache parameters were assessed after 15 30 <NUM> and <NUM> minutes <EOS>
<SOS> compared to the application of placebo a <NUM> peppermint oil in ethanol solution significantly reduced the clinical headache intensity already after <NUM> minutes p 0 01 <EOS>
<SOS> this significant clinical reduction of the pain intensity continued over the one hour observation period <EOS>
<SOS> acetaminophen too proved to be efficient compared to placebo p 0 01 <EOS>
<SOS> there was no significant difference between the efficacy of <NUM> mg of acetaminophen and <NUM> peppermint oil in ethanol solution <EOS>
<SOS> simultaneous application of <NUM> mg of acetaminophen and <NUM> peppermint oil in ethanol solution leads to an additive effect which remains below the significance threshold however <EOS>
<SOS> the patients reported no adverse events <EOS>
<SOS> this controlled study showed for the first time that a <NUM> peppermint oil in ethanol solution efficiently alleviates tension type headache <EOS>
<SOS> peppermint oil thus proves to be a well tolerated and cost effective alternative to usual therapies <EOS>

<SOS> aspiration of toxic substances foreign material bacterially contaminated secretions or water near drowning either immediately leads to cessation of respiration or to impaired ventilation due to airway obstruction it causes hypoxia due to surfactant dysfunction and pulmonary infection might develop <EOS>
<SOS> respiratory insufficiency is the resulting consequence which needs immediate and appropriate therapy and intervention <EOS>
<SOS> the knowledge of risk factors that promote aspiration injury is important for its prevention and limitation <EOS>
<SOS> mortality varies between <NUM> and 70 depending on patients studied and on the nature and amount of aspirated material <EOS>
<SOS> the major cause of death is acute respiratory failure <EOS>
<SOS> the onset of injury to the lung after aspiration is very rapid <EOS>
<SOS> therefore therapeutic interventions like bronchoscopy are often too late <EOS>
<SOS> more importantly oxygenation should be monitored continuously for timely institution of mechanical ventilation <EOS>
<SOS> antibiotics should not be given routinely but a calculated regime is neccessary when signs of infection develop <EOS>
<SOS> prognosis in near drowning considerably depends on early rescue and successful resuscitation <EOS>
<SOS> a rapid onset of cerebral hypothermia during the accident can help to increase the ischemic tolerance of the brain and makes it neccessary to continue advanced life support until rewarming of the near drowning victim <EOS>
<SOS> anticipation of individual outcome in unconscious patients is difficult <EOS>
<SOS> one third of them survive with a moderate to severe neurologic damage <EOS>
<SOS> the overall mortality of near drowning is about 11 <EOS>
<SOS> pathophysiological aspects diagnostic procedures pratical management and possible prophylaxis of aspiration injuries will be discussed <EOS>

<SOS> recently professional anaesthesiologists organizations have set up recommendations for intraoperative monitoring <EOS>
<SOS> these recommendations are based upon the assumption that anaesthesia related deaths are largely preventable and that extensive monitoring will reduce mortality <EOS>
<SOS> hypoxaemia appears to be an important pathophysiological mechanism and this is why oxygen monitoring is given a high priority in safety standards in anaesthesia <EOS>
<SOS> however no reduction in mortality has been definitively shown to follow the use of any monitoring device in randomized controlled trials <EOS>
<SOS> four techniques of oxygen monitoring are discussed and evaluated <EOS>
<SOS> oxygen monitoring during inspiration can be recommended although its implementation will probably prevent only a few anaesthesia related deaths <EOS>
<SOS> pulse oximetry is certainly highly recommended but also has some deficiencies which are not sufficiently well known considering the popularity of this technique <EOS>
<SOS> transcutaneous po2 is considered mainly for historical reasons <EOS>
<SOS> near infrared spectrometry is a new technique offering noninvasive and continuous monitoring of intracerebral oxygenation <EOS>
<SOS> the increasing frequency of stent implantation into coronary arteries is based mainly on assumptions <EOS>
<SOS> one of these assumptions is that stents may prevent restenosis <EOS>
<SOS> stents can prevent restenosis as has been shown in two randomized studies stress i and benestent i but only in large 3 0mm vessels with short denovo lesions <EOS>
<SOS> despite the very tight selection of patients suitable for stent implantation in these two studies the advantage for stents remained small about 10 less restenosis and appeared to decrease with time following intervention <EOS>
<SOS> there is increasing concern about the extension of stenting in an unrestricted strategy <EOS>
<SOS> this concern was expressed in the acc expert consensus document which was published recently jacc 28 no 3 september <NUM> <MOB> <EOS>
<SOS> based on the lack of data for most of the presently used stent indications the expert group recommended a more selective strategy for the implantation of stents into coronary arteries <EOS>

<SOS> while partial or complete arterial occlusion in conjunction with the vasoseal collagen prototype device has been previously reported similar complications occurring with the angio sealtm device were not published <EOS>
<SOS> in this report we describe a 54 year old female patient height <NUM> cm weight <NUM> kg who was transferred for ptca following an acute anterior wall myocardial infarction <EOS>
<SOS> immediately after ptca the angio sealtm device was deployed utilizing standard technique <EOS>
<SOS> no difficulties were encountered during device deployment however immediately following device placement active arterial bleeding occurred <EOS>
<SOS> due to the inadequacy of hemostasis heparin was reversed with protamine to avoid further hemorrhagic complications <EOS>
<SOS> following this the desired hemostasis quickly occurred but the patient soon complained about symptoms suggestive of an acute occlusion of the right femoral artery <EOS>
<SOS> unsatisfactory attempts as lysis resulted in the patient being transferred to vascular surgery <EOS>
<SOS> the complete angio sealtm system anchor including collagen was located intravasculary and removed during surgery <EOS>

<SOS> abstract <NUM> <NUM> mitoxantrone is an anthracenedione antineoplastic agent that has recently been shown to be effective in ameliorating disease activity in multiple sclerosis ms as indicated by clinical and mri data <EOS>
<SOS> however the role of mitoxantrone in escalating treatment of patients with frequent and severe relapses and with rapid progression of disability is less clear <EOS>
<SOS> in this retrospective analysis we report on <NUM> patients with severe relapsing remitting 9 patients and secondary progressive ms with superimposed exacerbations 6 patients treated openlabeled with mitoxantrone in our clinical research group from july <NUM> to october <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> eleven of these patients 73 were treated with azathioprine interferon beta 1b or cyclophosphamide before <EOS>
<SOS> the patients received mitoxantrone over a period of at least <NUM> months 19 <NUM> months with a single dose of <NUM> mg m2 monthly for the first three months <EOS>
<SOS> thereafter infusions were repeated every <NUM> months total dose <NUM> mg <NUM> mg <EOS>
<SOS> the annual relapse rate could be significantly reduced from 3 0 1 5 in the year before therapy to 0 5 0 5 during therapy <EOS>
<SOS> nine patients 60 were stabilised while four patients 27 showed an improvement of disability <EOS>
<SOS> the treatment was well tolerated with only minor side effects <EOS>
<SOS> these results although retrospectively obtained confirm previous trials showing that mitoxantrone may be useful in ms patients with frequent and severe exacerbations and or a rapidly progressive course of the disease who have had other immunomodulatory medication <EOS>
<SOS> interstitial cystitis ic represents a rare and complex inflammatory bladder condition in which diagnostics can be challenging <EOS>
<SOS> strict nih criteria for its diagnosis were designed for research purposes <EOS>
<SOS> their routine application would miss large proportions of ic patients <EOS>
<SOS> when ic is suspected history and physical exam are followed by an evaluation of long term voiding diaries <EOS>
<SOS> large voided volumes functional capacity 250 cc or longer micturition intervals 2 h absence of nocturia or symptom free periods reduce the likelihood of ic <EOS>
<SOS> further exclusion diagnostics include urine tests infection cytology in situ carcinoma ultrasound calculi bulks anomalies and urodynamics in selected cases <EOS>
<SOS> bladder capacity measurements under sedoanalgesia are of limited value since functional low volume bladders can be mechanically extendable <EOS>
<SOS> cystoscopy under general anesthesia represents the diagnostic standard procedure for ic during which 90 of ic patients present with characteristic mucosal glomerulations after bladder distension <EOS>
<SOS> biopsies are recommended for exclusion of malignancy <EOS>
<SOS> potassium leak testing plays no relevant role in routine diagnostics due to its poor sensitivity <EOS>
<SOS> similarly complex determinations of novel ic markers histamine tryptase cytokines growth factors substance p nitric oxide are of no relevance in clinical settings and should be restricted to research projects <EOS>
<SOS> according to semiotics which may be defined as the doctrine of the essential nature and fundamental varieties of signs objects and interpretants pain is considered to be a sign significant with very different meanings significance either as a naturalistic symptom of disease or as a symbol used in a metaphorical context <EOS>
<SOS> when following this methodological perspective it is possible to interpret medical as well as poetic writings on equal terms <EOS>
<SOS> in graeco roman medical texts pain was mostly understood as a result and an indicator of disease but nonetheless as a symptom which seemed to be actively produced by the affected body <EOS>
<SOS> especially in the corpus hippocraticum dating from the 5th and 4th century b c this materialistic and at the same time psychosomatic attitude can be noticed <EOS>
<SOS> aristotle 4th century b c celsus 1st century a d and the famous experimental physiologist galen 2nd century a d agreed that pain was a sign of evil which should be fought without exception <EOS>
<SOS> it was galen who added the disturbance of function functio laesa as the fifth cardinal sign of inflammation to the four well known cardinal signs of celsus rubor calor tumor dolor <EOS>
<SOS> he also coined the term µk to characterize an attack of migraine <EOS>
<SOS> in algotherapy galen used a complex pharmacological system which was based upon the four cardinal qualities of humoral pathology <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand pain was designed as a multi dimensional symbol by the famous graeco roman epic poets <EOS>
<SOS> in homer is odyssey 8th century b c pain appears transformed into the shape of a scar which is visible and palpable on the hero is leg like an identification tag whereas in virgil is aeneids 1st century b c pain symbolizes weakness and defencelessness which can only be alleviated by the goddess venus <EOS>
<SOS> in this article current indications and limitations of neuromuscular monitoring are reviewed <EOS>
<SOS> attention is mainly focused on detection of residual curarisation <EOS>
<SOS> new insights in the pathophysiological consequences of residual neuromuscular blockade and the actual criteria of complete recovery are discussed <EOS>
<SOS> surprisingly in this context despite the benefit of neuromuscular monitoring its utilisation in clinical practice is rather an exception than the routine <EOS>
<SOS> a lack of standardisation of neuromuscular monitoring is probably the major problem on the way to a widespread utilisation of the monitoring <EOS>

<SOS> the purpose of our study was to compare the diagnostic performance of a 0 2 t mri unit and a 1 0 t mri unit in the evaluation of the anterior cruciate ligament in patients with clinically suspected lesions of this ligament <EOS>
<SOS> twenty four patients with clinically suspected lesions of the anterior cruciate ligament underwent mri of the knee on both 0 2 t and 1 0 t mri units <EOS>
<SOS> three independent observers evaluated the examinations for primary and secondary signs of a tear of the anterior cruciate ligament <EOS>
<SOS> frequency of these signs was determined for both modalities and observer agreement was assessed using the kappa statistic <EOS>
<SOS> sixteen of <NUM> patients had signs of tears of the anterior cruciate ligament on the 1 0 t unit the 0 2 t unit detected primary signs in 15 16 93 patients and secondary signs in 7 12 43 patients <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> patients the <NUM> t unit showed neither primary nor secondary signs for tears of the anterior cruciate ligament in these patients the 0 2 t unit detected primary signs in 1 8 cases 12 and secondary signs in 3 8 cases 37 <EOS>
<SOS> observer agreement was very good for the 1 0 t unit and fair for the 0 2 t unit <EOS>
<SOS> there is no substantial difference between 1 0 t units and 0 2 t mri units in the visualisation of primary signs of tears of the anterior cruciate ligament <EOS>
<SOS> in the visualisation of secondary signs 1 0 t units are superior to 0 2 t units and there is a surprisingly high rate of false positive results with the 0 2 t unit <EOS>
<SOS> as to the reproducibility of the results the 1 0 t unit is far superior to the 0 2 t unit <EOS>

<SOS> 3 5 paraffin embedded formalin fixed tissue blocks of <NUM> clinical stage i nsgct were available from all patients and were analyzed for histopathological features associated with pathological stage presence absence of vascular invasion presence absence of tunical invasion percentage of each histological cell type present in the primary tumor <EOS>

<SOS> in the framework of rheumatic illnesses the lungs and pleura are often observed to be involved <EOS>
<SOS> dependent on the basic illness in question conditions of the bronchoalveolar system vessels lymphatic system and pleura that have developed differently inter and intraindividually can be diagnosed in toporegionally variable forms and combinations <EOS>
<SOS> in the causal pathogenesis the initial auto immunological alteration of the alveolar septa plays a role <EOS>
<SOS> when the monocytes macrophages and fibroblasts are activated as a result of a chronic inflammatory process there is increasing reparative proliferation which finally leads to the nonspecific end stage of irreversible interstitial fibrosis <EOS>
<SOS> the incidence and manifestation forms of lung changes show certain differences dependent on the underyling illness e g rheumatoid arthritis systemic lupus erythematosus progressive systemic scleroderma dermatomyositis and polymyositis sjögren syndrome and mixed connective tissue disease <EOS>
<SOS> in addition to vasculitis and granulomatosis of the lung therapy induced lung changes must also be considered in the differential diagnosis since almost all basic therapeutic agents can cause this type of lung condition <EOS>
<SOS> good knowledge of the parameters from the viewpoint of possible therapeutic measures is indispensable as is close cooperation between the treating physician and the pathologist <EOS>
<SOS> scintigraphic imaging identifies pathophysiological processes in other words it assesses regional perfusion permeability leukocytic accumulation and bone turnover <EOS>
<SOS> these processes precede morphological changes and this accounts for the high sensitivity of nuclear medicine procedures as well as the low specificity for the differential diagnosis of different diseases with similar pathophysiological characteristics <EOS>
<SOS> this review 1 describes and evaluates the currently used scintigraphic procedures 2 suggests their differential use in certain clinical settings in comparison with alternative radiological methods and 3 addresses new developments in diagnosis using nuclear medicine procedures <EOS>
<SOS> in summary we advise dynamic bone scanning as a primary scintigraphic investigation <EOS>
<SOS> a negative scan excludes osteomyelitis in most cases <EOS>
<SOS> the comparison is made with conventional radiology and clinical history <EOS>
<SOS> in cases with short clinical histories granulocytic inflammation leukocyte scintigraphy should be the next diagnostic step in chronic processes lymphomonocytic inflammation gallium scintigraphy is advisable <EOS>
<SOS> other scintigraphic methods might be of additional use in experienced hands <EOS>
<SOS> spect is useful for clarifying inconclusive planar scans of the head spine and large joints <EOS>

<SOS> we report a 44 year old female patient who underwent surgery because of a suspected primary tumor of the renal pelvis in imaging procedures <EOS>
<SOS> histology revealed the diagnosis of mesoblastic nephroma <EOS>
<SOS> this tumor represents a special entity of nephroblastoma that rarely occurs in adults <EOS>
<SOS> there is no unanimous opinion on the biological behavior of mesoblastic nephroma because the tumor behaves differently <EOS>
<SOS> the question of whether nephrectomy is indicated if there are no malignant features is also open <EOS>
<SOS> the decision depends on the given case <EOS>
<SOS> nephrectomy can only be avoided if the intraoperative situation allows the tumor to be removed with an adequate distance from healthy tissue <EOS>
<SOS> the safety margin is necessary because mesoblastic nephroma shows fingerlike spread into the surrounding tissue <EOS>
<SOS> cardiopulmonary exercise testing cpx is a non invasive method of recording quantitative data from gas exchange and ventilation for the evaluation of oxidative metabolism at rest and during exercise <EOS>
<SOS> determination of oxygen uptake vo2 and carbon dioxide output vco2 describes the activity of anaerobic vs aerobic metabolism <EOS>
<SOS> an incremental exercise test measuring gas exchange ventilation and lactate release was performed in healthy volunteers and in patients suffering from mitochondrial disorders <EOS>
<SOS> at rest as well as during exercise patients with mitochondrial disorders differ from healthy subjects with regard to gas exchange and ventilation parameters <EOS>
<SOS> during exercise the decreased oxygen utilization of skeletal muscle and early activation of anaerobic metabolism in these patients are mirrored by a reduced anaerobic threshold reduced maximal oxygen uptake and reduced oxygen pulse <EOS>
<SOS> our study shows that cpx is a sensitive and practical clinical screening method of investigating mitochondrial disorders <EOS>
<SOS> monitoring of ph of the esophagus is a routine diagnostic procedure whereas until now ph monitoring of the hypopharynx has been used only for scientific research <EOS>
<SOS> in the present study a critical evaluation scale was used to record the results of <NUM> patients who underwent ph monitoring to determine possible reflux <EOS>
<SOS> since high refluxes often remain unnoticed clinically further study is required in certain cases <EOS>
<SOS> the extent of reflux in the esophagus may not represent pathological changes in the hypopharynx <EOS>
<SOS> in such cases 24 h ph monitoring of the hypopharynx can be a useful diagnostic procedure and may also help detect the pathogenesis of gastric laryngitis <EOS>
<SOS> the occurrence of plasmodial giant cells in the liver is probably a morphological reaction pattern with the most diverse causes <EOS>
<SOS> in babies and infants these changes occur in particular in neonatal hepatitis and intrahepatic and extrahepatic bile duct atresia <EOS>
<SOS> viral infections and or autoimmune reactions are discussed etiologically in giant cell hepatitis in adults adult giant cell hepatitis agch which is much rarer <EOS>
<SOS> in some of the cases there were conspicuously high titers against paramyxoviruses <EOS>
<SOS> giant cell hepatitis can occur in the course of hiv infection <EOS>
<SOS> these both indicate an infectious cause <EOS>
<SOS> however the disease cannot be transmitted to chimpanzees <EOS>
<SOS> apart from our case only one further case is described in the literature in which a completed hepatitis a infection could be demonstrated serologically <EOS>
<SOS> in addition the titer of antinuclear antibodies was raised in our patient <EOS>
<SOS> this autoimmune phenomenon is probably of crucial pathogenetic significance in our patient especially since a hepatitis a infection on its own does not afford an adequate etiological explanation for the form of chronic and active hepatitis with consecutive cirrhotic transformation observed here <EOS>
<SOS> in patients with a significant elongation of the acl we propose a new therapeutic regimen <EOS>

<SOS> the hydrostatic pressure of spinal fluid is responsible for buoyancy of the brain within these compartments <EOS>
<SOS> in patients with craniectomy this equilibrium is exposed to atmospheric pressure <EOS>
<SOS> we report on four cases of reversible herniation after either bilateral or unilateral decompressive craniectomy performed for increased intracranial pressure icp and failure of conservative icp treatment <EOS>
<SOS> all four patients had survived a severe neurological disease encephalitis subdural haematoma stroke which required craniectomy to control raised icp <EOS>

<SOS> unilateral dilated pupils deteriorated alertness and extensor posturing shortly after either diagnostic or presumed therapeutic lumbar puncture <EOS>
<SOS> one patient developed herniation a second time while in the typical <NUM> ° upright position <EOS>
<SOS> after craniectomy transtentorial herniation is possible even in the absence of increased icp <EOS>
<SOS> it is related to a negative gradient between atmospheric and intracranial pressure which is enhanced by changes in the csf compartment following lumbar puncture <EOS>
<SOS> lumbar puncture should be avoided if possible and when necessary only be performed in the head down position <EOS>
<SOS> acute therapy in these cases is quite simple it requires flat or even head down positioning and early cranioplasty <EOS>
<SOS> diseases of the oral cavity floor of the mouth and nervous system can be accompanied by disturbances in tongue movement during swallowing <EOS>

<SOS> hearing aids have fundamental disadvantages 1 stigmatization of the patient 2 the sound is often found to be unsatisfactory due to the limited frequency range and undesired distortion 3 in many patients the ear canal fitting device generally necessary leads to an occlusion effect 4 acoustic feedback when amplification is high <EOS>
<SOS> conventional hearing aids transmit sound into the ear canal via a small microphone <EOS>
<SOS> sound has the disadvantage of requiring high output sound pressure levels for its transmission <EOS>
<SOS> this along with the necessary miniaturization of the loudspeaker as well as the resonances and reflections in the closed ear canal contribute to the disadvantages mentioned <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast implantable hearing aids do not make sound signals but micromechanical vibrations <EOS>
<SOS> an implantable hearing aid has an electromechanical transducer instead of the loudspeaker of a conventional hearing aid <EOS>
<SOS> the hearing signal does not leave the transducer as sound but as a mechanical vibration which is directly coupled to the auditory system bypassing the air <EOS>
<SOS> this implantable hearing aid is either coupled to the tympanic membrane the ossicular chain the perilymph of the inner ear or the skull <EOS>

<SOS> for the majority of patients with sensorineural hearing loss snhl many available hearing aids often do not achieve satisfactory results <EOS>

<SOS> furthermore they do not use the acoustic properties of the external auditory canal <EOS>
<SOS> recently we published the successful development of the first totally implantable hearing device for the treatment of snhl hno <NUM> 1998 <MOB> <EOS>
<SOS> here we report the first implantations of this unique totally implantable electronic hearing system in patients with snhl implex tica lz <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> the implant microphone is implanted subcutaneously in the outer ear canal near the ear drum <EOS>
<SOS> the signal is processed by a digitally programmable multichannel audioprocessor located subcutaneously on the bony skull behind the ear <EOS>
<SOS> a piezoelectric transducer is coupled to the body of the incus and drives the ossicular chain by vibratory actions <EOS>
<SOS> energy is provided by an implantable battery <EOS>
<SOS> implanted patients describe hearing as being distortion free and transparent <EOS>
<SOS> speech intelligibility and the hearing of music are improved <EOS>
<SOS> patients may achieve better speech discrimination especially in the presence of background noise <EOS>
<SOS> the aid can be used during sports including swimming <EOS>
<SOS> to our knowledge this is the first report of the implantation of a totally implantable electronic hearing system in patients <EOS>
<SOS> these results encourage further implantations of the totally implantable hearing system in the course of an ongoing clinical study <EOS>

<SOS> the current increase in the cost of health care must be considered as a severe threat to the prehospital emergency services system <EOS>
<SOS> two examples have been selected the patient with polytrauma and the patient in cardiac arrest to demonstrate the dilemma between a need for objective data and the requirements of emergency patients <EOS>
<SOS> study results obtained in trauma patients indicating that total prehospital time including scene time is correlated to patient outcome have led to the conclusion that at the scene treatment by emergency physicians may be dispensable <EOS>
<SOS> it has however also been demonstrated that the time required for medical treatment at the scene is equivalent to 20 of the total scene time thus representing only a fraction of the total prehospital time <EOS>
<SOS> correlating the total prehospital time or scene time to outcome therefore appears absurd <EOS>
<SOS> the treatment principle of aggressive shock treatment in polytrauma needs critical reevaluation on the basis of results obtained by recent preclinical studies in patients with penetrating torso injuries <EOS>
<SOS> small volume resuscitation could not be demonstrated to improve outcome in polytrauma patients although a slight improvement in patients with brain injury may be assumed <EOS>
<SOS> endotracheal intubation and early artificial ventilation are proven therapeutic principles in polytraumatized patients <EOS>
<SOS> unfortunately for ethical reasons randomised carefully controlled comparative studies can not be performed in polytrauma patients unless the patient is fully conscious <EOS>
<SOS> the importance of endotracheal intubation and artificial ventilation in unconscious trauma patients becomes apparent under conditions of anaesthesia where the application of the endotracheal tube averts regurgitation aspiration and concomitant morbidity and mortality <EOS>
<SOS> the common causes of cardiovascular collapse and their pathomechanisms as well as the mechanisms of cardiopulmonary resuscitation have been widely investigated <EOS>
<SOS> nevertheless various aspects of their application are still controversial <EOS>
<SOS> the most recent study results have recommended initial ventilation prior to thoracic compression <EOS>
<SOS> new methods of assisting mechanical cardiopulmonary resuscitation such as acd cpr or vest cpr have shown promising results in animal experiments <EOS>
<SOS> however the importance of results obtained by preclinical randomised controlled investigations in humans need to be confirmed by further studies as to outcome <EOS>
<SOS> the efficacy of defibrillation in cases of ventricular fibrillation has been clearly demonstrated particularly with a view to the interval between ventricular fibrillation and defibrillation <EOS>
<SOS> it has further been demonstrated that basic cardiopulmonary resuscitation preserves ventricular fibrillation and thus improves the chance of survival <EOS>
<SOS> the present generation of defibrillators has been further improved particularly by the introduction of biphasic defibrillator wave forms which may reduce the required energy as well as possible complications while offering an increase in the efficacy of defibrillation and a reduction in defibrillator size <EOS>
<SOS> scientific emergency medicine is responsible not only for the development and validation of new methods and concepts but in particular for their application under quality control conditions <EOS>
<SOS> politicians require an improvement in the quality of the validation of emergency measures although the instruments available for the investigation of these measures are known to be obsolete experimental models experimental design <EOS>
<SOS> additionally the financial support of research in emergency medicine suffers from being accourded low priority by public research funds such as the german research fund <EOS>
<SOS> however in view of the rapid application of experimental results to daily practice it should be emphasized that patients also support research in emergency medicine via their direct financial contributions to the health insurance companies <EOS>

<SOS> monodisciplinary orthopaedic pain therapy no longer measures up to international standards <EOS>
<SOS> in cases of chronic back pain in particular there is such a gulf between the clinical findings and the patient is subjective assessment that the symptoms cannot be attributed solely to so called degenerative changes <EOS>
<SOS> back pain patients are in great danger of becoming fixated on somatic symptoms due to an excess of diagnostic procedures or incorrect diagnoses of being treated purely somatically on the basis of associated findings and of suffering irreversible damage from invasive management of such findings <EOS>
<SOS> despite the wealth of empirical evidence it remains difficult to expand the everyday concept of illness and its causes to include not only physical and biological factors but also social and emotional disturbances <EOS>
<SOS> particularly physicians with a purely biological concept of pain have not learned to take note of affective relational factors and incorporate them into their diagnostic assessment <EOS>
<SOS> the decision to undertake invasive diagnostic or therapeutic procedures then frequently represents the doctor is reaction to feelings of irritation or helplessness <EOS>
<SOS> if this situation is to change an interdisciplinary concept of pain must be made a part of medical training and scientific findings must be presented in such a way that they can be integrated into routine daily practice <EOS>

<SOS> diffusion of nitrous oxide into the inner hernia considerably intensifies the obstruction <EOS>

<SOS> nearly all drugs currently used during the course of general anaesthesia may lead to hypersensitivity reactions of various types <EOS>
<SOS> there may be an acute type i allergic reactions or to a more or less severe pseudoallergic reactions in rare cases with lethal outcome <EOS>
<SOS> routine preoperative testing appears of little predictive value in spite of the high frequency of so called risk factors atopy other kind of allergy among the evaluated group of patients <EOS>
<SOS> careful allergological testing should be performed <NUM> to <NUM> weeks after any incidents of suspected drug intolerance in order to discover the underlying causative agent <EOS>
<SOS> skin testing is of diagnostic value for neuromuscular blockers and intravenous narcotics <EOS>
<SOS> rast and ria tests and or mediator releasing tests may also used additionally <EOS>
<SOS> together with all other administered drugs all the routinely used neuromuscular blockers suxamethonium vecuronium pancuronium alcuronium atracurium mivacurium should be tested since they often represent the cause for such reactions <EOS>
<SOS> for other classes of drugs for example volatile anesthetics and opioids the clinical relevance of skin testing still remains uncertain <EOS>
<SOS> for less severe incidents seen during general anaesthesia such as pruritus or exanthems skin testing seems to be less relevant <EOS>
<SOS> nociception is a protective system of the body which prevents it from injury and tissue damage <EOS>
<SOS> human beings respond to noxious stimuli by moving away <EOS>
<SOS> they learn by pain to avoid these situations in future <EOS>
<SOS> shortly after major injury there is a limited analgesic period allowing the body to flee the area of danger later on emerging pain compels the body to rest and supports recuperation <EOS>
<SOS> while acute pain has a certain meaning chronic pain does not <EOS>
<SOS> it induces a comprehensive suffering including loss of initiative appetite and vigilance <EOS>
<SOS> it reduces life quality often accompanied by depressive moods <EOS>
<SOS> acute pain causes changes in the central nervous system leading to an increased sensitivity of nociception hyperalgesia <EOS>
<SOS> during healing the central processing of noxious stimuli is normalised taking minutes to weeks <EOS>
<SOS> sometimes unknown factors initiate chronification of pain <EOS>
<SOS> changes on a molecular level in peripheral tissue as well as in the central nervous system induce cellular early genes 24 a synthesis of c fos c jun and other proteins favouring the chronification of pain <EOS>
<SOS> all efforts have to be made to depress or interrupt such a development <EOS>
<SOS> one of the first steps to pain prophylaxis in a hospital is an optimal surgical technique incision extension limited tissue damage and minimal invasive surgery should guarantee the smallest impairment of the nociceptive system possible <EOS>
<SOS> however nociceptive input is intense and of long duration and leads to central sensibilisation <EOS>
<SOS> postoperative pain has lost its function as surgery anticipates healing <EOS>
<SOS> pain induces a reduction of ventilation circulation digestion and increases the risk of other disorders <EOS>
<SOS> there is need of aggressive pain treatment for humanitarian reasons and for reasons of late sequelae like permanent pain and increased reduction of function 10 <EOS>
<SOS> this is of pivotal importance in patients with amputations or sympathetic reflex dystrophy srd <EOS>
<SOS> antinociception is best provided by regional anaesthesia technique with a combination of local anaesthetics and opioids which results in better outcome 2 12 <EOS>
<SOS> hence regional anaesthesia techniques are strongly indicated in those patients <EOS>
<SOS> good antinociception may be even more important than it is assumed today <EOS>
<SOS> anand 1 demonstrated a lower morbidity and mortality in <NUM> newborns undergoing cardiothoracic surgery when general anaesthesia was performed with high dose sufentanil versus halothane supplementary doses of morphine <EOS>
<SOS> anaesthesiologists have to reconsider the quality of general anaesthesia the antinociception of their regimen <EOS>

<SOS> for this purpose we cultured human endothelium cells gained from umbilical veins for <NUM> h with sera of <NUM> patients with hellp syndrome and <NUM> patients with preeclampsia <EOS>

<SOS> postoperative pain relief can be achieved by several methods including the use of systemic opioids and regional anaesthesia with intrathecal or epidural opioids or local anaesthetics <EOS>
<SOS> on demand analgesia using a pca patient controlled analgesia system is regarded as the ideal option for systemic opioid analgesia <EOS>
<SOS> while pca devices are not yet commonly used in all recovery units the use of repetitive boluses on demand is still the most frequent form of administration in postoperative pain therapy <EOS>
<SOS> the objective of the present study was to show if continuous infusion of the opioid tramadol could produce better analgesia than repetitive administration of boluses <EOS>
<SOS> in a study under double blind conditions <NUM> asa i and ii patients were assigned at random to group i infusion group or group b bolus group when they first requested pain treatment after abdominal surgery <EOS>
<SOS> the patients in group i received an initial intravenous loading dose of <NUM> mg tramadol followed by an infusion of <NUM> mg h tramadol for <NUM> h if necessary repeated boluses of <NUM> mg tramadol were given <EOS>
<SOS> in group b the patients received a placebo infusion instead of the tramadol infusion otherwise the procedure was the same <EOS>
<SOS> pain relief was monitored by means of a vas visual analogue scale up to <NUM> h after surgery <EOS>
<SOS> we investigated the retrograde assessment of analgesia by the patients after <NUM> h how often repetitive boluses were required and the amount of analgesics administered in <NUM> and <NUM> h results <EOS>
<SOS> the pain relief was assessed as excellent or good by 76 5 of group i and 65 6 of group b 19 1 of group i and 26 9 of group b assessed the analgesic effect as satisfactory 4 4 of group i and 7 5 of group b complained of insufficient analgesia <EOS>
<SOS> in group i 69 2 requested only one or no repetitive bolus compared with 40 3 in group b while two or more boluses were demanded by 30 8 in group i and 59 7 in group b <EOS>
<SOS> the average analgesic consumption after <NUM> h was <NUM> <NUM> mg tramadol in group i and <NUM> <NUM> mg tramadol in group b respectively <EOS>
<SOS> after <NUM> h it was <NUM> <NUM> mg tramadol in group i and <NUM> <NUM> mg tramadol in group b <EOS>
<SOS> while the consumption during the first <NUM> h was comparable from then on the consumption in group i increased significantly <EOS>
<SOS> side effects were reported by 25 in both groups <EOS>
<SOS> they were clinically irrelevant and did not necessitate termination of the clinical trial in any case <EOS>
<SOS> during the study period pulse and blood pressure remained within the normal range and did not show any significant changes <EOS>
<SOS> the fact that the patients in group i requested far fewer repetitive boluses than those in group b and the assessment by the patients led to the conclusion that treatment in the infusion group is better than that in the bolus group <EOS>
<SOS> concerns that a significantly higher consumption of analgesics would cause unwanted side effects have proven unfounded <EOS>
<SOS> six hours after surgery when analgesia was evaluated by the patients there was no significant difference between the two groups <EOS>
<SOS> not until the maintenance infusion had been administered for a further <NUM> h was the tramadol consumption within the infusion group significantly higher <EOS>
<SOS> thus we should consider continuing unreduced administration of the maintenance infusion <NUM> h after operation <EOS>
<SOS> the concept of tuberculid was introduced by darier in <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast to true cutaneous tuberculosis properties of the tuberculids were explained by an hyperergic response to myobacteria or their fragments released from a different site of manifest or passed tuberculous infection <EOS>
<SOS> key features include a strongly positive tuberculin skin test evidence of concomitant manifest or past tuberculosis and prompt response to antituberculous therapy the inability to culture m tuberculosis or to demonstrate it microscopically from lesional biopsies together with reports on tuberculid like eruptions after bcg vaccination supports this concept <EOS>
<SOS> clinical manifestations are lichen scrophulosorum papulo necrotic tuberculids and erythema induratum of bazin <EOS>
<SOS> the existence of tuberculids has been questioned however because the clinical and histological appearances are not always specific <EOS>
<SOS> an increasing number of case reports on tuberculids new immunological tests and molecular biology based techniques for the detection of mycobacteria have shed new light on the tuberculid concept <EOS>
<SOS> case report a 20 year old female patient was admitted to the hospital because of a pneumothorax <EOS>
<SOS> a secondary amenorrhea was coexisting <EOS>

<SOS> treatment was successful with the protocol as proposed by the international study for children <EOS>
<SOS> this treatment is characterized by higher dosage and combination with 6 mercaptopurine <EOS>
<SOS> the prognosis of patients with malignant diseases requiring treatment on intensive care units is poor <EOS>
<SOS> the hospital mortality for mechanically ventilated patients ranges from 70 90 in patients with solid tumors to 75 90 in patients with hematological malignancy and up to 95 in patients after bone marrow transplantation <EOS>
<SOS> the number of patients referred to intensive care units is however increasing due to improvements in the general treatment of malignant diseases <EOS>
<SOS> this results in controversies about the utilization of intensive care treatment in these patients <EOS>
<SOS> since the individual outcome can not be predicted prior to initiation of intensive care therapy a general refusal of intensive care treatment seems not justified <EOS>
<SOS> a reevaluation of the patients status after initiation of intensive care treatment based on predefined criteria may however be useful in the decision about continuing intensive care measures <EOS>
<SOS> patients requiring mechanical ventilation after bone marrow transplantation will not survive if prolonged treatment with vasopressors is necessary and or sustained hepatic and renal failure is present <EOS>
<SOS> for these patients a withdrawal of further life support may be considered <EOS>
<SOS> intensive care treatment should be continued in patients not fulfilling these criteria and treatment results are comparable to those in patients without malignant diseases <EOS>
<SOS> for other patients with malignant diseases the use of a new score system developed for patients with cancer can be helpful in the clinical decision making <EOS>
<SOS> on the basis of a solution oriented marital therapy the different within session effects of four different types of questions in systemic therapy lineal strategic circular and reflexive as described by tomm 1989 were tested <EOS>
<SOS> in this single case study the method of plan analysis caspar 1989 was used to categorize the client is reactions to the four types of therapeutic questions <EOS>
<SOS> lineal and strategic questions were expected to have a stabilizing and restraining effect on the system i e <EOS>
<SOS> the client the clients interaction and the therapeutic interaction whereas circular and reflexive questions were expected to open the system for change <EOS>
<SOS> interestingly this hypothesis was only supported for the wife who had the role of the identified client in the therapy and demonstrated a much stronger motivation for change <EOS>
<SOS> for the husband who preferred the role of a cotherapist and demonstrated only little motivation for change results were not as predicted <EOS>
<SOS> some of his reactions were even opposite to the expected therapeutic effects <EOS>
<SOS> therefore it is suggested that an interaction effect between questions and the motivation for change can be assumed <EOS>
<SOS> prerequisites for experimental study designs are extremely difficult to realise under prehospital emergency conditions <EOS>
<SOS> results obtained in animal experiments always need validation with prehospital or inhospital patient studies <EOS>
<SOS> investigations related to emergency medicine are however an ethical obligation on behalf of the patient <EOS>
<SOS> a retrospective analysis of the available literature should be considered a prerequisite for prospective randomised and controlled studies <EOS>
<SOS> frequently a pilot study or feasibility trial needs to precede the actual study <EOS>
<SOS> informed consent must be obtained for all patient studies <EOS>
<SOS> however under emergency conditions informed consent cannot always be obtained due to unconsciousness etc <EOS>
<SOS> nevertheless the following principles should be observed a randomised studies are essential even in emergency medicine b they are ethically acceptable if the treatment provided for the study group is at least equivalent to the therapy for the control group c only these preconditions guarantee that the patient always receives treatment in accordance with the standard of treatment <EOS>
<SOS> if the patient is unconscious or otherwise unable to give informed consent the principle of deferred consent is acceptable <EOS>
<SOS> the deferred consent principle should be carefully documented <EOS>
<SOS> a prospective randomized study represents the gold standard for an investigation even under emergency conditions <EOS>
<SOS> there are different principles of randomization telephone or telefax randomisation etc <EOS>
<SOS> emergency medicine investigations need to be completed within a reasonable time frame which should as a rule not exceed <NUM> years <EOS>
<SOS> otherwise too many items might change without being noted <EOS>
<SOS> curative treatment and the intention to treat are terms employed by ethics committees <EOS>
<SOS> if an investigation does not bear in itself additional risk factors it does not necessarily have to be brought before the ethics committee <EOS>
<SOS> if however for example the effect of obtaining blood samples is investigated separately for research purposes the patient needs to be informed and sign the respective agreement <EOS>
<SOS> in germany the ethics committees have agreed to accept their respective decisions <EOS>
<SOS> for multicentre and multinational studies however the ethics committees also need to accept decisions made by non german ethics committees <EOS>
<SOS> not all therapeutic principles can serve as the basis of prospective randomized studies because they need to be considered the present standard of care e g endotracheal intubation etc <EOS>
<SOS> nevertheless the feasibility of a study should be assessed according to the 1 3 rating proposed by the american heart association <EOS>
<SOS> in principle the overall emergency physician protocol does not fulfill scientific requirements <EOS>
<SOS> for all studies particularly in the prehospital setting an independent observer should be involved for documentation purposes <EOS>
<SOS> scores can be of importance for investigating different treatment regimens <EOS>
<SOS> biases in emergency medicine studies focus on the variability of ems personnel qualifications etc <EOS>
<SOS> this is in part why it is extremely difficult to prove efficacy and efficiency in emergency medicine <EOS>
<SOS> the results of emergency medicine investigations should be published in suitable journals i e journals with a reasonable rating <EOS>

<SOS> the technical solution in medtronic kappa <NUM> dual chamber devices is explained together with an evaluation of advantages and possible limitations <EOS>
<SOS> the 4 out of 7 algorithm offers a quick ms by the addition of a blanked flutter search algorithm integrated into this concept the detection of atrial flutter is facilitated in a wider range of programmed av intervals <EOS>

<SOS> the results of ankle arthroplasty have generally been disappointing compared to other forms of arthroplasty <EOS>
<SOS> the present survey of results of ankle arthroplasty deals with the anatomical the kinemasiological the biomechanical and the biological features of the ankle joint <EOS>
<SOS> these features all seem important prerequisites for a successful total ankle prosthesis design <EOS>
<SOS> from the study of the results displayed in the literature and those of my own series it can be stated that a modern ankle arthroplasty should respect the normal anatomy and kinemasiology <EOS>
<SOS> biomechanically it should work as a normal ankle joint i e cylindrical mobility congruency and a possibility for normal torque within the ankle mortise <EOS>
<SOS> the prosthesis components should only be fixed in solid subchondral bone and preferably without cement <EOS>
<SOS> only compressible forces should act at the bone prosthesis interface <EOS>
<SOS> the axis of the ankle joint as well as of that of the hindfoot should be aligned to normal <EOS>
<SOS> meticulous surgery and special guide instruments are absolute necessities <EOS>
<SOS> restoration of muscle power and gait postoperatively are essential for a good and lasting result <EOS>
<SOS> the indication for ankle arthroplasty is mainly cases of osteoarthritis primary or traumatic and rheumatoid arthritis <EOS>
<SOS> contraindications are talus necrosis charcot joints extreme osteoporosis severe arteriosclerosis and very aggressive arthritis <EOS>
<SOS> mental disorders and neurological disorders may also be contraindications <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore the patients should agree not to perform sports involving jumping and running or other ankle demanding activities <EOS>
<SOS> the average annual failure rate should not exceed <NUM> if these recommendations are followed <EOS>

<SOS> squamous metaplasia can be demonstrated in about 4 of all invasive carcinomas of the breast <EOS>
<SOS> primary squamous cell carcinomas of the breast are rare since they occur in less than 1 of all primary invasive breast carcinomas <EOS>
<SOS> in order to classify a breast tumor as a primary squamous cell carcinoma one must exclude an epidermal origin especially from the nipple region and the possibility of metastatic infiltration of the breast by a squamous cell carcnoma from a different location <EOS>
