<SOS> the acute liver failure alf is a complex syndrome resulting from loss of synthetic and metabolic functions of the liver <EOS>
<SOS> despite recent advances in intensive care medicine patients with severe alf have a very high mortality and the orthotopic liver transplantation still remains the only proven effective treatment of alf <EOS>
<SOS> numerous attempts have been made to improve survival by using various extracorporeal support techniques but none of these therapeutic approaches was able to increase the survival rate <EOS>
<SOS> liver support systems based on detoxification procedures only could not influence the deleterious course of the disease <EOS>
<SOS> it is certain that an ideal liver support system should be capable to fulfil the liver is essential synthetic and metabolic functions as well as detoxification and excretion <EOS>
<SOS> over the last years the development of hybrid liver assist devices has aimed at replacing these liver functions and therefore might give an advantage over earlier systems based on detoxification techniques only <EOS>
<SOS> this article gives a short review of the various liver support systems and focuses then on the hybrid liver support systems their construction and the remaining problems after the first clinical applications <EOS>

<SOS> myocardial stunning contractile dysfunction in the presence of normalized perfusion and myocardial hibernation contractile dysfunction matching reduced perfusion have represented separate concepts of viable but dyssynergic myocardium in the past <EOS>
<SOS> however in vivo experimental and clinical work suggests that repetitive ischemia due to coronary artery disease may induce a gradual transition between stunned and hibernating myocardium <EOS>
<SOS> myocardial hibernation itself can result from a spectrum of ischemic conditions ranging from impaired myocardial blood flow reserve to frank hypoperfusion <EOS>
<SOS> with increasing severity and duration of ischemia degeneration of cardiac myocytes accumulation of glycogen and cell death ensue <EOS>
<SOS> additonally there is an increase of extracellular matrix protein content leading to reparative fibrosis which in turn limits functional recovery <EOS>
<SOS> in the light of these structural features the available methods for detection of viable myocardium in particular dobutamine echocardiography and nuclear imaging techniques offer complementary rather than contradictory information <EOS>
<SOS> dobutamine echo has satisfactory sensitivity excellent specificity and high diagnostic accuracy for the detection of viable dyssynergic myocardium <EOS>
<SOS> while in the past only its predictive accuracy for segmental recovery has been validated newer data show an improved survival after revascularization if at least four viable dyssynergic left ventricular segments in a <NUM> segment model can be identified by dobutamine echocardiography <EOS>
<SOS> the complete low and high dose dobutamine protocol can elicit several types of contractile responses sustained improvement in contraction or monophasic response biphasic response new wall motion abnormality which should be interpreted in view of other clinical data including a previous infarction <EOS>
<SOS> the test protocol can be used safely at the end of the first week after myocardial infarction <EOS>
<SOS> if ischemia or viability is documented revascularization should be performed promptly <EOS>
<SOS> a similar strategy should be followed in the setting of chronic coronary heart disease with left ventricular dysfunction <EOS>
<SOS> since the structural changes of hibernating myocardium are progressive time to revascularization is critical <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand responsible therapeutic planning requires proof of ischemia or viability before initiating a potentially hazardous revascularization procedure <EOS>

<SOS> the coarctation causes an arterial hypertension of the upper half and an arterial hypotension of the lower half of the body <EOS>

<SOS> successful transplantation of autologous chondrocytes for repair of articular cartilage defects requires an undisturbed matrix synthesis of the transplanted cells <EOS>
<SOS> this in turn is dependent on the composition of the synovial fluid sf of the respective joint <EOS>
<SOS> we addressed the question whether analysis of a patient is sf can predict the rate of matrix synthesis of articular cartilage exposed to this sf in vitro <EOS>
<SOS> sf was obtained from <NUM> patients with disorders of the knee including gonarthrosis n 44 meniscal tears n 10 rheumatoid arthritis n 53 and reactive arthritides n 8 <EOS>
<SOS> in the sf the following parameters were determined interleukin 1 il 6 il 8 il 1 ra tnf insulin like growth factor i igf i igf ii igf binding protein 2 igfbp 2 igfbp 3 as well as total proteinase activity and total collagenase activity <EOS>
<SOS> to assess the effect of sf on the matrix synthesis of articular chondrocytes bovine cartilage was incubated in the presence of sf and the rate of proteoglycan synthesis subsequently determined <EOS>
<SOS> in some cases a monoclonal antibody directed against igf i was added <EOS>
<SOS> sf from patients with oa or trauma respectively stimulated pg synthesis of bovine cartilage more markedly than did sf from patients with rheumatic arthritides <EOS>
<SOS> on the average <NUM> percent of the sf induced increase of cartilage matrix synthesis could be titrated out by an anti igf i ab <EOS>
<SOS> the best predictor for the sf effects on pg synthesis of exposed cartilage was the proportion of free igf i r 0 573 p 0 001 spearman rank correlation followed by the sf concentrations of igf i with a positive sign igfbp 3 il 1 and tnf all with a negative sign <EOS>
<SOS> according to our data igf i is the most important anabolic factor in human sf with respect to cartilage pg synthesis <EOS>
<SOS> the proportion of free igf i seems to be of special importance in this regard <EOS>
<SOS> low sf levels of free igf i could be identified as a possible risk factor for a sub optimal protoeglycan synthesis of chondrocytes exposed to this synovial milieu <EOS>
<SOS> the coincidence between panic disorder and depression is a well known phenomenon <EOS>
<SOS> however only few studies investigated the coincidence of panic disorder with schizophrenia <EOS>
<SOS> this may in part be explained by the fact that both positive and negative symptoms of schizophrenia may mask the clinical symptoms of a panic disorder <EOS>
<SOS> we report on a female patient suffering both from agoraphobia with panic disorder and paranoid schizophrenia according to icd 10 <EOS>
<SOS> the productive psychotic symptoms responded well to treatment with a low dose of zotepine whereas the panic disorder was effectively treated with a combined therapy with imipramine and cognitive behavioral therapy <EOS>
<SOS> although it has to be questioned whether the coincidence between panic disorder and schizophrenia reflects two different diagnostic entities the occurence of symptoms of a panic disorder in schizophrenia deserve further attention because these may be treated efficiently by a specific pharmacotherapy and psychotherapy <EOS>

<SOS> diagnosis of bacterial infection and or sepsis in critically ill patients is a common problem in intensive care medicine <EOS>

<SOS> at this time significantly higher costs are the major detraction to daily or frequent measurements <EOS>

<SOS> confusion between syncope and epileptic seizures is a common problem in clinical practice <EOS>
<SOS> recently new insights into the phenomenology of transient cerebral hypoxia have been gained from video analysis of experimentally induced syncope <EOS>
<SOS> common elements of syncope include multifocal and generalized myoclonus tonic body extension automatisms vocalizations eye deviations and hallucinations <EOS>
<SOS> thus it is not the presence or absence of these features but their specific character that distinguishes syncope from epileptic seizures <EOS>
<SOS> other clues for differential diagnosis include precipitating factors premonitory symptoms and postictal events such as tongue bites and postictal confusion which has been identified as the single most powerful factor discriminating syncope from epileptic seizures <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast incontinence and head injury are common in both conditions <EOS>
<SOS> investigations such as electroencephalogram tilt testing and postictal prolactin or creatine kinase levels may aid diagnosis but are never diagnostic in isolation <EOS>
<SOS> in rare cases hypoxic and epileptic mechanisms may interact within one attack <EOS>
<SOS> in the past two decades increasing research efforts have focused on the molecular biology of the cell <EOS>
<SOS> in the beginning these research activities were purely academic without any direct clinical relation <EOS>
<SOS> a series of important discoveries initiated particularly by the unravelling of the genetic code and the discovery of the molecular basis of gene expression and genetics the subsequent identification of oncogenes and tumor suppressor genes and finally the description of major mechanisms which induce genetic instability in cells now indicate the way to many new diagnostic and therapeutic strategies <EOS>
<SOS> in surgical oncology these attempts are yielding the first clinical consequences <EOS>
<SOS> basic aspects of molecular cell biology as far as they are relevant for surgical oncologists are discussed <EOS>
<SOS> the compartment syndrome cs is characterized by an increased tissue pressure in a limited space <EOS>
<SOS> pathophysiologically it is a multifactorial disease that is potentially induced by an initial trauma and develops according to the existence of cofactors <EOS>
<SOS> cofactors are for instance the circulation of the patient and the initial treatment of the impending cs <EOS>
<SOS> in particular the microcirculation is altered with endothelial destruction development of a capillary leak protein loss from intravasal space and the development of an interstitial and intracellular third space <EOS>
<SOS> an impaired drainage of the lymphatic and venous system causes a venous infarction <EOS>
<SOS> an arterial infarction results if the tissue pressure exceeds the arteriolar pressure <EOS>
<SOS> an accompanying ischemia reperfusion mechanism increases the trauma load <EOS>
<SOS> in disadvantageous cases the patients are in danger of developing a multi organ deficiency syndrome mods by an uncontrolled inflammatory reaction by intravasal volume loss and by a myonephropathic systemic reaction <EOS>
<SOS> clinically the patients suffer a disproportionate amount of pain followed by neurological signs <EOS>
<SOS> especially in noncompliant patients tissue pressure measurement is useful <EOS>
<SOS> resuscitation of the circulation as well as splitting of casts is important <EOS>
<SOS> in case of a manifest cs dermatofasciotomy has to be performed as an emergency operation <EOS>
<SOS> even if cs is diagnosed early and fasciotomy is carried out early the development of sequellae cannot be avoided in every single case <EOS>

<SOS> it is a self expanding and self centering double disc made from a nitinol mesh which is tightly woven to give mechanical strength <EOS>
<SOS> both discs are separated by a connecting cylindrical portion <EOS>
<SOS> its diameter may be chosen so that it corresponds to that of the asd <EOS>

<SOS> this applies both to sepcifity models and to duality of body and mind or of illness and health <EOS>

<SOS> herpes simplex viruses are known to be among the most common disease causing microorganisms <EOS>
<SOS> their prevalence can exceed 90 depending on the socioeconomic status of the population <EOS>
<SOS> since the number of immunocompromised patients has increased because of the increased incidence in the acquired immunodeficiency syndrome and an increase in organ transplantation herpes virus infection may have a greater clinical significance <EOS>

<SOS> tumor invasion of the portal vein by ductal adenocarcinoma of the pancreatic head is classically known as a criterion for inoperability <EOS>
<SOS> despite improvement in operation techniques for portal vein resection during whipple is procedure and acceptable mortality and morbidity in the case of uncertain tumor infiltration vascular resection cannot be recommended in general <EOS>
<SOS> the problem is the preoperative detection of tumor infiltration of the portal vein <EOS>
<SOS> often the surgeon is confronted with unsuspected macroscopic portal vein infiltration or tumor adhesion during the operation <EOS>
<SOS> between <NUM> and <NUM> <NUM> patients underwent whipple is procedure for ductal adenocarcinoma of the pancreatic head in our department <EOS>
<SOS> in eight of these cases partial portal vein resection was performed because of macroscopic tumor infiltration or tumor adhesion <EOS>
<SOS> in all eight cases the preoperative diagnostic procedures with ct and portography did not show any suspicion of tumor infiltration <EOS>
<SOS> in four of the eight cases histological tumor infiltration of all vascular layers was found <EOS>
<SOS> in the others we found no or only adventitial tumor invasion <EOS>
<SOS> the patients without tumor infiltration of the portal vein showed a survival time after surgery of <NUM> months in contrast to <NUM> months in the group with histologically proven tumor infiltration <EOS>
<SOS> endovascular intraportal ultrasound ipeus a new diagnostic procedure can give helpful information regarding portal vein involvement <EOS>
<SOS> although the ipeus is not a standard diagnostic procedure it was shown to detect portal vein infiltration with high sensitivity and specificity <EOS>
<SOS> our results indicate that in such cases where portal vein infiltration has been excluded by ipeus patients with macroscopic tumor adhesion do benefit from partial portal vein resection <EOS>

<SOS> the effectiveness of each of these phases is influenced by several variables personnel technical equipment course of the disease etc <EOS>

<SOS> olfactory dysfunction seems to be one of the most frequent symptoms in idiopathic parkinsonian syndrome ips <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast to the increasing number of studies providing evidence of the usefulness of olfactory tests in the diagnosis of ips clinical assessment of olfactory function is rarely performed <EOS>
<SOS> this may be due to the lack of an easy to use <NUM> inexpensive standardized and reliable test <EOS>
<SOS> in this study we administered the newly developed sniffing sticks test to a group of <NUM> nondemented ips patients and compared the results with <NUM> healthy controls matched for age gender and smoking habits <EOS>
<SOS> in all three subtests including odor identification odor detection threshold and odor discrimination the control group scored significantly better than the ips group yielding a specificity and sensitivity of 90 each <EOS>
<SOS> our results indicate that olfactory disturbances in ips can be found at early stages of the disease appear bilaterally and do not correlate with the dominant side of parkinsonism <EOS>
<SOS> therefore we emphasize that olfactory testing may be a useful tool in the diagnosis of ips <EOS>

<SOS> drug induced toxic epidermal necrolysis ten is a rare but frequently lethal disease of the skin and mucosa of unknown etiology <EOS>
<SOS> toxic metabolic and immunologic products in the serum have been discussed as possible causes <EOS>
<SOS> for this reason we have performed plasmapheresis on these patients for many years <EOS>
<SOS> results regarding survival and healing of the lesions are quite favorable as exemplified with two patients described here who benefited from the procedure despite their old age <EOS>
<SOS> in order to gain insight into possible disease mechanisms that would explain the beneficial effect of plasmapheresis we did immunohistochemical studies on these patients before and in one case after the procedure <EOS>
<SOS> in dermis and epidermis there was a striking increase of macrophages and a relative increase of cd8 positive lymphocytes which might act as cytotoxic effector cells these findings can be interpreted as the result of an immunological reaction <EOS>
<SOS> an increased staining of lesional epidermis with tnf as previously noted by other autors should be interpreted with caution since necrotic cells are involved <EOS>
<SOS> on the basis of the clinical results the pathogenetic considerations and in view of the lack of specific treatment modalities clinical studies concerning plasmapheresis for the treatment of toxic epidermal necrolysis are recommended particularly since this procedure is widely available and generally well tolerated <EOS>

<SOS> impaction of an intramedullary nail during extraction is an unpredictable and delicate situation <EOS>
<SOS> its problematic nature is unfolded on a report of two cases one with a küntscher nail and one with a modern solid titanium nail <EOS>
<SOS> this event is caused by ingrowth of new bone formation into the slot or the dorsal flute respectively <EOS>
<SOS> the new bone formation is a mechanical barrier which effectively forces the distal part of the nail to jam against the cortex <EOS>
<SOS> both the slot of the unlocked reamed clover leaf nail and the wider dorsal flute of the solid titanium nail realize certain therapeutic concepts <EOS>
<SOS> their factual benefit within the concept of interlocking nailing is doubtful <EOS>

<SOS> hcg and afp may serve as useful markers to enable follow up of the disease <EOS>

<SOS> primary defects of skeletal growth and development can be subdivided into hypoplasias dysostoses and dysplasias <EOS>
<SOS> hypoplastic bones are small but otherwise normal <EOS>
<SOS> generalized skeletal hypoplasias comprise various forms of primordial dwarfism and syndromal disorders including trisomy <NUM> and ullrich turner syndrome <EOS>
<SOS> dysostoses are defects of bones as organs resulting from errors of morphogenesis <EOS>
<SOS> many of them are caused by mutations of single genes in the cascade of morphogenetic gene sequences <EOS>
<SOS> dysplasias are defects of bone as tissue <EOS>
<SOS> some of them e g achondroplasia jansen type of metaphyseal chondrodysplasia are caused by defects of signal genes influencing cell division or differentiation <EOS>
<SOS> others result from gene mutations affecting the cellular production of matrix components <EOS>
<SOS> examples are collagenopathies such as osteogenesis imperfecta and some spondyloepiphyseal dysplasias <EOS>
<SOS> finally disorders such as pycnodysostosis result from defects of chondro osseous homeostasis <EOS>
<SOS> the study of skeletal defects helps to unravel the complexity of normal skeletal development <EOS>
<SOS> human parvovirus b19 causes erythema infectiosum fifth disease and aplastic crisis <EOS>
<SOS> in pregnancy b19 may be transmitted on to the fetus resulting in hydrops fetalis <EOS>
<SOS> b19 is sometimes associated with thrombocytopenia and vasculitis <EOS>
<SOS> in immunocompromised patients b19 may persist causing chronic infection <EOS>
<SOS> several methods for detecting b19 virus or specific antibodies are now available <EOS>
<SOS> b19 infection does not usually require therapy <EOS>
<SOS> efficacy of immunoglobulins in chronic b19 infection has been demonstrated <EOS>
<SOS> in absence of significant symptoms and signs the diagnosis of pulmonary embolism pe remains difficult <EOS>
<SOS> sensitivity and specifity of laboratory tests chest x ray and ecg on their own is low <EOS>
<SOS> echocardiography is particularly useful in critically ill patients suspected of having pulmonary emboli and can help identify right ventricular pressure overload <EOS>
<SOS> venous ultrasonography is useful in patients with suspected pe but normal results do not rule out pe <EOS>
<SOS> helical ct with contrast medium can identify pulmonary emboli <EOS>
<SOS> however if the ct findings are normal in the presence of a high index of clinical suspicion only larger pulmonary embolism are ruled out and angiography with the focus on distal pulmonary vasculature should be performed <EOS>
<SOS> the diagnosis of pulmonary embolism should be made by combining clinical assessment several diagnostic techniques and finally pulmonary angiography in doubtful cases <EOS>
<SOS> heparin remains the standard therapy for patients with stable hemodynamics <EOS>
<SOS> thrombolytic therapy is recommended in hemodynamically compromised patients <EOS>
<SOS> in short term dose regimes the thrombolytic agents urokinase streptokinase and rt pa seem to be equally efficient <EOS>
<SOS> so far however no study has proven that thrombolytic therapy significantly reduces mortality in pulmonary embolism <EOS>

<SOS> we therefore evaluated mesopic vision in myopic eyes before and after lasik <EOS>

<SOS> it is thought to be inherited in an autosomal recessive manner <EOS>

<SOS> articular cartilage has only a small capacity for regneration <EOS>
<SOS> this makes the repair of articular surfaces difficult <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> pridie described his method of resurfacing osteoarthritic knee joints <EOS>
<SOS> this operation is still in widespread use today <EOS>
<SOS> pridie introduced the principle of drilling exposed subchondral bone with the objective of encouraging a fibro cartilaginous repair <EOS>

<SOS> isolated pancreatic metastases from renal cell carcinomas rcc are extremely rare <EOS>
<SOS> only <NUM> cases of clinically diagnosed renal cell carcinoma metastatic to the pancreas have been reported in the world literature and <NUM> of the patients including ours underwent a definitive surgical resection <EOS>
<SOS> in many cases the time between the nephrectomy and diagnosis of metachronous metastases is reported to exceed <NUM> years <EOS>
<SOS> therefore the initial diagnosis may be overlooked when there is a prolonged disease free interval <EOS>
<SOS> when it does occur simultaneously or metachronously aggressive surgical resection when possible seems to be the most effective treatment for this metastatic lesion <EOS>
<SOS> surgical resection can provide long term survival in selected cases <EOS>

<SOS> delusion is understood to mean intersubjectively disconcerting convictions with a tendency toward subjective certainty that lose their disconcerting character when made the object of psychiatric analysis in the knowledge of their independence from mental disorder <EOS>
<SOS> the perceptions from which delusions arise are dynamically charged according to their role in the structural context <EOS>
<SOS> the realisation pressure that burdens the perceptions and is intensified in psychotic constitutions is a precondition for the delusion <EOS>
<SOS> the failure of derealisation brought about by the psychotic disorganisation of the structure is also a requirement <EOS>
<SOS> based on a case study considerations arising out of the initial stages of schizophrenic delusion are extended to other forms of delusion and to the conditions for chronification <EOS>

<SOS> it usually occurs in otherwise healthy persons or in association with a systemic desease <EOS>
<SOS> several clinical variants of pyoderma gangrenosum have been described <EOS>
<SOS> extremely painful ulcerations are characteristic and evolve rapidly <EOS>
<SOS> malignant pyoderma the variant described in our case report is an aggressive variant of ulcerative pyoderma gangrenosum rapidly progressive and a potentially lethal ulcerative disease <EOS>
<SOS> the diagnosis of pyoderma gangrenosum depends on recognition of the evolving clinical features because histopathologic changes are not specific and characteristically serological or hematological markers of the disease do not exist <EOS>
<SOS> histopathologic findings however always include vasculitis either in form of the necrotizing cutaneous vasculitis 7 granulomatous 1 or lymphocytic vasculitis 2 <EOS>

<SOS> we could demonstrate successful perioperative treatment for prevention of exacerbation of pyoderma gangrenosum with prednisone and clofazimine <EOS>

<SOS> in <NUM> patients stereotactic serial biopsies of different intraaxial lesions were performed in <NUM> patients a spontaneous haemorrhage of the basal ganglia was removed by lysis with r tpa <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> patients suffering from hydrocephalus due to diencephalic cysts a cystventricular shunt device was implanted <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> patients an intracerebral abscess was aspirated and drained <EOS>
<SOS> a stereotactic guided craniotomy and excision of small deep seated lesions was performed in <NUM> cases <EOS>
<SOS> the accuracy of stereotactic tumour biopsies was <NUM> in our series in accordance to other authors <EOS>

<SOS> the stereotactic internal shunt implantation seems to be an alternative approach in the treatment of diencephalic cysts due to its minimal invasiveness and low operative risk <EOS>
<SOS> the aspiration of basal ganglia haematomas with insertion of an external drainage allows the lysis of the haematoma with r tpa or urokinase <EOS>
<SOS> with stereotactic guidance small deep seated intraaxial lesions can be well localized and removed <EOS>
<SOS> radiotherapy of patients with prostate cancer offers an alternative to radical prostatectomy in early stages t1 t2 <EOS>
<SOS> in locally advanced prostate cancer a high dose or combined radiotherapy is more effective than radical surgery with concurrent lower morbidity and mortality <EOS>
<SOS> recent developments in linear accellerator technique the progress in dose calculation and planning techniques provide the means to apply higher doses to a given tumor volume while effectively protecting the surrounding normal tissue at the same time <EOS>
<SOS> these improvements may possibly reduce the rate of therapy related side effects or complications significantly <EOS>
<SOS> the combination of external beam radiotherapy and interstitial brachytherapy as well as the combination of hormone therapy and external beam radiotherapy are most likely more effective than percutaneous irradiation alone <EOS>
<SOS> in special cases with a very low risk of recurrent tumor an interstitial permanent brachytherapy alone is indicated <EOS>
<SOS> future developments i e intensity modulated radiotherapy imrt combined thermo radiotherapy proton or neutrontherapy may further increase the rate of curative treatments in patients with prostate cancer <EOS>
<SOS> skin is the second most common site of extranodal lymphoma <EOS>
<SOS> the significance of cutaneous b cell lymphomas has been underestimated due to the lack of monoclonal antibodies and molecular genetics in former years <EOS>
<SOS> cutaneous b cell lymphomas represent a heterogenous group of entities which show variation in histology immunophenotype and in prognosis <EOS>
<SOS> the most common entities presenting in skin are follicular lymphomas marginal zone b cell lymphomas and diffuse large b cell lymphomas <EOS>
<SOS> the majority of primary cutaneous b cell lymphomas have an excellent prognosis <EOS>
<SOS> whereas in b cell lymphomas with secondary spread to the skin the clinical course is dependant on the prognosis of the primary lymphoma <EOS>
<SOS> it is evident that primary cutaneous lymphomas are distinct from nodal lymphomas and not extranodal manifestations of their lymph node based counterparts <EOS>
<SOS> in the current review the morphologic spectrum of cutaneous b cell lymphomas comprising primary and secondary cutaneous b cell lymphomas is discussed according to the who classification sheme <EOS>
<SOS> the phencyclidine derivative ketamine is a non competitive n methyl d aspartate nmda receptor antagonist with the thalamo neocortical projection system as the primary site of action <EOS>
<SOS> racemic ketamine consists of the enantiomers s ketamine and r ketamine <EOS>
<SOS> racemic ketamine has never been considered an adequate anaesthetic agent in neurosurgical patients since <NUM> it produces regionally specific stimulation of cerebral metabolism cmro2 and increases cerebral blood flow cbf and intracranial pressure icp <EOS>
<SOS> however recent experiments suggest that both tracemic ketamine and s ketamine may reduce infarct size in animal models of incomplete cerebral ischaemia and brain injury <EOS>
<SOS> this experimental protective effect appears to be related to decreases in ca influx and maintenance of brain tissue magnesium levels due to nmda and quisqualate receptor blockade by ketamine <EOS>
<SOS> studies in dogs have shown that racemic ketamine 2 0 mg kg increases cbf in the presence of the cerebral vasodilator n2o <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast studies in rats without background anaesthesia showed increases in cbf after racemic ketamine 100 mg kg i p <EOS>
<SOS> this suggests that the cerebrovascular effects of racemic ketamine are related to the pre existing cerebrovascular tone induced by background anaesthetics <EOS>
<SOS> cerebrovascular co2 reactivity was maintained regardless of the baseline cerebrovascular resistance <EOS>
<SOS> there are several mechanisms by which racemic ketamine may increase cbf <EOS>
<SOS> it induces dose dependent respiratory depression with consequent mild hypercapnia in spontaneously ventilating subjects <EOS>
<SOS> this produces vasodilation due to the intact cerebrovascular co2 reactivity <EOS>
<SOS> racemic ketamine also induces regional neuroexcitation which leads to stimulation of cerebral glucose consumption in the limbic extrapyramidal auditory and sensory motor systems <EOS>
<SOS> this regional neuroexcitation with increased cmro2 produces increases in cbf that can be blocked by infusion of barbiturates or benzodiazepines <EOS>
<SOS> however increases in cbf with racemic ketamine 1 mg kg may also occur during normocapnia and without changes in cmro2 <EOS>
<SOS> this effect is related to some additional direct cerebral vasodilating potency of racemic ketamine based on a mechanism involving blockade of ca channels <EOS>
<SOS> the effects of racemic ketamine on cbf autoregulation have not been investigated systematically <EOS>
<SOS> however studies in rats have shown that cbf autoregulation was maintained with low and high dose s ketamine <EOS>
<SOS> infusion of racemic ketamine alters intracranial volume and icp <EOS>
<SOS> studies in spontaneously ventilating pigs with and without intracranial hypertension have shown that racemic ketamine <MOB> mg kg produces increases in paco2 and icp <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast identical experiments with mechanical ventilation and controlled paco2 showed no changes in icp following racemic ketamine infusion <EOS>
<SOS> this implies that increases in icp are related to inadequate ventilation with consecutive hypercapnia and increases in intracranial blood volume <EOS>
<SOS> however mechanical ventilation may not be sufficient to control icp following racemic ketamine <EOS>
<SOS> experiments in mechanically ventilated dogs indicate that racemic ketamine 2 mg kg increases cerebral blood volume and icp even in the presence of normoventilation a response that is reversible by hyperventilation or the administration of diazepam <EOS>
<SOS> studies in patients have shown that racemic ketamine 2 0 mg kg reduces cbf in the presence of cerebral vasodilators like halothane or n2o <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast studies in unanaesthetised humans showed increases in cbf after racemic ketamine 2 3 mg kg <EOS>
<SOS> this observation is consistent with animal studies and suggests that the cerebrovascular effects of racemic ketamine are related to the pre existing cerebrovascular tone induced by background anaesthetics <EOS>
<SOS> dengue fever is a mosquito transmitted viral disease <EOS>
<SOS> it is endemic mainly in south east asia and afrika <EOS>
<SOS> the clinical manifestation is divided into different stages <EOS>
<SOS> ocular manifestations in travellers have been rarely reported <EOS>
<SOS> sufficient and regular wetting of the cornea with a normal preocular tear film is an essential requirement for the accurate visual functioning of the eye <EOS>
<SOS> multiple factors may cause tear film instability <EOS>
<SOS> measuring the break up time of the preocular tear film is a necessary clinically reliable means for evaluating tear film stability <EOS>
<SOS> we designed a new instrument to observe the preocular tear film at high magnification which can contribute to the in vivo imaging of the physiological and pathophysiological dynamics of the tear film and its break up phenomena <EOS>

<SOS> we report the case of a a <NUM> year old worker in the pharmaceutical industry who suffered from recurring contact dermatitis <EOS>
<SOS> initially the contact dermatitis was limited to the hands later on it became generalized <EOS>
<SOS> the patient had been working on a drug filling line in a pharmaceutical plant for more than <NUM> years <EOS>
<SOS> eight years after starting this job he had developed allergic hand dermatitis to 2 6 diaminopyridine patch test positive this healed upon cessation of exposure <EOS>
<SOS> ten years later he again developed hand dermatitis which progressed to generalized dermatitis and conjunctivitis <EOS>
<SOS> under systemic and local therapy with corticosteroids and cessation of work it healed nearly completly <EOS>
<SOS> four months after returning to work the patient experienced a first episode of severe asthma and generalized dermatitis with conjunctivitis following exposure to hydroxychloroquine the day before <EOS>
<SOS> the asthma and dermatitis improved after systemic corticosteroid therapy and stopping work <EOS>
<SOS> his condition continued to fluctuate when though the patient was transferred at work and now wore rubber gloves <EOS>
<SOS> eight months later he again developed a generalized dermatitis <EOS>
<SOS> patch testing revealed delayed type sensitizations to hydroxychloroquine tested in concentrations of 0 1 0 5 1 and 2 <EOS>
<SOS> equivalent tests in five healthy volunteers were negative <EOS>
<SOS> the patch test reactions were pustular while a biopsy was interpreted as a multiform contact dermatitis reaction <EOS>
<SOS> bronchial exposure with hydroxychloroquine dust produced a delayed bronchial obstruction over the next <NUM> hours which progressed to fever and generalized erythema hematogenous contact dermatitis <EOS>
<SOS> after removing exposure to 2 6 diaminopyridine and hydroxychloroquine the patient went on to develop a contact dermatitis to latex patch test positive <EOS>
<SOS> however skin prick tests with latex and patch tests with rubber additiva were negative <EOS>
<SOS> hydroxychloroquine is well known to cause drug reactions <EOS>
<SOS> to our knowledge contact dermatitis to this substance has not yet been reported <EOS>
<SOS> it is noteworthy that the patch test reactions were pustular and of multiform morphology and that bronchial exposure to the allergen resulted in asthma and a generalized drug reaction <EOS>
<SOS> pathogenetically the asthmatic reaction seems to be on a delayed type mechanism as is also seen with ampicillin cobalt and nickel induced asthma <EOS>

<SOS> this finding differ from findings in non drug induced tendinopathies <EOS>
<SOS> after antimicrobiotical treatment with ciprofloxacin the side effect of a tendon disorder must be considered <EOS>
<SOS> the impairment of the tendon may be as strong that a tendon rupture may occur at daily living activities without any typical clinical symptoms <EOS>
<SOS> the recent results obtained from investigations based on molecular biological techniques have led to a better understanding of recurrent genetic causes important for the pathogenesis of tumors <EOS>
<SOS> several genes have been identified as being involved in the development of cancer <EOS>
<SOS> in many cases the activation of oncogenes or the inactivation of tumor suppressor genes is the predominant reason for cancerogenic cell transformation <EOS>
<SOS> functional dysregulation is frequently the consequence of mutations resulting in an alteration of the primary structure of the dna <EOS>
<SOS> as our understanding of the nature function and interaction of these genes evolves new opportunities for early diagnosis classification prevention and treatment of malignant tumors will arise <EOS>

<SOS> hyperbaric oxygen hbo therapy is a kind of medical treatment in which a patient breathes 100 of oxygen inside a pressure chamber while the pressure of the chamber is increased to a point higher than sea level pressure <EOS>
<SOS> it is strongly based on clearly defined physical laws and physiological regularities <EOS>
<SOS> for the clinical use of hbo therapy according to international recommendations there are several commonly accepted indications in which hbo either is the only causative life saving kind of treatment or is an essential and oftenly decisive component of a comprehensive interdisciplinary intensive care therapy <EOS>
<SOS> among potential adverse effects barotrauma of the lungs and especially oxygen toxicity to the central nervous system have to be mentioned <EOS>
<SOS> clinical use of hbo therefore requires special knowledge of its effects risks and adverse effects a clear and distinct indication and the ability and skills to keep complications under control by means of intensive care or emergency medical measures <EOS>
<SOS> the clinical use of hyperbaric oxygen with its interdisciplinary like character of emergency medicine or intensive care therapy therefore should be an additional most interesting field of activity for the anaesthesiologist <EOS>

<SOS> conclusion the transculturally adapted version of both functional indices are valid reliable and internally consistent <EOS>
<SOS> because of psychometric advantages the basfi may be preferred in clinical trial settings <EOS>
<SOS> the role of radiotherapy of the pelvic lymphatic pathways in patients with node positive prostate cancer remains uncertain <EOS>
<SOS> interpretation of the few prospective studies rtog 75 06 and 77 06 is hampered by severe flaws in the study design <EOS>
<SOS> extension of the radiation to the paraaortal region shows no advantage over radiation of the pelvic lymphatics alone and is not warranted <EOS>
<SOS> data on longterm side effects are only available from older studies with outdated radiation techniques <EOS>
<SOS> according to more recent studies short term side effects are considerably higher with radiation of the pelvic lymphatics when compared with radiation of the prostate alone <EOS>
<SOS> in summary radiation of the lymphatic pathways in lymph node positive prostate cancer cannot currently be considered as standard treatment and should be carried out within clinical studies <EOS>

<SOS> group <NUM> showed no signs of resorption and chronic inflammation at all <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast group <NUM> presented correlating to the time of implanta tion increasing signs of cell death and fibrotic transformation representing an increased activity of resorption <EOS>
<SOS> in conclusion tissue encapsulation with a polyelectrolytecomplex membrane could ensure a sufficient protection of human cartilage transplants from resorptive influences <EOS>
<SOS> for the plastic reconstructive surgeon the desired result becomes more calculable <EOS>

<SOS> there were no significant differences between endogenous and neurotic depressives <EOS>

<SOS> sevoflurane degrades in co2 absorbents to produce compound a which may have <NUM> hepatotoxic potential in humans <EOS>
<SOS> several recent studies in human volunteers have been performed to evaluate this potential <EOS>
<SOS> three studies have evaluated sevoflurane administered to volunteers using a 3 concentration for <NUM> h duration at approximately <NUM> l min flow rate <EOS>
<SOS> the initial investigation found high excretion of protein glucose and renal tubular enzymes in the urine of the volunteers receiving sevoflurane <EOS>
<SOS> subsequent investigations using identical protocols found more minor or absent changes in excretion of these markers <EOS>
<SOS> one additional investigation in volunteers studied 3 sevoflurane anesthesia for <NUM> h duration using a low flow 1 l min technique <EOS>

<SOS> application of these results to clinical practice must be interpreted in light of the experimental nature of the anesthetic administration <EOS>
<SOS> although some controversy remains these data combined with results of recent studies in surgical patients suggest that renal function following modest duration low flow sevoflurane anesthesia is similar to that following isoflurane anesthesia <EOS>
<SOS> background the microbial colonization of the intestinal tract in newborns begins during delivery <EOS>
<SOS> streptococci and escherichia coli pave the way for the bifidobacterial dominance typical in breast fed newborns <EOS>
<SOS> they provide optimal living conditions for anaerobic bifidobacteria by withdrawal of intraluminal oxygen <EOS>
<SOS> a mixed intestinal flora is established on infant formula feeding in the infant <EOS>
<SOS> bifidobacteria bacteroides enterobacteriaceae streptococci and lactobacilli are the main genera of this mixed intestinal flora <EOS>
<SOS> this represents an intermediate stage of the microflora in adults <EOS>
<SOS> the bifidogenic effect of mothers milk is based on the active substances it contains which selectively enhance the growth of bifidobacteria whereas other active substances suppress the growth of the accompanying flora <EOS>
<SOS> bifidus enhancing factors in breast feeding are lactose oligosaccharides glycoproteins such as glycomacropeptide and the inoculation with bifidobacteria deriving from the skin surface of the mother <EOS>
<SOS> factors directed to the suppression of the accompanying microflora are antibodies lactoferrin lysozyme fatty acids and monoglycerides that act as antimicrobial substances and the comparatively low protein and iron content in mothers milk <EOS>
<SOS> a bifidus inhibiting colonization of the intestinal tract with pathogenic germs is caused by maternal birth canal infections which are now known to be the most frequent reason for premature births <EOS>
<SOS> an increasing number of surgical deliveries the separation of the newborn infant from its mother and the generous use of antibiotics contribute to the delayed colonization of bifidobacteria and to the development of life threatening nosocomial infections <EOS>
<SOS> counteractive measures against this disastrous situation are the preferential use of bifidobacteria preserving antibiotics and the inoculation of lyophilized bifidobacteria <EOS>

<SOS> seventy two patients comprising a total of <NUM> feet were available for post operative review after an average of <NUM> years from the date of the original operations <EOS>

<SOS> in addition every available pre and post operative x ray taken from <NUM> to <NUM> was analyzed <EOS>

<SOS> before the operations nearly 100 of the examined feet suffered from painful synovial hypertrophy and erosion of the metatarsophalangeal joints with dislocation and subluxation causing approximately 70 of all patients to have great difficulties in walking <EOS>
<SOS> after the operations however 90 2 of the patients reported that this condition had noticeably improved or had completely disappeared <EOS>
<SOS> in fact 87 5 of all patients reported a lasting improvement in their ability to walk longer distances <EOS>

<SOS> sonography has provided an important addition to the tools available for the diagnosis of the soft tissues in the head and neck region <EOS>
<SOS> the ent surgeon himself is able to examine pathological formations by this quick non invasive and last but not least less expensive method <EOS>
<SOS> due to the high resolution of the procedure the chance of detecting even small changes is increased and the exactness of diagnosis of pathological lymph nodes of the neck has been significantly improved compared to palpation alone <EOS>
<SOS> ultrasound has replaced the sialographic procedures in the field of diagnostic evaluation of salivary gland disease in the daily practice except for special indications <EOS>
<SOS> after inauguration of color doppler sonography non invasive evaluation of vascular stenosis of the large cervical vessels concerning their hemodynamic effects has become possible <EOS>
<SOS> this issue is important for the differential dignosis of otoneurological diseases such as sudden hearing loss vertigo and tinnitus <EOS>
<SOS> additionally the extent of perfusion of space occupying lesions can be easily examined and therefore the risk of mass bleeding can be preoperatively assessed by this method without harm to the patient <EOS>
<SOS> especially carotid body tumors may be diagnosed with high accuracy by the evidence of significant diffuse perfusion of the lesion <EOS>
<SOS> in several studies the specificity of the assessment of cervical lymph node disease could be increased by examination of resistance indices <EOS>
<SOS> however other authors have shown inconsistent results in differentiation of benign and malignant lumps therefore final judgment does not seem to be possible yet <EOS>
<SOS> use of echo contrast agents to enhance the ultrasound signal seems to be a promising approach for future developments in color doppler imaging <EOS>
<SOS> painful stiffness of the shoulder is an ill defined clinical entity that is difficult to assess and delicate to treat <EOS>
<SOS> the nomenclature used is broad and includes terms such as frozen shoulder adhesive capsulitis focal algodystrophy stiff shoulder contracted shoulder and others <EOS>
<SOS> apart from its idiopathic form the disease can be initiated by trauma infection tumour radiation systemic and local metabolic disturbances <EOS>
<SOS> pathoanatomically the common denominator is an inflammatory vascular proliferation followed by thickening scarring and retraction of the joint capsule <EOS>
<SOS> the inflammatory process often starts at the rotator interval and may extend to the subacromial space <EOS>
<SOS> the prognosis for patients in whom metastatic renal cell carcinoma rcc is not treated is unfavorable with a reported 5 year survival of 0 18 <EOS>
<SOS> before the era of immunotherapy and in the absence of effective nonsurgical therapy resection of metastases was the accepted way to prolong survival giving a 5 year survival of 7 69 <EOS>
<SOS> retrospective studies have shown that several clinical factors are associated with a relatively good prognosis <EOS>
<SOS> some patients will benefit from resection of metastases but most patients with metastatic rcc are not candidates for such aggressive surgery <EOS>
<SOS> the use of interleukin 2 has demonstrated that immunotherapy can produce durable remissions <EOS>
<SOS> without randomized trials it is difficult to know whether survival is longer than that in untreated patients but there is clear evidence that immunotherapy improves survival and yields long lasting remissions in selected patients <EOS>
<SOS> many questions remain concerning quality of life and the benefit to risk ratio of immunotherapy but it is the most effective treatment for metastatic rcc <EOS>

<SOS> but fusion is definite and the options of muscle transfer operations and above elbow amputation have to be considered <EOS>

<SOS> fractures of the atlas account for 1 2 of all vertebral fractures <EOS>
<SOS> we divide atlas fractures into <NUM> groups isolated fractures of the anterior arch of the atlas isolated fractures of the posterior arch combined fractures of the anterior and posterior arch so called jefferson fractures isolated fractures of the lateral mass and fractures of the transverse process <EOS>
<SOS> isolated fractures of the anterior or posterior arch are benign and are treated conservatively with a soft collar until the neck pain has disappeared <EOS>
<SOS> jefferson fractures are divided into stable and unstable fracture depending on the integrity of the transverse ligament <EOS>
<SOS> stable jefferson fractures are treated conservatively with good outcome while unstable jefferson fractures are probably best treated operatively with a posterior atlanto axial or occipito axial stabilization and fusion <EOS>
<SOS> the authors preferred treatment modality is the immediate open reduction of the dislocated lateral masses combined with a stabilization in the reduced position using a transarticular screw fixation c1 c2 according to magerl <EOS>
<SOS> this has the advantage of saving the atlanto occipital joints and offering an immediate stability which makes immobilization in an halo or minerva cast superfluous <EOS>
<SOS> in late instabilities c1 2 with incongruency of the lateral masses occurring after primary conservative treatment an occipito cervical fusion is indicated <EOS>
<SOS> isolated fractures of the lateral masses are very rare and may if the lateral mass is totally destroyed be a reason for an occipito cervical fusion <EOS>
<SOS> fractures of the transverse processes may be the cause for a thrombosis of the vertebral artery <EOS>
<SOS> no treatment is necessary for the fracture itself <EOS>
<SOS> reported is the case of a 36 year old man with neurofibromatosis type <NUM> with lethal haemorrhage from rupture of the left common iliac artery <EOS>
<SOS> histologically and immunohistochemically no hints on angiodysplasia as a possible cause of bleeding were detected <EOS>
<SOS> considering the literature and the histological findings in the area of rupture a local weakness of the vascular wall caused by the neighbouring neurofibromatous proliferates was most probably the reason for bleeding <EOS>
<SOS> we report on a 2 year old girl with chronic bullous disease of childhood cbdc <EOS>
<SOS> concomitantly with a feverish gastrointestinal infection caused by salmonella enteritidis the child presented with lesions resembling impetigo contagiosa on the legs and face <EOS>
<SOS> following antibiotic treatment with cephalosporins p o <EOS>
<SOS> she developed typical symptoms of cbdc i e <EOS>
<SOS> tense blisters on erythematous skin in the perineal area on the flexor aspects of the thighs and upper arms and on the face <EOS>

<SOS> fractures and dislocations of the elbow are some of the most common injuries in childhood and adolescence <EOS>
<SOS> the majority occur in sport and play activities e g a fall from gymnastics apparatus or a bike or from popular sports items such as skateboards or in line skates <EOS>
<SOS> the injuries can be divided into pure dislocations of the joint and fractures of the distal humerus proximal radius and ulna or combinations of both <EOS>
<SOS> in addition extra and intraarticular fracture types are defined with the latter as partial or complete joint lesions <EOS>
<SOS> dislocations of the elbow joint or the radial head can occur as single injuries or in combination with a fracture <EOS>
<SOS> supracondylar fractures and avulsion fractures of the medial epicondyle are the most frequent extraarticular lesions of the distal humerus <EOS>
<SOS> fractures of the lateral condyle prevail is incomplete intraarticular lesions <EOS>
<SOS> in the forearm radial head and neck fractures are predominant while typical and atypical monteggia injuries have a special status <EOS>
<SOS> the complex joint construction and the age dependent appearance of the epiphyseal ossification centers sometimes make a correct radiological diagnosis difficult <EOS>
<SOS> the trauma history and an exact clinical examination help to verify the injury as do comparative x ray studies of the uninjured side when necessary but not routinely <EOS>
<SOS> unlike other anatomical areas most elbow injuries even in the growing skeleton are treated operatively <EOS>
<SOS> hereby the growth plates have to be respected using minimal amounts of small implants <EOS>
<SOS> additional immobilization in a cast for <NUM> <NUM> weeks is necessary in most cases but does not lead to a functional deficit in contrast to adults <EOS>
<SOS> the implants should be removed as early as possible <EOS>

<SOS> the rate of long term complications increases in cases of untreated displacement of fragments or joint instability <EOS>
<SOS> corrective measures are performed only in selected cases and after the growth plates are closed <EOS>

<SOS> endothelins are peptides with powerful vasoconstrictor and mitogenic properties <EOS>

<SOS> brain infarctions lesions in cerebral microangiopathy and occlusions of the carotid artery with very poor collateralization showed definite differences in perfusion imaging compared with normal controls <EOS>
<SOS> however our results show that acceleration of the imaging sequence and optimization of the contrast bolus and data processing are prerequisites for the clinical use of this method which in principle may provide information on the absolute cerebral blood volume and even blood flow <EOS>

<SOS> for the maintenance of muscle relaxation vecuronium bromide was used <EOS>
<SOS> all patients were given droperidol to prevent postoperative emesis and they were artifically ventilated with n2o o2 60 40 to normal end expiratory co2 concentrations <EOS>
<SOS> no anticholinergic agents were used at the end of operation since they are known to interfere with bowel motility <EOS>
<SOS> in order to determine gastro intestinal motility the h2 exhalation test was used <EOS>
<SOS> for this purpose <NUM> g lactulose in <NUM> ml of water was given to all patients via a gastral tube shortly before extubation <EOS>
<SOS> lactulose is broken down by bacteria once it enters the colon and h2 is released taken up by the vascular system and exhaled <EOS>
<SOS> postoperatively patients were asked to exhale into a 20 ml syringe every <NUM> min <EOS>
<SOS> the content was analysed for hydrogen ppm using an electrochemical sensor gmi exhaled hydrogen monitor <EOS>
<SOS> from the time of lactulose instillation to a threefold increase in endexpiratory hydrogen concentration compared to the preoperative value gastro coecal transit time was computed <EOS>
<SOS> all three groups of patients were comparable in age height and body weight <EOS>
<SOS> also the duration of operation was comparable in all three groups <EOS>
<SOS> mean gastro coecal transit time was <NUM> <NUM> sd min following enflurane <NUM> <NUM> sd min following fentanyl midazolam and <NUM> <NUM> sd min following ketamine midazolam anaesthesia <EOS>
<SOS> the gastro intestinal inhibition after the opioid based anaesthetic technique was significantly prolonged p0 001 kruskal wallis test <EOS>
<SOS> there was no significance between patients after ketamine based anaesthesia and those who had the volatile anaesthetic <EOS>
<SOS> when using intravenous anaesthesia with an opioid gastro intestinal inhibition especially in patients prone to have constipation is likely to develop postoperatively <EOS>
<SOS> in classical neuroleptanaesthesia and in analgosedation in the icu the simultaneous use of the butyrophenone droperidol seems to counteract the inhibition of opioid related gastrointestinal motility <EOS>
<SOS> in cases of opioid related gastrointestinal atonia a gastrokinetic compound may be necessary to overcome this effect on intestinal motility <EOS>

<SOS> syringe drivers are used in anaesthetics intensive care and emergency medicine to deliver small volumes of highly potent drugs with continuous constant and reproducible flow <EOS>
<SOS> for early recognition of interruptions of the drug delivery caused by occlusion of the infusion system an alarm is triggered as soon as the system pressure exceeds a certain limit <EOS>
<SOS> the sensitivity of this alarm depends on the flow rate type specific cut off pressure and the elastic parameters of the infusion system <EOS>
<SOS> the sudden release of pressure built up in the system after occlusion occurred can cause delivery of an uncontrolled drug bolus and hence an additional hazard <EOS>
<SOS> methods six syringe drivers that are widely used in clinical practice were tested for alarm delay and bolus delivery in the event of an occlusion in the system <EOS>
<SOS> first the alarm pressures at flow rates of 10 <NUM> and <NUM> ml h were measured <EOS>
<SOS> then the alarm delay time and bolus volumes post occlusion were assessed using a basic infusion system syringe single infusion set <EOS>
<SOS> finally several alterations to the system like extension tap battery with germ filters or branching were made and their impact on alarm delay and bolus volume measured <EOS>
<SOS> results because of the great differences in alarm pressures between the devices tested there were marked differences in the alarm delay at same flow rates <EOS>
<SOS> predictably there was an indirect proportional link between alarm delay and flow rate <EOS>
<SOS> using the basic infusion system alarm delays between <NUM> s and <NUM> min were measured <EOS>
<SOS> in two of the tested syringe drivers a pressure release mechanism is activated with the pressure alarm which prevented bolus application <EOS>
<SOS> in the other devices release of the pressure in the occluded system caused boli of 0 5 7 ml <EOS>
<SOS> variations in the actual syringe volume and insertion of a second connection tube had no impact on alarm delay and bolus volume <EOS>
<SOS> tap batteries parallel running syringe drivers or trapped air in the system however caused marked increase in both alarm delay 107 and bolus volume 147 <EOS>
<SOS> discussion unidentified occlusions of the system cause grave malfunctioning of syringe drivers <EOS>
<SOS> while applying highly potent drugs the discontinuation of drug delivery with subsequent bolus application can cause vital danger to the patient <EOS>
<SOS> as a result of the significant time delays in the pressure alarms the devices tested do not provide sufficient protection against unrecognized system occlusion <EOS>
<SOS> syringe drivers with adjustable alarm pressure can be set close to the actual infusion pressure <EOS>
<SOS> a further important point is that one should aim at a reduction in the elastic properties of the infusion set because of the great impact on alarm delay and bolus volume <EOS>

<SOS> classical stable plate osteosynthesis with its anatomical repositioning absolute stability between fragments and medial support should only be applied to joint fractures and spongy bone <EOS>
<SOS> in cortical bone the anatomical reposition connected with the plate promotes bone necrosis along the fracture and prevents callus formation <EOS>
<SOS> direct cortical synthesis a method also known as primary bone healing serves the bone is revascularisation and is not necessarily aimed at healing <EOS>
<SOS> thus this may also be termed necrosis healing <EOS>
<SOS> along the shaft of long bones elastic plate osteosynthesis a biological method is safer than and superior to the rigid technique <EOS>
<SOS> this even applies to short oblique and transverse fractures insofar as nailing does not appear feasible <EOS>
<SOS> elasticity is achieved by leaving a flexible stretch of at least <NUM> <NUM> holes i e <EOS>
<SOS> as long as possible without screws over the fracture and by employing a titanium plate <EOS>
<SOS> thus there is no punctate fatigue leading to plate breakage <EOS>
<SOS> the fitting of third fragments is deliberately left out <EOS>
<SOS> the same applies to all kinds of compression with lag screws tension devices or dc gliding holes and this with the intention of allowing micromovements in the fracture is fissure <EOS>
<SOS> periost and muscle are not removed and the fracture is not examined <EOS>
<SOS> healing occurs spontaneously via a fixating callus forming within the first <NUM> <NUM> weeks out of the periost soft tissue combination <EOS>
<SOS> histomorphological investigation dates the first woven bone bridges between the fragments to <NUM> weeks subsequent to the accident <EOS>
<SOS> in göttingen university trauma centre <NUM> fractures have been attended to over <NUM> years using this technique <EOS>
<SOS> despite considerable soft tissue damage no delayed bone healing pseudoarthrosis or bone infection has been observed <EOS>
<SOS> the risks of elastic plate osteosynthesis lie in unbiological and exaggerated reposition methods too short a flexible stretch and insufficient anchorage of the screws <EOS>

<SOS> the main cations identified were sodium 134 <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> mmol l and potassium <NUM> 37 <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> mmol l and as anions chloride 183 <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> mmol l and bicarbonate 10 <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> mmol l <EOS>
<SOS> the ph value of the pus liquid was <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> <MOB> <EOS>
<SOS> the calculated mean osmotic pressure of the pus liquid was <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> mm hg whereas the measured physical pressure inside the abscess was <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> mm hg <EOS>
<SOS> both pressure types show time dependent pressure curves <EOS>
<SOS> with time the real pressure inside the abscess cavity increases whereas the osmotic pressure decreases <EOS>
<SOS> there was no relationship between the two pressure types and the different species of microorganisms responsible for the inflammation <EOS>
<SOS> the results of the study reveal that abscesses can be regarded as osmotically active systems and the mechanism by which the abscess is formed might be as follows <EOS>
<SOS> after penetration of virulent microorganisms into the tissue space the area of acute inflammation is walled off by the collection of inflammatory cells <EOS>
<SOS> destruction of tissue by products of the polymorphonuclear leucozytes takes place and results in liquefactive necrosis and a hypertonic abscess cavity <EOS>
<SOS> the inwards directed flow of tissue fluids into the cavity via the abscess membrane causes volume expansion and generates pressure two facts that can explain the swelling dynamics and typical symptoms of abscesses in the maxillofacial area <EOS>

<SOS> this study represents a feasable surgical method to evaluate the effectiveness of the ima graft function by temperature measurement of the heart during warm reperfusion after hypothermic cardioplegia <EOS>
<SOS> twenty five patients with multi vessel coronary artery disease underwent coronary artery bypass grafting using the ima as an arterial graft to the left anterior descending coronary artery and saphenous vein grafts to the remaining coronary arteries <EOS>
<SOS> distal anastomoses were installed during cold intermittent blood cardioplegic <NUM> arrest <EOS>
<SOS> after unclamping the aorta and ima graft the temperatures in cardiac front and rear sides were measured during the first five minutes of warm reperfusion <EOS>
<SOS> a sufficient ima graft function was expressed by a typical rise of temperature the cardiac front and rear sides showed a parabolic and exponential course respectively <EOS>
<SOS> the rewarming speed expressed as the first derivative of temperature over time led to a sharp and early peak for the front side and a smaller and delayed peak for the rear side <EOS>
<SOS> an insufficient ima graft function could be recognized by atypical temperature courses <EOS>

<SOS> clinical parameters were compared between both groups as well as with respect to different age groups <EOS>
<SOS> results there were no differences in terms of operative results operative time pre and postoperative hemoglobin between the laparoscopy group and open nephrectomy group as well as among the different age groups <EOS>
<SOS> patients in the laparoscopy group demonstrated significant advantages with respect to blood loss transfusion rate analgesic consumption hospital stay and convalescence <EOS>
<SOS> these advantages were not related to patient age <EOS>
<SOS> the complication rate was comparable for both groups however both groups showed an elevation of the complication rate in the age groups <NUM> to <NUM> years <EOS>
<SOS> the mortality rate within the first <NUM> days after nephrectomy was 1 7 in the open nephrectomy group <EOS>
<SOS> conclusions the laparoscopic nephrectomy offers comparable operative results with less blood loss and a lower transfusion rate when compared to open nephrectomy <EOS>
<SOS> in terms of postoperative parameters patients in the laparoscopy group have significant advantages <EOS>
<SOS> especially geriatric patients benefit from these advantages and therefore the laparoscopic approach should be the preferred technique for a nephrectomy in these patients <EOS>

<SOS> autocapture is a newly developed automatic threshold tracking algorithm implemented in implantable pacemakers <EOS>
<SOS> based on the detection of the cardiac evoked response autocapture continuously controls the effectiveness of stimulation <EOS>
<SOS> increases in threshold are immediately followed by an adaption of the pulse amplitude <EOS>
<SOS> automatic threshold tests periodically lower the amplitude in order to adapt to decreased thresholds <EOS>
<SOS> thus changes in threshold can be monitored over a long period and utilized as a diagnostic tool <EOS>
<SOS> this case report demonstrates the diagnosis and monitoring of a microdislodgement by means of autocapture <EOS>

<SOS> indication and operative technique of these three procedures are described in detail <EOS>

<SOS> in clubfeet the os calcis is usually too short and the medial opening wedge osteotomy provokes skin problems <EOS>
<SOS> in these cases an osteotomy according to mitchell with lateral displacement of the tuber calcanei is more suitable <EOS>

<SOS> if these procedures are carried out carefully they have low complications rates <EOS>

<SOS> definition of the problem in parallel with public and philosophical discussions there is an ongoing debate about euthanasia in theological ethics <EOS>
<SOS> in this situation it is helpful to provide a systematic overview of the different arguments and judgements <EOS>
<SOS> arguments a short introduction is followed by a first part dealing with the definition of terms <EOS>
<SOS> the second and major part concerning normative arguments is subdivided into three steps the level of principles the more concrete level of actions and finally the level of social consequences <EOS>
<SOS> the third part presents some reflections following the eudaimonistic ethical tradition the ethics of a good life and death focusing on the central question how to find meaning in life when faced with suffering <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion it would be fruitful to intensify the ethical reflection both on the problems concerning the foundations of social life especially the meaning of dignity autonomy and inviolability of human life and social consequences of a liberal practice of euthanasia <EOS>
<SOS> in this context ethicists are challenged to reflect on the different approaches to what is or can be a good life and a human death <EOS>

<SOS> nevertheless successful strategies for radiation therapy may need to take into account the tissue of origin and the status of p53 in the tumor <EOS>
<SOS> the human cartilage and bone is characterized by a remodeling during the life well balanced by neosynthesis and degradation of matrix components <EOS>
<SOS> in different joint diseases it becomes imbalanced and the destruction of the cartilage supersedes the repair <EOS>
<SOS> in tissue processes in disease and in normal turnover of the matrix these molecules are fragmented and released into surrounding fluids in the synovial fluid and then in the blood and the urin where they can be detected <EOS>
<SOS> the quantitative measurement in the synovial fluid is more specific than in the other body fluids <EOS>
<SOS> the research process in recent years has suggested that these molecular markers of cartilage and bone matrix metabolism can be used to determine diagnosis the disease severity rather than its presence or absence the prognosis and the response to therapy <EOS>
<SOS> they should help to identify the disease mechanism in different joint diseases not only on the tissue but also on the molecular level <EOS>
<SOS> the specific cartilage matrix markers promise to become useful tools in the future in clinical use <EOS>
<SOS> the research in this area is still in the early stages with most results dated from the end of the 1980s and the 1990s <EOS>
<SOS> axillary block is a common anaesthetic technique for operations on the hand and forearm <EOS>
<SOS> in our hospital with many trainees in anaesthesia only <NUM> <NUM> axillary blocks per year are performed by about <NUM> colleagues <EOS>
<SOS> this implies a small number of blocks for each anaesthetist <EOS>
<SOS> the present study was designed to assess whether it is possible to teach this technique and use it with an adequate degree of success under these conditions <EOS>
<SOS> we used a nerve stimulator and studied whether the success of the block under these conditions is independent of anaesthetist is experience in this technique <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore we examined other factors involved in the success of the block <EOS>
<SOS> the study included <NUM> patients subjected to elective surgery of the upper extremity all received an axillary block <EOS>
<SOS> we used a nerve stimulator and injected mepivacaine 1 without adrenaline <EOS>
<SOS> the following parameters were recorded the number of blocks to date performed by the anaesthetist the minimal current required for nerve stimulation the dose of local anaesthetic the time between the end of injection and the beginning of surgery the duration of surgery and the quality of sensory and motor blockade after 10 20 and <NUM> min <EOS>
<SOS> sensory blockade was assessed by the pinprick method no blockade analgesia anaesthesia motor blockade was judged by comparing the muscle strength of both arms no blockade paresis paralysis <EOS>
<SOS> data were analyzed using the mann whitney test with p0 05 considered statistically significant <EOS>
<SOS> of the <NUM> blocks <NUM> 85 were successful <NUM> 15 failed and the patients required general anaesthesia <EOS>
<SOS> eight of the successful blocks showed a decrease in analgesic quality after 70 min and required additional analgesics or general anaesthesia <EOS>
<SOS> we found no correlation between the experience of the anaesthetist and the success of the block <EOS>
<SOS> the minimal required current for nerve stimulation in the success group was <NUM> ma and differed significantly from the value of <NUM> ma in the failure group table 3 <EOS>
<SOS> the dose of mepivacaine was higher in the success group 5 9 vs <NUM> mg kg <EOS>
<SOS> complete sensory blockade was more frequently achieved for the median ulnar and radial nerves than for the musculocutaneous and cutaneous brachii medialis fig <EOS>
<SOS> the frequency of complete sensory blockade anaesthesia had increased by 21 9 between the 20th and 30th min <EOS>
<SOS> complete motor blockade was less often achieved than sensory blockade fig <EOS>
<SOS> using the method of electrostimulation the axillary block is an appropriate anaesthetic technique that can be applied in a hospital where each anaesthetist only occasionally performs it <EOS>
<SOS> prior to injection of the local anaesthetic the current for nerve stimulation should be reduced to 0 5 ma <EOS>
<SOS> the time between the end of injection and the beginning of surgery should be no less than <NUM> min because complete sensory blockade can more often be achieved <EOS>
<SOS> the dose of mepivacaine should be no less than <NUM> mg kg body weight <EOS>
<SOS> vascular endothelial growth factor vegf was discovered <NUM> years ago as a growth factor that can regulate angiogenesis and in addition the permeability of blood vessels <EOS>
<SOS> numerous studies have revealed that it is essential for normal embryonic development and that it plays a major role in physiological and pathological events of angiogenesis in adults <EOS>
<SOS> it is unique in that its expression is regulated directly by hypoxia <EOS>
<SOS> these properties are now being exploited in attempts aimed at the induction of new blood vessels in pathological situations such as ischemic heart disease <EOS>
<SOS> five vegf forms of <NUM> to <NUM> amino acids are produced from a single gene by alternative splicing <EOS>
<SOS> cells expressing vegf usually express several forms simultaneously <EOS>
<SOS> vegf121 does not contain exons <NUM> and <NUM> of the gene and consequently lacks a heparin binding ability <EOS>
<SOS> however this form is fully <NUM> active as an inducer of angiogenesis and as a blood vessel permeabilizing agent <EOS>
<SOS> exon <NUM> and <NUM> contain <NUM> independent heparin binding domains <EOS>
<SOS> the vegf form containing exon <NUM> vegf165 and the vascular endothelial growth factor form containing exon <NUM> vegf145 display similar biological potencies raising the question of why so many vegf forms are required <EOS>
<SOS> it was found that vegf121 diffuses better because it does not bind to heparan sulfate proteoglycans <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast vegf145 binds to extracellular matrix ad is released from it slowly <EOS>
<SOS> when the receptor binding properties of vegf121 and vegf165 were compared it was found that vegf165 binds to a class of vegf receptors that is not recognized by vegf121 <EOS>
<SOS> these receptors are encoded by the neuropilin 1 gene and we have recently found that the related neuropilin 2 gene also encodes a vegf165 receptor <EOS>
<SOS> we have recently found evidence indicating the neuropilins form complexes with another vegf receptor vegfr 1 <EOS>
<SOS> however the biological function of this complex remains to be elucidated <EOS>

<SOS> the typical clinical features of myasthenia gravis are weakness and excessive fatiguability of striated muscles that increases during the course of the day or after strenous exercise <EOS>
<SOS> ocular muscle involvement with ptosis in 50 and diplopia in 25 are the most common initial signs <EOS>
<SOS> the disease can progress to bulbar muscles and to all other striated muscles generalized myasthenia <EOS>
<SOS> the muscle fatiguability and a fluctuating course can mislead to a diagnosis of neurasthenia <EOS>
<SOS> since the treatment of myasthenia gravis is directed at the pathogenetic mechanisms of the disease an early diagnosis is of great significance for the course of the disease <EOS>
<SOS> also a false positive diagnosis of myasthenia has to be avoided because of the potentially hazardous side effects of the therapy <EOS>
<SOS> the mainstay of the diagnosis is the history and a subtle clinical examination with tests of excessive muscle fatiguability <EOS>
<SOS> the injection of edrophonium tensilon the electrodiagnostic testing after repitive stimulation decrement test and the testing for serum antibodies against acetylcholin receptors have to be performed to secure the diagnosis of myasthenia <EOS>
<SOS> the edrophonium test and the decrement test can yield false positive results in other neuromuscular diseases <EOS>
<SOS> antibodies are present in 50 of ocular myasthenia and in 80 90 of the generalized form <EOS>
<SOS> the lambert eaton myasthenic syndrome other neuromuscular diseases mitochondrial diseases diseases of the cranial nerves botulism and the rare congenital myasthenic syndromes have to be considered as differential diagnosis <EOS>

<SOS> vasculitides are rare diseases characterized by inflammation of blood vessels <EOS>
<SOS> according to diameter of the blood vessels involved in the inflammatory process the clinical presentation and the histological appearance different vasculitic syndromes may be distinguished <EOS>
<SOS> primary vasculitides are of unknown origin while secondary vasculitides may be caused by drugs malignancy or infection <EOS>
<SOS> panarteriitis nodosa caused by chronic hepatitis b and mixed cryoglobulinemia secondary to chronic hepatitis c are classical examples of vasculitides triggered by infections <EOS>
<SOS> however these are rare complications of chronic viral hepatitis <EOS>
<SOS> patients infected by hiv frequently suffer from vasculitis which may be caused by opportunistic infections and by defects in immune regulation <EOS>
<SOS> in numerous case reports various other infectious particles have been reported to cause different forms of vasculitis either by direct infection of endothelial cells or by induction of an immunologic process leading to blood vessel destruction <EOS>
<SOS> immunologically mediated vasculitis secondary to infection may be due to a predisposing reactivity of the patient is immune system <EOS>
<SOS> after successful treatment of the infection the vasculitis usually subsides <EOS>
<SOS> therefore all patients with vasculitis should be evaluated for underlying infection <EOS>

<SOS> the draining sinus is an unpleasant complication of acne conglobata acne fulminans acne inversa rosacea conglobata and rosacea fulminans pyoderma faciale <EOS>
<SOS> it is most common on the face especially in the nasolabial folds and on the neck below the mandibular line <EOS>
<SOS> clinically it is an elongated 2 5 cm long elevated periodically inflamed lesion which sporadically discharges pus <EOS>
<SOS> the lesion persists with no tendency to spontaneous regression <EOS>
<SOS> histopathologically it consists of elaborate epithelialized galleries connected to the skin surface at multiple points <EOS>
<SOS> it contains corneocytes hairs bacteria serum inflammatory cells and epitheloid granulomas <EOS>
<SOS> a surgical thread placed into the skin provides a model in which the generation of sinus tracts can be studied <EOS>
<SOS> intralesional corticosteroid injection cryosurgery and isotretinoin are not always very effective <EOS>
<SOS> sometimes complete excision of the lesion is necessary <EOS>
<SOS> the draining sinus is a special form of scar analogous to the pilonidal cyst <EOS>
<SOS> a thoracic outlet syndrome is only rarely caused by osseous anomalies <EOS>
<SOS> instead it is a soft tissue disease where the c8 and t1 roots or the proximal inferior trunk of the brachial plexus are compressed by fibromuscular anomalies between the inferior cervical spine and the first rib or pleura <EOS>
<SOS> thoracic outlet syndrome is a clinical diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> if surgery is recommended it should be concentrated on the fibromuscular anomalies and not on the first rib <EOS>
<SOS> transaxillary removal of the first rib carries an important risk of serious complications <EOS>
<SOS> among these brachial plexus injury is the most frequent one <EOS>
