<SOS> intraartial conduction disturbances iacd are the known substrate of re entrant atrial arrhythmias and their diagnosis is important for the selection of proper therapy <EOS>
<SOS> signs of iacd can be missed on the standard ecg and signal averaged sa p wave analysis has proved valuable for the evaluation of electrophysiological eps properties of atrial myocardium <EOS>
<SOS> unfavourable eps effects of raa pacing are known to electrophysiologists but this aspect is rarely considered in normal practice and raa based pacing modes remain standard even for pts <EOS>
<SOS> we examined and compared eps effects of different atrial pacing modes using two diagnostic tools iegm obtained from two atrial leads of biatrial pacing system via telemetry and time domain analysis of sa p wave in <NUM> pts <EOS>
<SOS> with bia pacing system implanted due to atrial arrhythmias and iacd <EOS>
<SOS> the results showed that different atrial pacing modes influence atrial activation timing parameters differently raa pacing aggravates iacd in comparison to sinus rhythm the effects of cs pacing is less visible <EOS>
<SOS> bia pacing normalises all atrial activation times <EOS>
<SOS> the normalisation of sa p wave duration reduction of sa p wave dispersion increasing of rms <NUM> and decreasing of las <NUM> and finally abolition of presence of late atrial potentials in most of pts <EOS>
<SOS> indicates beneficial effects of bia pacing in pts <EOS>
<SOS> with iacd in comparison to sinus rhythm and raa pacing <EOS>
<SOS> unfavourable eps effects of raa pacing in patients with iacd indicates suitability the need for alternative resynchronising atrial pacing modes <EOS>
<SOS> time domain analysis of sa p wave is a valuable and sensitive diagnostic tool for non invasive evaluation of eps effects of different modes of atrial pacing <EOS>

<SOS> chronic lymphoplasmacellular osteomyelitis may occur in children adolescents and adults but has not been found in newborns or babies either in our series or in the literature <EOS>
<SOS> symptoms suggesting an acute disease like fever are uncommon but a primary chronic course with symptomatic and asymptomatic periods is typical <EOS>
<SOS> pain and swelling are the main symptoms painless masses are rare <EOS>
<SOS> in children and adolescents the clavicle and metaphyseal regions of long bones are typical sites of chronic abacterial osteomyelitis <EOS>
<SOS> in adults the clavicles or the first two ribs are mainly affected with synovitis of the adjacent joints but the long bones are rarely involved <EOS>
<SOS> laboratory findings are non specific but important for the differential diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> the sedimentation rate and c reactive protein might be elevated <EOS>
<SOS> the x ray examination shows osteolytic sclerotic or mixed bony changes and in case of a diaphyseal involvement onionskinlike periosteal bone formation may be present suggesting a malignant process <EOS>
<SOS> in late stages sclerotic bone formations may be seen as a rest <EOS>
<SOS> uni or multifocal lesions can be detected by bonescan as can asymptomatic lesions <EOS>
<SOS> magnetic resonance imaging shows gross signal intensity differences both in the bone and perifocal soft tissue and involvement of the synovium with gadolinium dpta enhancement in t1 weighted images <EOS>
<SOS> in early stages of the disease granulocytes microabscesses and new bone formations might suggest bacterial osteomyelitis that cannot be differentiated by histology <EOS>
<SOS> in intermediate phases lymphocytic and plasmacellular infiltrates are found whereas in late phases sclerotic bone formations and fibrosis of the bone marrow are seen histologically <EOS>
<SOS> in chronic lymphoplasmacellular osteomyelitis all clinical radiological and histological findings as well as negative bacteriological cultures are mandatory and will allow a definitive diagnosis to be made <EOS>
<SOS> the disease may be uni or multifocal and new bone lesions may occur over time as well as skin manifestations which can be found years before or after bone involvement <EOS>
<SOS> the association with dermatological diseases and or synovitis led to the acronym sapho syndrome synovitis acne pustulosis hyperostosis osteomyelitis <EOS>
<SOS> for the treatment non steroidal anti inflammatory drugs are effective for pain relief reduction of swelling and dysfunction <EOS>
<SOS> antibiotics have been used in several series and are not effective <EOS>
<SOS> major surgery is not recommended even for recurrences and the prognosis for growth and function is excellent in the long term despite recurrences over several years <EOS>

<SOS> tmlr transmyocardial laser revascularization is a disputed cardiosurgical technique available in europe since <NUM> that aims to deliver additional blood flow to ischemic myocardium from the left heart chamber <EOS>
<SOS> goal of our study is morphological examination of laser channels in human hearts to answer the questions are there patent laser channels with communication to the left chamber and to intramural vessels <EOS>
<SOS> we examined hearts of <NUM> patients who died during the first <NUM> days after tmlr <EOS>
<SOS> channels were examined in histological serial sections under the light microscope <EOS>
<SOS> laser channels in the first days postoperatively have a lumen diameter of about <NUM> mm and are surrounded by coagulation necrosis about <NUM> µm thick <EOS>
<SOS> despite phagocytic removal of necrotic tissue the lumen diameter decreases during the following two weeks <EOS>
<SOS> open intramyocardial channels can be shown in all patients <EOS>
<SOS> these channels communicate with intramural vessels but in no instance with chamber lumen <EOS>
<SOS> our results suggest that clinical benefits are based on improved distribution of coronary blood <EOS>
<SOS> additional blood is not delivered from left chamber lumen to the myocardium <EOS>
<SOS> however our patients represent the small subgroup of the deceased <EOS>
<SOS> if similar observations can be made in the majority of patients living symptomfree after tmlr remains open <EOS>
<SOS> recurrent miscarriages are like sporadically occurring miscarriage often approx <EOS>
<SOS> 50 due to chromosomal aberrations <EOS>
<SOS> an undefined proportion of the other half may be due to immunological incompliances <EOS>
<SOS> the basis for this assumption is the fact that the maternal immune system recognizes paternal antigens and rejects them <EOS>
<SOS> the initial hypothesis that such immune reaction is due to a high similarity between the maternal and paternal hla systems hla sharing is most likely incorrect <EOS>
<SOS> nevertheless the incomplete recognition of the fetus by the maternal immune system and the resulting insufficient protection is basis for the active immune therapy with partner or donor lymphocytes <EOS>
<SOS> several placebo controlled studies have been performed <EOS>
<SOS> due to the small number of cases results were not significant <EOS>
<SOS> a metaanalysis of all studies however proves significant effects of the active immune therapy <EOS>
<SOS> the risks of active immune therapy led to the development of passive immune therapy with immune globulins ivig <EOS>
<SOS> this therapy however is relatively expensive and obviously no more successful than the active immune therapy <EOS>
<SOS> in a metaanalysis of all published results ivig was not significantly more effective than treatment with placebo <EOS>
<SOS> the indication for both forms of immune therapy is given after <NUM> or more consecutive abortions after exclusion of other reasons for these abortions <EOS>
<SOS> it appears that only primary aborting patients are suitable for active immune therapy <EOS>
<SOS> athough the concept of immune therapy is still under debate alternative concepts are not available <EOS>
<SOS> hence new therapeutic approaches are also not available <EOS>
<SOS> the first electronic implantable hearing aids for patients with hearing loss are coupled to the ossicular chain or perilymph during implantation and are now available <EOS>
<SOS> our new tübingen implant designed for sensorineural hearing loss snhl is the combination of an implantable microphone and piezotransducer <EOS>
<SOS> to avoid hearing losses during implantation the tübingen piezotransducer will be 1 fixed to the mastoid cavity and 2 positioned to one of the ossicular target points <EOS>
<SOS> this can be done with a micromanipulator which will be implanted together with transducer and microphone in the mastoid cavity <EOS>
<SOS> the manipulator weights <NUM> g with four degrees of freedom it allows highly secure and safe positioning of the transducer is probe tip to the ossicular chain under close to stereotactic conditions <EOS>
<SOS> the main advantages of the present micromanipulator are 1 easy handling during surgery 2 the transducer is precise positioning to the ossicular target point with sufficient degrees of freedom and 3 the transducer is stable fixation in the mastoid cavity in the final position <EOS>
<SOS> following integrated safety as the leading principle ossicular or inner ear injuries caused e g by the patient is head movement or unintentional manual contact by the surgeon are minimized <EOS>
<SOS> the micromanipulator is as it were the surgeon is vibration free artificial hand <EOS>
<SOS> the manipulator is development and its optimization to the mastoid cavity by test implantation in <NUM> human temporal bones are shown in detail <EOS>
<SOS> while coupling the transducer to the body of the incus transducer microphone and micromanipulator can be implanted into 76 of all mastoid cavities without protrusion <EOS>
<SOS> in the case of transducers coupling to the long process of the incus the protrusion free implantation rate of the above mentioned three implant modules is 78 <EOS>
<SOS> the role of neuroimaging in the acute setting of head trauma is to diagnose the extent of intracranial injury and to identify all lesions which require urgent neurosurgical treatment <EOS>
<SOS> computed tomography ct remains the most important diagnostic tool for initial screening of trauma victims <EOS>
<SOS> although magnetic resonance imaging mr has higher sensitivity to most traumatic lesions than ct due to the ease and speed of ct and the fact that sufficient monitoring of critically ill patients during the examination is much easier with ct than with mr mean that mr is not the imaging modality of choice for the initial diagnostic work up <EOS>
<SOS> recent mr techniques such as flair or diffusion imaging further improve the sensitivity of mr in head trauma <EOS>
<SOS> conventional angiography is currently indicated only for few suspected vascular lesions e g <EOS>
<SOS> traumatic arterio venous fistulas vascular dissections <EOS>
<SOS> injuries to the posterior cruciate ligament are among the major injuries to the knee joint <EOS>
<SOS> today we are often confronted with an inapproprate and delayed diagnosis of this injury and its concomitant lesions <EOS>
<SOS> additionally the outcome of operative treatment has not yet reached an acceptable rate of satisfactory results <EOS>
<SOS> therefore the goal of this current concept review is to give a comprehensive insight into anatomy and biomechanics injury mechanisms and pathobiomechanics based on our experiences and data from the international literature <EOS>
<SOS> a further goal is to clarify diagnostic problems with respect to clinical examination and imaging techniques <EOS>
<SOS> we also present a differential concept for the perioperative and conservative management of posterior cruciate ligament deficient knees in order to also adequately address concomitant injuries such as posterolateral rotatory instability and combined anterior cruciate ligament injuries with the aim of further improving results <EOS>
<SOS> sevoflurane like all currently used volatile anaesthetics is degraded by carbon dioxide absorbents <EOS>
<SOS> the most significant degradant is a haloalkene known trivially as compound a <EOS>
<SOS> compound a is nephrotoxic in rats and at higher doses in nonhuman primates causing proximal tubular necrosis <EOS>
<SOS> there has been much interest in the potential for compound a toxicity in humans <EOS>
<SOS> inhaled compound a concentrations are greatest at low flow rates high sevoflurane concentrations warmer absorbent barium hydroxide vs soda lime and drier absorbent <EOS>
<SOS> typical inspired compound a concentrations during low flow and closed circuit sevoflurane anaesthesia in humans are 8 24 and 20 32 ppm with soda lime and barium hydroxide lime respectively <EOS>
<SOS> renal effects of compound a production during sevoflurane anesthesia have been examined in surgical patients and volunteers using standard creatinine clearance serum bun and creatinine and experimental urine excretion of protein glucose nag gst aap markers of renal function <EOS>
<SOS> investigations to date in surgical patients show similar renal effects of low flow sevoflurane low flow isoflurane or high flow sevoflurane <EOS>
<SOS> there have been no case reports of compound a associated renal injury in humans <EOS>
<SOS> in volunteers one study found changes in experimental but not conventional renal markers while other investigations show no significant changes in either standard or experimental markers <EOS>
<SOS> the mechanism of compound a nephrotoxicity in rats appears to involve metabolism to glutathione and cysteine conjugates and their subsequent renal uptake and metabolism by pathways that are different in rats and humans <EOS>
<SOS> in the report of the <NUM> world health federation international society and federation of cardiology whf isfc task force on the definition and classification of cardiomyopathies the definition of heart muscle diseases was updated <EOS>
<SOS> idiopathic autoimmune and infectious forms of inflammatory cardiomyopathy are now recognized in this definition <EOS>
<SOS> enteroviruses adenoviruses and cytomegaloviruses are considered as main etiopathological factors in the pathogenesis of inflammatory heart disease <EOS>

<SOS> pulmonary embolism is a frequent and potentially life threatening event with uncharacteristic clinical manifestations <EOS>
<SOS> diagnosis is commonly established by ventilation perfusion scintigraphy and pulmonary angiography <EOS>
<SOS> both methods however carry substantial drawbacks <EOS>
<SOS> therefore clinicians claim that there is a need for an accurate and non invasive diagnostic modality <EOS>
<SOS> spiral ct of the pulmonary arteries is a recent modality that allows reliable visualization of emboli in pulmonary arteries up to fourth order branches <EOS>
<SOS> this paper reviews the technical aspects typical findings and diagnostic pitfalls of this recent technique <EOS>
<SOS> the potential role of spiral ct in the screening of patients with suspected pulmonary embolism is discussed and selected cases are presented <EOS>
<SOS> introduction interleukin 12 p70 il 12 p70 is a potent immunoregulatory cytokine composed of a heavy chain p40 and a light chain p35 <EOS>
<SOS> contradicting results have been reported with regard to leukocyte release and systemic concentration of il 12 after polytrauma <EOS>
<SOS> methods we daily analyzed systemic concentrations of il 12 in polytrauma patients n 37 mean iss 33 9 in comparison to healthy donor values during intensive care course by elisa <EOS>
<SOS> patients were divided according to their mean il 12 levels into those with elevated il 12 group 1 n 7 those with decreased il 12 group 2 n 4 and those with il 12 in the normal range group 3 n 26 <EOS>
<SOS> results patients in group <NUM> revealed elevated levels of il 12 up to p70 <NUM> pg ml and p40 <NUM> pg ml <EOS>
<SOS> the common clinical feature of group <NUM> was a thorax trauma in combination with pneumonia 85 survivors <EOS>
<SOS> patients with single thorax trauma or pneumonia without thorax trauma group 3 showed normal il 12 values <EOS>
<SOS> patients with decreased il 12 levels revealed also a thorax trauma and pneumonia but all patients succumbed <EOS>
<SOS> the groups significantly differ in their stay in the intensive care unit in tiss in mods score and in respiratory ratio but not in iss mean crp values and leukocyte counts <EOS>
<SOS> correlation analysis revealed no significant relation between systemically altered il 12 values and clinical parameters with the exception of a negative correlation of p70 and iss r <MOB> or mods score r <MOB> in group <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> conclusions after major injuries there is no overall suppression of il 12 formation <EOS>
<SOS> patients with normal or elevated il 12 levels belong mainly to the survivors whereas patients with decreased il 12 levels are at high risk of succumbing to multi organ failure <EOS>
<SOS> this article reviews the pathogenesis and clinical and imaging findings in shoulder impingement syndrome <EOS>
<SOS> shoulder impingement is caused by compression of the supraspinatus tendon underneath the coracoacromial arch mainly in forward flexion of the arm <EOS>
<SOS> different stages of impingement syndrome are described <EOS>
<SOS> stage i relates to edema and hemorrhage of the supraspinatus tendon <EOS>
<SOS> stage ii is characterized by bursal inflammation and fibrosis as well as tendinopathy <EOS>
<SOS> in stage ii there is a tear of the rotator cuff <EOS>
<SOS> moreover calcifying tendinitis fractures and pain originating from the cervical spine may mimic shoulder impingement syndrome <EOS>
<SOS> imaging is important for the exact diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> standard radiographs are the basis of imaging in shoulder impingement syndrome <EOS>
<SOS> they may demonstrate subchondral sclerosis of the major tuberosity subacromial spurs and form anomalies of the acromion <EOS>
<SOS> they are also important in the differential diagnosis of shoulder impingement syndrome and demonstrate calcifying tendinitis fractures and neoplasm <EOS>
<SOS> ultrasonography has found acceptance as a screening tool and even as a final diagnostic method by many authors <EOS>
<SOS> however there is a high interobserver variability in the demonstration of rotator cuff tears <EOS>
<SOS> its usefulness has therefore been questioned <EOS>
<SOS> mr imaging is probably the method of choice in the evaluation of the rotator cuff and surrounding structures <EOS>
<SOS> several investigations have demonstrated that differentiation of early findings such as tendinopathy versus partial tears may be difficult with mr imaging <EOS>
<SOS> however reproducibility for full thickness tears appears to be higher than for sonography <EOS>
<SOS> moreover specificity appears to be superior to sonography <EOS>
<SOS> mr arthrography is not universally accepted <EOS>
<SOS> however it allows for more exact differentiation of discrete findings and may be indicated in preoperative planning <EOS>
<SOS> standard arthrography and ct have a limited role in the current assessment of the rotator cuff <EOS>

<SOS> over the past <NUM> years we have observed <NUM> cases of this tumour type accounting for <NUM> of all surgically treated gastric carcinomas <EOS>
<SOS> macroscopically they were classified as borrmann iv or ii while histologically most of them were well differentiated <EOS>
<SOS> histologically these tumours retained the pre existing structures of the stomach most readily observable at the tunica muscularis propria a pronounced desmoplasia was also characteristic particularly in the submucosal and subserosal layers <EOS>
<SOS> in all cases the tumour tissue spread inside lymphatic vessels <EOS>
<SOS> all but <NUM> cases with metastatically involved lymph nodes often small showed infiltration of the lymph node sinus in three quarters of cases the serosa was infiltrated by the tumour <EOS>

<SOS> owing to the diffuse type of tumour growth extensive surgery is recommended as in cases of signet ring cell cancer <EOS>
<SOS> the high incidence of small lymph node metastases from this type of tumour should also be taken in account at preoperative staging <EOS>
<SOS> preoperative diagnosis of this tumour subtype is difficult because histological criteria alone do not allow clear identification <EOS>

<SOS> in this paper the relationship between psychodiagnosis and client centered therapy is discussed <EOS>
<SOS> rogers is wrongly said to have rejected any kind of diagnosis and that this therapy form has therefore developed an ambiguous relationship to this issue <EOS>
<SOS> if one sees psychodiagnosis as something psychodynamic and symptoms as defense strategies against underlying conflicts then a comprehensive status diagnosis using more or less traditional psychiatric categories appears compatible with theory led client centered diagnosis in the initial phase and during the course of therapy <EOS>
<SOS> client centered psychotherapy itself may be seen as a continuous process of dialogue in which assumed diagnoses embedded in the therapist is empathic knowledge are jointly checked and in which the client through direct experience learns to understand and change his diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> in the examination of reversible segmental articular hypomobile dysfunction blockage of the spine we have to recognize by palpation the feeling of beginning resistance at the end of the passive movement barrier <EOS>
<SOS> this is the main finding to diagnose segmental articular dysfunction <EOS>
<SOS> normal mobility gives us a slowly increasing resistance with possible springing at the end <EOS>
<SOS> in contrary the sudden feeling of hard tension without springing is seen as typical for the restricted movement in articular dysfunction i e restriction of joint facet gliding <EOS>

<SOS> the purpose of this study was to determine whether <NUM> hour patch testing with 0 5 sodium lauryl sulphate sls could reliably predict skin susceptibility to an irritant when compared with the alkali resistance test art a widely used method employing sodium hydroxide <EOS>
<SOS> after having given informed consent <NUM> patients age range from <NUM> to <NUM> years with an active irritant contact dermatitis icd <NUM> patients in whom icd had cleared as well as <NUM> healthy volunteers serving as controls were tested <EOS>
<SOS> the skin responses to sls were assessed both visually and by measurement of transepidermal water loss tewl as an indicator of stratum corneum integrity <EOS>
<SOS> sls significantly increased the erythema scores and tewl in patients with healed icd and the increase of tewl was even more pronounced in patients with active icd <EOS>
<SOS> by contrast a decrease in alkali resistance was found in patients with active icd only but not in patients with healed icd <EOS>
<SOS> the data obtained indicate that the sls test unlike art may provide a non invasive tool predicting a possible constitutional skin susceptibility or indicating a subclinically impaired epidermal barrier function <EOS>
<SOS> however because of the relatively high interindividual variation a cut clear statement concerning the skin susceptibility cannot be made by this test <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand the art seems only to be useful for following and documenting the healing period following icd <EOS>

<SOS> the diagnosis of acute reactive cholecystitis and the indication for cholecystectomy should be based on the synopsis of pathologic and clinical findings <EOS>
<SOS> osteoporosis is characterized by reduced bone mass and a deterioration of bone structure which results in an increased fracture risk <EOS>
<SOS> the purpose of this review is to evaluate structure analysis techniques in the diagnosis of osteoporosis <EOS>
<SOS> several imaging techniques were applied to analyze trabecular bone such as conventional radiography high resolution computed tomography hr ct and high resolution magnetic resonance imaging hr mri <EOS>
<SOS> the best results were obtained using high resolution tomographic techniques <EOS>
<SOS> the highest spatial resolutions in vivo were achieved using hr mri <EOS>
<SOS> these studies show that texture parameters and bone mineral density predict bone strength and osteoporotic fractures in a complementary fashion <EOS>
<SOS> combining both techniques yields the best results in the diagnosis of osteoporosis <EOS>

<SOS> the treatment of critically ill patients compromises frequently between an adequate fluid resuscitation for maintenance of a sufficient regional perfusion on the one hand and the avoidance of pulmonary edema on the other hand <EOS>
<SOS> the application of the transpulmonary indicator dilution method allows the orientation of fluid therapy by using the parameters intrathoracic blood volume and extravascular lung water <EOS>
<SOS> this technique is less invasive than the pulmonary artery catheter since it only needs a <NUM> or <NUM> french catheter in the femoral artery <EOS>
<SOS> additionally controlling the fluid therapy with the pulmonary capillary wedge pressure is severely limited in the mechanically ventilated patient <EOS>
<SOS> therefore the intrathoracic blood volume may be of advantage in the critically care patient in comparison to the pulmonary capillary wedge pressure to assess the cardiac preload <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore the indocyanine clearance adds a valuable parameter to assess liver function when the double indicator technique is used <EOS>
<SOS> hypnosis autogenic training progressive relaxation and biofeedback show good empirical evidence concerning relaxation therapy and are useful techniques in psycho or behavior therapy <EOS>
<SOS> though they share some aspects with body oriented psychotherapy these relaxation techniques show a modern scientific orientation and are therefore to seperate from religious meditation <EOS>
<SOS> though in details somewhat different the methodology of these techniques creates a framework in which the psychophysiological determined relaxation response is easily elicited <EOS>
<SOS> however regular practice of the patients is requiered <EOS>
<SOS> focussed attention imagination and new attributions of bodily or mental perceptions play a dominant role concerning the therapeutic effects which may contribute to enhanced internal selfcontrol and selfesteem <EOS>
<SOS> controlled clinical studies give evidence to positive effects concerning various psychosomatic disorders e g <EOS>
<SOS> headache pain ess <EOS>
<SOS> hypertension as well as anxiety and sleeping disorders <EOS>
<SOS> as components of psychotherapeutic or behavioral programs there is even more evidence for effects of relaxation in a broad spectrum of disorders e g <EOS>
<SOS> relaxation therapy is a well established and scientific based component in the treatment of psychic psychosomatic or psychiatric disorders except psychosis <EOS>
<SOS> juvenile hyaline fibromatosis is a rare autosomal recessive connective tissue disease first described in <NUM> by murray <EOS>
<SOS> major diagnostic criteria are multiple cutaneous tumors and gingival hypertrophy minor criteria include contractures osteolytic lesions and a positive family history <EOS>
<SOS> a 35 year old woman suffering from crohn is disease for <NUM> years developed painful erythematous nodular lesions predominantly on the dorsa of her hands and feet as well as on her elbows and wrists <EOS>
<SOS> the clinical features and histopathological picture of leukocytoclastic vasculitis were both highly suggestive of erythema elevatum diutinum <EOS>
<SOS> no improvement of the skin lesions was observed during treatment with high doses of oral steroids <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast treatment with dapsone resulted in a marked reduction of skin lesions <EOS>
<SOS> during a new attack of her crohn is disease the erythema elevatum diutinum lesions flared again <EOS>
<SOS> the parallel clinical course of erythema elevatum diutinum and crohn is disease as well as the detection of immune complexes and neutrophilic granulocytes in lesions of both diseases strongly suggest a common etiology <EOS>
<SOS> this hypothesis is discussed in context with this case and the recent literature <EOS>
<SOS> the mammalian brain is capable of a substantial functional reorganization manifesting on a cortical somatotopical and on a behavioral level <EOS>
<SOS> possible mechanisms are reviewed based on the work by others and ourselves on somatosensory reorganization in humans <EOS>
<SOS> the somatosensory system is characterized by divergent projections from the periphery to the cerebral cortex <EOS>
<SOS> changes in synaptic weights allow for reorganization of sensory processing on one side limb amputation will result in a representational invasion of the deafferentated cortex from neighboring regions with concomitant perceptual changes <EOS>
<SOS> on the other side sensorimotor training can increase the representational cortical zone of a limb <EOS>
<SOS> plastic changes can be temporary or persistent <EOS>
<SOS> modulating factors like pain and certain drugs seem to induce a permissive state in the cortex resulting in enhanced reorganization <EOS>
<SOS> thus specific physical training combined with pharmacoceutical modulation holds promise to improve functional recovery after brain lesions <EOS>

<SOS> however a substantial number of patients with ami who would not have been included in those trials are treated with one of these two therapeutic options <EOS>
<SOS> to describe the proportions characteristics and outcome of these patients treated with primary angioplasty or thrombolysis we analyzed the data of the prospective maximal individual optimized therapy for acute myocardial infarction mitra trial <EOS>
<SOS> chronic infectious diseases may run over many months and years accompanied by only mild clinical signs and often without organ specific symptoms <EOS>
<SOS> people with any kind of immuno deficiency are more frequently affected by chronic infections <EOS>
<SOS> history physical examination laboratory tests microbiological tests and imaging methods may lead to an exact diagnosis <EOS>

<SOS> background we perform partial sphincterectomy during cataract surgery in cases with very small pupil <NUM> mm <EOS>
<SOS> we assume that the small pupil is mainly due to a fibrosis ring of the sphincter muscle <EOS>
<SOS> trauma scores in emergency medicine quantitatively characterise the severity of trauma victims injuries and physiologic derangements <EOS>
<SOS> they are used to detect and assess patients and have applications in guiding patient care and early therapeutic decisions <EOS>
<SOS> in the pre clinical setting an effective trauma index meets the following criteria it is highly reliable with regard to identifying high and low risk patients <EOS>
<SOS> it has high face validity <EOS>
<SOS> it has high inter and intra rater reliability <EOS>
<SOS> it is easy to use and allows rapid accurate measurements <EOS>
<SOS> the most widely accepted injury severity index is probably the injury severity score iss <EOS>
<SOS> it is calculated as the sum of the squares of the three most severely injured body regions and was originally developed as a means to standardise the description of injuries sustained in motor vehicle accidents <EOS>
<SOS> the trauma score ts represents the gold standard of physiologic scoring of injury severity <EOS>
<SOS> it summarises the numerical assessments of the central nervous and cardiopulmonary system functions <EOS>
<SOS> the recently developed mainz emergency evaluation score mees is based upon numerical specification of the vital signs including a pain scale and has been designed as a dynamic score <EOS>
<SOS> nevertheless limitations of the established trauma score systems have been described <EOS>
<SOS> mortality and patient outcome do not strictly correlate with injury severity scoring <EOS>
<SOS> in addition intubated or paralysed patients were excluded from outcome studies since the scoring systems lacked options for evaluation of pathophysiological conditions after therapeutic interventions <EOS>
<SOS> thus therapeutic efficacy could hardly be assessed and subsequent scoring during time periods was impossible <EOS>
<SOS> the accurate definition of comprehensive evaluation of a trauma victim is challenging for example pain as chosen in the mees must be regarded as a highly desirable piece of information although its rating may prove difficult especially when classifying unconscious patients <EOS>
<SOS> further criticisms of the above mentioned trauma indices could include omission of the trauma victim is age gender pre injury health status or the influence of alcohol or additional medication <EOS>
<SOS> moreover questioning the interrater reliability of injury severity scoring a recent study revealed bias in assigning values to trauma patients trained raters classified injury severity with significantly higher indices than less experienced researchers <EOS>
<SOS> if trauma indices in pre hospital emergency medicine were relied upon as the only means of evaluating a trauma patient and guiding therapeutic approaches significant numbers of trauma victims requiring major interventions would be missed <EOS>
<SOS> resuscitative treatment regimens must not be based solely upon indices since e g in states of shock injury scores do not correlate with fluid resuscitative requirements <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore a qualitative assignment of single vital function parameters as crucial indices for a patient is condition never reflects the broad range of a patient is profile <EOS>
<SOS> many multiple trauma patients do benefit from controlled ventilation in clinical experience even though pulse oximetry values are within the physiological range and the administration of analgesics or even pre hospital anaesthesia has often proved advantageous for trauma patients in the field <EOS>
<SOS> providing the opportunity of subsequent patient evaluation and the efficacy of acute care the mees has been developed as a dynamic scoring system <EOS>
<SOS> this design is extremely desirable and must be regarded as an indispensible criterion for future scoring systems <EOS>
<SOS> in view of the peculiarities of field emergency medicine pre hospital indices do have limitations <EOS>
<SOS> the parameters unknown patient time pressure unprecise measurements lack of diagnostic facilities incomplete evaluation and limited statistical power cannot be eliminated <EOS>
<SOS> accurate prediction of outcome within early time frames is therefore not possible <EOS>
<SOS> ossification of the achilles tendon is the result of a traumatic hypoxic injury of the tendon <EOS>
<SOS> the usually asymptomatic ossification has a clinical importance only in case of a new trauma <EOS>
<SOS> we report about a patient with an isolated fracture of the ossification without an accompanying rupture of the achilles tendon <EOS>
<SOS> because of the radiologically occult fracture the diagnosis could only be verified by mri <EOS>
<SOS> with a conservative treatment without resection of the ossification we could reach painless recovery <EOS>
<SOS> hair problems are attacked at the levels of information supply trichological competence and evidence based medical treatment <EOS>
<SOS> the alopecias represent a major health care challenge and the psychological significance of hair loss has only recently found appreciation in the medical community <EOS>
<SOS> they may pose a vexing problem for non specialized physicians who tend to trivialize such complaints although the patient is perception of abnormality determines whether or not advice is sought <EOS>
<SOS> perception of a hair problem is subject to sociocultural standards films and advertisements help determine the threshold for normality and what is healthy and beautiful and the media provide an abundance of undiscriminating information with respect to hair care <EOS>
<SOS> patients with hair problems frequently consult the hairdresser prior to the medical specialist <EOS>
<SOS> thus additional areas of competence should be incorporated into the hairdresser is training qualifications <EOS>
<SOS> besides manual creative and psychological aptitudes trichological competence relating to the recognition of most important hair disorders recognition of personal limitations and cooperation with the medical specialist are required <EOS>

<SOS> it is mandatory to differentiate between traumatic and atraumatic instability when treating shoulder instability <EOS>
<SOS> the traumatic instability is characterized by secondary lesions bankart lesion hill sachs lesion overstretching of the capsule which are caused at the time of primary dislocation <EOS>
<SOS> the quality of the capsule has to be considered in close relationship to the appearance of the bankart lesion <EOS>
<SOS> the stronger the capsule the greater the external force has to be in order to surmount the resistance caused by the capsule <EOS>
<SOS> the damage to the glenoid rim makes it possible to draw conclusions about the condition of the capsule <EOS>
<SOS> in cases of atraumatic instability secondary lesions are normally absent <EOS>
<SOS> these instabilities are often caused by laxity of the capsule <EOS>
<SOS> when stabilizing a shoulder two criteria have to be taken into consideration stability and function <EOS>
<SOS> reattachment of the labrum alone will not guarantee stability <EOS>
<SOS> additionally the overstretched capsule has to be shortened or shifted <EOS>
<SOS> both criteria are decisive for the success of the stabilizing operation <EOS>

<SOS> implantable hearing aids can form the basis of new surgical techniques for dealing with hearing problems originating in the inner ear provided they are fully implantable <EOS>

<SOS> a novel electromechanical transducer for implantable hearing aids based on the piezoelectric principle is described <EOS>
<SOS> unlike the piezoelectric transducers reported so far this transducer does not rely on the bimorphic principle but on a circle shaped heteromorphic combination system consisting of a piezoceramic disc and metal membrane <EOS>
<SOS> the transducer can be hermetically sealed and is designed for implantation into the mastoid <EOS>
<SOS> transfer of mechanical oscillations to an ossicle in the middle ear is effected by a directly fixed coupling rod or via suitable coupling elements <EOS>
<SOS> the transducer is highly tuned with a resonance frequency at the upper end of the spectral transfer range greater than <NUM> khz <EOS>
<SOS> below this resonance and down to low frequencies the frequency response of elongation is smooth with amplitudes of around <NUM> nm <EOS>
<SOS> at low and middle frequencies of up to <NUM> khz these vibration amplitudes correspond to sound pressure levels of around <NUM> db spl <EOS>
<SOS> at higher frequencies of up to <NUM> khz the output level increases to about <NUM> db spl <EOS>
<SOS> nonlinear distortions are also very small at the highest levels less than 0 1 throughout the whole transfer range <EOS>
<SOS> electric power consumption at maximum levels is in the range of a few microwatts and is therefore significantly lower than that of electromagnetic systems <EOS>
<SOS> particularly this makes it possible to use the transducer in fully implantable hearing aids for rehabilitation of sensorineural hearing loss <EOS>

<SOS> substantial improvement in conformal radiotherapy is possible using modulated irradiation fields <EOS>
<SOS> such modulated fields may be generated even with conventional accelerators by means of individual metal compensators or with the recently available dynamic multileaf collimators mlc <EOS>
<SOS> for treatment planning a new kind of planning program is required that can calculate the <NUM> d intensity matrices for each photon field <EOS>
<SOS> at the german cancer research center deutsches krebsforschungszentrum such a program has been developed under the name of konrad conformal radiotherapy <EOS>
<SOS> although it is an independent application it is proposed for clinical usage to supplement a planning system that is already present <EOS>
<SOS> so called inverse planning differs from conventional <NUM> d planning as the trial and error approach for finding good field parameters is nearly completely avoided <EOS>
<SOS> instead the radio oncologist is given the chance directly to specify medically oriented criteria like the prescription dose in the target volume maximal tolerance dose values for each organ at risk and their weighting factors <EOS>
<SOS> in addition the so called dvh optimization allows aimed partial overdosage especially in parallelly structured organs in order to obtain better overall planning results <EOS>

<SOS> objective elevated levels of interleukin 1 il 1 and interleukin 6 il 6 have been reported after cardiac operation during inflammatory process and cardiac allograft rejection <EOS>
<SOS> although several groups proved the evidence of a negative inotropic effect the actual mechanism is not completely understood <EOS>
<SOS> speaking generally it is possible that low molecular weight proteins are capable of altering myocardial contractility on the level of the contractile apparatus <EOS>
<SOS> therefore this study analyzes whether il 1 and or il 6 influence myocardial contractility on the level of the contractile apparatus <EOS>
<SOS> methods during aorto coronary bypass operation human muscle fibers were excised n 32 and skinned using triton x 100 <EOS>
<SOS> the experimental skinned fiber model excludes membrane related factors such as receptor activation and provides direct examination of the contractile apparatus itself <EOS>
<SOS> different concentrations of il 1 and il 6 were applied pil 1 il 6 1 2x<MOB>m <EOS>
<SOS> force generation calcium sensitivity and velocity of force generation and relaxation were measured <EOS>
<SOS> experiments were carried out at optimal length bath temperature <NUM> °c and isometric conditions <EOS>
<SOS> results none of the skinned muscle preparations of the human myocardium showed under the given experimental setup a significant change in contractility and relaxation after exposure to il 1 and il 6 <EOS>
<SOS> despite using nonphysiologic concentrations of il 1 and il 6 pil 1 il 6 10 5m no significant effect occurred <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore no difference in calcium sensitivity of the contractile proteins following addition of il 1 and il 6 could be observed <EOS>
<SOS> conclusions thus there is no experimental evidence for direct modulation of the contractile apparatus by il 1 or il 6 <EOS>
<SOS> given these results it is possible to exclude some potentially negative inotropic cascades that are mediated on the level of the contractile apparatus as the molecular mechanism <EOS>
<SOS> these data show that therapies which support myocardial contractility during sepsis by stimulation of the contractile proteins do not seem to be very promising <EOS>

<SOS> the need for a more refined characterization of the biological potential of the indidual tumor results from the introduction of modified operative strategies as organ preserving surgery for example as well as from the recently suggested application of an adjuvant systemic therapy adapted to the individual risk for tumor recurrence resp <EOS>
<SOS> the development of progressive disease <EOS>

<SOS> numerous different diseases lead to scarring alopecia with irreversible follicular destruction as a common ending <EOS>
<SOS> current classifications are based on clinical histopathological or prognostic parameters as well as on pathogenetic criteria which allow only a rough assessment because the precise mechanisms leading to scarring alopecia are still unknown <EOS>
<SOS> inadequacies of the established classifications are obvious when regarding special forms of scarring alopecia like lichen planopilaris or pseudopelade brocq <EOS>

<SOS> research in the field of scarring alopecia should aim at defining the pathological processes on any of the above mentioned levels which will lead to an irreversible damage of the hair follicle thus allowing the development of new therapeutic agents <EOS>

<SOS> aim of the study and methods in the present study the correlation between ischemia induced ventricular tachyarrhythmias and a dynamic behavior of ventricular late potentials was investigated <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> patients with significant coronary artery disease and survived sustained ventricular tachyarrhythmia an electrophysiologic study eps was performed <EOS>
<SOS> before eps t1 at every stimulation interval and after induction of a ventricular tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation vt vf the lactate concentration was measured in arterial blood and in the coronary sinus for calculation of the myocardial lactate extraction <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore before investigation after induction of a vt vf and after a <NUM> minute recovery phase an analysis of the signal averaged ecg was performed <EOS>
<SOS> nine patients showed a so called lactate reversal i e an increase of the lactate concentration in the coronary sinus over the concentration of the arterial blood as an expression of ischemia development during inducibility of a vt vf group a <EOS>
<SOS> the control group consisted of <NUM> patients without ischemia related vt vf group b <EOS>
<SOS> results in group a significant changes of the three late potential criteria were found between t1 and t2 qrs <MOB> <NUM> vs <MOB> 16 74 p 0 08 rms <NUM> <NUM> vs <NUM> 10 72 p 0 01 las <NUM> <NUM> vs <NUM> 10 72 p 0 01 <EOS>
<SOS> in group b no significant changes could be measured <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore the prevalence of late potentials increased in group a from 66 t1 to 89 t2 whereas in group b no increase was detectable <EOS>
<SOS> conclusions these data suggest a dynamic behavior of ventricular late potentials in correlation with the inducibility of ventricular tycharrhythmias due to ischemic circumstances <EOS>
<SOS> therefore the dynamic behavior of ventricular late potentials can be an expression of a modification of the arrhythmogenic substrate in arrhythmia endangered patients <EOS>
<SOS> recent studies and reviews continue to report a high mortality associated with the acute respiratory distress syndrome ards which involves a severe inflammatory reaction within the whole lung that is frequently associated with multiple organ failure <EOS>
<SOS> important factors contributing to the poor results in severe ards are the aggressive procedures required to maintain sufficient arterial oxygenation such as mechanical ventilation with high inspiratory pressures and high inspired oxygen concentrations fio2 which themselves contribute to the progression of the disease <EOS>
<SOS> as no specific therapy that reduces or prevents the general inflammatory reaction is known current therapy is limited to procedures that minimize peak inspiratory pressures and fio2 <EOS>
<SOS> therefore pressure and volume limited ventilation modes with positive end expiratory pressure controlled hypercapnia differential lung ventilation when appropriate positioning particularly prone and aggressive dehydration are used <EOS>
<SOS> should these procedures fail to improve arterial gas exchange the patients may be additionally treated by veno venous extracorporeal gas exchange <EOS>
<SOS> to reduce the risk of severe haemorrhagic complications due to high levels of systemic heparinization systems internally coated with covalently bound heparin which allow a lower level of systemic anticoagulation should be used <EOS>
<SOS> from april <NUM> to august 1993 <NUM> patients were transferred to our intensive care unit for treatment of severe ards <NUM> were treated by combining the described conventional methods without artificial gas exchange survival rate 88 and <NUM> additionally underwent artificial gas exchange survival rate 57 <EOS>
<SOS> the overall survival rate was 75 <EOS>
<SOS> on the basis of these experiences we conclude that this step by step approach may improve survival in patients with severe ards <EOS>

<SOS> past research on the phenomenon of enhanced pain sensitivity in fibromyalgia syndome fs revealed evidence for both a higher pain magnitude in response to nociceptive stimuli hyperalgesia and a general perceptual amplification of sensations hypervigilance <EOS>
<SOS> in order to distinguish between these two aspects of disturbed sensory processing in fs cerebral evoked potentials after brief painful laser and auditory stimuli were measured in <NUM> fs patients <EOS>
<SOS> results were compared with those from age matched painfree controls <EOS>
<SOS> amplitudes of middle latency n1 and long latency p2 laser evoked potentials leps were significantly higher in fs than in controls <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore laser intensity at pain but not at sensation threshold was lower in fs than in controls <EOS>
<SOS> however auditory evoked potentials aeps did not differ between groups <EOS>
<SOS> enhanced n1 and p2 amplitudes of leps suggest stronger sensory and attentional processing of nociceptive information in fs respectively <EOS>
<SOS> the concept of hypervigilance is challenged by the failure to find differences in auditory perception among fs and control patients <EOS>
<SOS> yet the importance of unpleasant intensities of auditory stimulation not applied in this study to reveal abnormal non nociceptive perceptual amplification in fs is discussed <EOS>

<SOS> complex mechanisms have evolved in mammalian cells for regulating cellular lifespan <EOS>
<SOS> normal cells demonstrate a strictly limited growth potential and senescence after a defined number of cell divisions <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast tumor cells often exhibit an apparently unlimited proliferation potential and are termed immortalized <EOS>
<SOS> it has been proposed that the progressive shortening of the tips of the eukaryotic chromosomes the telomeres is an important component of senescence and is involved in the control of cell cycle <EOS>
<SOS> the enzyme telomerase adds ttagg repeats onto mammalian telomeres preventing their shortening <EOS>
<SOS> telomerase is normally inactive in most somatic cells but detectable in tumor cells <EOS>
<SOS> the activation of telomerase in malignant cancers seems to be an important step in tumorigenesis in order to gain the ability of indefinite proliferation and to become immortal <EOS>
<SOS> this review describes the present knowledge of telomeres and telomerase and their role in cellular senescence and human aging <EOS>
<SOS> it summarizes aspects of telomerase in cancer and its function as a diagnostic and prognostic tumor marker <EOS>

<SOS> pcr based diagnosis of infectious diseases if performed according to appropriate quality standards is a safe and effective technique with high sensitivity and specificity and results in an etiologically based diagnosis <EOS>

<SOS> we live in an epoch that could be designated as the post gutenberg era <EOS>
<SOS> writing is no longer the dominant sign system <EOS>
<SOS> it is replaced by electronic signs <EOS>
<SOS> we consider approximately the year <NUM> as the turning point between these two epochs because by then in the years after the 2nd world war the american households were saturated with televisions <EOS>
<SOS> thereby the new sign system asserted itself <EOS>
<SOS> the topic of this article is the transformation of our sign system and thereby of our worlds of symbols the leap from the world of written signs into the world of electronic signs and the possibility born out of it to create electronic objects which i prefer to call virtual objects <EOS>
<SOS> the manipulation of object choice and object relationships accompanying this change and the role assigned to analysts in this new world will be considered as well <EOS>
<SOS> these electronic signs developed quickly a life of their own <EOS>
<SOS> a totally new class of objects came into being the class of virtual objects <EOS>
<SOS> these are electronically transformed completed or wholly electronically produced objects <EOS>
<SOS> this procedure is accompanied by an industrialization of object choice and object relationships <EOS>
<SOS> the manipulated object choice and object relationship is born and moreover a displacement of natural objects through virtual ones <EOS>
<SOS> a change of the socio cultural understanding is also a consequence of this process <EOS>
<SOS> new patterns of socio cultural understanding develop that could be described as industrial feudalism <EOS>
<SOS> the goal of this article is to describe the transformation of our world of signs and the connected industrialization of object relationships and to interprete them according to our present possibilities <EOS>

<SOS> the early complications of the technique are usually minor and late complications are rare <EOS>

<SOS> anesthesia per se however may also result in severe perioperative patho physiological changes which may be both desired e g <EOS>
<SOS> analgesia vasodilation in vascular surgery or detrimental e g <EOS>
<SOS> hypothermia ventilatory depression and which may differ depending on the anesthetic technique used e g <EOS>
<SOS> general anesthesia vs regional anesthesia <EOS>
<SOS> yet all anesthestic techniques have in common that their effects are not limited to the duration of the surgical intervention but may expand far into the postoperative period <EOS>
<SOS> therefore many trials have been performed in the past aiming to compare the impact of different anesthetic techniques on the incidence of postoperative techniques no significant advantage of one or the other technique has been identified up to now with respect to postoperative mortality or severe morbidity <EOS>
<SOS> this finding may be due to at least three factors <EOS>
<SOS> 1 many side effects related to anesthesia due to close postoperative monitoring are detected and treated early in the postoperative phase e g <EOS>
<SOS> in the recovery room thereby preventing serious complications <EOS>
<SOS> 2 postoperative mortality related exclusively to anesthesia probably is so low that huge patient numbers would be required to demonstrate any significant differences between different techniques <EOS>
<SOS> 3 besides the factor anesthesia may other factors contribute to the anesthesia related morbidity and mortality e g <EOS>
<SOS> the factor anesthetist which are hardly quantified <EOS>
<SOS> the fact that clear advantages for a single technique have not yet been demonstrated must not however result in anesthetic nihilism <EOS>
<SOS> rather there may be good reasons in the individual patient e g <EOS>
<SOS> lack of a recovery room to prefer a certain anesthetic technique or drug over another in order to lower the individual risk of anesthesia <EOS>
<SOS> whether the use of a certain technique e g <EOS>
<SOS> spinal or epidural anesthesia may contribute to a reduction of specific postoperative surgical complications e g <EOS>
<SOS> rate of reocclusion subsequent to peripheral vascular surgery is presently under investigation <EOS>

<SOS> m linehan developed dialectical behavioral therapy specifically to treat chronically suicidal borderline patients <EOS>
<SOS> it rests on a biosocial model that assumes a disorder in the regulation of emotions and in tolerance of stress <EOS>
<SOS> the numerous dysfunctional patterns of behavior such as self destructive behavior inability to govern impulses or severe dissociative phenomena are regarded as attempts at problem solving <EOS>

<SOS> this increase was <NUM> and <NUM> per cent higher than the general rise in cost of living in germany during the interval between the two studies <EOS>

<SOS> 57 clinical trials were separated into <NUM> groups according to their scientific quality 1 placebo controlled double blind studies with high power 2 placebo controlled double blind studies with low power 3 4 open controlled studies or studies with historical controls 5 case reports <EOS>
<SOS> a study was positive if the tested antidepressant was more effective than placebo or the compared drug or seemed beneficial with respect to the interval of its previous absence <EOS>

<SOS> in four cases the anterior ring was fixed with tension band wiring or plates and the dorsal aspect of the pelvic ring with sacral bars <EOS>
<SOS> three patients had their additional acetabular fracture plated through a anterior approach <EOS>
<SOS> all surviving <NUM> patients were followed up for an average of <NUM> months range 7 59 months after the trauma <EOS>
<SOS> the patients were classified using the pelvic outcome score proposed by the german society of trauma surgery <EOS>
<SOS> 53 4 of the type b fractures showed a good clinical outcome 47 6 a poor outcome <EOS>
<SOS> 15 4 with type c fractures presented with a good outcome 84 6 with a poor outcome <EOS>
<SOS> 80 of the type b and 23 of the type c fractures had a good radiological outcome <EOS>

<SOS> seven patients died in the emergency room due to uncontrollable bleeding four in the intensive care unit from multi organ failure <EOS>
<SOS> the management of complex pelvic trauma consists of fracture treatment and interdisciplinary treatment of the associated injury <EOS>
<SOS> lesions of the abdominal organs or of major vessels must be addressed first if hemodynamic instability is present <EOS>
<SOS> injuries to smaller vessels can be embolized percutaneously <EOS>
<SOS> urinary bladder ruptures are treated as an emergency urethral lesions electively after four to six weeks we recommend external fixation of the pelvis in the acute phase for control of both the osseous instability and control of haemorrhage through external compression <EOS>
<SOS> the treatment of choice for the anterior pelvic ring is tension band wiring or plating <EOS>
<SOS> if this is contraindicated due to an open fracture external fixation is the treatment of choice <EOS>
<SOS> type c fractures require posterior ring stabilization which should be postponed until four days post admission <EOS>
<SOS> dysfunction of serotonergic neurotransmission has been associated with two different psychopathological syndromes impulsive aggressivity resulting form a lack of stimulation of the behavior inhibition system on the one hand and the manifestation of clinical depression and compulsive syndromes on the other <EOS>
<SOS> the examination of primate behavior provides a model which may reconciliate these seemingly contradictory hypotheses <EOS>
<SOS> according to primate experiments monoaminergic depletion results in anxious and desperate behavior only if the individual has previously been exposed to social isolation stress which in turn induces a decrease in the central serotonin turnover rate <EOS>
<SOS> young non human primates who experience early social separation stress are anxious and fearful while as adults they tend to be aggressive consume excessive amounts of alcohol and are less intoxicated by alcohol intake <EOS>
<SOS> these observation indicate the importance of social separation stress in the pathogenesis of alcoholism and antisocial behavior and may point to prophylactic and pharmacological treatment strategies <EOS>

<SOS> starting at this point radiofrequency current 500 khz with a target temperature of <NUM> °c was delivered with the intention to ablate the slow pathway <EOS>

<SOS> otherwise radiofrequency current was delivered step by step up to a septal position next to the tricuspid valve annulus <EOS>

<SOS> slow pathway modulation was defined as maximal one atrial echoimpulse after ablation <EOS>
<SOS> results the number of energy applications ranged from 1 19 median 6 <EOS>
<SOS> in 35 41 patients slow pathway ablation could be achieved in six patients the slow pathway was modulated <EOS>
<SOS> in none of the patients permanent high grade av block was observed <EOS>
<SOS> during follow up mean <NUM> years two patients had a recurrent episode of avnrt after slow pathway modulation <EOS>
<SOS> all other patients are still free of avnrt without medical treatment <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion selective radiofrequency current ablation modulation of the slow pathway is a safe and curative treatment of avnrt in young patients <EOS>

<SOS> the programming of a cochlear implant speech processor used by young children is often difficult especially when the stimulus level associated with maximum auditory loudness mal needs to be determined <EOS>
<SOS> excessively high stimulation should be avoided as this can have a traumatic effect <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of this study was to determine if a relationship exists between the intraoperatively determined electrical stapedius reflex threshold esrt and the postoperatively determined mal and hearing threshold for <NUM> patients each having one of three implant types <EOS>
<SOS> the question of whether the esrt provides a practical technique to simplify improve and accelerate speech processor programming was investigated <EOS>
<SOS> for the monopolar stimulation mode used for the med el and clarion implant systems the average mal and threshold was expressed as a percentage of the average esrt across all electrodes <EOS>
<SOS> for the common ground stimulation mode used for the nucleus implant system a parabolic transformation was used to relate mal and esrt to one another <EOS>
<SOS> these transformations between mal values calculated from the esrt and the actual mal values determined psychoacoustically diverged considerably from one another <EOS>
<SOS> therefore it was not possible to determine the mal from the esrt with certainty <EOS>
<SOS> the esrt does however provide a means to estimate an approximate upper boundary for the mal apart from its use to control implant function <EOS>
<SOS> the determination of the exact mal will still need to be determined using behavioural techniques <EOS>

<SOS> in this biomechanical study the implanted unreamed humeral nail uhn has been tested concerning bending and torsional stiffnesses <EOS>
<SOS> in literature other intramedullary implants have been critisized for insufficient rotatory stability especially in transverse and short oblique fractures of the humeral shaft <EOS>
<SOS> this study examined whether the implanted uhn as well as the uhn implanted with interfragmentary compression through a specific compression device is able to augment torsional stiffness significantly <EOS>
<SOS> to evaluate bending and torsional stiffnesses the uhn has been compared biomechanically to the russell taylor humeral nail rt in paired mid shaft osteotomized cadaveric humeri <EOS>
<SOS> identic paired comparison has been performed with the uhn without and uhn with interfragmentary compression <EOS>
<SOS> in anterior posterior as well as medio lateral direction stiffness under four point bending is significantly higher in stabilizing with the rt <EOS>
<SOS> under torsional loading with moments of <NUM> nm <NUM> nm and <NUM> nm the uhn reached more than the double torsional stiffness <EOS>
<SOS> the rt which is only dynamically interlocked owns a high initial play between bolts and nail itself <EOS>
<SOS> through additional interfragmentary compression stiffness of the uhn under four point bending in anterior posterior as well as medio lateral direction augments significantly <EOS>
<SOS> also under torsional loading with moments of <NUM> nm <NUM> nm und <NUM> nm torsional stiffness increases with interfragmentary compression significantly <EOS>
<SOS> in comparison to other biomechanical studies of different autorship it is clear that this statically interlocked intramedullary nailing of the humeral shaft is superior to non statically interlocked types of nailing concerning their stabilizing potency in torsion and serves especially for fracture types which are critically under rotation as transverse or short oblique humeral shaft fractures <EOS>
<SOS> while the different national health systems merge structurally cost expansion in health care is a global challenge <EOS>
<SOS> structural reforms have been developed during recent years in the usa which can be summarized as managed care <EOS>
<SOS> they are characterized by the evolution of an economically orientated system in which units of medical therapy are generally handled like conventional economical goods <EOS>
<SOS> in managed care models patients are deliberately directed to the most economic forms of therapy <EOS>
<SOS> the spectrum of medical interventions as well as diagnostic or therapeutic patterns are predefined by a system of contracted guidelines which lead to a standardization of processes <EOS>
<SOS> financing and medical executive responsibilities fuse <EOS>
<SOS> the autonomy of medical decisions is clearly reduced to enforce an integrated and economically oriented steering of the health system <EOS>
<SOS> leadership is no longer primarily confined to doctors or scientists <EOS>
<SOS> it is progressively shifting to financing institutions managing directors or insurance companies <EOS>
<SOS> structural changes currently are expanding rapidly in the u s and have meanwhile led to marked regional reductions of medical costs <EOS>
<SOS> nevertheless the us model is still far more expensive compared to the german system <EOS>
<SOS> historical development current concepts of us managed care its potential influence and general applicability to the german situation are discussed in an overview <EOS>
<SOS> on the subject of natriuretic peptides there is a great deal of controversy and intensive research efforts have been made studying their effects on electrolyte homeostasis <EOS>
<SOS> in the early 1980s a peptide that caused diuresis natriuresis and had a relaxant effect on vascular smooth muscle was discovered independently by several groups <EOS>
<SOS> this was the breakthrough for the identification of natriuretic peptides followed by the characterisation of the amino acid sequences of several species <EOS>
<SOS> synthesis of the peptide cloning of the encoding gene identification and characterisation of specific receptors as well as the development of antibodies and radioimmunoassays were rapidly accomplished <EOS>
<SOS> research on the immunohistochemistry of cardiodilatin atrial natriuretic peptide cdd anp and the regulation of cdd anp gene expression led to detection of the peptide in extra atrial tissues <EOS>
<SOS> later on two new peptides were discovered brain natriuretic peptide bnp and c type natriuretic peptide cnp <EOS>
<SOS> these peptides share structural features with cdd anp with regard to their 17 amino acid exhibiting loop bridged by a disulfide bond <EOS>
<SOS> another recently discovered peptide is urodilatin uro a renal borne new member of a type natriuretic peptide <EOS>
<SOS> uro was isolated from human urine and consists of the same sequence as cdd anp containing the 17 amino acid residue loop of the circulating hormone with <NUM> additional amino acids located at the nh2 terminus of the peptide <EOS>
<SOS> regarding physiological actions data strongly support a close association between uro and urinary sodium excretion <EOS>
<SOS> the application of uro in animals revealed a stronger diuresis and natriuresis with a lower influence on arterial blood pressure compared to cdd anp<MOB> <EOS>
<SOS> these results were encouraging for the use of uro in clinical trials as a tool to prevent acute renal failure arf in patients following heart transplantation and for treatment of incipient arf in patients following liver transplantation <EOS>
<SOS> summarising the results of these two studies uro represents a new approach for not only prevention but also for treatment of arf following organ transplantation <EOS>
<SOS> this opens up new possibilities for the treatment of arf of other origins in intensive care medicine <EOS>

<SOS> introduction bile duct complications after laparoscopic cholecystectomy occur twice to three times more frequently than after an open procedure <EOS>
<SOS> four different types of lesions may be differentiated by the siewert classification postoperative bile fistulas type i late strictures type ii tangential injuries of the bile duct type ii and defect lesions type iv <EOS>
<SOS> the diagnostic and therapeutic management is demonstrated in relation to our own experience and the literature <EOS>
<SOS> methods eleven patients median age <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> 17 2 with bile duct complications after laparoscopic cholecystectomy were operatively treated between november <NUM> and december <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> nine patients four type ii lesions five type iv lesions were referred from another hospital <NUM> defect lesions out of <NUM> laparoscopic cholecystectomies 0 5 were documented in our own patient group <EOS>
<SOS> results four patients with late strictures were operatively treated with a hepaticocholedochostomy n 2 or hepaticojejunostomy n 2 after <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> months and were discharged from hospital after <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> days <EOS>
<SOS> in both cases with type iv lesion and a short defect an end to end anastomosis was successful hospital stay <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> days <EOS>
<SOS> however a retrocolic roux y end to side hepaticojejunostomy was perfomed in all cases with a larger defect n 5 hospital stay <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> days <EOS>
<SOS> the two defect lesions in our own group were detected by intraoperative cholangiography and immediately treated after conversion either with hepaticocholedocho stomy or hepaticojejunostomy hospital stay <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> days <EOS>
<SOS> conclusions the incidence of bile duct complications after laparoscopic cholecystectomy might be kept down by anatomic preparation selective intraoperative cholangiography and early consideration of conversion to open procedure <EOS>
<SOS> the clinical course after biliary tract injury can be positively influenced only by a standard diagnostic and operative procedure and by an early transfer to a specialized center <EOS>

<SOS> with the advent of atypical antipsychotics quality of life for patients with schizophrenia has improved significantly <EOS>

<SOS> the mortality of perioperative myocardial infarction is still high and according to recently published data amounts to <NUM> to 42 <EOS>
<SOS> in the seventies introduction of thrombolytic therapy has led to a dramatic reduction in mortality of non perioperative myocardial infarction <EOS>
<SOS> however in the perioperative situation thrombolytic therapy remains to be problematic in most cases because of expected severe bleeding complications <EOS>
<SOS> in the last 4 6 years acute ptca has been established in the therapy of acute myocardial infarction <EOS>
<SOS> up to date no data are available concerning the effect of acute ptca on mortality of perioperative myocardial infarction <EOS>
<SOS> nevertheless it can be assumed that acute ptca will lead to a considerable reduction in mortality of perioperative myocardial infarction <EOS>
<SOS> therefore in patients with significant perioperative myocardial infarction immediate coronary angiography and if indicated acute ptca should be performed <EOS>
<SOS> in principle thrombolytic therapy is considered to be contraindicated in the intra or postoperative situation <EOS>
<SOS> however if coronary angiography and ptca are not possible thrombolysis might be taken into consideration in particular if the expected bleeding complications are small in relation to the expected benefit of thrombolysis <EOS>
<SOS> since acute ptca has been shown to remarkably reduce mortality in patients with cardiogenic shock after acute myocardial infarction this group of patients should be especially considered <EOS>

<SOS> however as a result of the lack of controlled studies there is no large body of evidence available to support the use of plication long tubes or any other specific surgical intervention <EOS>

<SOS> such conditions have been noted in the literature designated as chronic lymphoedema or solid persistent facial oedema in acne or rosacea <EOS>

<SOS> the major problems to the anaesthesiologist in these patients are induction of anaesthesia in infants with hlhs and treatment of pulmonary hypertension in the early post bypass period <EOS>
<SOS> objective thirty years ago cardiopulmonary resuscitation cpr was primarily developed for otherwise healthy individuals who experienced sudden cardiac arrest <EOS>
<SOS> today cpr is widely viewed as an emergency procedure that can be attempted on any person who undergoes a cessation of cardiorespiratory function <EOS>
<SOS> therefore the appropriateness of cpr has been questioned as a matter of the outcome the patient is preferences and the cost <EOS>
<SOS> the objective of this article is to analyse ethical issues in prehospital resuscitation <EOS>
<SOS> arguments cpr is bound by moral considerations that surround the use of any medical treatment <EOS>
<SOS> according to beauchamp and childress the hierarchy of justification in biomedical ethics consists of ethical theories principles rules and particular judgements and actions <EOS>
<SOS> the decision to start cpr is based on the medical judgement that a person is suffering from circulatory arrest <EOS>
<SOS> the decision is justified by the moral rule that the victim of a cardiac arrest has the right to survive and to receive cpr <EOS>
<SOS> moral rules are more specific to contexts and are based on ethical principles <EOS>
<SOS> the principle of beneficence means the provision of benefits for the promotion of welfare <EOS>
<SOS> talking about beneficence in resuscitation means once again reporting stories of success as many victims of pre and in hospital sudden death have been saved in the past <EOS>
<SOS> nevertheless resuscitative efforts still remain unsuccessful in the majority of cases involving the principle of nonmaleficence <EOS>
<SOS> there is potential harm in cpr <EOS>
<SOS> survivors may recover cardiac function but sustain severe hypoxic brain damage at worst surviving without awakening for months or years <EOS>
<SOS> in particular post traumatic cpr is associated with an extremely poor outcome leading to the issue of futility <EOS>
<SOS> however futility should be defined in a strict fashion as there might be an individual chance of survival <EOS>
<SOS> the principle of respect for autonomy means the right of a patient to accept or reject medical treatment which continues in emergency conditions and after the patient has lost consciousness <EOS>
<SOS> the time frame in cpr requires medical decision making within seconds and cpr is usually initiated without the patient is involvement <EOS>
<SOS> if the patient is wish is can be ascertained later on life sustaining therapies might be withdrawn at that time <EOS>
<SOS> terminally ill but still competent patients should be encouraged to write a no cpr document which does not deny patients relief from severe symptoms but might facilitate withholding resuscitative efforts at the scene <EOS>
<SOS> the principle of justice affects priorities in the allocation of health care resources <EOS>
<SOS> the decision made for a particular patient might delay or prevent emergency treatment in other patients who could receive greater benefit <EOS>
<SOS> conclusions the standard of care remains the prompt initiation of cpr <EOS>
<SOS> however ethical principles such as beneficene nonmaleficence autonomy and justice have to be applied in the unique setting of emergency medicine <EOS>
<SOS> physicians have to consider the therapeutic efficacy of cpr the potential risks and the patient is preferences <EOS>
<SOS> acting within the context of the therapeutic process is often equated with acting out <EOS>
<SOS> subtile behaviour too as a part of the complex system of sending and receiving unconscious signals sandler which serve for the patient to induce behavior of the transference object in the analyst or fulfilling his unconscious wishes is seen as acting out or microacting out treuniet <EOS>
<SOS> however this delicate acting has no meaning it is not symbolic or communicative action <EOS>
<SOS> it is aimed at inducing effects and interactions <EOS>
<SOS> it appears both on the side of the analyst and of the patient and is part of the unconscious communication in the therapeutic process <EOS>
<SOS> diverse interactive means and ways will be demonstrated how the analyst is moved to unnoticed acting and to handling the patient in an unnoticed manner in a certain way <EOS>
<SOS> the acting reactions of the analyst may have the character of interpretations by which he unintentionally demonstrates in what a way he understands the patient <EOS>

<SOS> since many years it has been discussed whether phimosis is treatable with local estrogen application analogous to the treatment of labial synechia in girls <EOS>
<SOS> this conservative treatment depends on the presence of estrogen receptors er alpha in male prepuce cells <EOS>

<SOS> people who suffer a stroke most often experience a major crisis in their lives <EOS>
<SOS> this leads to psychological problems which are likely to influence the patient is life satisfaction long term rehabilitation outcome and quality of life as much as the physical consequences caused by the stroke <EOS>
<SOS> the patient is ability to accept the new reality created by a disability as a part of their future life is therefore essential <EOS>
<SOS> this necessitates an individual coping strategy in the center of which is a mourning process which unfolds in the same way as other experiences of vital threat e g <EOS>
<SOS> confrontation with one is own dying <EOS>
<SOS> different stages of mourning that can also be found in stroke patients are nonacceptance of the facts erupting emotions parting with the former and finding of a new self as well as new perspectives for one is future <EOS>
<SOS> whether a coping process is successful does not depend on the type of the defense mechanisms or stages but essentially on their persistence <EOS>
<SOS> it is the task of the therapeutical team to support this process by applying a basic therapeutic behavior stage consistent interventions and a positive feedback <EOS>
<SOS> a failed process of coping may be one of the causes of the high prevalence of psychological disorders like depression and anxiety disorders in patients having sufferd a stroke <EOS>

<SOS> these data are usually acquired from subjective classifications of individual patients <EOS>
<SOS> in cases with non reliable patient responses objective methods are necessary <EOS>

<SOS> the significant legal and ecomonic ramifications of a positive drug test produce an incentive among users of illicit drugs to escape detection <EOS>
<SOS> therefore being the easiest body fluid to handle for drug screening urine is very often manipulated to test clean <EOS>
<SOS> methods available to cause a negative result range from substitution of urine adulteration of the collected specimen by various chemical agents and in vivo manipulations <EOS>
<SOS> among these the preferred strategy is to increase fluid intake and urine flow so as to dilute the concentration of drugs below the threshold of detection <EOS>
<SOS> to determine the extent of possible specimen dilution the urinary creatinine concentration is generally determined <EOS>
<SOS> based on data from uncontrolled and controlled fluid intake studies in the literature and physiological conditions of urinary excretion the meaningfulness of creatinine concentration in randomly obtained urine samples is discussed <EOS>
<SOS> a low creatinine concentration not clearly proving an intentional dilution of the sample the application of gc ms analysis or the concentration of the urine prior to drug screening is recommended for specimens exhibiting a suspect urinary creatinine concentration <EOS>
