<SOS> risk factors for development of malignant melanoma have been investigated in several case control studies during the last decade with some variation in results partly with geographical region <EOS>
<SOS> four studies have been conducted under the auspices of the central malignant melanoma registry of the german dermatological society these have yielded consistent results allowing the identification of risk factors for melanoma development <EOS>
<SOS> the numbers of common melanocytic naevi of atypical melanocytic naevi and the frequency of actinic lentigines were found by multivariate regression analysis to be the most important independent risk factors for melanoma development <EOS>
<SOS> additional factors were hair colour skin type and a history of naevus growth <EOS>
<SOS> a classification of relative risks was established by considering the first three risk factors mentioned without any clear improvement of classification when further additional significant factors were taken into accout <EOS>
<SOS> for example in individuals with more than <NUM> common melanocytic naevi <NUM> or more atypical melanocytic naevi and simultaneous presence of actinic lentigines the risk of developing melanoma was found to be 100 fold that in persons with <NUM> common melanocytic naevi or fewer and without atypical melanocytic naevi or actinic lentigines <EOS>
<SOS> early recognition of melanomas may be substantially improved if these risk factors are considered <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore intermittent intensive sun exposure sunburns as indicator before the age of <NUM> induces the development of melanocytic naevi and after the age of <NUM> it contributes to the development of actinic lentigines both factors are associated with an increased risk of melanoma development <EOS>

<SOS> the interpretation of three dimensional 3d structures of the coronary tree and the myocardium by a clinician demands a subjective visual integration of two dimensional 2d images of cardiac diagnostic procedures like coronary angiography and myocardial scintigraphy <EOS>
<SOS> although in the conventional analysis of 2d display scintigraphic myocardial perfusion segments are arbitrarily assigned to three major coronary artery systems the standard myocardial perfusion distribution territories correspond with the individual pathologic anatomic coronary tree in only 50 60 of the patients <EOS>
<SOS> hence the mental integration ob both 2d images of coronary angiography and myocardial scintigraphy does not necessarily allow an accurate assignment of particular myocardial perfusion regions to the corresponding vessels <EOS>
<SOS> for an objective assignment of each vessel segment of the coronary tree to the corresponding myocardial regions we have developed a 3d fusion image technique and applied it to patients with coronary artery disease <EOS>
<SOS> cause and effect relationships may be more obvious with 3d data fusion and may enable an easier comparison of anatomy and physiology <EOS>
<SOS> the physician is duty of professional discretion is one of the basic tenets at the heart of the doctor is profession <EOS>
<SOS> it is laid down in the physicians professional code and determined ultimately by the patient is right to self determination which is regulated in §203 of the german criminal code <EOS>
<SOS> it is established in the ordinance governing physicians work and has its origin in the patient is right of self determination <EOS>
<SOS> it is also regulated in §203 of the german criminal code <EOS>
<SOS> an exception can be made to the duty of professional secrecy if a patient gives express permission for this or if it is allowed or required by law <EOS>
<SOS> some such exceptions are also specified in the german social code although the physician is duty of disclosure is then always precisely stated particularly when medical data in the strictest sense of the phrase are concerned <EOS>
<SOS> borderline cases are described to illustrate how the rules of professional medical discretion are breached in the course of day to day business transacted between the statutory accident insurance firms and the physicians under contract to them and some hints are given on how this can be avoided <EOS>

<SOS> with multislice spiral computed tomography msct existing indications for performing ct of the chest are strengthened and new applications are emerging <EOS>
<SOS> the high speed of msct improves efficiency image quality and patient comfort of routine imaging of the chest <EOS>
<SOS> the ability to cover large volumes with thin slices improves the evaluation of mediastinal lymph nodes and pulmonary nodules and allows for high quality secondary reconstruction <EOS>
<SOS> if a comprehensive diagnosis of the mediastinal structures and the pulmonary parenchyma is desired msct for the first time allows reconstruction of contiguous and high resolution hrct sections from the same set of thin collimation raw data <EOS>
<SOS> this way contiguous chest images of superior and hrct sections of equal image quality compared to conventional ct scanning can be obtained <EOS>
<SOS> vascular protocols greatly benefit from the high speed of msct for imaging the thoracic aorta or pulmonary emboli pe the amount of contrast material can be substantially reduced <EOS>
<SOS> owing to thin collimation the detection rate of small peripheral emboli can be significantly increased <EOS>
<SOS> if indicated the entire subphrenic venous system can be evaluated during the same session without additional contrast material <EOS>
<SOS> abstract <NUM> <NUM> basis of the modern shoulder implants is the neer ii system a non constrained total shoulder prosthesis with conforming radii of curvature and improved protection against dislocation <EOS>
<SOS> the second generation of shoulder prosthesis is based on the geometric shaft design of the neer ii prosthesis and offers not only a variety of modular head and shaft sizes but also through different radii a physiologic rotation translation mechanism <EOS>
<SOS> the third generation of humeral head prosthesis carries the concept of an anatomic reconstruction one step further and enables the surgeon to adjust the inclination and the eccentric offset of the humeral head to restore the centre of rotation <EOS>
<SOS> the latest development in shoulder arthroplasty are humeral head prosthesis with a fully variable 3 dimensional modularity to independently adjust the prosthestic head position regardless of the individual shaft geometry <EOS>
<SOS> this achieves a 3 dimensional adaptability of the prosthetic head about the stem axis in the coronary and in the sagittal plane <EOS>
<SOS> besides of the humeral shaft prosthesis an alternative concept of shoulder joint replacement is established the replacement of the humeral head articular surface <EOS>
<SOS> a hemispheric surface prosthesis cup arthroplasty is cemented onto the residual humeral head which eliminates the obligatory humeral head resection and the reaming of the medullary canal <EOS>
<SOS> bipolar shoulder prosthesis are humeral shaft prosthesis with a bi rotational head system <EOS>
<SOS> their indication is limited to pre existing lesions of the rotator cuff and or the glenoid surface <EOS>
<SOS> the inverse total shoulder prosthesis reverses the articular surface morphology of the humeral head and the glenoid <EOS>
<SOS> the hemispheric glenoid component serves as the centre of rotation for the concave epiphyseal proximal humerus component <EOS>
<SOS> this implant is especially used in cases of massive rotator cuff deficiences <EOS>
<SOS> the role of shoulder prosthesis in treating acute humeral head fractures needs special consideration <EOS>
<SOS> a fracture prosthesis has to restore the exact length of the humerus the centre of rotation and the anatomical retroversion <EOS>
<SOS> positioning of the tubercula and their adequate osteosynthesis is most critical and fundamental to ensure a correct healing process <EOS>
<SOS> a failed consolidation of the tubercula does not lead to a satisfying result <EOS>
<SOS> the shoulder joint replacement can be sufficiently fixated in cemented cementless or hybrid techniques <EOS>
<SOS> today several component design variations of cemented glenoid implants exist <EOS>
<SOS> their main distinction is the fixation system which can be divided into two main groups the keel and the peg shaped glenoid components <EOS>
<SOS> the peg shaped anchorage system shall guarantee a greater stability against shear forces <EOS>
<SOS> cementless glenoid components consist of a polyethylen inlay and a surface treated metal back with an integrated fixation system <EOS>
<SOS> these fixation systems are object of intensive biomechanical research and range from conventional screw fixation to specialised cone systems and self cutting cage screw systems <EOS>
<SOS> the critical area of cementless glenoid components is the transition zone of the pe inlay and the metal back because of high force development <EOS>
<SOS> the question of implanting a hemi or total shoulder prosthesis is answered by the morphologic changes of the glenoid articular surface which includes the size of the subchondral defect and the underlying etiology of the shoulder joint disease and the age of the patient <EOS>
<SOS> preoperative planning must consist of an adequate radiologic work up x ray ct or mri to accurately assess the glenoid morphology <EOS>
<SOS> g walch categorised the different glenoid lesions and developed a very important classification of possible glenoid deformations <EOS>
<SOS> to compare and evaluate the operative results one must consider the different shoulder prosthesis and the discrepancies between a hemi and a total shoulder prosthetic replacement <EOS>
<SOS> looking at the loosening and survival rate of the implant the results are related to the type of prosthesis and the preoperative diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> the neer total shoulder prosthesis has a <NUM> year survival rate of <NUM> compared to <NUM> of the hemi prosthesis <EOS>
<SOS> the objective for the future has to be to further advance the development of prosthetic components especially for primary joint replacement in acute humeral head fractures <EOS>
<SOS> another point of interest is how to reduce the still existing high loosening rates of the glenoid components <EOS>
<SOS> a fairly new research field is the computer assisted surgery e g navigation systems and robotics <EOS>
<SOS> the computer assisted navigation could be of great advantage to accurately find the individual resection plane inclination and restroversion of the humeral head <EOS>
<SOS> the use of a surgery robot could be very helpful to reproducibly achieve the desired conformity of the articular surface when preparing the glenoid <EOS>

<SOS> introduction since the introduction of laparoscopic hernioplasty the tapp procedure transabdominal preperitoneal approach has become the most widely used technique <EOS>
<SOS> many surgeons have changed to the total extraperitoneal approach tep because they fear the consequences of a peritoneal lesion <EOS>
<SOS> method we evaluated our results with tapp in a retrospective study with special attention to complications caused by the approach <EOS>
<SOS> we operated on <NUM> hernias in <NUM> patients in a period of <NUM> years <EOS>
<SOS> results complication rates and recurrence rates were similar to those after tep <EOS>
<SOS> there was a marked learning curve with decrease of both rates during the evaluated years <EOS>
<SOS> there were no complications related to the transabdominal approach other than trocar hernias the rate of which could be reduced by eliminating the learning curve and by using smaller trocar diameter <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion we see no reason to change from tapp to the tep technique <EOS>
<SOS> this article examines the use and acceptance of ticket machines automatic teller machines atms and telephone cards by the elderly in four european regions <EOS>
<SOS> the analyses are based on data from an international project entitled keeping the elderly mobile collected in mannheim former west germany n 404 home dwelling respondents chemnitz former east germany n 400 ancona italy n 600 and jyväskylä finland n 618 <EOS>
<SOS> the random sample was stratified by age and gender in each country <EOS>
<SOS> two generations of men and women aged 55 74 and 75 years respectively participated in the study <EOS>
<SOS> results show that respondents generally made little use of the three technologies under investigation in fact the majority of respondents does not use them at all <EOS>
<SOS> the most frequently used devices were atms in chemnitz and ticket machines and telephone cards in mannheim <EOS>
<SOS> on the basis of logistic regression analysis age was the most important explanatory factor for the three technologies and for all four regions i e the users were mostly the young old <EOS>
<SOS> education was a more important variable than gender <EOS>
<SOS> in all four regions the majority of the respondents who used the technologies assessed felt that each of them made life easier nevertheless ticket machines make life more difficult to almost every third user in mannheim <EOS>
<SOS> interesting differences and similarities among the towns were also found <EOS>
<SOS> the present study exhibits preliminary results regarding elderly and technology which future research should investigate in greater depth <EOS>

<SOS> background the maximum number of cell divisions of a certain cell population is genetically fixed so that aging cells become non dividing senescent at least <EOS>
<SOS> this replicative life span also known as hayflick limit is probably defined by a critical length of the telomeres <EOS>
<SOS> telomeres are special dna sequences located at the four ends of the chromosomes which are shortened with each cell cycle <EOS>

<SOS> results of the four repeated tests ranged from no to 80 side to side differences in the same individual <EOS>

<SOS> as with previous investigators we found significant side to side differences in healthy subjects <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore we could also show for the first time that the amplitude ratio was not constant in every individual at repeated measurements <EOS>
<SOS> we conclude that there is a physiological variability that must be taken into account in the interpretation of facial nerve neuromyography <EOS>

<SOS> in an experimental study the biomechanical qualities of the combined kirschner wire osteosynthesis kwo in the unstable colles fracture were analyzed <EOS>
<SOS> this type of pin fixation is our preferred osteosynthesis in the treatment of unstable colles fracture because it allows immediate functional therapy <EOS>
<SOS> it represents a modification of kapandji is dynamic kwo compensating for the insufficient volar stability by means of the conventional static kwo <EOS>
<SOS> clinical experience according to the anatomical and functional results was very encouraging suggesting that a clinical concept based on the biomechanical principles of combined kwo and its single components should be constituted <EOS>
<SOS> simulation of the unstable colles fracture was realized by dorsal wedge osteotomy of the distal end of the radius using cadaveric material <EOS>
<SOS> this fracture model was subsequently pinned using the different kwo types and tested by a standardized vector energy testing device regarding its stability in the four main loading directions <EOS>
<SOS> the combined kwo unifies the advantage of volar stability of the conventional kwo with the high dorsal stability of dynamic kwo <EOS>
<SOS> the main functional principle of dynamic kwo with regard to its axial stability consists in the repositioning of the dorsal bone fragmentation zone and hence the reconstitution of cortical load transmission <EOS>
<SOS> besides its good stabilization dynamic kwo also leads to optimal alignment of the distal metaphyseal fragment <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore the experiments yielded important information about technical aspects of the surgical procedure which helps us to avoid anatomical and functional deficiencies <EOS>
<SOS> based on these experimental findings the surgical technique of combined kwo was standardized <EOS>

<SOS> in order to restore function and esthetics in mandibular hypoplasia transplantation of osteochondral grafts and the distraction osteogenesis technique are used alternatively <EOS>
<SOS> in a retrospective study the indication growth and complication rate of osteochondral graft and distraction osteogenesis cases in mandibular hypoplasia were compared <EOS>
<SOS> in total <NUM> patients 4 14 years old <NUM> female <NUM> male with different grades of mandibular hypoplasia received osteochondral grafts 7 costochondral <NUM> iliac crest observation period 4 9 years <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> patients <MOB> years old <NUM> female <NUM> male distraction osteogenesis was performed observation period <NUM> months to <NUM> 1 2 years <EOS>
<SOS> in the results according to the literature the range of growth after osteochondral grafting varied considerably approximate normal growth was noticed in only two cases <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand all patients treated by distraction osteogenesis showed a stable increase of bone length as expected <EOS>
<SOS> after osteochondral grafts adequate growth is to be expected in the minority of cases and it does not seem predictable in individual cases <EOS>
<SOS> therefore the indication for osteochondral grafts should be restricted to severe hypoplasia where the local amount of bone does not allow the use of a distraction device and to cases where support of the mandibula at the skull base is necessary <EOS>
<SOS> in all other cases of mandibular hypoplasia in children distraction osteogenesis should be discussed as the primary option even if in the long term a second surgical procedure should be necessary <EOS>

<SOS> miniplate osteosynthesis is a standard method for the surgical treatment of mandible fractures today <EOS>
<SOS> apart from easy handling in the majority of cases it also ensures adequate fracture stability <EOS>
<SOS> the treatment of fractures of very atrophic mandibles as well as mandibular defects and comminuted fractures with miniplates and rigid plates is often difficult or only possible to an inadequate extent <EOS>
<SOS> titanium mesh has proved successful for the treatment of such fractures <EOS>
<SOS> compared with conventional miniplates this mesh is outstanding for its considerably higher stability due to its given geometry <EOS>
<SOS> the titanium mesh can be adapted and screwed individually in any situation in contrast to miniplates and rigid plates <EOS>
<SOS> as a result complications such as fracture gap infections and pseudoarthrosis can be avoided to a great extent <EOS>
<SOS> non invasive methods to identify absent or persistent myocardial viability have gained increasing importance in the therapeutic management and risk stratification of patients with ischemic left ventricular dysfunction <EOS>
<SOS> myocardial scintigraphy using thallium 201 and positron emission tomography with metabolic imaging of myocardial glucose metabolism using fluorine 18 fluoro deoxyglucose are today the most widely used nuclear methods for the assessment of myocardial viability <EOS>
<SOS> besides the prediction of reversible regional and global myocardial dysfunction following coronary revascularization both methods have demonstrated the ability to identify patient subgroups who will benefit most with regard to cardiac prognosis and survival and those patients in whom coronary revascularization has a limited effect with regard to survival and cardiac events <EOS>
<SOS> this short review summarizes the clinical impact of both imaging modalities on todays diagnostic approach in patients with ischemic left ventricular dysfunction <EOS>

<SOS> the woman has obviously been surprised by the sudden bleeding which produced the impressive pattern of blood stains on the floor and finally a fatal hemorrhage <EOS>
<SOS> a similar case of a ruptured renal artery aneurysm and bleeding to death via the urinary tract has not yet been described <EOS>
<SOS> in the ankle talocrural joint the lower end of the tibia and fibula embrace the trochlea tali <EOS>
<SOS> thus an approximately uniaxial joint is formed which permits dorsiflexion and plantarflexion of the foot against the leg <EOS>
<SOS> due to the geometry of the trochlea tali conjunct lateral rotation of the fibula against the tibia occurs at the tibiofibular articulations synchronously with active dorsiflexion at the ankle joint <EOS>
<SOS> movements at the talocrural joints are mainly limited by the opposing muscles as well as by strong collateral ligaments <EOS>
<SOS> talus and calcaneus form a functional unit connected by posterior and anterior articulations <EOS>
<SOS> the posterior articulation is the subtalar talocalcaneal joint in the anterior articulation talar facets of the calcaneus together with the posterior surface of the navicular and the superior fibrocartilaginous surface of the plantar calcaneonavicular ligament form a concavity for the talar head <EOS>
<SOS> thus the talocalcaneonavicular joint is a compound and like the subtalar joint a multiaxial articulation <EOS>
<SOS> on the weight bearing foot the distal tarsus and metatarsus are pronated and supinated against the talus in order to maintain plantigrade contact <EOS>
<SOS> when the foot is off the ground these movements are modified to eversion and inversion also involving the calcaneocuboid joint <EOS>
<SOS> in addition movements between the calcaneus and cuboid also occur during pronative or supinative changes between the fore and hindfoot <EOS>
<SOS> limitation of movements is due to leg muscles as well as strong ligaments <EOS>
<SOS> finally the cuneonavicular cuboideonavicular intercuneiform and cuneocuboid joints permit some additional alterations of the loaded foot in contact with the ground <EOS>

<SOS> our results prove a direct correlation between the bolt is diameter and mechanical properties <EOS>
<SOS> further more we found that bolts with a continuing thread were weaker than bolts of the same diameter with only a short thread and an increased diameter at the nail is aperture <EOS>

<SOS> some of the tested locking bolts may even withstand full weight bearing in a physiological walking cycle but will not withstand the stress of a running cycle <EOS>

<SOS> in a long ischemic time we have to change our concept and do the reconstruction of the vessels first <EOS>

<SOS> therefore it is necessary that severe hand injuries are treated at well established centres for hand surgery <EOS>

<SOS> intubation and positive end expiratory pressure ventilation peep is a well established therapeutic strategy for impaired lung function particularly following blunt chest trauma <EOS>
<SOS> complications of this regime are however also well known and pose the question why non invasive forms of respiratory assistance such as continuous positive airway pressure cpap have only gained minor popularity <EOS>
<SOS> in a prospective study <NUM> patients who had suffered blunt chest trauma were treated with cpap administered by mask <EOS>
<SOS> the regime consisted of continuous administration of cpap by a face mask with gradually increasing periods of spontaneous breathing <EOS>
<SOS> initially a fio2 of <NUM> range 0 28 0 38 proved necessary <EOS>
<SOS> the initial cpap level was <NUM> mbar range 5 8 with an assisted spontaneous breathing asb of <NUM> mbar range 13 18 <EOS>
<SOS> fio2 and cpap asb levels were subsequently gradually reduced until no longer necessary <EOS>
<SOS> in all patients intubation and ventilation was avoided by this regimen <EOS>
<SOS> the treatment was well accepted by all patients and common ventilation associated complications such as pneumonia did not occur <EOS>
<SOS> in comparison with the former standard method of treatment the average icu stay was dramatically reduced principally due to not having to gradually wean patients from ventilation and sedation <EOS>
<SOS> other positive benefits include normal communication and feeding with active early mobilisation leading to faster recovery both physical and psychological <EOS>
<SOS> we conclude that non invasive respiratory techniques should be used more frequently and recommend further studies are undertaken to define the indications <EOS>

<SOS> diagnosis should be reached fast sure and cost effective with a high sensitivity and specifity <EOS>
<SOS> current methods for articular cartilage repair are unpredictable with respect to clinical success <EOS>
<SOS> in the present study we investigated the ability of cells from articular cartilage perichondrium and costochondral resting zone to form new cartilage when loaded onto biodegradable scaffolds and implanted into calf muscle pouches of nu nu mice <EOS>
<SOS> prior in vitro studies showed that platelet derived growth factor bb pdgf bb but not transforming growth factor beta 1 tgf 1 basic fibroblast growth factor or bone morphogenetic protein 2 promoted proliferation and extracellular matrix sulfation of resting zone chondrocytes without causing the cells to exhibit a hypertrophic chondrocyte phenotype <EOS>
<SOS> tgf 1 has also been shown to stimulate chondrogenesis by multipotent chondroprogenitor cells like those in the perichondrium <EOS>
<SOS> in addition pdgf bb has been shown to modulate chondrogensis by resting zone cells implanted in poly d l lactide co glycolide plg scaffolds <EOS>
<SOS> in the present study we examined whether the cartilage formation is dependent on state of chondrocyte maturation and whether the pretreatment of chondrocytes with growth factors has an influence on the cartilage formation <EOS>
<SOS> scaffolds were manufactured from <NUM> plg with a <NUM> lactide glycolide ratio and <NUM> modified plg with a <NUM> lactide glycolide ratio plg h scaffolds <EOS>
<SOS> for each experimental group four nude mice received two identical implants one in each calf muscle resulting in an n <NUM> implants plg h scaffolds alone plg h scaffolds with cells derived from either the femoral articular cartilage costochondral periochondrium or costochondral resting zone cartilage of <NUM> g male sprague dawley rats plg h scaffolds with either articular chondrocytes or resting zone chondrocytes that were pretreated with 37 5 ng ml rhpdgf bb for <NUM> h or <NUM> h before implantation or with perichondrial cells treated with pdgf bb plus 0 22 ng ml rhtgf 1 for <NUM> h and <NUM> h at <NUM> or <NUM> weeks after implantation samples were harvested and analyzed histomorphometrically for new cartilage formed area of residual implant and area of fibrous connective tissue <EOS>
<SOS> only resting zone cells showed the ability to form new cartilage at a heterotopic site in this study <EOS>
<SOS> there was no neocartilage found in nude mice with implants loaded with either articular chondrocytes or perichondrial cells <EOS>
<SOS> pretreatment of resting zone chondrocytes for <NUM> h prior to implantation significantly increased the amount of newly formed cartilage after <NUM> weeks and suppressed chondrocyte hypertrophy <EOS>
<SOS> the amount of fibrous connective tissue around implants containing either articular chondrocytes or perichondrial cells decreased with time whereas the amount of fibrous connective tissue around implants containing resting zone chondrocytes pretreated with pdgf bb was increased <EOS>
<SOS> the results showed that resting zone cells can be successfully incorporated into biodegradable porous plg scaffolds and can induce new cartilage formation in a non weight bearing site <EOS>
<SOS> articular chondrocytes as well as perichondrial cells did not have the capacity for neochondrogenesis when implanted heterotopically in this model <EOS>
<SOS> bone tumors represent a group of tumors of various dignity <EOS>
<SOS> in spite of this single tumor entities may display strong morphological resemblance to each other which can in turn result in profound difficulties in differential diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> the biological behaviour of a tumor is mainly determined by its rate of proliferation <EOS>
<SOS> in this study the rate of proliferation of <NUM> bone tumors 30 high grade central osteosarcomas <NUM> low grade osteosarcomas <NUM> giant cell tumors <NUM> aneurysmatic bone cysts <NUM> osteoidosteomas osteoblastomas <NUM> fibrous dysplasias and <NUM> cases of a myositis ossificans were analysed <EOS>
<SOS> immunohistochemistry was performed on paraffin embedded tissue sections using the mib 1 monoclonal antibody <EOS>
<SOS> mib 1 recognizes the proliferation associated ki 67 protein which is expressed during the active phases of the cell cycle but cannot be detected in senescent cells <EOS>
<SOS> among high grade central osteosarcomas a significantly higher rate of proliferation average value <NUM> was found in comparison with low grade osteosarcomas and other benign intraosseous bone tumors <EOS>
<SOS> this approach proved to be very useful in the distinction between high grade and low grade osteosarcomas as well as bone forming intraosseous tumors <EOS>
<SOS> however distinguishing low grade osteosarcomas from benign bone tumors by determining only the rate of proliferation was not possible although interestingly the proliferative rate of myositis ossificans a purely reactive lesion was in the range of the values determined for high grade osteosarcoma <EOS>
<SOS> over the past century numerous graft materials have been used for the reconstruction of the cruciate ligament of the knee <EOS>
<SOS> among the autologous tissues that are currently recommended as graft materials the central bone patellar tendon bone graft a quadrupled hamstring graft and the central quadriceps tendon graft have the greatest clinical significance <EOS>
<SOS> with some limitations allograft materials can also be used <EOS>
<SOS> each of the three mentioned grafts has specific features regarding morphological and structural properties graft fixation and graft incorporation <EOS>
<SOS> clinical studies have failed to identify any of the three grafts as superior to the others <EOS>
<SOS> when choosing the graft for surgery the different anatomy and function of the anterior and posterior cruciate ligaments have to be considered <EOS>
<SOS> for the treatment of multiple ligament injuries and for revision cases thorough preoperative planning is necessary and modified graft selection may be required <EOS>
<SOS> myasthenic crisis is a lifethreatening complication of myasthenia gravis due to respiratory failure and inability to swallow and cough up secretions <EOS>
<SOS> frequent causes are intercurrent infections fluctuations due to the natural history of the disease and insufficient immunosuppressive treatment prior to the crisis <EOS>
<SOS> early referral to an experienced neurologist is essential <EOS>
<SOS> specific therapy consists of symptomatic treatment with cholinesterase inhibitors crisis management with plasmapheresis or immunoglobulins and immunosuppression with clucocorticoids <EOS>
<SOS> infections must be treated vigorously <EOS>
<SOS> thymectomy in patients with previously unrecognized myasthenia gravis is never urgently indicated and should be postponed until the patient is stabilized <EOS>
<SOS> in cases of impending respiratory failure and severe swallowing difficulties early and elective admission to a specialized neurological intensive care unit and elective intubation should be performed <EOS>
<SOS> adequate nursing care of intubated patients and a set of prophylactic measures are essential to avoid complications adversely affecting prognosis <EOS>
<SOS> whenever it can be achieved the best therapy of myasthenic crisis is its prevention by appropriate long term management and follow up of patients with myasthenia gravis <EOS>
<SOS> in a retrospective analysis we evaluated <NUM> patients who had been arthroscopically treated for tendinitis calcarea <EOS>
<SOS> the calcific deposit was removed whenever possible and all patients were treated by arthroscopic subacromial decompression <EOS>
<SOS> in subjects who showed subacromial stenosis by x ray or by intraoperative findings an arthroscopic acromioplasty was performed <EOS>
<SOS> at follow up all patients were evaluated according to the constant score <EOS>
<SOS> additionally all pre and postoperative x rays were reviewed <EOS>
<SOS> after surgery the constant score significantly improved <EOS>
<SOS> in all cases where acromioplasty was performed a flattening of the bony configuration was achieved <EOS>
<SOS> the x ray analysis showed that no calcific deposit with blurred borders converted to sharp borders <EOS>
<SOS> there was also no deposit that converted from a transparent appearance to a dense structure <EOS>
<SOS> patients with disappearance of the calcific deposit postoperatively had significantly better outcome than patients with no change in the x ray <EOS>
<SOS> an additional acromioplasty did not improve the results <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of arthroscopic treatment of calcific tendinitis has to be the removal of the calcific deposit <EOS>
<SOS> acromioplasty does not lead to further improvement of the result <EOS>
<SOS> preventive strategies aim to reduce gastric acidity h2ms sucralfate antacids pirenzepine and to normalize gastric mucosal microcirculation sucralfate pirenzepine <EOS>
<SOS> thus the most important prophylactic measure is an optimized emergency and icu regime aiming to improve oxygenation and microcirculation <EOS>
<SOS> all specific drugs used for stress ulcer prophylaxis have been shown to be effective in prospective controlled studies <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore pirenzepine has been found to be superior to h2 antagonists at least in neurosurgical patients <EOS>
<SOS> insufficient or no data exist to support the use of prostaglandins or omeprazole for stress ulcer prophylaxis <EOS>
<SOS> the most important adverse effect of stress ulcer prophylaxis is nosocomial pneumonia due to gastric alkalinization <EOS>
<SOS> this may occur in long term ventilated patients with a gastric ph4 and may account for up to 50 of all nosocomial pneumonias in certain groups of patients <EOS>
<SOS> mortality is not influenced by antacids or h2 antagonists while sucralfate has been shown to reduce mortality most probably by inhibition of bacterial translocation <EOS>

<SOS> for inter hospital comparison they may only be used if additionally the observed patient groups are well defined and comparable <EOS>

<SOS> finally it is demonstrated that conclusions concerning a general risk of infection based on infection rates for specific surgical procedures are not possible and vice versa <EOS>
<SOS> we strongly recommend the future application of a standardized definition of wound infection <EOS>

<SOS> introduction the treatment of full thickness cartilage defects still represents a problem that has not yet been solved satisfactorily <EOS>
<SOS> current methods used to cover defects in the knee joint are osteochondral cylinder transplantation oct and autologous chondrocyte transplantation act <EOS>
<SOS> methods with a prospective clinical investigation at the time being with 2 year results we have examined act in comparison to oct in <NUM> patients with regard to clinical and histomorphological histology immunohistochemistry res outcome <EOS>
<SOS> results we found equally good results with both methods in lysholm meyers and tegner activity scores <EOS>
<SOS> histomorphologic evaluation of biopsies obtained by arthroscopy after act showed a defect filling in all cases mainly with fibrous cartilage while localized areas of hyalinelike regenerative cartilage were documented near the base we did not see any histomorphologically visible change in the transplants after oct <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion at the time we prefer oct instead of act given the correct indication <EOS>
<SOS> this case report intends to focus attention on hemodynamic tias as cause of repetitive involuntary movements rims as differential diagnosis of simple partial motor seizures <EOS>
<SOS> we report two patients with episodic unilateral limb shaking lasting up to several minutes and which could be triggered by orthostasis heat or physical exertion <EOS>
<SOS> repeated eeg recordings revealed no epileptic discharges <EOS>
<SOS> in both patients duplex ultrasonography revealed an occlusion of the internal carotid artery ica contralateral to the side of the rims <EOS>
<SOS> blood flow velocities in the middle cerebral artery ipsilateral to ica occlusion were reduced and vasomotor reactivity to hypercapnia was absent <EOS>
<SOS> after elevation of blood pressure both patients became asymptomatic <EOS>
<SOS> we suggest that in patients with episodes of rims doppler sonography and tests of cerebral vascular reserve capacity should be performed to search for a hemodynamic origin of these symptoms <EOS>

<SOS> edc depresses almost all cells but essentially those of the central nervous system liver kidneys and heart <EOS>
<SOS> death is usually due to liver or central nervous failure <EOS>
<SOS> retrospectively analyzing the history of three patients with gastrointesinal stromal tumors gist treated over a period of <NUM> year in the surgical department of our regional hospital we tried to answer the following questions using the current recommendations in the literature how are the macro and microscopic features and clinical presentation to be interpreted <EOS>
<SOS> which prognostic and therapeutic conclusions should we draw giving special consideration to practice orientated management of such cases <EOS>
<SOS> the patients were 65 <NUM> and <NUM> years old respectively and in each case the gist manifested as recurrent gastrointestinal bleeding <EOS>
<SOS> during surgical treatment four gastric tumors ranging in cross section between <NUM> and <NUM> cm were found <EOS>
<SOS> the gist diagnosis was established after light microscopic and immunohistochemical examinations <EOS>
<SOS> going through the current literature a large number of structural and immunohistochemical criteria have come to light for determining its classification and potential malignancy <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand very few subsequent recommendations concerning therapy and prognosis can be found and follow up recomendations are almost unavailable <EOS>
<SOS> we conclude that gists are difficult to diagnose because of their locality and that their clinical behavior is uncertain <EOS>
<SOS> the potential malignancy on the other hand requires a well founded diagnostic procedure in the form of the best possible pre therapeutic staging <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore initially radical surgical treatment should be adopted and the follow up should be adapted to the risk involved <EOS>
<SOS> the latter is arbitrary and further clinical studies are required <EOS>

<SOS> according to the data on the toxicity of perfluorcarbons available today it could potentially be applied in infants in the future too <EOS>
<SOS> however the catalogue of unanswered questions is still too long for controlled clinical phase ii studies to be conducted <EOS>
<SOS> further possible applications of liquid ventilation offer hope of solving open therapeutic and diagnostic problems <EOS>
<SOS> taking into account all available data about liquid ventilation with perfluorcarbons today we still do not know whether it is a real alternative method for respiratory support however further studies to investigate whether the method is an alternative strategy for artificial ventilation in neonates are justified <EOS>

<SOS> after orthopedic surgery skeletal muscle will enter the rehabilitation process in weakened condition due to the following characteristics <EOS>
<SOS> after use of a tourniquet during surgery the muscle suffers ischemia reperfusion damage due to oxidative stress resulting in structural impairment <EOS>
<SOS> the resulting immobilization leads to muscular atrophy with a loss of calcium homeostasis and oxidative stress being of etiological significance <EOS>
<SOS> degeneration of muscle fibers as well as regeneration occurs in muscle while still immobilized <EOS>
<SOS> after remobilization the muscle has impaired functional capacity and frequently shows disturbances in its innervation pattern <EOS>
<SOS> high mechanical loading should therefore be avoided and electrical stimulation may be applied to facilitate recovery <EOS>
<SOS> considering the role of oxygen radicals supplementation with vitamin e appears generally recommendable <EOS>
<SOS> the timing of surgery and postoperative radiotherapy especially if combined with chemotherapy has been a subject of interest over the past years <EOS>
<SOS> this analysis was based on a literature review of mostly retrospective publications <EOS>
<SOS> data concerning the interval between surgery and radiotherapy were correlated with the locoregional control incidence of distant metastases and prognosis of breast cancer lung carcinoma and head and neck carcinomas <EOS>
<SOS> the reviewed data did not show a clear relationship of the time interval between surgery and start of radiotherapy and locoregional control <EOS>
<SOS> however evaluation of the data was difficult because in most publications retrospective analyses were performed and other prognostically more relevant parameters may influence locoregional control stronger than the time interval <EOS>
<SOS> in patients with head and neck carcinomas there is a negative effect of time interval between surgery and radiotherapy on local control if unfavorable factors exist i e close surgical margins unfavorable pathohistological parameters and low radiation dose <EOS>
<SOS> in patients with breast cancer who do not receive chemotherapy there are inconsistent reports in the literature <EOS>
<SOS> if additional chemotherapy is necessary the sequence surgery chemotherapy and radiotherapy seems adequate <EOS>
<SOS> although some data suggest that delaying the initiation of radiotherapy due to chemotherapy may increase the risk or local recurrences there may on the other hand be an increased likelihood of systemic metastases if radiotherapy is applied before chemotherapy <EOS>
<SOS> concerning lung cancer only one retrospective analysis exists suggesting a better survival of patients with an interval of more than <NUM> days between surgery and radiotherapy as compared to patients with a shorter interval <EOS>

<SOS> in situ polymerase chain reaction pcr and pcr in situ hybridization are new diagnostic tools in dermatopathology <EOS>
<SOS> these techniques can combine the sensitivity of pcr with the advantage of in situ hybridization to localize specific cellular structures <EOS>
<SOS> with optical control of the pcr reaction product in these techniques false positive results due to contamination can be minimized <EOS>
<SOS> several working protocols have been established which allow detection of dna and rna sequences in a rapid and reproducible manner <EOS>
<SOS> two different methods have been established to detect the amplification product the indirect pcr in situ hybridization pcrishyb and the direct in situ pcr is pcr <EOS>
<SOS> an easy and reproducible method for pcrishyb and ispcr in formalin fixed and paraffin embedded tissue is described and the two techniques are compared <EOS>
<SOS> using both ispcr and pcrishyb the amplification product can be visualized with an optimal morphological preservation of the tissue <EOS>
<SOS> indirect pcrishyb showed a slightly higher specificity whereas direct ispcr was the quicker easier and less expensive method <EOS>

<SOS> a prick test was done the day before by scarification of the skin in the forearm <EOS>
<SOS> after premedication with <NUM> mg lormetazepam anaesthesia was induced with thiopentone 4 12 mg kg and maintained with o2 n2o and isoflurane <MOB> vol <EOS>
<SOS> six minutes after thiopentone the patients received the relaxant and after further <NUM> min <MOB> mg fentanyl was given and the trachea was intubated <EOS>
<SOS> heart rate hr and blood pressure bp were monitored every minute <EOS>
<SOS> blood samples for histamine were withdrawn <NUM> min prior <NUM> and <NUM> min after each drug administration thiopentone relaxants <EOS>
<SOS> plasma histamine was measured by radioimmunoassay ria with a sensitivity of approximately <NUM> pg ml <EOS>
<SOS> additionally serum tryptase was measured by ria at baseline 10 and <NUM> 1 min and <NUM> and <NUM> min after the relaxant administration <EOS>
<SOS> levels for histamine 100 pg ml and for tryptase 2 µg ml were considered significant <EOS>
<SOS> cutaneous signs of histamine release were documented <EOS>
<SOS> results ten patients showed a positive prick test reaction <EOS>
<SOS> only after thiopentone some cutaneous signs 4 flush <NUM> erythema of histamine release were observed <EOS>
<SOS> there were no cutaneous signs of histamine release correlating with cardiovascular changes <EOS>
<SOS> analysis of the blood samples demonstrated no significant increase in the histamine level in all three groups <EOS>
<SOS> only in <NUM> patient was a significant higher histamine level 1133 pg ml measured <NUM> min after 5xed95 cisatracurium <EOS>
<SOS> all measurements of serum tryptase were within the physiological limits <EOS>
<SOS> discussion in this study with the particular time course of drug administration neither cisatracurium nor vecuronium increased plasma histamine levels <EOS>
<SOS> only after 5xed95 cisatracurium was <NUM> elevated histamine level documented after <NUM> min <EOS>
<SOS> in several studies increased histamine levels have been described but without clinical manifestations <EOS>
<SOS> it is known that cutaneous signs can occur without increased plasma histamine levels due to the structural heterogeneity of mast cells <EOS>
<SOS> the cutaneous reactions in this study were caused by thiopentone <EOS>
<SOS> the tryptase values were within normal limits even in the patient with histamine release <EOS>
<SOS> no relationship between the positive results in the prick test and the incidence of cutaneous reactions and or histamine release for drugs used in the induction of anaesthesia was observed <EOS>

<SOS> proton pump inhibitors omeprazole lansoprazole and pantoprazole have revolutionized the therapy of peptic disease of the upper gastrointestinal tract and reduced the indications for surgical intervention <EOS>
<SOS> these substances inhibit the h k atpase in the parietal cells with an acid suppressing potency that is much higher than that of h2 receptor antagonists <EOS>
<SOS> the first proton pump inhibitor omeprazole has been introduced ten years ago <EOS>
<SOS> since then sufficient experience with this drug in children has accumulated <EOS>
<SOS> omeprazole is released for children aged one year or older <EOS>
<SOS> a new formulation makes the drug applicable in tube fed patients <EOS>
<SOS> the main indications for the use of omeprazole are endoscopically verified peptic esophagitis and gastric and duodenal ulcerations of different etiologies <EOS>
<SOS> in the treatment of helicobacter pylori infection a sufficient acid suppression is essential for the efficacy of the antibiotics <EOS>
<SOS> the recommended pediatric dose ranges between 0 7 1 4 mg kg bodyweight and day <EOS>
<SOS> however some children with ulcerative esophagitis may need daily doses up to <NUM> mg kg <EOS>
<SOS> healing of the esophageal mucosa should be monitored by endoscopy <EOS>
<SOS> after remission doses can often be reduced for maintenance therapy <EOS>
<SOS> side effects are rare and do not seem to increase with higher doses <EOS>
<SOS> possibly interactions with other medications i e <EOS>
<SOS> antiepileptic drugs may occur <EOS>
<SOS> a long term therapy lasting more than <NUM> months in a child should be monitored by an experienced pediatric gastroenterologist <EOS>

<SOS> apnea bradycardia and oxygen desaturation in infants with very low birth weight are common findings in neonatal intensive care <EOS>
<SOS> the prognostic significance of their intensity and frequency and the principles of treatment however are controversial <EOS>
<SOS> the universal aim in order to prevent traumatization of the lung is to ventilate infants with very low birth weight for as short a time as possible <EOS>
<SOS> therefore drugs such as theophylline aminophylline and doxapram and techniques such as nasal cpap have been studied in our neonatal intensive care unit <EOS>
<SOS> in these studies we developed a treatment algorithm <EOS>
<SOS> in two clinically controlled studies performed successively we first proved that sodium acetate theophylline given intravenously has the same efficacy as aminophylline <EOS>
<SOS> as aminophylline has more side effects sodium acetate theophylline is preferable <EOS>
<SOS> bradycardia apnea and desaturation were registered from the print out of the monitoring system is trend analysis and in a polysomnographic study during steady state conditions <EOS>
<SOS> in a historical study we were able to prove that intravenous injection of aminophylline is superior to oral administration <EOS>
<SOS> we demonstrated equal efficacy of doxapram and theophylline however doxapram reduced the rate of apnea significantly more during the first <NUM> days of treatment <EOS>
<SOS> in a retrospective study we analyzed the efficacy of nasal cpap as the third level of treatment <EOS>
<SOS> the rate of bradycardia apnea and desaturation was significantly reduced during cpap and respiratory rate and oxygenation improved <EOS>
<SOS> the algorithm developed established theophylline with <NUM> mg kg as bolus infusion over <NUM> min followed by <NUM> mg kg bid as the first line of treatment <EOS>
<SOS> only if a quick therapeutic response was desirable was doxapram the first drug of choice indication 4 bradycardias below 80 min <NUM> desaturations below 80 or <NUM> apneas of 20 s over <NUM> h <EOS>
<SOS> after <NUM> h an additional second drug was added if we could still observe 3 apneas <NUM> bradycardias or <NUM> desaturations over this period <EOS>
<SOS> nasal cpap was introduced as the third line of treatment <EOS>
<SOS> with this treatment algorithm we were able to reduce the time on a respirator of infants with very low birth weight from <NUM> to <NUM> days p0 01 <EOS>
<SOS> an evaluation of similar treatment algorithms in multi institutional studies is indicated <EOS>

<SOS> conclusion at least for chronic sufferers from back pain and sleep problems the association between sleep quality and quality of the mattress is significant <EOS>

<SOS> we report on a 32 year old male patient with advanced acquired immunodeficiency syndrome aids who had severe candidiasis of the gastrointestinal tract <EOS>
<SOS> treatment with fluconazole <NUM> mg day was introduced <EOS>
<SOS> after oral intake of fluconazole over <NUM> months itraconazole <NUM> mg day was given for <NUM> month <EOS>
<SOS> however fungal infection still persisted <EOS>
<SOS> the antifungal activity of fluconazole itraconazole and ketoconazole against candida albicans was evaluated by means of the microdilution test by determining the 90 inhibitory concentrations of each drugs <EOS>
<SOS> a high minimal inhibitory concentration mic was detected for fluconazole 50 µg ml revealing fluconazole resistance <EOS>
<SOS> the susceptibility to itraconazole was borderline mic <NUM> µg ml and that to ketoconazole was markedly lowered mic <NUM> µg ml <EOS>
<SOS> plasma levels of itraconazole were also found to be lowered <EOS>
<SOS> in hiv patients the gastrointestinal absorption of azole derivatives is often reduced <EOS>
<SOS> therefore the clinical resistance of candida albicans to itraconazole can be explained by reduced susceptibility after azole therapy and also by the decreased absorption of the drug in hiv patients <EOS>
<SOS> patients suffering from soft tissue sarcoma of the extremities may sometimes require vascular reconstruction to remove the tumor with adequate margins of clearance <EOS>
<SOS> besides this recurrent lymph node metastases are often affixed to neighboring vessels <EOS>
<SOS> mri and angiography represent the adequate diagnostic procedures <EOS>
<SOS> vessel invasive sarcoma can hardly be treated by surgical resection with curative intent alone <EOS>
<SOS> if there is doubt about invasion of arteries and veins the vessels should be resected and replaced by autologous vein graft <EOS>
<SOS> soft tissue coverage is of major importance particularly if prosthetic grafts are used or the resection is within an area of irradiated tissue <EOS>
<SOS> after radical resection and combined modality therapy one can expect local recurrence rates similar to those without vessel invasion <EOS>

<SOS> laser treatment of various skin changes has become common clinical practice in recent years <EOS>
<SOS> due to its physical properties the co2 laser is particularly well suited for cutting and ablating tissue <EOS>
<SOS> the high absorption of its wavelength in water 10600 nm is responsible for its low penetration depth in biological tissue <EOS>
<SOS> shortening the exposure time minimizes thermal side effects such as carbonization and coagulation <EOS>

<SOS> this enables a controlled and reliable removal of various dermal lesions <EOS>

<SOS> cosmetically favorable reepithelialization of the treated skin surfaces occurs within a very short time after treatment <EOS>

<SOS> apc resistance was first discovered in <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> it is the most frequent cause of thrombophilia in europe and north america <EOS>
<SOS> in more than 90 of cases the underlying cause of apc resistance is a single point mutation in the factor v gene <EOS>
<SOS> heterozygous patients have a between five and ten fold higher risk of developing venous thrombosis while in homozygous patients the risk is increased up to between 50 and 100 fold <EOS>
<SOS> where there is a previous history of thrombosis a careful investigation of the coagulation system in particular a determination of the apc ratio is recommended prior to surgery <EOS>
<SOS> in patients with apc resistance a body weight specific thrombosis prophylaxis with heparin is recommended <EOS>
<SOS> heterozygous patients only need anticoagulation when additional risk conditions are present while homozygous patients with thromboembolic disease should be anticoagulated over a long period of time <EOS>
<SOS> primary varicosis of the saphenous system should be treated promptly by surgery to minimize the additional risk of thrombotic complications <EOS>
<SOS> pyomyositis is an acute bacterial infection with abscess formation in the skeletal muscles mostly due to staphylococcus aureus <EOS>
<SOS> the disease is found more often in males <EOS>
<SOS> since the patients symptoms and the clinical and laboratory findings are relatively unspecific the clinical diagnosis of pyomyositis can present difficulties <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore cases of pyomyositis are rare in non tropical countries and some physicians may not be familiar with it <EOS>
<SOS> if not diagnosed and treated properly pyomyositis can lead to sepsis and death <EOS>
<SOS> although the pathogenesis of the disease has not yet been clarified some predisposing factors of forensic interest are well known trivial trauma or vigorous exercise of the affected skeletal muscles small potentially septic foci in other tissues or internal organs and a preexisting immunodeficiency e g in diabetes mellitus intravenous drug abusers or individuals suffering from hiv <EOS>
<SOS> three cases of non tropical pyomyositis with fatal outcome are presented and the literature on the subject is reviewed with special reference to epidemiological and etiological factors taking forensic aspects histomorphologic findings and the problems of post mortem diagnosis of pyomyositis into consideration <EOS>

<SOS> interfragmentary movement and size of the fracture gap influence fracture healing <EOS>
<SOS> limited movements promote callus formation and may result in increased mechanical stability <EOS>
<SOS> although larger movements still promote callus formation the bony consolidation of the fracture is hampered <EOS>
<SOS> fracture healing is also hampered if the size of the fracture gap is too large <EOS>
<SOS> a combination of large movement and large gap bears the risk of non union <EOS>
<SOS> therefore having in mind a minimally invasive surgical approach one should strive for good reduction of the fracture ends and flexible yet stable osteosynthesis <EOS>
<SOS> dynamization of the fracture by enabling axial movement will close the fracture gap stimulate tissue differentiation and possibly accelerate the healing process <EOS>
<SOS> external mechanical stimulation however has not been shown to effectively enhance the healing process under flexible fixation or in load bearing patients <EOS>

<SOS> the calculation of predicted postoperative lung function ppo is of importance <EOS>
<SOS> the postoperative values for the forced expiratory volume in one second fev1 ppo the transfer factor tl co ppo and vo2max ppo can be predicted by using the same formula <EOS>
<SOS> patients with nearly normal lung function fev1 tl co <NUM> predicted and no concomitant cardiac disease can undergo lung resection right up to pneumonectomy without further diagnostic procedures <EOS>

<SOS> if vo2max is <NUM> ml kg min or <NUM> predicted functional operability without limitation is given <EOS>

<SOS> patients with either fev1 ppo and tl co ppo <NUM> predicted or vo2max ppo <NUM> ml kg min or <NUM> predicted are deemed inoperable <EOS>

<SOS> based on a case report we offer brief guidelines on the perioperative management of patients with sleep apnea syndrome sas who present with a high incidence of a difficult airway and a high risk of respiratory depression during the perioperative period <EOS>
<SOS> a <NUM> year old male patient with a body mass index of 34 22 kg m2 and receiving continuous positive airway pressure cpap therapy for known sas was scheduled for elective plastic surgery <EOS>
<SOS> after induction of anaesthesia and direct laryngoscopy no adequate airway could be established and the patient became hypoxic hypercapnic and developed hypotension and bradycardia <EOS>
<SOS> with the use of a laryngeal mask airway the patient was stabilized and did not show neurologic sequale after immediate awakening <EOS>
<SOS> the following fiberoptic intubation of the awake patient still showing tendency of upper airway obstruction confirmed the difficult anatomical structures <EOS>
<SOS> the subsequent general anesthesia was uneventful <EOS>
<SOS> the patient received cpap therapy and was monitored during the first postoperative night in the intensive care unit <EOS>
<SOS> he made an uneventful recovery <EOS>
<SOS> he was advised to have regional anaesthesia or planned fiberoptic intubation where possible in the case of further anesthetic intervention <EOS>
<SOS> sas has major implications for the anaesthesiologist and whenever patients exhibiting the high risk factors obesity male sex history of intense snoring impaired daytime performance nonrefreshing daytime naps are presented for surgery this condition should be considered <EOS>
<SOS> elective surgery should be postponed until after adequate examination and treatment when necessary <EOS>
<SOS> patients with sas should always be suspected of having cardiopulmonary dysfunctions such as hypertension cardiac dysrhythmia or cor pulmonale <EOS>
<SOS> it is most important to avoid sedative premedication to initiate cpap therapy preoperatively to encourage regional anaesthesia if possible and to ensure close monitoring over the complete perioperative period <EOS>
<SOS> planned fiberoptic intubation preferably with surgical personnel available for an emergency airway is a safe method for the induction of anaesthesia <EOS>
<SOS> postoperatively patients are at high risk from respiratory depression even in the awake state <EOS>
<SOS> postoperative opioid analgesia no matter what route should only be given under close monitoring <EOS>
<SOS> independently of regional or general anaesthesia there is an increased risk of respiratory depression in the middle of the first postoperative week suspected to be caused by the catching up on lost rem sleep due to shifts in the normal sleep pattern during the first postoperative days <EOS>

<SOS> the absorption of large volumes of irrigation fluid is a major problem in transurethral prostatic surgery tur p <EOS>
<SOS> various indicators have been tested to monitor fluid absorption with regard to continuous registration and sufficient accuracy <EOS>
<SOS> the volumetric fluid balance is not suitable as a routine method because of its inaccuracy <EOS>
<SOS> easily accessible parameters are unspecific because of surgical bleeding haematocrit hct or are interfered with by physiological counter regulatory actions serum sodium na concentration <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> hulten et al <EOS>
<SOS> suggested adding 2 ethanol to the irrigation fluid as a marker and investigated it intermittently in the expired air with an alcohol test appliance <EOS>
<SOS> in a prospective clinical study of <NUM> patients undergoing tur p under spinal anaesthesia expiratory concentrations of alcohol that was added to the irrigation fluid 2 ethanol in purisole fresenius bad homburg were monitored <EOS>
<SOS> gas was continuously sampled from the nasopharynx through a nasal cannula and the ethanol concentration was measured using a modified diverting anaesthetic gas monitor normac datex helsinki that allows continuous as well as early detection of the absorbed irrigation fluid with reliable accuracy for clinical use <EOS>

<SOS> in the last decades back pain has reached dramatic proportions in industrialized countries <EOS>
<SOS> disorders of the back are nowadays the leading cause of direct and indirect health care costs <EOS>
<SOS> accurate prevalence estimates are needed to serve as a basis for health care evaluations <EOS>
<SOS> a review of epidemiologic studies in the general population reveals that back pain has reached a prevalence of <NUM> for current pain <EOS>
<SOS> 7 to <NUM> are frequently often daily or constantly affected <EOS>
<SOS> 75 of the adult population suffers from back pain during the last year <EOS>
<SOS> 80 to <NUM> of the adult population in industrialized countries experience back pain ever <EOS>
<SOS> gender specific differences are only present in severe chronic forms which are more often experienced by women <EOS>
<SOS> back pain has a prevalence maximum at <NUM> to <NUM> years <EOS>
<SOS> older persons display lower prevalence estimates <EOS>
<SOS> the prevalence maximum in men is one decade earlier than in women <EOS>
<SOS> there are several potential explanations for this prevalence pattern that are discussed in the article <EOS>
<SOS> back pain can be classified by location temporal characteristics pain intensity and pain history <EOS>
<SOS> currently for none of these dimensions generally accepted uniformly employed and validated definitions are available <EOS>
<SOS> in most of the industrialized countries back pain is one of the most expensive symptoms <EOS>
<SOS> 75 90 of the direct and indirect health care costs were caused by those 5 10 of patients who are disabled <EOS>
<SOS> as predictors of back pain a history of back pain and job satisfaction play by far a more important role than the extensively studied mechanical factors <EOS>
<SOS> for a first episode of back pain the prognosis is favorable <EOS>
<SOS> if the pain persist for more than three months the prognosis is unfavorable <EOS>
<SOS> after six months of absenteeism because of back pain more than half of the afflicted never return to work <EOS>
<SOS> rarely back pain is present as a single symptom <EOS>
<SOS> in more than <NUM> back pain is associated with pain in at least one joint <EOS>
<SOS> it remains to be studied if back pain may be viewed as an entity or as part of a more complex pain syndrome <EOS>
<SOS> chronic low back pain can be considered to be one of the most frequently treated and most costly diseases in modern industrial societies <EOS>
<SOS> dysfunctions and imbalances of the spine supporting muscles increase the risk of low back pain <EOS>
<SOS> consequently preventive treatment and rehabilitation have to aim at preserving and restoring the full capacity of the spine supporting muscles as well as training coordination and spine friendly behaviour <EOS>
<SOS> in addition to various measures of pain therapy physiotherapeutic treatment including neuro physiotherapy physical treatment eg electrotherapy balneotherapy and supportive behavioural training medical rehabilitation therapy mrt ranks among the most effective ways of treating low back pain <EOS>
<SOS> mrt applies guidelines and methods of exercise methodology within medically indicated programmes of preventive treatment and rehabilitation <EOS>
<SOS> various objectives of mrt are outlined with special regard to the stages of mrt treatment emphasizing positive adaptation of the neuro muscular system in the course of rehabilitation <EOS>
<SOS> physicians are responsible for mrt diagnosis and control <EOS>
<SOS> taking into account the base disorder and the progress of therapy physiotherapists and the physicians in charge determine mrt objectives and treatment strategies <EOS>

<SOS> diagnosis of parasomnias in the sleep laboratory is difficult since the nocturnal behavior reported by the patients often does not show up in the laboratory <EOS>
<SOS> to test the efficacy of sleep deprivation as a tool to provoke somnambulism we investigated ten patients three women and seven men mean age <NUM> 3 4 with somnambulism <EOS>
<SOS> their standard polysomnographies and videomonitored nocturnal behavior was compared to that of sex and age matched controls and to polysomnography and behavior after sleep deprivation <EOS>
<SOS> patients with parasomnias and controls did not show significant differences in sleep parameters with the exception of longer arousal duration in controls which was nonsignificant <EOS>
<SOS> in magnetic resonance tomography patients with parasomnias did not reveal abnormality of the brain that might explain release of nocturnal behavior <EOS>
<SOS> sleep deprivation led to significantly reduced number of arousals reduced arousal index significantly prolonged arousal duration and more stage shifts from all sleep stages nonsignificant <EOS>
<SOS> complex behavior during sleep increased under sleep deprivation whereas sleepwalking did not increase <EOS>
<SOS> the majority of complex behavior during sleep is triggered by stage shifts and not by arousal in the sense of the arousal definition of the american sleep disorder society <EOS>
<SOS> complex behavior in sleep is stereotypical and nonviolent <EOS>
<SOS> its complexity seems to depend on the duration and intensity of arousals <EOS>
<SOS> sleep deprivation can be recommended as an efficacious method of increasing complex behavior in sleep which is a preliminary stage of sleepwalking <EOS>
<SOS> concerning the underlying pathology it seems to be important to register the quality and duration of stimuli that trigger arousals instead of focusing the number of arousals alone <EOS>

<SOS> two closely matched groups of responders n 20 and non responders n 20 were compared <EOS>
<SOS> no significant differences were observed between both groups with respect to the following parameters skin type minimal erythema dose single and cumulative doses of uva1 and peripheral blood eosinophils <EOS>
<SOS> however non responders were characterized by a highly elevated atopic score and by high levels of total ige and of specific ige <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore colonization of the skin with staphylococcus aureus occured at higher densities and intestinal growth of candida albicans was more frequently observed <EOS>
<SOS> these data indicate that high dose uva1 irradiation is not effective in all patients suffering from atopic dermatitis <EOS>
<SOS> we conclude that non responders with complicating infections might benefit from the combination of high dose uva1 therapy and antibiotic or antimycotic treatment <EOS>

<SOS> the hepatorenal syndrome is defined as the development of renal failure in patients with severe liver disease in the absence of any other identifiable cause of renal functional impairment <EOS>
<SOS> the pathogenesis of this obviously functional renal failure is complex and not completely understood <EOS>
<SOS> of importance seems to be a peripheral and systemic vasodilatation with redistribution of blood volume <EOS>
<SOS> nitric oxide seems to play a major role as a possible primary mediator <EOS>
<SOS> as a consequence changes in several different pathophysiological mechanisms sympathetic nervous system renin angiotensin system vasopressin endothelin prostanoids natriuretic peptides lead to a functional renal impairment which is characterized by renal cortical vasoconstriction <EOS>
<SOS> supportive treatment and intensive monitoring of the cardiovascular circulation is the main goal in the care of these patients <EOS>
<SOS> the mortality is still high exceeding 90 <EOS>
<SOS> renal extracorporeal support should be initiated using a continuous method when recovery of liver function is expected acute liver failure waiting for liver transplantation <EOS>
<SOS> the only effective and permanent treatment is orthotopic liver transplantation <EOS>

<SOS> an adequate increase of uterine blood flow throughout gestation is essential for uterine placental and fetal growth <EOS>
<SOS> maternal cardiovascular adaptation has to provide the uterine perfusion that is necessary to meet the requirements of the developing and growing fetus by providing transport of nutrients and oxygen to the placenta and the fetus <EOS>
<SOS> thus uterine blood flow is inextricably linked to fetal growth and survival <EOS>
<SOS> reductions of uterine blood flow can occur under acute or chronic conditions or in a combination of both <EOS>
<SOS> chronic reductions of uterine blood flow can be observed in pregnancy induced hyertension pih diabetes mellitus in pregnancy and intrauterine growth restriction iugr <EOS>
<SOS> chronic restrictions in uterine blood flow will elicit a placental and fetal response in the form of growth adaptation to the reduced supply of oxygen and nutrients to the conceptus <EOS>
<SOS> if compensatory growth restriction reaches its limits intrauterine fetal distress can ensue <EOS>

<SOS> paragangliomas of the cauda equina show monomorphous main cells arranged in a typical cell cluster pattern demonstrating a lobular architecture and a fine net of connective tissue formed by so called sustentacular cells some tumours show focal ganglionic differentiation <EOS>

<SOS> during this observation period twenty nine of them died because of cancer disease <EOS>

<SOS> process experiential pe therapy is a neo humanistic treatment that strives to maintain a creative tension between a client centered emphasis on a genuine estecming empathic relationship and the active task focused process directive style of gestalt therapie <EOS>
<SOS> this form of treatment is scientifically validated grawe 1997 <EOS>
<SOS> its theory of function and dysfunction has been updated via contributions from contemporary psychological theory <EOS>

<SOS> this second part of the review provides an overview of specific therapeutic tasks <EOS>
<SOS> at last suggestions for practical implementation are discussed and available outcome data is summarized <EOS>

<SOS> because of the side effects for example the irritation of the stomach analytical chemists and pharmacologists searched for chemical modifications <EOS>
<SOS> in august <NUM> felix hoffmann <MOB> was successful in acetylizing the salicylic acid to acetylsalicyl acid asa <EOS>

<SOS> despite wide spread immunisation programs epidemic influenza continues to cause ten thousands of deaths worldwide every year especially in the high risk groups of elderly or immunocompromised persons <EOS>
<SOS> at present amantadine and rimantadine are the only approved agents available for prophylactic and therapeutic use yet the deployment of these substances is problematic neither of the two drugs is effective against influenza b their use is accompanied by rapid development of viral resistance and they show many adverse effects <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast zanamivir and gs4071 gs4104 are rationally developed influenza specific neuraminidase inhibitors proving prophylactic and therapeutic efficacy against influenza a and b as well in vitro as in animal models and in experimental human studies <EOS>

<SOS> in primary abdominal compartment syndrome the increased intraabdominal pressure is caused directly by peritonitis ileus or abdominal and pelvic trauma <EOS>
<SOS> secondary compartment syndrome is a result of forced closure of the abdominal wall after abdominal surgery <EOS>

<SOS> we used a standard posterolateral approach under local anesthesia combined with spinal morphine anesthesia <EOS>
<SOS> the treated levels were l5 s1 11 l4 5 12 l3 4 3 and l2 3 1 <EOS>
<SOS> all areas could be reached by this approach <EOS>
<SOS> one procedure had to be abandoned because of instrumentation problems <EOS>
<SOS> one patient had recurrent disk herniation and had an open procedure <EOS>
<SOS> two patients were reoperated because of persistent pain <EOS>
<SOS> no signs of reherniation could be found in these cases but there was swelling of the nerve root and minimal scarring <EOS>
<SOS> minor complications were trancient root paresthesia and headache postoperatively <EOS>
<SOS> postoperative mri or ct scans revealed only little scar tissue <EOS>
<SOS> this impression was supported in the open revisions we performed <EOS>
<SOS> clinical acceptance of the procedure was excellent and the patients recovered very quickly <EOS>
<SOS> endoscopic transforaminal surgery has a considerable learning curve even when surgeons are acquainted with the posterolateral approach and arthroskopic surgery <EOS>
<SOS> however it offers a good alternative to other minimally invasive procedures and has to be seen as a good alternative to open disk surgery too <EOS>

<SOS> conventional mr imaging can accurately demonstrate normal or acutely injured ligaments however in subacute and chronic injury joint fluid necessary for delineation of injured ligaments is absent and mr arthrography should be performed <EOS>

<SOS> several studies have demonstrated an association chlamydia pneumoniae with coronary artery disease suggesting that infection with c pneumoniae increases the risk for coronary artery disease by factor <NUM> or more <EOS>
<SOS> since atherosclerosis is considered to be a chronic inflammatory process these data would fit into the response to injury hypothesis of atherosclerosis rather than representing a completely novel concept <EOS>

<SOS> preeclampsia is a disorder specific to pregnancy which can affect all maternal organs <EOS>
<SOS> cerebral involvement with the occurence of convulsions is the defining factor for eclampsia <EOS>
<SOS> the most prominent signs of cerebral dysfunction include headache hyperreflexia visual disturbances confusion and or altered state of consciousness <EOS>
<SOS> patients usually recover completely however some patients remain disabled due to cerebrovascular damage <EOS>
<SOS> intracerebral and subarachnoidal hemorrhage are severe however rare complications of eclampsia <EOS>
<SOS> tcd investigations regularly find vasospasm in all great cerebral arteries <EOS>
<SOS> reversible hypodense lesions in the white matter on early ct scans and increased signal intensities on t2 weighted mrt images indicate local edema <EOS>
<SOS> the etiology of preeclampsia and eclampsia remains unknown and its current pathophysiology is still hypothetical <EOS>
<SOS> the clinical picture may best be explained by an endothelial dysfunction with increased vascular sensivity to circulating pressure agents as well as by a structural endothelial lesion with fluid loss from the intravascular compartment <EOS>
<SOS> this article reviews the surgical treatment of chronic posterior knee instability <EOS>
<SOS> the treatment rationale includes exact definition of the instability pattern envelope of motion of the tibia by clinical examination arthrometry and stress radiography <EOS>
<SOS> exact evaluation of the osseous anatomy is mandatory to identify an eventual varus morphotype <EOS>
<SOS> this osseous variant in combination with posterior posterolateral instability should be treated by an osteotomy in every case <EOS>

<SOS> results of surgery are still moderate <EOS>

<SOS> the research field of tissue engineering combines cells biology biomaterial science and surgery <EOS>
<SOS> major long term goals are tissue and organ replacement therapies using the patients own cells <EOS>
<SOS> our work is focused on the treatment of severe joint defects and on plastic surgery using in vitro engineered cartilage tissues <EOS>
<SOS> the practical approaches in cartilage engineering face problems with three dimensional cell distribution or cell immobilization raising biocompatibility problems <EOS>
<SOS> the tissue engineering of cartilage is based on combining biocompatible cell embedding substances such as fibrin agarose alginate hyaluronic acid and fiber fleece scaffolds of poly hydroxy acids plla pgla <EOS>
<SOS> different technical approaches were established a three dimensional in vitro cultures of chondrocytes for the development of vital tissue transplants and b interacting three dimensional cultures consisting of different cell populations such as bmp transfected mesenchymal cells <EOS>
<SOS> the preshaped artificial tissue constructs were cultured in perfusion chambers to maintain a stable diffusion of nutrients during the in vitro pre formation step <EOS>
<SOS> subsequently pre formed tissues were implanted into nude mice and into 4mm articular joint defects of rabbits <EOS>
<SOS> transplants were found to produce cartilage typic morphological patterns and matrix <EOS>
<SOS> 80 of the transplants remained stable in vivo <EOS>
<SOS> however 20 of the tissues are resorbed or replaced by a fibrous tissue <EOS>
<SOS> these results demonstrate that current artificial cartilage transplants are already feasible for plastic reconstruction <EOS>
<SOS> the treatment of severe joint defects however faces additional problems which are addressed in ongoing studies a the fixation of engineered cartilage in joints b the protection against chronic inflammatory degradation and c the required enormous mechanical stability <EOS>

<SOS> sepsis developing on the basis of a postoperative infection is a rare but life threatening event <EOS>
<SOS> early diagnosis of postoperative complications usually facilitates decisive intervention and a favorable prognosis <EOS>
<SOS> if the right moment is missed endothelial damage leads to the release of inflammatory mediators and generalized systemic infection sirs <EOS>

<SOS> in one third of the healthy volunteers the values of the piano voice duration were greater than those of forte for almost all pitches examined <EOS>
<SOS> in two thirds of the healthy subjects the values of forte voice duration were partly greater as were those of piano voice duration <EOS>
<SOS> all of the patients showed voice duration values greater for forte than for piano <EOS>
<SOS> the results of the study demonstrate that the 3d phonogram is a useful tool for obtaining new insights into various relationships of voice parameters <EOS>
