<SOS> the aim of the study was the investigation of the metabolism of hepatocellular carcinomas hcc and the kinetics during a treatment with intratumoral ethanol by pet <EOS>
<SOS> the ongoing study includes seven patients with child a cirrhosis and hcc uicc stage ii iva tumor size 3 6 cm <EOS>
<SOS> dynamic pet studies 60 min with 18f fluordeoxyglucose fdg were performed prior to therapy to assess tumor viability <EOS>
<SOS> the evaluation of the fdg data demonstrated a liver equivalent uptake in six of the tumors well and moderately differentiated hcc which were poorly delineated against the normal liver parenchyma <EOS>
<SOS> one moderately differentiated hcc showed an increased fdg metabolism indicating no correlation between histology and metabolism <EOS>
<SOS> a dose of 37 80 mbq 11c ethanol was applied together with a nonlabelled therapeutic dose of the drug via a puncture needle positioned under sonography <EOS>
<SOS> five out of seven tumors demonstrated a high 11c uptake shortly after the end of the ethanol injection followed by constant 11c ethanol concentration during the whole study period of <NUM> min <EOS>
<SOS> the pet data demonstrated no significant elimination of the 11c ethanol from the tumor and no accumulation in the surrounding liver tissue <EOS>
<SOS> one case showed a decrease of the intratumoral 11c ethanol concentration due to a punkture of a tumor vein and in another case the surrounding liver parenchyma demonstrated significant 11c uptake in the early phase following paratumoral injection of the drug <EOS>
<SOS> in conclusion pet is a useful tool for the study of the mechanism and the kinetics of percutaneous intratumoral ethanol injection of hcc <EOS>
<SOS> during the last decade many investigations were conducted in order to understand the mechanisms involved in the development of acute lung injury ali or acute respiratory distress syndrome ards <EOS>
<SOS> however the increasing knowledge instead of clarification leads us to realize that these terms may assemble a wide variety of lung pathologies <EOS>
<SOS> indeed many circumstances can result in these syndromes and no particular factor has been defined to distinguish ards of one etiology from another <EOS>
<SOS> we are still ignorant about which factors lead to the extended inflammation from pneumonia to ards while it is not clear whether the timing of events are determined by some mediators <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore in the clinical arena there is no clear distinction between pneumonia severe pneumonia which may lead to ali and then ards <EOS>
<SOS> finally the results of all these studies should have allowed us to investigate new therapeutical approaches while none seems to emerge <EOS>
<SOS> this review is an analysis by an icu clinician of the different points of view of these syndromes and intends to give a global vision of the numerous factors implied emphasizing the complex interactions between them <EOS>
<SOS> the present state about new potential treatments directed on mediators is summarized <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of the study was to evaluate if a combined physiologic therapeutic scoring system maris marburger intensive score offers better outcome prediction compared to scoring systems which are based either only physiologically apache ii acute physiology and chronic health evaluation ii or only therapeutically tiss therapeutic intervention scoring system in medical intensive care medicine <EOS>
<SOS> main outcome parameters employed were hospital mortality severity of disease classification and length of hospital stay <EOS>
<SOS> during a 12 months period 1993 94 <NUM> consecutive patients icu stay 4 hours being admitted to a medical icu of a tertiary care university hospital were prospectively investigated <EOS>
<SOS> the day 1 scores of maris apache ii and tiss were determined and the patients were followed until hospital discharge or death <EOS>
<SOS> there was no advantage in using the combined scoring system maris neither in discrimination between survival and non survival hospital mortality areas under the roc curve maris 0 84 apache ii 0 86 tiss 0 78 nor in severity classification relationship between day 1 scores and hospital mortality p0 001 chi2 test in all three systems <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast only for the combined system maris a dependence of length of hospital stay from day 1 scores in the analysis of survivors only and in the analysis of all patients survivors and non survivors p0 001 anova could be demonstrated <EOS>
<SOS> in conclusion the combined physiologic therapeutic scoring system maris did not offer a better outcome prediction concerning hospital mortality and severity classification compared to the established systems in critically ill patients <EOS>
<SOS> its use may be advantageous in evaluating the relationship between day 1 scores and length of hospital stay which for economical reasons has become a parameter of growing interest in intensive care medicine <EOS>

<SOS> spinal opioids are effective analgesics for surgical and non surgical pain <EOS>
<SOS> central and systemic side effects are less frequent than with epidural local anaesthetics or parenteral opioids <EOS>
<SOS> this review focuses on the analgesic efficacy of spinal opioids and their combination with local anaesthetics for postoperative analgesia including patient controlled epidural analgesia <EOS>
<SOS> intrathecal administration of opioids has some advantages over their administration by the epidural route <EOS>
<SOS> several factors may influence selection of the opioid however in most situations morphine is the drug of choice <EOS>
<SOS> thoracic epidural administration of opioids seems to have no clinically important advantages over the lumbar route in terms of quality of analgesia adverse effects doses required or pulmonary function <EOS>
<SOS> however evidence suggesting that effective postoperative analgesia can significantly improve postoperative morbidity in patients at risk is accumulating <EOS>
<SOS> in such patients combined use of epidural local anaesthetics and opioids may become the technique of choice for postoperative analgesia <EOS>
<SOS> however there is no evidence that this would have any clinically relevant benefit in low risk patients <EOS>

<SOS> the treatment of distal fractures of the lower arm can be conservative or operative <EOS>
<SOS> the immediate aims of any treatment are anatomical realignment and the avoidance of trophic impairments with the ultimate objective of unrestricted function of the hand and wrist <EOS>

<SOS> according to the literature chronic ankle instability occurs after acute rupture of the lateral ankle ligaments in 10 20 of the cases <EOS>
<SOS> the etiology of the instability are ligamentous damage and functional neuromuscular disorder of the peroneal muscles <EOS>
<SOS> the standards of diagnostics are the history with the frequency of inversion trauma per period and the interval from the primary trauma the clinical examination and radiological stress tests <EOS>
<SOS> newer diagnostic methods up to now not well established in clinical routine include stabilometry cybex measurements of the pronator muscles the evaluation of peroneal reaction time on a tilting platform and dynamic pedography <EOS>

<SOS> no other disease has exhibited such a significant influence on the behaviour of health care workers hcw as the aids pandemic <EOS>
<SOS> numerous epidemiological data however have proven that the overall risk of transmission of the human deficiency virus hiv during surgical interventions is low it is <NUM> for all types of percutaneous exposures <EOS>
<SOS> nevertheless there still is a need for wider adoption of safer surgical techniques to reduce the chances of hiv transmission in the operation theatre which additionally minimize the risk of transmission of other blood borne pathogens <EOS>
<SOS> in the case of occupational exposure to hiv contaminated blood or body secretions post exposure prophylaxis should be recommended stratified by the type of exposure and source material <EOS>
<SOS> abstract <NUM> <NUM> pachyonychia congenita pc comprises a heterogeneous group of autosomal dominantly inherited conditions showing characteristic nail thickening and associated signs such as palmoplantar keratoderma follicular keratoses and mucosal leukokeratoses <EOS>
<SOS> less frequently epidermal cysts hairshaft abnormalities natal teeth and laryngeal involvement may be seen <EOS>
<SOS> phenotypically and genetically two major forms of pc are recognized pachyonychia congenita jadassohn lewandowsky pc type i medelian inheritance in man mim <MOB> and pachyonychia congenita jackson lawler pc type ii mim <MOB> <EOS>
<SOS> both conditions show nail deformities focal palmoplantar keratoderma and follicular hyperkeratoses <EOS>
<SOS> diagnostically relevant are leukokeratoses of the oral mucosa in patients with pc type i <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast individuals affected with pc type ii show premature dentition and multiple pilosebaceous cysts predominantely affecting the upper trunk <EOS>
<SOS> the latter closely resemble eruptive vellus hair cysts and steatocystoma multiplex <EOS>
<SOS> by mutational analysis keratin k6a and k16 gene mutations have been detected in patients with pc type i and keratin k6b and k17 gene mutations have been shown to be the underlying genetic defect in patients with pc type ii <EOS>

<SOS> we retrospectively analyzed the surgical and icu records of cabg patients who had recieved dil 27 pats <EOS>

<SOS> the present study investigated the frequency and influencing factors of petechial bleeding pet in the conjunctivae and eyelids in different causes of death except strangulation <EOS>
<SOS> in a series of <NUM> autopsies the over all occurrence of pet was 13 3 <EOS>
<SOS> the highest frequencies were found in fire victims 31 persons who had died after intensive care 24 cardiac death 22 drowning and intoxication 16 each <EOS>
<SOS> the frequency of pet decreased with increasing age and increased with the body mass <EOS>
<SOS> at first sight cardiopulmonary resuscitation cpr seemed to influence the occurrence of pet because the rate was 11 without and 19 with cpr x2 p 0 05 an aspect which has been mentioned in the literature <EOS>
<SOS> however further analysis showed that a higher rate of pet could only be observed in causes of death where pet are often fround irrespective of cpr whereas in the other groups pet with or without cpr are uncommon <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore a case by case analysis showed that in several cases with pet after cpr the causes could clearly be attributed to conditions other than cpr <EOS>
<SOS> in a second series of autopsy cases with only cardiac deaths 181 cases the influence of age and body mass on the rate of pet was statistically significant and there was a tendency for more frequent pet with increasing heart weight <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand no statistically significant influence of cpr on the rate of pet could be found in this relatively homogeneous group <EOS>

<SOS> according to the speed hypothesis of cognitive development the slowing of information processing in old age is at the core of negative age differences in psychometric intelligence <EOS>
<SOS> the present study investigates the speed hypothesis for fluid intelligence at the individual level using latent growth curve methodology <EOS>
<SOS> date on <NUM> measurement points come from the bonn longitudinal study of aging n 128 mean age 67 2 53 women <EOS>
<SOS> based on principal factor analysis markers of mental speed were the wais digit symbol test and simple psychomotor task <EOS>
<SOS> as indicators of fluid intelligence the wais object assembly and block design were used <EOS>
<SOS> after separately fitting latent growth curve models for the trajectory of mental speed and fluid intelligence a combined model showed no statistically significant improvement of fit for freeing the covariance between the two slope factors <EOS>
<SOS> interpreting this result contrary to the speed hypothesis the intraindividual change of fluid intelligence does not relate to the according change of mental speed <EOS>
<SOS> for patients with dilative cardiomyopathy dcm the prognosis is highly unfavorable even under conditions of optimal medication <EOS>
<SOS> at present there is no option for causal therapy <EOS>
<SOS> since there is increasing evidence that modifications of the immune system accompanied by the production of autoantibodies e g against <NUM> ad renergic or muscarinergic receptors are involved in the pathogenesis of dcm the elucidation of the possible functional significance of these autoantibodies has attracted increasing interest <EOS>
<SOS> in addition to the role of autoantibodies as markers for an autoimmune process discussion of the possible pathogenetic mechanisms has centered on direct toxicity as well as on negative influencing of myocardial contractility and energy metabolism <EOS>
<SOS> the effects gained through removal of autoantibodies by immunoadsorption therapy for dcm patients sheds light on the functional importance of autoantibodies in this syndrome <EOS>
<SOS> the principle of this form of therapy is based on the binding of circulating antibodies to sepharose columns to which polyclonal antibodies against human immunoglobulin are linked <EOS>
<SOS> a pilot study conducted among dcm patients disclosed that immunadsorption took place in simultaneous conjunction with a reduction in the immunoglobulin level and with significant hemodynamic and clinical improvement <EOS>
<SOS> these results may be interpreted as indicating that autoantibodies play an active role in dcm and that their removal by immunadsorption possibly represents a highly promising future therapeutic concept <EOS>

<SOS> the sound transmission properties of three different commercially available middle ear implants and the prototype of a complete middle ear prosthesis comep were evaluated with a special measurement system that permits standardized conditions <EOS>
<SOS> this system uses a mechanical middle ear model mm which approximates the impedances of the tympanic membrane and inner ear <EOS>
<SOS> the implants were fitted under defined conditions into the mm <EOS>
<SOS> displacement of the artificial stapes footplate of the mm was measured with an optical probe <EOS>
<SOS> the measurements of different middle ear prostheses showed that the mass of the implant was the most important factor for optimum high frequency transmission <EOS>
<SOS> the lightest implant 4 mg titanium showed the best results <EOS>
<SOS> the comep revealed the highest sensitivity because of a slight enlargement of the diameter of the artificial tympanic membrane <EOS>
<SOS> these findings show that the comep is able to restore sound transmission to a normal range <EOS>
<SOS> in a second experiment one of the implants was fitted into the mm with different forces <EOS>
<SOS> the increase of stiffness produced a slightly better high frequency transmission at the expense of low frequency sensitivity <EOS>
<SOS> hence the fitting of the implant may not be too stiff because of its loss of mobility within a significant frequency range <EOS>

<SOS> closed rupture of the anterior tibial tendon is rare <EOS>
<SOS> fewer than <NUM> cases have been reported in the literature perhaps because the symptoms are often neglected by the patient as well as by the doctor <EOS>
<SOS> most often the rupture occurs as a consequence of a sudden plantar flexion of the ankle and pre existing degenerative changes of the tendon tissue due to systemic disease or iatrogenic local corticoid injections <EOS>
<SOS> clinically the tendon rupture presents as acute weakness of the ankle extensors without reddening swelling or neurological signs <EOS>
<SOS> differential diagnoses such as anterior tibial syndrome and peroneal nerve palsy can thus be excluded <EOS>
<SOS> during the clinical examination the distal stump and the discontinuity of the anterior tibial tendon are often palpable <EOS>
<SOS> the clinical diagnosis can be confirmed by an ultrasound examination <EOS>
<SOS> an operation may be undertaken up to <NUM> months after the injury <EOS>
<SOS> preferred procedures are end to end anastomosis and transosseous refixation of the tendon followed by a plaster cast for <NUM> weeks postoperatively <EOS>
<SOS> high risk patients can be treated conservatively but the functional results are less satisfactory <EOS>

<SOS> a yet unpublished method of osseous reinsertion of the tendon is presented <EOS>

<SOS> background according to literature 30 60 of pacemaker patients suffer from paroxysmal atrial fibrillation paf <EOS>
<SOS> as rapid tracking of paf may cause severe symptoms in patients with dual chamber pacemakers refined algorithms providing av synchronous pacing during periods of sinus rhythm and preventing high ventricular rates during paf are highly desirable <EOS>
<SOS> aim and method this comprehensive paper introduces a new mode switching ms algorithm which uses either a fixed inos2cls or programmable logos number of short intervals out of <NUM> consecutive atrial intervals to detect paf <EOS>
<SOS> if the ms criterion is fulfilled a switch from av synchronous pacing to nontracking mode is automatically performed <EOS>
<SOS> the algorithm is described together with a discussion on optimization of the programming of parameters which may indirectly influence the ms sensitivity and specificity <EOS>
<SOS> results this ms concept maintains the high sensitivity and fast reactivity towards paf of the mode conversion in actros and kairos pacemaker systems preventing a long time delay between onset of paf detection of the arrhythmia and switch to nontracking mode <EOS>
<SOS> in addition adequeate sensing and short blanking periods in the new ms concept enable reliable ms <EOS>
<SOS> the occurrence of atrial oversensing should be tested as it may lead to inappropriate ms programmability of the ms algorithm may be advantageous for individual programming with respect to the patients arrhythmia rate and atrial sensing performance but the use of very restrictive or very liberal criteria should be avoided as both may lead to mode oscillations <EOS>
<SOS> finally examples of stored diagnostic data are presented to assess ms reliability identify possible problems and optimize ms function during follow up <EOS>

<SOS> non palpable breast lesions like microcalcifications often fail an exact diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> accurate treatment is difficult by conventional marking and operating procedures since freehand positionin of al localization wire is often suboptimal <EOS>
<SOS> the consequences are larger tissue defects leading to an insufficient cosmetic result <EOS>

<SOS> the advantages and disadvantages of the advanced breast biopsy intstrumentation abbi procedure versus vacuum biopsy systems are summarized and compared <EOS>

<SOS> chondroid syringoma belongs to the group of so called mixed tumors like pleomorphic adenomas of the lacrimal and salivary glands <EOS>
<SOS> the histogenesis of this tumour is still disputed in particular with respect to its stromal component <EOS>
<SOS> the distribution of cytokeratins cks cea ema vimentin s 100 protein desmin and actin smooth muscle actin sma was investigated by immunohistological examination of paraffin sections from a chondroid syringoma of the apocrine type <EOS>
<SOS> the neoplastic formations have been classified into tubuloalveolar structures solid nests aggregations and stromal cells of varying morphology <EOS>
<SOS> the innermost cells of tubuloalveolar structures were characterized by marked expression of cks kl1 and mnf116 cea and ema while in the outer ones there was moderate expression of vimentin s 100 was expressed to a lesser extent and kl1 weakly but there was marked and consistent expression of mnf116 <EOS>
<SOS> whereas the solid nests expressed vimentin s 100 protein mnf116 markedly and kl1 weakly the stromal cells were consistently positive for vimentin s 100 protein and focally cks and sma <EOS>
<SOS> anti sma specifically detects myoepithelial cells <EOS>
<SOS> in addition the partly overlapping immunoreactivity of the intermediate filaments membrane proteins and proteins in the different structures may indicate a common clonal origin of all neoplastic cells in chondroid syringoma <EOS>
<SOS> leg ulcers may be caused by many different diseases <EOS>
<SOS> most frequently they are due to vasculopathies to a lesser extent to metabolic neuropathic or hematologic diseases <EOS>
<SOS> neoplasms connective tissue diseases infections trauma and panniculitis should also be included in the differential diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> a 38 year old caucasian female patient with hereditary prolidase deficiency developed progressive and very painful leg ulcers <EOS>
<SOS> the ulcers first appeared in childhood and did not respond to various treatments <EOS>
<SOS> additional features of prolidase deficiency included mental retardation short stature extensive dental caries and multiple malar teleangiectases <EOS>
<SOS> hereditary prolidase deficiency is a very rare autosomal recessive disease <EOS>
<SOS> it is caused by heterogeneous mutations of the prolidase gene and affects many aspects of protein metabolism <EOS>
<SOS> ion exchange chromatography and high voltage electrophoresis of urine can prove the suspected diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> so far there is no efficient therapy for hereditary prolidase deficiency <EOS>
<SOS> all reported treatment attempts have ended in failure <EOS>
<SOS> in this paper the basic features of acute subacute and chronic types of osteomyelitis skeletal tuberculosis and some special forms of osteomyelitis are described <EOS>
<SOS> the diagnosis of osteomyelitis is established using clinical signs and symptoms culture studies laboratory studies and radiological signs <EOS>
<SOS> the common conservative and surgical treatments are discussed <EOS>
<SOS> in the treatment of post traumatic postoperative osteitis severe problems are encountered as a result of an increasing number of orthopaedic traumatologic surgical techniques using a variety of implants and because of a generally increasing occurrence of multiresistant strains <EOS>
<SOS> thanks to modern treatment and the increased use of antibiotics a considerable decrease in morbidity and mortality is observed <EOS>
<SOS> despite this improved prognosis an established infection remains one of the most challenging problems for the orthopaedic surgeon <EOS>
<SOS> besides an exponential growth in possibilities for diagnosis treatment and prevention in reproductive medicine and genetics the synergistic effects of modern health technologies have led to the necessity of fast transfer of knowledge into the public domain in order to develop a common social consensus <EOS>
<SOS> thus physicians and scientists have enormous obligations not only for the development of medical technology but also of medical and societal ethics <EOS>
<SOS> very early i e in 1984 the german medical association developed professional laws for reproductive medicine <EOS>
<SOS> in addition the german government saw the need in <NUM> for an embryo protection law embryonenschutzgesetz <EOS>
<SOS> today in the light of european integration the medical profession is and state is obligations are challenged in different ways <EOS>
<SOS> whereas the german medical association continuously works on professional guidelines for reproductive medicine and genetics currently the case with preimplantation genetic diagnosis the government must develop the sociolegal framework for ethically sound reproductive medicine i e in the areas of inheritance law adoption law family law and law of succession the latter especially in the case of discrepancies between genetic vs social paternity in heterologous insemination <EOS>
<SOS> in crohn is disease some concomitant neurological illnesses such as cerebral ischemia following arterial or venous thrombosis subacute combined degeneration of the spinal cord following malabsorption of vitamin b12 or folic acid opticus neuropathy and polyneuropathy have been described <EOS>
<SOS> cerebral vasculitis secondary to crohn is disease seems to be a very rare phenomenon <EOS>
<SOS> we report on three such cases in three female patients aged 26 29 and <NUM> years <EOS>
<SOS> all patients became symptomatic with a hemiparesis one complained additionally of a speech disorder headache and intermittent loss of orientation <EOS>
<SOS> in ct and mri scans multiple lesions were detected cerebral angiography showed multiple stenoses of middle and large sized vessels that were compatible with cerebral vasculitis <EOS>
<SOS> serologic tests concerning vasculitis were inconspicuous at that time <EOS>
<SOS> under anticoagulation in two cases and immunosuppressive therapy neurologic symptoms disappeared <EOS>
<SOS> in the following <NUM> to <NUM> months no new neurological symptoms appeared <EOS>
<SOS> in two cases doppler sonographic controls showed stationary and in one case progressive intracranial stenoses <EOS>
<SOS> the serin protease tryptase ecnr <EOS>
<SOS> <URL> which is almost exclusively expressed in mast cells is released by mast cell degranulation in an enzymatically active form together with other mediators e g <EOS>
<SOS> histamine into the extracellular space and the circulation <EOS>
<SOS> the capability of the enzyme to directly stimulate several cell types as well as to cleave polypeptide hormones and to activate pro enzymes suggests a role for tryptase in inflammatory and tissue remodeling processes <EOS>
<SOS> therefore in the skin a role of tryptase is suggested not only in mastocytosis and immediate type hypersensitivity reactions but also in other inflammatory diseases degenerative or neoplastic conditions as well as in wound healing where an accumulation and or activation of mast cells is found <EOS>
<SOS> extracellular tryptase may be superior to histamine as a parameter for the onset and course of immediate type reactions and as an indicator for the activation of mast cells in other conditions <EOS>
<SOS> its absence during histamine liberating reactions may suggest basophil activation <EOS>
<SOS> in addition tryptase has been shown to be a sensitive and specific marker for the localization of mast cells in tissues <EOS>

<SOS> surgery of tibial plateau fractures with joint involvement ao classification <NUM> a1 b1 b3 and c1 c3 makes high demands on traumatological management <EOS>
<SOS> by using modern minimally invasive operative techniques for juxta articular fractures it is possible to prevent soft tissue injuries that might affect the functional result <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of this technique is to achieve the exercise stability obtained with standard procedures <EOS>
<SOS> arthroscopically assisted osteosynthesis not only minimizes the surgical soft tissue trauma but also enables a precise assessment of the articular surfaces under the operation as well as the simultaneous treatment of concomitant intra articular injuries a particular advantage as compared to conventional operative methods <EOS>
<SOS> from a total of <NUM> patients with tibial plateau fractures arthroscopically assisted osteosynthesis was performed in <NUM> patients at our clinic from september <NUM> to january <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> the follow up of a total of <NUM> patients revealed good recoveries when assayed by means of the lysholm and delamarter score <EOS>
<SOS> we suggest that arthroscopically assisted minimally invasive osteosynthesis can also be used in selected patients for the treatment of ao classification <NUM> c1 c3 fractures <EOS>
<SOS> dorsal tension band fixation is a wide spread technique of finger arthrodesis <EOS>
<SOS> when using a resorbable pds suture as tension band fixation a costly implant removal is not needed <EOS>
<SOS> aim of this study is the investigation of the primary stability of this technique in combination with the cup in cone procedure <EOS>
<SOS> freeze preserved fingers with thread tension band fixation using the pds material series 1 the same fixating method on formaldehyde preserved fingers series 3 freeze preserved fingers with a standard tension band fixating wire loop series 2 are load in a four point bending in the direction of palmarflexion <EOS>
<SOS> from <NUM> degrees onwards the wire tension system requires a higher torque for bending but in case of higher torque frequently leads to fracture <EOS>
<SOS> the examination shows that the thread tension band method by pds loop for the stabilisation of finger joint arthrodesis has a sufficient initial stability against bending forces <EOS>
<SOS> modern medicine has succeeded in achieving enormous technical developments <EOS>
<SOS> one recent highlight has been the introduction of postmortem organ transplantation <EOS>
<SOS> at the same time serious objections have been raised concerning the radical changes in the cultural conception of the inviolable body <EOS>
<SOS> one major objection arises from the conflict of considering a brain dead person as dead <EOS>
<SOS> the presence of brain death is a prerequisite for post mortem organ donation because only during this phase of dying does the individual quality as dead while the organs other than the brain remain viable <EOS>
<SOS> the objection implies scepticism as to the physician is ability to distinguish a dead from a living person <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand even the critics must rely on the physician is ability to discriminate e g when to discontinue resuscitation <EOS>
<SOS> the medical community has not found reasons to restrict the definition of irreversible coma <NUM> years after its first formulation <EOS>
<SOS> it must be clearly recognised that reasons other than medical ones can be decisive for refusing organ donation <EOS>
<SOS> one ethical problem is the therapeutic benefit of organ transplantation <EOS>
<SOS> the beneficiary of the treatment is not the donor but another person the recipient <EOS>
<SOS> the concept of human dignity does not allow the use of a person fur purposes other than the ones he she consents to as immanuel kant stated <EOS>
<SOS> although the human corpse is not a person in the full sense even if it is protected by the thought of respect for the former person the life interest of the organ recipient had to be considered legitimate <EOS>
<SOS> the resulting conflict between the respect for the donor and the life interest of the recipient should be balanced by seeking the donor is consent as far as possible <EOS>
<SOS> the proposed information model seems adequate at the moment <EOS>
<SOS> a common report of both churches in germany in <NUM> supported postmortem organ transplantation <EOS>
<SOS> the report dealt with the medical problems and harmonized them with the christian value of solidarity <EOS>
<SOS> the ethical alternatives to organ transplantation however are not mentioned <EOS>
<SOS> within this limitation the report seems to adequately express the aim to strengthen individual competence and plead for fair perception of the neighbour is life interest <EOS>
<SOS> starting point for this analysis are the mobility needs and requirements of elderly as well as problems concerning access and use of public transport <EOS>
<SOS> elderly people as car drivers suffer from several performance deficits which are currently compensated by mobility restrictions and changed driving behaviour <EOS>
<SOS> driver assistance systems just available or soon on the market are demonstrated and analysed with respect to their impact on elderly drivers <EOS>
<SOS> an expert evaluation comes to the conclusion that the most important systems for elderly are emergency systems enhanced vision systems and parking aids <EOS>
<SOS> emergency systems can call rescue teams automatically or at driver is request and direct them to the emergency location <EOS>
<SOS> self imposed restrictions of elderly concerning night driving can partly be compensated by means of curve lightning and automatic dipping <EOS>
<SOS> parking aids using cameras or infrared technique are especially helpful for persons with movability problems <EOS>
<SOS> the group of helpful but not highly important driver assistance systems covers several means for longitudinal and lateral control of the car comprising autonomous cruise control antilock systems and electronic stability programmes <EOS>
<SOS> the value and impact of these systems are analysed in the light of risk homeostasis theory <EOS>
<SOS> reduced work load and ease of mobility will at last result from user centered navigation systems helping the elder driver also to move to new areas without orientational problems <EOS>
<SOS> the article demonstrates the particular importance of specific layouts of the man machine interface for elderly to guarantee high acceptance and minimal distraction from traffic <EOS>

<SOS> in <NUM> patients with alzheimer is disease ad in <NUM> patients with non ad dementia and in <NUM> cognitively normal controls the concentration of protein tau was determined in the cerebrospinal fluid csf <EOS>
<SOS> of the ad patients <NUM> were very mildly demented mmse score from <NUM> to 28 <EOS>
<SOS> even in these patients csf tau was significantly more elevated than in controls <EOS>
<SOS> in the non ad patients protein tau was less increased <EOS>
<SOS> among the ad patients there was no association between csf tau and severity of cognitive impairment or deficit in cerebral blood flow determined by spect <EOS>
<SOS> our findings suggest that csf tau may be elevated even at the predementia stage of ad and be useful as a biological marker for the early recognition of the disease <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of our review is to summarize relevant data on the perioperative use of anti ischaemic drugs in patients at risk for or with proven coronary heart disease <EOS>
<SOS> the accessible medical literature according to current electronic information sources was explored <EOS>
<SOS> one in every eight general anaesthetics is administered to a patient at risk for or with proven coronary heart disease <EOS>
<SOS> of these patients it is estimated that 20 40 have perioperative myocardial ischaemia pmi the majority being nonsymptomatic <EOS>
<SOS> this figure correlates with the occurrence of postoperative cardiac complications and myocardial infarction <EOS>
<SOS> the anaesthetist therefore has an important role to play in reducing the rate of perioperative cardiac sequelae <EOS>
<SOS> this can be achieved with good control of haemodynamic stability and the timely and appropriate use of antiischaemic drugs <EOS>
<SOS> nitrocompounds nitrates molsidomine serve as the gold standard in current angina pectoris treatment <EOS>
<SOS> acting as coronary and systemic vasodilators they effect an immediate reduction in preload and have been shown to be the drugs of first choice for intraoperative myocardial ischaemia <EOS>
<SOS> beta blockers reduce the rate of pmi to a greater extent than nitrates <EOS>
<SOS> they are also effective in myocardial ischaemia not accompanied by an increased heart rate <EOS>
<SOS> single pre operative administration of beta blockers has also been shown to be beneficial in reducing theincidence of perioperative tachycardia hypertension and pmi <EOS>
<SOS> consequently such one time medication can be considered for previously untreated high risk patients presenting for surgery <EOS>
<SOS> the continuation of oral calcium channel blockers to the morning of surgery also reduces the rate of pmi and myocardial infarction in coronary bypass patients and combination with beta blockers enhances this effect <EOS>
<SOS> intra operative diltiazem infusions are similarly advantageous in this patient group <EOS>
<SOS> in addition to nitrates calcium antagonists are the drug of choice for coronary vasospasm <EOS>
<SOS> drugs inhibiting platelet aggregation have a particular role in patients with coronary heart disease however they also cause increased perioperative bleeding <EOS>
<SOS> consequently it is recommended that these medications be discontinued <NUM> <NUM> days prior to major surgery with the exception of high risk patients <EOS>
<SOS> pilot studies using alpha2 agonists have shown reduced anaesthetic requirements and a reduction in pmi <EOS>
<SOS> the perioperative relevance of these drugs is currently being investigated <EOS>
<SOS> beta blockers calcium channel blockers nitrates and possibly alpha2 agonists lead to reduced rates of pmi and other cardiac complications in risk patients <EOS>
<SOS> current anti anginal medications with the exception of anti platelet agents should be maintained to the day of surgery and continued as soon as possible thereafter <EOS>
<SOS> all of these drugs except anti platelet agents may also be used intra operatively however possible interactions with anaesthetic agents should be carefully considered <EOS>
<SOS> inflammatory bowel diseases crohn is disease ulcerative colitis were thought to be psychosomatic disorders <EOS>
<SOS> however this argument has recently been questioned by many researchers <EOS>
<SOS> at the same time biomedical factors have been described that were claimed to play a role in the aetiology and modulation of the course of inflammatory bowel diseases ibd <EOS>
<SOS> in the present paper the state of research regarding both biomedical and psychosomatic factors of the aetiology and course of ibd is reviewed and critically evaluated from a methodological perspective <EOS>
<SOS> results covering the following topics are presented epidemiology sociodemographic variables genetic factors dietary factors and cigarette smoking drugs permeability of bowel epithelia immunological factors microbiological factors psychiatric disorders affective symptoms personality factors life events and psychosocial stress quality of life and coping with the illness <EOS>
<SOS> among biomedical factors a genetically based pathological immune reaction is highly probable <EOS>
<SOS> however the findings of immunological disturbances are of a more descriptive nature and seem to explain not the aetiological process of the development of the disease but rather a kind of disposition <EOS>
<SOS> the question of which agents trigger the pathological immune cascade is still under investigation <EOS>
<SOS> interesting findings can possibly be expected of the psycho neuro immunological research in this area <EOS>
<SOS> results of research on psychological pathology psychiatric disorders personality factors are inconclusive <EOS>
<SOS> in particular some modern well controlled studies have not been able to confirm the findings of the older literature <EOS>
<SOS> part of the high rate of psychiatric morbidity might be due to effects of selective sampling of more disturbed subjects <EOS>
<SOS> research pertaining to the influence of distressing life events has also yielded inconsistent results <EOS>
<SOS> prospective studies about the association of psychosocial stress and somatic symptomatology mostly demonstrated cross sectional correlations which did not allow for causal interpretations <EOS>
<SOS> however coping research has shown interesting results that point to the mediating influence of coping strategies on the course of the disease <EOS>
<SOS> finally perspectives for future research are suggested <EOS>
<SOS> genital infection particularly bacterial vaginosis bv increases the relative risk of prematurity <EOS>
<SOS> detection of disturbances of vaginal milieu at an early stage and the use of suitable countermeasures such as intervention with antimicrobial substances can reduce the preterm birth rate <EOS>
<SOS> a pregnancy with a partial or complete hydatidiform mole and a coexistent living fetus is a rare condition <EOS>
<SOS> most cases are consistent with a twin pregnancy with distinct borders between placenta and mole on sonography <EOS>
<SOS> we report a case with a single placenta with cystic structures resembling histologically a complete hydatidiform mole <EOS>
<SOS> the pregnancy resulted in a diploid female fetus in the 34th week of gestation with marked hypotrophy <EOS>
<SOS> the non molar part of the placenta showed a complex alteration of villous maturity resulting in intrauterine growth retardation but a living fetus <EOS>
<SOS> no malignancy occured post partum <EOS>
<SOS> the clinical and pathogenetic aspects of this rare entity are discussed <EOS>
<SOS> so far necrosis of the lunate bone has been interpreted in the literature as a phenomenon with a traumatic primarily vascular arterial or mechanical causation <EOS>
<SOS> these models seem problematic since neither the patients histories nor the macroscopic radiographical or histological appearances can be reconciled with them <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast the model of a primarily venous aetiopathogenesis accepted for idiopathic necrosis of the femoral head is now examined <EOS>
<SOS> evaluation of <NUM> cases of lunate bone necrosis treated in the department of orthopaedics at the university hospital in heidelberg between <NUM> and <NUM> made it possible to reconstruct the spontaneous course of the condition <EOS>
<SOS> x ray material core spin tomographic images and material from a prospective study carried out in <NUM> patients with unexplained painful conditions of the wrist were available <EOS>
<SOS> a stage by stage progression emerged which initially caused alterations only in the mr image while the x ray picture remained unremarkable <EOS>
<SOS> it was recognized from the spontaneous course that subsequent changes in the shape of the diseased lunate bones were always the result of the necrotic transformation process and never the cause of it <EOS>
<SOS> this meant that fractures were excluded as a possible cause of necrosis of the lunate bone <EOS>
<SOS> the spontaneous course was used as the basis of a stage related classification for lunate bone necrosis <EOS>
<SOS> in a pressure measurement test the behaviour of the intraosseous pressure in <NUM> necrotic lunate bones <NUM> healthy lunate bones and <NUM> healthy capitate bones was tested under various functional conditions <EOS>
<SOS> the pressure fluctuations in the capitate bones were very slight while in the healthy lunate bones pressure increased significantly during extension of the wrist <EOS>
<SOS> the position dependent pressure increases in the lunate bones indicated that the venous drainage was constantly in jeopardy <EOS>
<SOS> the pressure increases in necrotic lunate bones were significantly in excess of those in healthy ones in some cases they were far in excess of the systolic blood pressure <EOS>
<SOS> it was also concluded that necrotic lunate bones were mechanically deformed on movement <EOS>
<SOS> the anatomical causes of the pronounced pressure increases were examined experimentally <EOS>
<SOS> after staining of both the arteries and the veins epoxy sheet plastination was used to fix six fresh cadaver arms in the neutral position and six in extension <EOS>
<SOS> visualization of the vessels showed that capsular ligamentous structures that were stretched on the palmar side and slackly turned back on themselves on the dorsal side still allowed the blood supply from the arteries but substantially hindered venous drainage <EOS>
<SOS> the anatomical preparations made it possible to see that venous drainage from the lunate bone was being prevented this explained the pronounced pressure increases <EOS>
<SOS> the unphysiological position of the base of the radius inclined in the palmar direction relative to the hand axis when it was extended dorsally was the crucial factor in the development of necrosis <EOS>
<SOS> evaluation of the histories of the patients with necrosis of the lunate bone made it clear that trauma was not significantly involved in the causation while manual work had an important role <EOS>
<SOS> most manual activites are performed with the wrist in extension <EOS>
<SOS> any extension favours triggering of bone necrosis through congestion in the venous trunk <EOS>
<SOS> thus our investigations have shown that the beginning of this illness starts with congestion such as occurs with every extension of the wrist which is initially physiological before further factors favouring the process cause it to take a pathologic course <EOS>

<SOS> using the interview data <NUM> of the west but only <NUM> of the east german adults have had e g <EOS>

<SOS> frequent patterns of combination are food allergy allergic rhinitis and asthma allergic rhinitis <EOS>

<SOS> mostly class i antiarrhythmic drugs such as lidocaine or ajmaline are preferred <EOS>

<SOS> the value of preoperative fine needle aspiration biopsy is not clearly proven for insular carcinoma <EOS>
<SOS> the criteria for histological diagnosis have been outlined by carcangiu et al <EOS>

<SOS> the vvf occurred in the course of hysterectomy in <NUM> patients was due to radiotherapy in 7 was a result of obstetric complications in <NUM> patients and occurred after colporrhaphy in <NUM> patient <EOS>

<SOS> the other <NUM> patients were successfully treated by a second procedure again transvaginal n 3 transabdominal n 2 <EOS>
<SOS> in conclusion the transvaginal approach to close vvf is of advantage avoiding an abdominal incision and reducing postoperative morbidity <EOS>
<SOS> in the vast majority of the cases isolated vvf can be treated successfully by transvaginal repair <EOS>

<SOS> the underlying mutation is an expanding trinucleotide ctg repeat in the 3 prime untranslated region of a serine threonine kinase gene on chromosome 19q <EOS>
<SOS> a statistical correlation exists between the ctg copy number and the severity of the disease <EOS>

<SOS> however not all patients with many ctg copies develop congenital myotonic dystrophy <EOS>

<SOS> in <NUM> patients with <NUM> coronary lesions the percent diameter stenosis ds was assessed both by visual estimation and by digital quantitative coronary angiography dqca by use of an on line computer workstation <EOS>
<SOS> the decision for coronary angioplasty in the same setting prima vista ptca was based on history evidence of ischemia and visual estimation of ds <EOS>
<SOS> dqca measurements of the <NUM> stenoses revealed a normal distribution of lesion severity with a mean of <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> 11 3 <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast to dqca visual estimation led to a bimodal distribution with a nadir at 55 between two peaks at 45 and 75 and a mean of <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> 19 6 <EOS>
<SOS> visual estimation underestimated lesions in the range of 30 55 and overestimated the ds between 55 99 <EOS>
<SOS> visual estimation revealed a ds 60 in <NUM> stenoses 74 0 of the <NUM> lesions an estimate that led to subsequent prima vista ptca <EOS>

<SOS> as can be substantiated by many data reported in literature there are no pharmacokinetic or pharmacodynamic reasons whatsoever to withhold propofol from the younger children this applies both to the use as a narcotic supplement and as a short term hypnotic for diagnostic and therapeutic interventions <EOS>
<SOS> orthostatic circulatory disorders are frequently the cause of orthostatic intolerance syncope or dangerous falls <EOS>
<SOS> a sufficient therapy should be based on a differential diagnosis by means of an active standing test or a tilt table test <EOS>
<SOS> three typical pathological reactions of blood pressure and heart rate can be differentiated <EOS>
<SOS> the hypoadrenergic orthostatic hypotension is characterised by an immediate drop in blood pressure systolic drop 20 mmhg below base line within <NUM> min with or without compensatory tachycardia <EOS>
<SOS> it is caused by peripheral or central sympathetic dysfunction <EOS>
<SOS> tachycardia 30 beats per minute above base line within <NUM> min without significant blood pressure drop but with a fall of cerebral blood flow indicates a postural tachycardia syndrome <EOS>
<SOS> in general there is no further somatic dysfunction <EOS>
<SOS> increased venous pooling is thought to be the assumed pathomechanism <EOS>
<SOS> a reflex mechanism evokes the neurocardiogenic syncope after a certain time of standing sympathetic inhibition yields a strong blood pressure drop and vagal activation bradycardia <EOS>
<SOS> proved therapies include use of the mineralocorticoide fludrocortison hypoadrenergic orthostatic hypotension of the a agonist midodrin postural tachycardia syndrome and of b blockers neurocardiogenic syncope <EOS>

<SOS> several different theories exist about the orign of kinetosis and the space adaption syndrome with individual sensitivities differing significantly <EOS>
<SOS> one explanation involves the hypothesis of a different otolith mass between the right and left statolith organ and especially a difference in the utricles <EOS>
<SOS> a difference in mass results in a different sensitivity to acceleration <EOS>
<SOS> for this reason we measured interindividual variances in saccular and utricular otolith mass <EOS>
<SOS> since the anatomy of the vestibular organ in vertebrates is based as similar principles we selected fish salmon and trout as our study model to facilitation preparations <EOS>
<SOS> the maximum difference in mass in the saccule was 17 and was generally smaller in the utricle although in individual cases was much higher <EOS>
<SOS> we assume that a misbalanced sensitivity of the statolith organs occurs but is totally compensated for by the vestibular system as long as physiological motion patterns take place <EOS>
<SOS> decompensation leads to kinetosis under non physiological motion patterns <EOS>
<SOS> when the vestibular system is better balanced and has an equally distributed otolith mass to both sides the possibility for developing kinetosis or space adaption syndrome is much less likely <EOS>

<SOS> il 6 was also able to reverse the inhibitory effect of dexamethasone 1 µmol l on gr in both cell lines <EOS>
<SOS> in mg 63 cells expressing higher concentrations of gr il 6 deprivation via a specific anti il 6 antibody 100 ng ml significantly decreased gr <EOS>

<SOS> this latter effect was completely abolished by co treating the cells with the anti il 6 antibody <EOS>
<SOS> our results provide evidence that il 6 is an autocrine positive modulator of gr number in human osteoblasts <EOS>

<SOS> the simulation of unilateral deafness is very rare <EOS>
<SOS> objective findings are of special interest if it happens <EOS>
<SOS> a patient with alleged deafness on the left hand side due to commotio cerebri was treated in our hospital <EOS>
<SOS> pure tone audiometry showed deafness on the left hand side and normal hearing on the right hand side <EOS>
<SOS> however stapedius reflexes were found ipsilaterally left as well as contralaterally right at <NUM> to <NUM> khz with a stimulation of approxamately <NUM> db spl <EOS>
<SOS> transiently evoked otoacoustic emissions teoae and distortion product otoacoustic emissions dpoae were measured <EOS>
<SOS> the teoae had the same reproducibility but a very low response on both sides such that inner ear function could not be evaluated <EOS>
<SOS> in comparison the dp gram showed clear dp amplitudes over the whole frequency range on both sides <EOS>
<SOS> nonphysiological dps could be excluded by assessing the dp growth rate at three different frequencies <EOS>
<SOS> by means of brainstem electric response audiometry bera with which the iv v complex was detectable up to stimulation with <NUM> db spl clicks and the stenger test a neural or central hearing loss could be excluded <EOS>
<SOS> normal hearing on the left hand side was thus confirmed <EOS>
<SOS> in cases of simulated deafness it is possible to prove a normal inner ear function by dpoae <EOS>
<SOS> dpoae therefore complements the list of potential audiological simulation tests <EOS>

<SOS> the sonographic diagnosis of malignant lymphoma in childhood is described <EOS>
<SOS> malignant lymphomas are sonographically relatively uniform initial enlargement of the lymph nodes and organs involved and disturbance of normal echo texture by mainly hypoechoic lesions can be found <EOS>
<SOS> generally four sonographic patterns of infiltration are described diffuse small nodular large nodular and bulky type <EOS>
<SOS> secondary tumor related or inflammatory complications e g dislocation or compression of vessels thoracic inlet syndrome venous thrombosis ileus urinary retention abscess and effusion can be sonographically evaluated <EOS>
<SOS> response to therapy correlates with normalization of size and echo texture and recovery from tumor related complications <EOS>
<SOS> differential diagnosis with ultrasound is based on the topographic distribution and echo pattern of infiltration and with certain restrictions on the echogenicity of lesions and perfusion feasible with doppler sonography <EOS>
<SOS> the primary diagnosis has to be established histologically <EOS>

<SOS> the german social security legislation has recognized only recently the concern of quality assessment in the field of social and medical services <EOS>
<SOS> the legal frame for quality assessment in the field of medical treatment was enacted in the sickness insurance provision social code book v only in <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> quality assessment is considered to be a part of the production of medical services and therefore is regulated in the context of providing medical services <EOS>
<SOS> the legal provisions do not establish standards for quality and quality assessment <EOS>
<SOS> due to the variety of medical services quality assessment is not regulated in an exhaustive or systematic manner <EOS>
<SOS> according to the law providers of medical services doctors hospitals are bound to participate in quality assessment <EOS>
<SOS> as internal quality assessment prevails in the definition of the various measures of quality assessment and the control of quality in all fields of medical treatment external quality assessment is also prescribed for hospitals <EOS>
<SOS> because the establishment of quality assessment is considered to be a part of the service production organization consumers patients or their representatives are not involved in the definition establishment and control of quality assessment <EOS>
<SOS> the participation of patients should be provided by law <EOS>

<SOS> in spite of the high and lasting efficiency of transurethral prostatectomy intraoperative blood loss results in increased morbidity in this procedure <EOS>
<SOS> this led to the development of many alternative treatment modalities in the last years <EOS>
<SOS> to minimize the risk of bleeding we improved the high frequency technology in several steps <EOS>
<SOS> to achieve this the output signals of commercially available high frequency generators were modulated to the effect that each cut results in an efficient coagulation zone in the tissue at excellent cutting quality <EOS>
<SOS> laboratory and in vitro studies using porcine kidneys as well as clinical trials showed good cutting characteristics accompanied by a significant reduction of bleeding <EOS>
<SOS> as a result blood transfusions were less necessary the transurethral catheter could be removed earlier in the postoperative period and hospitalization time was significantly reduced <EOS>
<SOS> in conclusion the improved high frequency technology in form of the coagulating intermittent cutting results in a blood sparing tissue resection with a consecutive reduction of morbidity <EOS>

<SOS> during pressure support ventilation psv the timing of the breathing cycle is mainly controlled by the patient <EOS>
<SOS> therefore the delivered flow pattern during psv might be better synchronised with the patient is demands than during volume assisted ventilation <EOS>
<SOS> in several modern ventilators inspiration is terminated when the inspiratory flow decreases to 25 of the initial peak value <EOS>
<SOS> however this timing algorithm might cause premature inspiration termination if the initial peak flow is high <EOS>
<SOS> this could result not only in an increased risk of dyssynchronization between the patient and the ventilator but also in reduced ventilatory support <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand a decreased peak flow might inappropriately increase the patient is inspiratory effort <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of our study was to evaluate the influence of the variation of the initial peak flow rate during psv on respiratory pattern and mechanical work of breathing <EOS>

<SOS> the historical opinion that the intima layer of a ruptured artery of muscular type could stop bleeding by rolling in should be controlled experimentally <EOS>
<SOS> five segments of human femoral popliteal artery 3 4 cm long were overstretched until complete rupture occured <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore a longitudinally split and a partially oblique incised segment were ruptured <EOS>
<SOS> as morphological findings a sandclock deformity was observed in the region of rupture <EOS>
<SOS> this phenomenon was induced by adventitia layer which closed the ends of ruptured media layer like a chinese finger trap <EOS>
<SOS> in the longitudinally split segment a transverse rupture of the media layer could be observed while the fibers of adventitia layer were pulled out when the traction was continued <EOS>
<SOS> neither macroscopical nor microscopical signs could be found for rolling in of intima or media layer <EOS>
<SOS> the reason for spontaneous hemostasis after arterial rupture is more likely the activation of platelets by collagenous fibers of adventitia layer than rolling in of intima or media layer <EOS>
<SOS> if there is no finger trap mechanism of adventitia layer like in shot or stabwounds a massive blood loss must be expected <EOS>

<SOS> there are two types of diabetes mellitus <EOS>
<SOS> type i insulin dependent diabetes iddm which becomes manifest before the age of 40 is the result of an absolute deficiency of insulin <EOS>
<SOS> type ii the non insulin dependent diabetes niddm develops in the elderly and is caused by a relative insulin deficiency <EOS>
<SOS> patients with type i diabetes are prone to the development of ketoacidosis while type ii causes hyperglycaemic hyperosmolar nonketotic coma <EOS>
<SOS> apart from these acute metabolic alterations the long term complications of diabetes are of concern to the anaesthesiologist <EOS>
<SOS> hypertension coronary artery disease renal insufficiency and autonomic neuropathy are common and can result in myocardial ischaemia cardiovascular instability and gastroparesis with an increased risk of aspiration <EOS>
<SOS> limited movement of the atlanto occipital joint can cause difficult intubation <EOS>
<SOS> to avoid perioperative metabolic catastrophy blood glucose concentration should be kept between <NUM> and <NUM> mmol l 1 120 <NUM> mg dl 1 <EOS>
<SOS> hypoglycaemia can result in neurological damage whereas hyperglycaemia causes impaired wound healing and susceptibility to infections and worsens ischaemic damage to the myocardium and brain <EOS>
<SOS> perioperative diabetes management depends on the severity of the surgical procedure and the type of diabetes <EOS>
<SOS> all type i diabetics whatever operation being performed need insulin <EOS>
<SOS> the intravenous route is recommended as it allows better adjustment <EOS>
<SOS> after determination of the fasting blood glucose level insulin is given at a dosage of <NUM> <NUM> u h 1 at gluc11 1 mmol l 1 <NUM> <NUM> u h 1 at gluc <NUM> <NUM> mmol l 1 or <NUM> <NUM> u h 1 at gluc16 7 mmol l 1 <EOS>
<SOS> in addition <NUM> <NUM> g glucose h 1 is given <EOS>
<SOS> in type ii diabetes the oral antidiabetic drug is withheld <EOS>
<SOS> during minor surgery the blood glucose concentration is monitored frequently and if necessary insulin with gluc13 9 mmol l 1 or glucose is given <EOS>
<SOS> in most cases of major surgery insulin therapy will be necessary <EOS>
<SOS> administration should follow the guidelines listed for type i diabetes <EOS>
<SOS> whether the intravenous or the subcutaneous route is used for insulin repeated glucose determinations are mandatory <EOS>
<SOS> if ketoacidosis develops the volume depletion is treated with normal saline <EOS>
<SOS> for hyperglycaemia and acidosis insulin 3 <NUM> u h 1 with <NUM> <NUM> mmol h 1 potassium phosphate is given <EOS>
<SOS> bicarbonate is only indicated when the serum ph is lower than <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> it must be borne in mind that perioperative management of diabetes does not end with postanaesthesia care <EOS>
<SOS> at the beginning of the <NUM> th century institutional care for the insane was established by the various german states <EOS>
<SOS> at first the separation of curable and incurable patients influenced psychiatric care and the construction of hospitals <EOS>
<SOS> the combination of care and cure in one hospital in illenau was a turning point in institutional care <EOS>
<SOS> contradictory tendencies characterized the second half of the <NUM> th century the integration with general medicine in the cities on the one hand the social separation and cure in the seclusion of the countryside on the other <EOS>
<SOS> the characteristic psychiatric construction in different countries was influenced by individual architects <EOS>
<SOS> the following building styles were dominant in england panoptic architecture in the united states linear staggered structures in france the carrés isolés and in germany the structure of blocks with cross axes <EOS>
<SOS> at the end of the <NUM> th century the system of pavilions was internationally accepted occupational therapy and mental care in the countryside were introduced <EOS>
<SOS> from the first world war until the end of the <NUM> s a standstill in psychiatric buildings was noted in germany and institutional care came under increasing criticism <EOS>
<SOS> there was a reorientation from the middle of the <NUM> s as a result of more effective therapeutic possibilities <EOS>
<SOS> a variety of complementary institutions outpatient and partly inpatient therapies which were recommended by the psychiatrie enquête started to be realized <EOS>
<SOS> smaller units and different models of integration of psychiatric care such as building the hospital next to a general hospital or psychiatric wards within a general hospital became relevant criteria for planning the construction of psychiatric hospitals as did the integration into the community and the city <EOS>
<SOS> principles of organization like the construction of a communicative quiet inner room or grading the rooms from public to private were structurally integrated <EOS>
<SOS> specific structural requirements for the construction and design of psychiatric hospitals should be evaluated in more detail by post occupancy methods <EOS>

<SOS> increasing numbers of elderly people are being treated in hospitals and are additionally at particular risk of acquiring nosocomial infections with antibiotic resistant organisms <EOS>

<SOS> many additional aspects e g route of administration drug pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics drug toxicity and drug drug interactions compliance and multiple underlying diseases e g renal failure must be considered in the rational selection of antibiotic regimen <EOS>

<SOS> the treatment planning was based on the 3 d reconstruction of the surgical clips implant tubes and skin points <EOS>
<SOS> in all cases the implantations were planned with a semi 3 d technique aided by simulator <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> cases a recently developed ct guided 3 d planning system was used <EOS>
<SOS> the semi 3 d and 3 d treatment plans were compared to hypothetical 2 d plans using dose volume histograms and dose non uniformity ratios <EOS>
<SOS> the values of mean central dose mean skin dose minimal clip dose proportion of underdosaged clips and mean target surface dose were evaluated <EOS>
<SOS> the accuracy of tumor bed localization and the conformity of planning target volume and treated volume were also analyzed in each technique <EOS>
<SOS> with the help of conformal semi 3 d and 3 d brachytherapy planing we could define reference dose points active source positions and dwell times individually <EOS>
<SOS> this technique decreased the mean skin dose with 22 2 and reduced the possibility of geographical miss <EOS>
<SOS> we could achieve the best conformity between the planning target volume and the treated volume with the ct image based 3 d treatment planning at the cost of worse dose homogeneity <EOS>
<SOS> the mean treated volume was reduced by 25 1 with semi 3 d planning however it was increased by 16 2 with 3 d planning compared to the 2 d planning <EOS>
<SOS> the application of clips into the tumor bed and the conformal semi 3 d and 3 d planning help to avoid geographical miss <EOS>
<SOS> ct is suitable for 3 d brachytherapy planning <EOS>
<SOS> better local control with less side effects might be achieved with these new techniques <EOS>
<SOS> conformal 3 d brachytherapy calls for new treatment planning concepts taking the irregular 3 d shape of the target volume into account <EOS>
<SOS> the routine clinical application of image based 3 d brachytherapy is a real aim in the very close future <EOS>

<SOS> multiple organ failure mof may occur early or late after trauma <EOS>
<SOS> besides direct physical injury of organs compromise of the microcirculation by inflammation plays an important role in the pathogenesis of mof <EOS>
<SOS> inflammation also induces counterregulatory responses which may end up in immunoparalysis <EOS>
<SOS> as a result infection and sepsis with additional inflammatory damage to the microcirculation ensue thereby contributing to the late development of mof <EOS>
<SOS> in addition to this biphasic model of posttraumatic mof there is evidence that inflammation and immunoparalysis do not only occur in sequence to each other but in parallel early after surgical procedures <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of the present brief review is to summarize the posttraumatic mechanisms of inflammation and immunoparalysis and to discuss how to differentiate between both pathophysiologic states <EOS>

<SOS> introduction orthotopic liver transplantation olt has become an accepted treatment for end stage liver disease <EOS>
<SOS> however postoperative complications result in significant patient morbidity and mortality <EOS>
<SOS> early detection and treatment of these complications is therefore of utmost importance <EOS>
<SOS> materials and methods we retrospectively reviewed the postoperative complications of the patients who underwent olt at our institution <EOS>
<SOS> duplex doppler sonography and cholangiography were the primary imaging modalities in postoperative evaluation of the transplanted liver <EOS>
<SOS> other important techniques were ct mri and angiography which may contribute to a reliable diagnosis of vascular or biliary complications <EOS>
<SOS> results second to primary organ dysfunction vascular complications are the most frequent cause of graft loss <EOS>
<SOS> thrombosis of the hepatic artery is the most common and most serious vascular complication with a reported incidence from <NUM> to <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> bile duct sludge leaks and strictures are frequent complications after liver transplantation which can contribute to graft dysfunction <EOS>
<SOS> biliary tract complications usually occur within the first <NUM> months and require interventional radiological or surgical therapy <EOS>
<SOS> since liver transplant recipients undergo immunosuppressive therapy they are at increased risk of developing late post transplant malignancies which are best depicted by us ct or mri <EOS>
<SOS> however radiological diagnosis of lymphoproliferative disorder has to be confirmed by liver biopsy <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion cholangiography and duplex sonography are routinely used in the postoperative evaluation of patients with olt <EOS>
<SOS> ct mri and angiography are problem solving tools in equivocal cases <EOS>

<SOS> the detection method used was the injection of radiolabeled antibody able to recognize the immune complex <EOS>
<SOS> from <NUM> patients stage i ii and ii treated with ics <NUM> survived more than <NUM> years showing a statistically significant increase of survival compared to patients treated with standard procedures <EOS>
<SOS> in conclusion these data show that surgery of colorectal cancer should be selectively extended to specific anatomical regions in order to remove hidden micrometastases and more importantly correct postoperative immune processes that could suppress the t cell response against residual tumor cells <EOS>

<SOS> pyoderma gangraenosum can cause great therapeutic problems <EOS>

<SOS> however recalcitrant pyoderma gangraenosum or side effects from corticosteroid treatment may require therapeutic alternatives <EOS>
<SOS> pyoderma gangraenosum responds excellently to treatment with cyclosporine a <EOS>
<SOS> because of side effects and drug interactions the patients must be selected and carefully and closely monitored <EOS>
<SOS> six patients with pyoderma gangraenosum unresponsive to various topical and systemic therapies were treated with oral cyclosporine a at mean daily doses of approximately <NUM> mg kg <EOS>
<SOS> marked improvement of the skin lesions and complete healing occurred in all patients over a period of 3 6 months <EOS>
<SOS> only one patient suffered a relapse after discontinuation of the treatment <EOS>
<SOS> no severe irreversible side effects occurred <EOS>
<SOS> the results show that low dose cyclosporine a treatment can be considered a first line treatment of pyoderma gangraenosum <EOS>
<SOS> medical treatment of injured patients by international missions of non governmental organisations in crisis areas and out of area operations by troops and also national disasters require special trauma management <EOS>
<SOS> deviations from peacetime surgical guidelines are obligatory because of long distance medical evacuation the possibility of gaps in supply and the typical pattern of war injuries <EOS>
<SOS> massive contamination combined with the high risk of infection is one typical attribute of wounds inflicted during a war or a disaster <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast to peacetime surgical guidelines aggressive wound débridement is often needed <EOS>
<SOS> timely and prophylactically prescription of a broad spectrum antibiotic with a long half life has great importance in the treatment of these wounds <EOS>
<SOS> suitable antibiotics for these indications are piperacillin tazobactam and ceftriazon <EOS>
<SOS> nevertheless the use of antimicrobial agents will only be effective with early surgical débridement <EOS>

<SOS> intrinsic positive end expiratory pressure peepi occurring during mechanical ventilation depends on expiratory time constants expiratory volume and expiration time as well as on external flow resistance tubes valves etc <EOS>
<SOS> it is not routinely determined in mechanically ventilated patients but it is necessary to optimize respirator settings <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of the present study was the validation of an automated peepi determination method implemented in the respirator evita drägerwerke lübeck in mechanically ventilated patients with acute lung failure <EOS>
<SOS> the method was validated in ten sedated myorelaxed patients with respiratory insufficiency of different etiologies five with restrictive and five with obstructive pulmonary disease <EOS>
<SOS> peepi was determined using the volume constant ventilatory mode at zeep or at an external peep of <NUM> as well as <NUM> cm h2o <EOS>
<SOS> peepi was first determined with the automated method implemented in the evita five measurements at each end expiratory pressure level peepevita <EOS>
<SOS> steady state was attained between each measurement <EOS>
<SOS> these values were compared to the results obtained with end expiratory occlusion external computer controlled valve in the inspiratory limb of the circuit at the respective pressure levels peepeeo <EOS>
<SOS> the average of five measurements at each peep level with each method was defined as peepi for the particular ventilatory situation <EOS>
<SOS> gas flow was measured at the proximal end of the endotracheal tube with a heated pneumotachometer fleisch no <EOS>
<SOS> 2 fleisch lausanne switzerland and a differential pressure transducer <EOS>
<SOS> tracheal pressure was determined in the same position with a further differential pressure transducer dr fenyves gut basel switzerland <EOS>
<SOS> after a d conversion data were sampled with a frequency of <NUM> hz and processed on an ibm compatible pc <EOS>
<SOS> software for data collection and processing as well as for control of the occlusion valve was self programmed <EOS>
<SOS> for the statistical analysis we used the mann whitney u test or wilcoxon signed ranks test a p value less than <NUM> was considered significant <EOS>
<SOS> at the given respiratory setting and without peep patients with obstructive lung disease had a higher peepi median <NUM> cm h2o range <NUM> <NUM> cm h2o than those with restrictive pulmonary disease median <NUM> cm h2o range <NUM> <NUM> cm h2o p0 05 <EOS>
<SOS> increasing external peep to <NUM> or <NUM> cm h2o significantly decreased the pressure difference between peepi and external peep p0 05 but was unable to eliminate it completely <EOS>
<SOS> there was no statistically significant difference between peepeeo and peepevita p 0 43 wilcoxon signed ranks tests <EOS>
<SOS> regression analysis showed a highly significant correlation between peepeeo and peepevita values r 0 985 p0 001 y 1 03x 0 18 <EOS>
<SOS> peepi occurs during ventilation in patients with obstructive and restrictive lung disease <EOS>
<SOS> the difference between external end expiratory pressure and peepi decreases with increasing external peep <EOS>
<SOS> however peepi may increase with increasing external peep in some instances <EOS>
<SOS> the reason for this may be that the peepi determined at the proximal end of the endotracheal tube represents only a mean value of different peepi values of various lung regions <EOS>
<SOS> increasing external peep only partially alters this mean value due to an effect on peepi values lower than external peep <EOS>
<SOS> the peepi values measured by the evita respirator compared with classical end expiratory occlusion with an external valve were nearly identical <EOS>

<SOS> total effective antiemetic response was defined as the absence of nausea and vomiting for <NUM> h postoperatively <EOS>
<SOS> the incidence of nausea vomiting and the number of patients showing total antiemetic response as well as the incidence of adverse effects were compared with the chi2 test and p0 05 was considered significant <EOS>
<SOS> patients were similar with respect to age height body weight and total anaesthetic agents received <EOS>
<SOS> duration of anaesthesia and the time until awakening was not significantly different among groups <EOS>

<SOS> postoperative sedation and well being scores did not differ significantly among groups <EOS>

<SOS> hydromorphone is a µ receptor agonist opioid <EOS>
<SOS> according to who recommendations hydromorphone is to be classified in step ii of pain therapy <EOS>
<SOS> an oral formulation with a prolonged duration of action of <NUM> hours has been evaluated only recently <EOS>
<SOS> the controlled release capsule is especially suited for the regular twice a day administration in cases of severe and persistent pain <EOS>
<SOS> the oral formulation of hydromorphone increases the number of opioid analgesics available for pain therapy in step ii <EOS>
<SOS> hydromorphone is recommended when morphine fails to produce sufficient pain relief despite increase of doses or causes intolerable side effects despite treatment of symptoms <EOS>
<SOS> in principle no differences in efficacy of morphine and hydromorphone are to be expected <EOS>
<SOS> however clinical experience shows that changing one opioid analgesic to another one can improve the treatment of patients so that hydromorphone may replace another opioid analgesic to which a patient fails to respond well or develops side effects <EOS>

<SOS> in several open label and controlled studies hydromorphone proved to be of good efficacy in the treatment of acute and persistent pain especially in patients with severe cancer pain <EOS>
<SOS> with regard to the incidence of side effects no significant differences between morphine and hydromorphone could be established <EOS>
<SOS> in general the side effects of hydromorphone are typical for opioid analgesics <EOS>

<SOS> we describe a patient with a primary renal plasmacytoma <EOS>

<SOS> based on this case we discuss how one should proceed in this disease <EOS>

<SOS> postoperatively further staging procedures must rule out bone involvement solitary myeloma or multiple myeloma <EOS>

<SOS> diagnostic pitfalls exist when benign salivary gland diseases are mistakenly classified as malignant with consequences for treatment and prognosis <EOS>
<SOS> examples are necrotizing sialometaplasia metaplastic warthin tumour and sclerosing polycystic sialadenopathy <EOS>

<SOS> a 59 year old male patient was transnasally operated on because of a pituitary adenoma with hypopituitarism <EOS>

<SOS> acute compartment syndrome of the thigh has been infrequently reported in the literature <EOS>
<SOS> closed femoral fractures and blunt soft tissue trauma are the main causes of this injury <EOS>
<SOS> the multiple injured patient in this case report developed a compartment syndrome of the thigh after intramedullary nailing of a comminuted fracture of the femur <EOS>
<SOS> fasciotomy was performed two days after surgery because of extense swelling of the thigh in the ventilated and sedated patient <EOS>
<SOS> sciatic and femoral nerve palsy was recognized after extubation of the patient nine days after the injury <EOS>
<SOS> during the following weeks the paresis of the femoral nerve recovered but neither motor nor sensory function of the sciatic nerve could be demonstrated <EOS>
<SOS> therefore an operative revision of the sciatic nerve was performed eighteen weeks after trauma <EOS>
<SOS> no direct nerve injury could be detected but there were adhesions around the nerve as a sign of compression neuropathy caused by the compartment syndrome <EOS>
<SOS> the tibial component of the sciatic nerve showed a complete recovery within the next months but there was a persisting peroneal nerve palsy <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion early clinical symptoms of a compartment syndrome like pain paresthesia and paresis can not be ascertained in a ventilated and sedated patient <EOS>
<SOS> tense swelling of the muscles is often the only detectable sign <EOS>
<SOS> frequent measurements of compartment pressure should be done in these patients <EOS>
<SOS> we suggest early decompressive fasciotomy because the morbidity caused by fasciotomy in a borderline compartment syndrome is far outweighed by the morbidity that accompanies an undiagnosed untreated compartment syndrome with possible nerve palsy <EOS>
