<SOS> simpson in scotland was the first to describe the administration of ether for analgesia in painful deliveries <EOS>
<SOS> only a few days later e c j <EOS>
<SOS> von siebold 1801 in würzburg dagger1861 in göttingen performed the first systematic study on ether in obstetrics <EOS>
<SOS> following a preceding evaluation of the action of ether on non pregnant woman and on pregnant women not in active labour he administered ether for analgesia during the second stage of labour in eight parturients <EOS>
<SOS> the first administration was on february 25th <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> while he was satisfied with the good analgesia without sequelae of the new born he was discouraged by the termination of uterine contractions observed in all his patients <EOS>
<SOS> he concluded that ether was not a useful substance for analgesia during vaginal delivery since it disturbed the natural course of labour <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand von siebold was very pleased with the administration of ether for operative obstetric procedures such as forceps deliveries or placental retention <EOS>
<SOS> background mode switching aims to maintain a ventricular rhythm that matches metabolic needs during both sinus rhythm and atrial tachyarrhythmias <EOS>
<SOS> this allows patients with atrial arrhythmias to benefit from av synchronous pacing <URL> and method beat to beat mode switching in diamond and clarity pacemakers is designed to maintain a relatively stable ventricular rhythm ensuring consistent ventricular filling patterns <EOS>
<SOS> atrial tachyarrhythmia detection is based on a continuous analysis of the atrial rhythm <EOS>
<SOS> a too rapid increase of the atrial rate with a beat to beat acceleration <NUM> bpm is considered to be an atrial tachyarrhythmia <EOS>
<SOS> mode switching occurs on detection of the first premature atrial event atrial tracking is stopped and the ventricular rate is determined by the rate indicated by the dual sensor qt interval and activity <EOS>
<SOS> atrial pacing restores av synchrony immediately after cessation of the atrial tachyarrhythmia effectively avoiding retrograde conduction <EOS>
<SOS> dedicated diagnostic functions allow one to monitor the incidence of atrial tachyarrhythmias and to study atrial and ventricular events just prior to its onset <EOS>
<SOS> both the mode switching and rate responsive function are fully automatic rendering follow up procedures easy and less time consuming <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion reliable detection of all atrial events is essential to guarantee appropriate mode switching <EOS>
<SOS> therefore the pacemaker stores the distribution of the amplitude of all atrial events both during sinus rhythm and atrial tachyarrhythmias which facilitates the appropriate programming of the atrial sensitivity <EOS>

<SOS> transesophageal endoscopic ultrasonography circumvents this problem and ensures visualization of parts of the mediastinum <EOS>
<SOS> blood glucose alterations prior to cerebral ischaemia are associated with poor neurologic outcome possibly due to extensive lactic acidosis or energy failure <EOS>
<SOS> cerebral effects of hyper or hypoglycaemia during cardiopulmonary resuscitation cpr are less well known <EOS>
<SOS> in addition little information is available concerning cardiac effects of blood glucose alterations <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of this study was to evaluate the effects of pre cardiac arrest hypo or hyperglycaemia compared to normoglycaemia upon haemodynamics cerebral blood flow cbf and metabolism cmro2 and regional cardiac blood flow during cpr subsequent to <NUM> min of cardiac and respiratory arrest and after restoration of spontaneous circulation <EOS>
<SOS> after approval by the state animal investigation committee <NUM> mechanically ventilated anaesthetised pigs were instrumented for haemodynamic monitoring and blood flow determination by the radiolabeled microsphere technique <EOS>
<SOS> the animals were randomly assigned to one of three groups in group i n 9 blood glucose was not manipulated in group ii n 10 blood glucose was increased by slow infusion of 40 glucose to <NUM> <NUM> mg dl in group ii n 10 blood glucose was lowered by careful titration with insulin to <NUM> <NUM> mg dl <EOS>
<SOS> after <NUM> min of untreated ventricular fibrillation and respiratory arrest cpr chest compressor ventilator thumper and epinephrine infusion was commenced and continued for <NUM> min <EOS>
<SOS> thereafter defibrillation was attempted and if successful the animals were observed for another <NUM> min <EOS>
<SOS> cerebral perfusion pressure cpp cbf cmro2 coronary perfusion pressure corpp and regional cardiac blood flow were determined at control after <NUM> min of cpr and at 10 30 and <NUM> min post cpr <EOS>
<SOS> in group i 4 9 animals 44 could be successfully resuscitated in group ii 4 10 40 and in group ii 0 10 0 <EOS>
<SOS> prior to cardiac arrest mean arterial pressure cpp and corpp in group ii were significantly lower compared to groups i and ii <EOS>
<SOS> in group i cpp during cpr was <NUM> <NUM> mmhg cbf <NUM> <NUM> ml min 100 g cmro2 <NUM> <NUM> ml min 100 g corpp <NUM> <NUM> mmhg and left ventricular lv flow <NUM> <NUM> ml min 100 g in group ii cpp 21 5 cbf <NUM> 7 cmro2 <NUM> 0 8 corpp <NUM> 6 and lv flow <NUM> 9 and in group ii cpp <NUM> 3 cbf <NUM> 8 cmro2 <NUM> 1 1 corpp <NUM> 2 and lv flow <NUM> <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> during the 240 min post resuscitation period there were no differences in cbf cmro2 or lv flow between groups i and ii <EOS>
<SOS> hypoglycaemia prior to cardiac arrest appears to be predictive for a poor cardiac outcome whereas hyperglycaemia does not impair resuscitability compared to normoglycaemia <EOS>
<SOS> in addition hyperglycaemia did not affect lv flow cbf or cmro2 <EOS>
<SOS> however it has to be kept in mind that haemodynamics and organ blood flow do not permit conclusions with respect to functional neurologic recovery or histopathologic damage to the brain which is very likely to be associated with hyperglycaemia <EOS>
<SOS> abstract <NUM> we present an algorithm for the rational diagnosis of glutaric aciduria type i ga1 <EOS>
<SOS> normal urinary organic acids in patients with non specific clinical features and normal results of brain imaging render the diagnosis highly unlikely and no further investigations are required <EOS>
<SOS> in other patients the diagnostic strategy depends on the individual clinical neuroradiological and biochemical findings <EOS>
<SOS> gcdh enzyme analysis should be reserved for patients in whom ga1 is very likely <EOS>
<SOS> this article gives a brief review of the history of spinal surgery from the end of the nineteenth century up to our own time <EOS>
<SOS> malignant lymphomas originating from peripheral t or nk cells are rare tumours in europe and account for less than 10 of all malignant lymphomas <EOS>
<SOS> in this review the salient features of the more frequently occurring entities derived from t or nk cells will be presented <EOS>
<SOS> nasal nk t cell lymphoma is mainly found in the nose and paranasal sinuses and often but not always display an angiocentric growth pattern leading to coagulation necrosis <EOS>
<SOS> the tumor cells consistently express cd56 cd2 and the eber molecules encoded by the epstein barr virus <EOS>
<SOS> clonal t cell receptor gene rearrangements are often absent indicating in the majority of cases a derivation of these tumors from nk cells <EOS>
<SOS> enteropathy type intestinal t cell lymphomas often arise in patients with celiac disease and have a dismal prognosis <EOS>
<SOS> the tumour cells express t cell antigens cd103 and cytotoxic molecules but are negative for cd4 <EOS>
<SOS> approximately 20 of the cases display cd56 mostly in combination with cd8 <EOS>
<SOS> recently an early purely intraepithelial form of this tumour was identified <EOS>
<SOS> histologically these cases resemble celiac disease however the intraepithelial lymphocytes often exhibit an abnormal immunophenotype with absent cd8 and t cell receptor protein expression and they are clonal by molecular analysis <EOS>
<SOS> clinically the patients suffer from refractory sprue or ulcerative jejunitis <EOS>
<SOS> the prognosis is bad with the patients often dying from malnutrition or an invasive tumour forming t cell lymphoma <EOS>
<SOS> angioimmunoblastic t cell lymphoma is defined by characteristic morphological findings atypical lymphoid cells in part with pale cytoplasm arborizing high endothelial venules and large fdc meshworks as well as clinical features systemic symptoms signs of a dysregulated immune response <EOS>
<SOS> peripheral t cell lymphomas that do not fit into a distinct entity are classified in the real and the new who classifications as peripheral t cell lymphomas unspecified <EOS>
<SOS> these display a broad morphological spectrum including the t cell lymphomas of different cell sizes lennert is lymphoma and t zone lymphoma of the kiel classification and in general are clinically aggressive <EOS>
<SOS> causes and courses of the diseases are subjected to a change of an increasing life expectancy on the one hand and technically highly developed medicine on the other hand <EOS>
<SOS> since a growing number of elderly people is denying intensive medical interventions which serve the purpose of keeping them alive despite severe diseases the problem of euthanasia imposes direct questions <EOS>
<SOS> a central role is played by the active passive difference and its moralistic legitimacy <EOS>
<SOS> the difficulties of this difference are discussed below on the applicable level of ethical discussions <EOS>
<SOS> at the same time knowledge of the danger is being made aware that in a maximal therapeutical orientated medical care system the desire for euthanasia may become identical with the reverse side of this care system <EOS>
<SOS> isolated severe head trauma sht or sht in combination with multiple injuries are important factors for the prognosis of morbidity and mortality in patients suffering from the consequences of accidents <EOS>
<SOS> the prognosis mainly depends on the presence of primary mechanic brain injury and the development of secondary brain damage <EOS>
<SOS> causes for the development of secondary brain damage are the intracranial space demand after traumatic injury and edema formation which may result in iscemia as well as inflammatory processes <EOS>
<SOS> both isolated sht and polytrauma with or without brain damage may result in a systemic inflammatory response syndrome sirs due to the synthesis of cytokines and other inflammatory mediators which may cause a single or multiple organ failure mof <EOS>
<SOS> often the organism is able to survive isolated traumatic injuries and functional disturbances but in combination or cumulation they may be lethal <EOS>
<SOS> the hypermetabolism after sht is often regarded as an interaction between the central nervous system and the whole organism by the activation of the neuroendocrine axis <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast to the consequences of sht for the whole organism multiple injuries after polytrauma may affect brain functions such as the shock dependent disturbance of the brain perfusion accompanied by brain hypoxia which may lead to an aggravated prognosis <EOS>
<SOS> moreover coagulation metabolism and fracture healing are influenced by the onset of sirs as well <EOS>
<SOS> our knowledge about the bidirectional inflammatory interaction between brain and whole organism is still limited <EOS>
<SOS> in this context the effects of secondary surgical interventions which may additionally stress a traumatized body have to be considered and are the subject for actual clinical discussions and experimental studies <EOS>
<SOS> this article tries to summarize some important aspects on this topic <EOS>
<SOS> background chronic cough and thoracic pain commonly caused by upper airway infections are frequently seen symptoms in pediatrics <EOS>
<SOS> these benign symptoms are very seldom caused by malignant disorders <EOS>
<SOS> methods in two patients male age 41 12 and 43 12 years chronic cough and thoracic pain were due to a malignant pulmonary neoplasm pleuropulmonary blastoma <EOS>
<SOS> results pleuropulmonary blastoma is a rare malignant primary pulmonary neoplasm in childhood with a poor prognosis <EOS>
<SOS> an incomplete resection was performed in both cases <EOS>
<SOS> both patients received postoperative radiotherapy and combination chemotherapy <EOS>
<SOS> one boy died the other one is alive and well more than <NUM> years after diagnosis without evidence of disease <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion our findings indicate that even after incomplete resection subsequent multimodal therapy adjuvant chemotherapy and radiotherapy can provide a long term remission <EOS>

<SOS> abstract the term acute exacerbation of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease copd reflects an acute worsening of the stable state with an increase in dyspnea cough and count or purulence of sputum <EOS>
<SOS> the management of an acute exacerbation is guided mainly clinical severity which has implications on the decision of outpatient management hospital management or intensive care treatment <EOS>
<SOS> cardiopulmonary comorbidity and the number of previous exacerbations are prognostic factors <EOS>
<SOS> the first line therapy of each exacerbation is the intensification of drug treatment with 2 agonists and anticholinergics <EOS>
<SOS> systemic steroids as a short term course are advocated if hospital treatment is necessary <EOS>
<SOS> infections of the respiratory tract are a frequent cause of acute exacerbations <EOS>
<SOS> however a colonization with potential pathogenic microorganisms is found in many patients in the stable state <EOS>
<SOS> antibiotic treatment is justified if cardiopulmonary comorbidity and frequent previous exacerbations are present <EOS>
<SOS> the severity of airflow obstruction and the frequency of previous exacerbations are linked to the spectrum of the underlying microorganisms <EOS>
<SOS> this should be borne in mind for the choice of the antimicrobiotic treatment <EOS>
<SOS> noninvasive ventilation in severe exacerbation is able to improve gas exchange and to reduce the work of breathing <EOS>
<SOS> as a consequence the number of intubations and the attributable morbidity and mortality are reduced <EOS>
<SOS> if invasive mechanical ventilation is necessary the potential of dynamic hyperinflation in acute exacerbation has to be considered <EOS>
<SOS> background in <NUM> prof h olbing university of essen pediatrics department supported by prof g stickler mayo medical school minnesota introduced a 4 weeks clinical skills lab for all students annual class 250 based on self instruction by means of computer assisted interactive audiovisual learning materials models bedside teaching and seminars on special topics partially peer guided <EOS>
<SOS> each year <NUM> chosen senior medical students get a two weeks intensive training in order to function as peer tutors for the bedside teaching <EOS>
<SOS> the peer tutors train the junior students in basic behaviour and clinical examination skills <EOS>
<SOS> each tutor is active during 4 5 skills lab periods and in each period he she coaches two groups of two students each <EOS>
<SOS> during the bedside teaching phase each group examines and presents four patients <EOS>
<SOS> spinal injuries referring to banal falls are common injuries in elderly persons <EOS>
<SOS> up to <NUM> years of age spinal fractures are more frequent in men while its opposite in older persons <EOS>
<SOS> there are two typical lesions odontoid fracture in the upper cervical spine and compression fracture in thoracolumbar spine <EOS>
<SOS> odontoid fracture is the most frequent lesion in cervical spine in the elderly <EOS>
<SOS> this is caused by trabecular structure of dens axis and spine is stiffness in old age <EOS>
<SOS> instable fractures in extension type ii are most common <EOS>
<SOS> in many cases the instability of the lesion is hidden and can be first seen in functional examination controlled by x ray <EOS>
<SOS> conservative treatment is efficient in stable lesions type ii while there is a high risk for pseudarthrosis in treatment of instable lesions in elderly with halo fixateur e g we think that the best operation for these fractures is the anterior screw fixation <EOS>
<SOS> if this is not sufficient because of low bone mass or early dislocation of the screws a dorsal fusion c1 c2 with transarticular screwing e g should be done <EOS>
<SOS> because of rare symptoms thoracolumbar fractures in osteoporosis are hidden frequently <EOS>
<SOS> in many cases it is not easy to distinguish acute lesions from healed fractures or tumor lesions <EOS>
<SOS> therefore there are just few compression fractures a type that have to be treated operatively <EOS>
<SOS> instable lesions type b and c must be operated as well in the elderly as in the young <EOS>
<SOS> because of low bone mass in elderly the dorsal instrumentation should include more than just the two injured segments <EOS>
<SOS> an even more adequate stabilisation is done with an additional vertebral replacement <EOS>
<SOS> following curative minimal invasive laser resection of t1 t3 laryngeal carcinomas patients were subjected to an intensive voice rehabilitation <EOS>
<SOS> therapy was effected twice a day for approximately <NUM> months utilizing the concept of functional voice therapy <EOS>
<SOS> before and after rehabilitation acoustic analyses were made by using two different computer supported measuring systems 1 the multidimensional voice program kay elementrics corp and 2 a novel software program developed in göttingen that includes a new voice quality parameter based on correlations between frequency bands <EOS>
<SOS> acoustic analyses showed superiority of the glottal versus supraglottal compensatory phonation <EOS>
<SOS> findings showed that not all acoustic parameters equally documented voice improvement after rehabilitation <EOS>
<SOS> the standard deviation of fundamental frequency was the only parameter showing a significant post therapeutic improvement <EOS>
<SOS> a further suitable acoustic method proved to be the voice quality parameter that has been newly introduced by us <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast to analogous parameters of other methods this approach is independent of the exact periodicity of the glottal excitation function thus permitting reliable results to be obtained even with aphonic or heavily dysphonic voices <EOS>
<SOS> aseptic pseudarthrosis may occur after all kinds of traumatology treatment <EOS>
<SOS> following conservative treatment incomplete immobilisation or an unattached bone fragment can be causal <EOS>
<SOS> after plate osteosynthesis the biomechanical principles are not efficient or the circulatory damage delays healing <EOS>
<SOS> there are two broad types of pseudarthrosis vascular and nonvascular <EOS>
<SOS> the extent of vascularisation can be demonstrated by bone scintigraphy as well as x ray <EOS>
<SOS> the treatment of vascular nonunions is very common <EOS>
<SOS> mechanical stability is required therefore a new osteosynthesis is desirable <EOS>
<SOS> osteoporosis caused by inactivity and dislocation increases the rate of complications <EOS>
<SOS> much more difficult problems are encountered in treatment of unreactive and avital pseudarthrosis particularly in cases with a defect of bone substance <EOS>
<SOS> these defects can be treated with a segment transfer and a fibula to tibia operation <EOS>
<SOS> extracorporal lithotripsy has been established as a new method in treatment of active and vascular nonunions <EOS>
<SOS> former osteosynthesis is not a contraindication <EOS>
<SOS> stability and immobilisation are necessary <EOS>
<SOS> treatment in the low frequency magnetic field shows no effect <EOS>
<SOS> correct biomechanical and biological osteosynthesis with proper attention paid to location quality of bone and asepsis can avoid the development of a pseudarthrosis <EOS>

<SOS> electrocardiographic and clinical characteristics are currently used as diagnostic criteria for the long qt syndrome <EOS>
<SOS> in borderline electrocardiographic findings associated with unclear syncope it is often difficult to ensure or exclude long qt syndrome <EOS>
<SOS> schwartz and coworkers therefore created a point system as a guide in clinical decision making <EOS>
<SOS> in recent years genetic diagnostics have entered the arena of long qt assessment <EOS>
<SOS> aside from new insights into the pathophysiology of the long qt disorder it is expected that genetic diagnostics will offer substantial help to ascertain long qt syndrome in patients with borderline electrocardiographic and clinical findings and improve risk stratification in long qt family members <EOS>
<SOS> performing linkage analysis coupling of autosomal dominant congenital long qt syndrome romano ward syndrome to chromosomes <NUM> lqt1 11p15 5 <NUM> lqt3 3p21 <NUM> lqt2 7q35 and <NUM> lqt4 4q25 27 was demonstrated <EOS>
<SOS> more recently the disease genes in long qt syndrome 1 2 and <NUM> could be identified <EOS>
<SOS> analysis of the base pair sequence allowed detection of several different mutations in different families illustrating genetic heterogeneity <EOS>
<SOS> aside from diagnostic aspects molecular genetics may also guide pharmacological therapy by identifying the specific ion channel disorder leading to qt prolongation and sudden death <EOS>

<SOS> cranial dural fistulae are rare when they occur it is usually difficult to detect them at an early stage <EOS>
<SOS> with a view to the question of possible progress in diagnosis we now report on seven patients with lateral dural fistulae fed by branches of the external carotid artery <EOS>
<SOS> the examination was carried out before selective arteriography using cw doppler sonography and colour coded duplex sonography in combination <EOS>
<SOS> sonographic criteria for detection of hyperperfusion take account of flow velocity as well as pulsatility <EOS>
<SOS> in all cases hyperperfusion of the external carotid artery and the common carotid artery was detected <EOS>
<SOS> in most of these cases pathologic findings were also observed at the occipital artery and more rarely in the contralateral external carotid artery or the ipsilateral vertebral artery in addition <EOS>
<SOS> a possible source of error arising from confusion of blood vessels was present with the cw doppler sonography but not for colour coded duplex sonography <EOS>
<SOS> therefore cranial dural fistulae characterized by a high shunt volume can be diagnosed correctly by indirect doppler sonographic criteria using cw doppler and duplex sonography <EOS>
<SOS> direct visualization of the fistula and its nidus requires additional selective arteriography in the course of which endovascular embolization may be performed <EOS>

<SOS> this retrospective study shows the results in <NUM> patients of revision surgery on their reruptured acl <EOS>
<SOS> the follow up time was <NUM> months on average range <NUM> <NUM> months <EOS>
<SOS> the follow up examination included subjective lysholm score tegner activity level rating score clinical and radiological criteria and also instrumental laxity testing with the kt 100 arthrometer <EOS>
<SOS> the overall evaluation was done according to the ikdc score <EOS>
<SOS> the follow up showed subjective and objective results almost equal to those after primary surgery on acl <EOS>

<SOS> nowadays restorative proctocolectomy is considered the gold standard in the surgical therapy of ulcerative colitis <EOS>
<SOS> alternative procedures such as brooke ileostomy or kock pouch are limited to special indications <EOS>
<SOS> preservation of function is the decisive advantage of the ileoanal pouch but preservation of function is not equal to quality of life <EOS>
<SOS> quality of life is a multidimensional concept that is difficult to define and measure <EOS>
<SOS> quality of life can only be assessed by standardized and validated quality of life questionnaires <EOS>
<SOS> preoperatively patients with ulcerative colitis have a restricted quality of life depending on the intensity of their disease <EOS>
<SOS> proctocolectomy is the curative therapy and improves quality of life <EOS>
<SOS> when evaluating quality of life it is not essential if patients are treated by brooke ileostomy or restorative proctocolectomy <EOS>
<SOS> the advantage of restorative proctocolectomy is the improvement in some aspects such as sexuality and physical acticity <EOS>
<SOS> the total quality of life index is not impoved <EOS>
<SOS> preoperatively patients should be informed that preservation of function by restorative proctocolectomy is accompanied by an increased postoperative morbidity in comparison to other procedures <EOS>
<SOS> decreased quality of life results when complications occur postoperatively that cannot be controlled over a long period of time <EOS>
<SOS> in some cases excision of the ileoanal pouch may be the most sensible way of solving the problems <EOS>
<SOS> on the other hand patients without complications and good function after ileoanal pouch procedure may achieve a quality of life comparable to that of healthy controls <EOS>
<SOS> preoperatively patients should be aware of this risk benefit relationship and should share the responsibility of the decision for or against restorative proctocolectomy <EOS>
<SOS> the objective of this investigation was the experimental determination of the contact pressures in the hip joint for characteristic phases of the gait cycle <EOS>
<SOS> the joint forces determined in vivo with telemetric endoprosthesis by bergmann et al <EOS>
<SOS> 1993 were converted into a pelvic reference system based on kinematic gait analysis <EOS>
<SOS> in eight cadaveric hip joints age 18 75 yrs <EOS>
<SOS> the reaction forces were applied corresponding to four phases of the gait cycle heel strike mid stance heel off toe off and the pressure distribution determined with fuji pressure sensitive film <EOS>
<SOS> we found maxima of <NUM> mpa during mid stance <EOS>
<SOS> the areas of highest pressure were located in the ventro superior aspect of the acetabulum anterior part of the acetabular roof and in the dorso inferior aspect of the lunate surface <EOS>
<SOS> the pressure distribution was relatively constant during the four phases and the maxima did not vary proportional to the applied load <EOS>
<SOS> the normal pressure distribution in the hip appears to be determined by the physiological incongruity of the articular surfaces and the inhomogeneous bony support of the acetabulum <EOS>
<SOS> during operative interventions this normal load transfer should be restored as accurately as possible <EOS>

<SOS> getting such quantities was facilitated by his occupational access to propane <EOS>

<SOS> the relationship of his organic mental disorder to the abuse of propane was not clear since he had also abused alcohol <EOS>

<SOS> inter and intraobserver variability in manual measurements of the left ventricular cross sectional area was below 5 on average and differed non significantly with regard to the method <EOS>
<SOS> in <NUM> patients continuous monitoring was aggravated by repeated loss of contact between the miniaturized tee probe and mucosa <EOS>
<SOS> conclusions in comparison with conventional tee the miniaturized tee probe provides practicability advantages without significant loss of information for cardiovascular monitoring <EOS>

<SOS> the discussion of the osheroff vs chestnut lodge court case in the american journal of psychiatry raised the question whether individual psychotherapy or pharmacotherapy is the appropriate treatment for severe depression <EOS>

<SOS> background the implantation of a femoro popliteal bypass graft represents the gold standard in the management of arteriosclerotic occlusive disease in the femoro popliteal region <EOS>
<SOS> application of interventional techniques has permitted the development of a novel endovascular implantable bypass system <EOS>
<SOS> the device is placed within the lumen of the superficial femoral artery <EOS>
<SOS> the present study investigated the technical properties of the new system in cadavers with subsequent evaluation of its application in humans <EOS>
<SOS> methods the endopass consists of a thin wall polycarbourethane tube with a total length of <NUM> cm <EOS>
<SOS> the distal end is connected with a self expanding stent prothesis <NUM> cm in length <EOS>
<SOS> endovascular implantation is performed through a groin incision <EOS>
<SOS> following antegrade ringstripper tea the endopass is introduced into the femoral artery after placement of a guide wire <EOS>
<SOS> the proximal anastomosis is performed surgically <EOS>
<SOS> results the technical requirements and feasibility of the system were tested on <NUM> cadaver extremities <EOS>
<SOS> implantation of the device proved technically successful in seven of eight extremities with significant occlusion of the superficial femoral artery <EOS>
<SOS> the most important problems included the complete ringstripper tea the placement of the guide wire following the tea and the expansion of the endopass <EOS>
<SOS> following approval by the ethics commission the endopass was implanted in five patients between june <NUM> and march <NUM> <EOS>
<SOS> in three patients the endopass remained patent and has functioned well <EOS>
<SOS> one patient with poor vascular outflow suffered an early noncorrectable occlusion while in the remaining case perforation secondary to the ringstripper procedure forced us to abandon the attempt <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion experience from the cadaver study and initial human applications confirm the feasibility of this method <EOS>
<SOS> further development and methodological improvement however are necessary requiring additional larger studies on patients <EOS>

<SOS> in order to evaluate patients exposure to radiation in computed tomography dose quantities such as the computed tomography dose index ctdi multiple scan average dose msad and dose free in air on the axis of rotation are used <EOS>
<SOS> the ctdi and the msad derivable from the ctdi are a good measure for the absorbed doses in the examined volume but they do not take the biological sensitivity of the organs into account and do not describe the radiogenic risk that is actually relevant for patients and doctors <EOS>
<SOS> the dose on the axis of rotation is not an accurate measure of the effective dose and the radiogenic risk <EOS>
<SOS> the declaration of a limit for the dose on the axis of rotation should take the different regions into account in order to guarantee acceptable image quality on one hand and to avoid an unnecessarily high risk on the other side <EOS>
<SOS> as physical dose quantities the ctdi msad and dose on the axis of rotation are useful to characterize and differentiate between programs and systems concerning radiation exposure <EOS>
<SOS> prognosis of patients surviving acute myocardial infarction has substantially improved over the last two decades <EOS>
<SOS> however stratification of patients at risk for death due to arrhythmic events remains a clinical challenge <EOS>
<SOS> due to the important role of the autonomic nervous system in the genesis of sudden death autonomic markers such as heart rate variability and baroreflex sensitivity have recently gained attention as risk stratification parameters <EOS>
<SOS> the present study reports the results of noninvasive risk stratification in <NUM> consecutive postinfarction patients treated due to contemporary therapeutical guidelines with a high proportion of patients discharged with a patent infarct related artery <EOS>
<SOS> the diagnostic arsenal of risk parameters comprised heart rate variability baroreflex sensitivity and more traditional markers such as non sustained ventricular tachycardia left ventricular ejection fraction and ventricular late potentials <EOS>
<SOS> patiens were followed for a mean of <NUM> <NUM> <NUM> months <EOS>
<SOS> stepwise logistic regression analysis revealed that left ventricular function both autonomic markers and the patency of the infarct related artery were independent predictors of the prospectively defined primary study endpoint i e all cause mortality plus ventricular tachyarrhythmic events <EOS>
<SOS> with respect to the secondary endpoint ventricular tachyarrhythmic events left ventricular function heart rate variability and infarct vessel patency were independent predictors <EOS>
<SOS> ventricular late potentials and nonsustained ventricular tachycardia had no predictive value with respect to ventricular tachyarrhythmic events <EOS>
<SOS> these findings from a large prospective long term study demonstrate the value of markers of cardiac autonomic tone in identifying infarct survivors at risk for malignant ventricular tachyarrhythmias and sudden death <EOS>
<SOS> k channels and cardiotoxicity of drugs implications for drug toxicity assessment the time required for repolarization of the ventricles can be measured as the qt interval of the ecg and is determined primarily by activation of the delayed rectifier k current ik which consists of a rapid component ikr and a slow component iks <EOS>
<SOS> drugs that block cardiac ikr prolong the cardiac action potential ap <EOS>
<SOS> prolonged repolarization is detected as a longer qt interval on the ecg <EOS>
<SOS> during prolonged aps increased inward currents induce early afterdepolarizations which increase the risk of torsades de pointes tdp cardiac arrhythmias <EOS>
<SOS> tdp arrhythmia is characterized by an apparent twisting of the electrical axis around the isoelectric line <EOS>
<SOS> it has a rate of <NUM> to <NUM> beats min and it can occasionally degenerate into ventricular fibrillation that may be fatal <EOS>
<SOS> the incidence of drug induced tdp arrhythmias is highest among class ia and class ii antiarrhythmic agents <EOS>
<SOS> however under certain clinical conditions also several non cardiovascular medicinal products induce qt interval prolongations in the ecg or tdp arrhythmias <EOS>
<SOS> since all drugs known to cause tdp block ikr an early evaluation of possible effects on aps of cardiac myocytes expressing ikr channels during the developmental phases of novel drugs seems to be recommended <EOS>
<SOS> if in vitro electrophysiological studies show the new active substance to induce ap prolongation and or k channel blockade in appropriate models and at relevant concentrations <NUM> either further development of the new active substance may not be justified or the risk factors predisposing to tdp arrhythmias should be taken into account in further clinical studies <EOS>
<SOS> carcinoma of the penis is a malignant epithelial tumor of ominous prognosis if not adequately treated <EOS>
<SOS> to a large extent the probability of positive lymph nodes is determined by the grade of the primary lesion <EOS>
<SOS> in turn the number of positive nodes greatly influences the survival <EOS>
<SOS> in the past the complications of radical ilioinguinal lymphadenectomy have decreased their timely indication <EOS>
<SOS> if delayed lymphadenectomy is performed the survival rate is reduced by approximately <NUM> as compared to the results of immediate lymphadenectomy <EOS>
<SOS> the modified inguinal lymphadenectomy described by catalona leads to less complications <EOS>
<SOS> if performed without delay it should lead to improved survival in patients with higher stage and high grade penile cancer <EOS>
<SOS> recently suggested employment of adjuvant and neoadjuvant chemotherpy may further enhance the survival <EOS>

<SOS> cryptococcal meningitis is one of the most frequent forms of meningoencephalitis in aids patients <EOS>
<SOS> before the introduction of triazol antibiotics like difluconazole the frequency of this meningitis among aids patients was 5 10 yet declined during the last years <EOS>
<SOS> clinically nonspecific signs of a meningeal inflammation predominate while focal neurological signs are rare <EOS>

<SOS> antimycotics of choice are amphotericin b fluconazole and flucytosin <EOS>

<SOS> during the last years life long secondary prevention with difluconazole was established <EOS>
<SOS> cryptococci which are resistent against fluconazole and amphotericin b are a special challenge yet fortunately are rare <EOS>
<SOS> longterm outcome of patients is determined by the progression of the underlying immunsuppression <EOS>
<SOS> therefore combination of secondary prophylaxis with modern antiviral substances is important <EOS>
<SOS> clinical decision analysis in patients with suspected cryptococcal meningitis is presented using methods from evidence based medicine <EOS>

<SOS> early defibrillation is the standard of care for patients with ventricular fibrillation vf and pulseless ventricular tachycardia vt <EOS>
<SOS> technical developments aim at further miniaturization and simplification of defibrillators as well as adaptation of energy requirements to the patient is needs <EOS>
<SOS> implantable cardioverter defibrillators icd and automated external defibrillators aed are based upon the same technology <EOS>

<SOS> regional perfusion of the lung is not distributed homogeneously within the organ <EOS>
<SOS> this phenomenon has been explained by the classical concept of west et al <EOS>
<SOS> based on the isolated canine lung <EOS>
<SOS> the concept stresses the importance of different gravitational forces along the vertical axis of the lung resulting in three zones in which no pulmonary perfusion zone 1 waterfall like perfusion zone 2 and continuous blood flow zone 3 prevail <EOS>
<SOS> in this article we review recent publications in which observations have been made which cannot be explained by the west model <EOS>
<SOS> a new concept of distribution of regional pulmonary perfusion is presented which centers on vascular factors which are better suited to account for observed blood flow heterogeneities <EOS>
<SOS> the pulmonary vasculature is composed of repetitions of one structural unit the vessel bifurcation <EOS>
<SOS> apart from its size each single bifurcation is similar to all others <EOS>
<SOS> the pulmonary vessel tree can therefore be considered to be self similar <EOS>
<SOS> self similarity has been identified as a design principle of living nature <EOS>
<SOS> self similar objects can produce heterogeneity which is also self similar when viewed at different scales of magnification <EOS>
<SOS> for measurement of the structure of such objects and their function i e in this case the heterogeneity of pulmonary perfusion fractal geometry is best suited <EOS>
<SOS> distribution of blood flow within the lung can be described by means of fractal analysis and all phenomena of perfusion distribution can easily be explained when applying this concept <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore since the basis of fractal analysis is pulmonary vascular anatomy it lends itself for the study of blood flow distribution <EOS>
<SOS> a major advantage is the independence of fractal parameters from resolution of perfusion measurements <EOS>
<SOS> thus fractal analysis can be used to compare results that have been obtained using different resolutions and different species <EOS>
<SOS> fractal methods have previously been used in medicine for other purposes <EOS>

<SOS> very similar methods applied to electrical brain activity have been shown to allow prediction of epileptical seizures approximately <NUM> min prior to appearance of clinical symptoms <EOS>

<SOS> gastric content was aspirated once after intubation <EOS>

<SOS> significance was defined as p0 05 <EOS>

<SOS> the reduction of these parameters after medication was similar <EOS>
<SOS> complete response over <NUM> h was 60 in the ondansetron and 68 in the droperidol group <EOS>

<SOS> vdd single lead systems use floating ring electrodes for atrial sensing <EOS>
<SOS> to ensure an optimal atrial sensing function knowledge of the interactions between electrode design pacemaker amplifier and implantation technique is required <EOS>
<SOS> in this overview technical determinants of atrial sensing concerning atrial ring configuration surface area ring spacing full half ring design of the lead insulation material conductor coil configuration and amplifier design differential amplifier sensing impedance bandpass filter shall be explained and related to determinants at implant av distance site of implantation atrial position intraoperative measurement technique <EOS>
<SOS> 1 ring configuration bipolar atrial full ring systems have proved to be efficient with narrow 5 10mm or wide <MOB>mm ring spacing as well as bipolar half ring systems with dab configuration and narrow ring spacing <EOS>
<SOS> especially in a position close to the atrial wall a wide ring spacing detects a less clear cut signal than a short ring spacing on the other hand with a wide ring spacing sensing is less compromised if the rings move to a worse position further away from the wall <EOS>
<SOS> a narrow ring spacing detects a sharper signal if positioned close to the atrial wall but a considerable reduction of sensed p wave amplitude may result if it moves away from the wall or to an oblique angle relative to the atrial depolarization front <EOS>
<SOS> 2 design of the lead polyurethane as insulation material provides a higher stiffness than silicone insulation <EOS>
<SOS> a coaxial conductor configuration increases stiffness and consequently the possibility to manipulate the atrial part of the lead <EOS>
<SOS> thus if a position close to the atrial wall is desired the combination of a coaxial conductor coil polyurethane insulation and a narrow ring spacing seems most promising <EOS>
<SOS> 3 amplifier design for atrial sensing in vdd systems bipolar sensing differential amplifier high sensing impedance 2k and a wide bandpass filter e g <MOB>hz should be realized <EOS>
<SOS> especially the inclusion of a relatively low frequency range <MOB>hz is important because compared to a fixed atrial electrode a higher quantity of the atrial signal sensed by a floating electrode is in the low frequency range <EOS>
<SOS> 4 implantation to choose the best fitting electrode a preoperative assessment of the size of the right cardiac cavities should be performed <EOS>
<SOS> a position of the ring electrodes in the mid to high right atrium parallel to the lateral wall should be the goal <EOS>
<SOS> correct interpretation of the sensed p wave amplitude and prediction of sufficient sensing after connection with the pacemaker is only possible with exact knowledge of the measurement technique of the intraoperative pacing system analyzer and the connected permanent pacemaker device bandpass filter signal peak to baseline or peak to peak <EOS>
<SOS> attention should be paid to the fixation of the electrode at the site of insertion to avoid postoperative dislocation of the ring electrodes <EOS>
<SOS> knowledge of different electrode pacemaker specific parameters and special aspects at implantation is a prerequisite for optimal function of vdd single lead systems <EOS>
<SOS> preoperatively considerations should concern the choice of the electrode av distance ring spacing and implantation strategy position close to or rather apart from the atrial wall <EOS>
<SOS> an atrial position may only be accepted if sufficient sensing can be documented with a measuring method similar to that of the implanted pacemaker <EOS>

<SOS> recurrent abdominal pain rap is one of the most common pain syndromes in childhood with prevalence rates ranging from <NUM> to 20 in all school age children <EOS>
<SOS> in nearly 50 the complaints persist over many years of their life span to adolescence or adulthood <EOS>
<SOS> although the empirical findings have increased in the last decade our knowledge about the etiology pathogenesis and pathophysiology is still very limited <EOS>
<SOS> current approaches suggest that we understand recurrent pain syndromes as a complex and multidimensional disturbance biopsychosocial paradigm <EOS>
<SOS> in this respect there is strong evidence for the major importance of psychosocial causes daily hassles specific life events psychopathological factors anxiety depression somatization disorder and social environmental influences mother is psychopathology social modelling reinforcement in the pathogenesis of functional abdominal pain <EOS>
<SOS> the noticeable correlation with other pain syndromes and functional disturbances indicates that recurrent pain may possibly be a manifestation of a basic somatization disorder <EOS>

<SOS> psychological treatment requires a medical examination to exclude organic origins <EOS>
<SOS> some of these invasive diagnostic procedures can be very difficult expensive and distressing for the child <EOS>

<SOS> the psychological interventions applied in clinical practice include prophylaxis reduction of pain symptoms and environmental modification <EOS>

<SOS> although preliminary data on the use of these behavioural medicine programs have shown some promise further investigations are needed to examine the applicability and effectiveness of specific interventions in the treatment of abdominal pain symptoms <EOS>

<SOS> auditory similarities in voices of monozygotic twins have already been described in the literature <EOS>
<SOS> however is there a clinical relevance <EOS>
<SOS> thus the present study was designed to identify parameters of vocal performance and acoustic features which are significantly more similar in monozygotic twins than in non related persons <EOS>
<SOS> in our hypothesis comparable prerequisites for an increased vocal load in a profession or in an artistic education of the voice could be due to these similarities <EOS>
<SOS> we compared intra pair differences with data from a control group <EOS>
<SOS> moreover we examined the correlation of intra pair differences with the age of the monozygotic twins <EOS>
<SOS> a greater difference in older twin pairs than in younger pairs could show the effect of an exogene influence <EOS>
<SOS> in addition to the few phoniatric studies in twins in the literature we used current methods for acoustic analysis <EOS>
<SOS> we examined seven parameters of vocal performance and three acoustic features in <NUM> monozygotic twin pairs median age <NUM> years range 18 75 years and compared them with <NUM> control group pairs which consisted of non related persons of the same age and sex newly combined from the group of monozygotic twins statistical twins <EOS>
<SOS> we found significant differences in seven of ten parameters vocal range highest and lowest vocal fundamental frequency fundamental speaking frequency maximum voice intensity number of partials vibrato of intensity u test by mann whitney <EOS>
<SOS> no correlation of the differences of the identical twins with age was found in the examined parameters <EOS>
<SOS> the voices of identical twins are significantly more similar than those of non related persons regarding the above mentioned features <EOS>
<SOS> thus the suitability of the voices of monozygotic twins for professions with a high demand on voice is comparable <EOS>
<SOS> results of the group comparison correlate largely with the literature <EOS>
<SOS> the missing correlation with age could be due to the fact that the environmental effects were not measurable and or the development of the voice is more influenced by genetic effects <EOS>

<SOS> the vascular organization of human spermatic cord was analyzed by means of injection and by casting preparation of the testicular artery and veins of the pampiniform plexus after orchiectomy <EOS>
<SOS> after leaving the human testis the testicular veins are organized in two main groups and form two vein plexus <EOS>
<SOS> one of these vein groups forms a tight plexus around the testicular artery <EOS>
<SOS> computer aided 3 d reconstructions based on the paraffin serial sections of the human spermatic cord allowed us to demonstrate the relation between the blood vessels and the other tissue structures of the spermatic cord <EOS>
<SOS> the results obtained allowed us to subdivide the human spermatic cord into three compartments <EOS>
<SOS> the dorsomedial compartment contains the vas deferens and its blood vessels <EOS>
<SOS> the middle compartment contains the testicular artery and the vein group which forms a tight plexus around this artery <EOS>
<SOS> the ventrolateral compartment contains a vein group which shows no topographic relation to the testicular artery <EOS>
<SOS> this vein group is embedded in a large macroscopically visible volume of fatty tissue <EOS>
<SOS> to be sure of sparing the testicular artery during antegrade sclerotherapy this vein group should be prepared <EOS>

<SOS> the hemodynamic treatment of septic shock consists of fluid repletion maintenance of an adequate cardiac output and restoration of mean arterial pressure <EOS>
<SOS> norepinephrine is a potent vasopressor that can be considered when the patient is adequately fluid resuscitated when cardiac output is greater than <NUM> l min m2 or sv o2 65 and when blood pressure remains low <EOS>
<SOS> the objective is to achieve and maintain a mean arterial pressure of 60 70 mmhg or more in some patients older or hypertensive patients <EOS>
<SOS> renal effects of norepinephrine were evaluated in several studies urine output creatinine clearance and osmolar clearance are significantly increased <EOS>
<SOS> norepinephrine is perfectly suited in situations of high renal output and low renal resistance as is the case in septic shock patients <EOS>
<SOS> the effect on oxygen transport is unpredictable <EOS>
<SOS> the effects on lactate concentrations were poorly evaluated but several studies suggest that the drug does not worsen and can even improve tissue oxygenation of septic shock patients <EOS>
<SOS> provided that cardiac output is maintained treatment with norepinephrine is without negative effects on splanchnic tissue oxygenation <EOS>
<SOS> in conclusion the clinical experience with norepinephrine strongly suggests that this drug can successfully increase blood pressure without deteriorating cardiac output and organ function <EOS>
<SOS> whether using norepinephrine in septic shock patients effects mortality as compared to dopamine or epinephrine still requires a prospective study <EOS>

<SOS> gamma hydroxybutyric acid ghb is a naturally occurring transmitter in the mammalian brain related to sleep regulation and possibly to energy balance in diving or hibernating animals <EOS>
<SOS> it has been used for almost <NUM> years as an intravenous agent for induction of anaesthesia and for long term sedation <EOS>
<SOS> its convincing pharmacological properties without serious adresse effects on circulation or respiration are compromised by its unpredictable duration of action <EOS>
<SOS> this is not a major problem with long term sedation during icu treatment <EOS>
<SOS> ghb has been used with good results for sedation of patients with severe brain injury where it compares favourably with barbiturates <EOS>
<SOS> in animal studies it seems to possess a protective action against hypoxia on a cellular and whole organ level <EOS>
<SOS> however in some experimental animals ghb has been shown to produce seizure like activities and the compound is being used to produce absence like seizures <EOS>
<SOS> ghb has been used in our icu for years to provide adequate sedation for patients under controlled ventilation or for patients figthing the respirator during spontaneous respiration <EOS>
<SOS> no serious side effects were observed in these patients while in some patients under haemodialysis hypernatraemia and metabolic alkalosis developed both were reversible after discontinuation of ghb and restriction of additional sodium input somsanit the commercially available ghb preparation in germany contains <NUM> mmol sodium g the daily dose averages 20 40 g ghb i e <EOS>

<SOS> the injustice of corruption is an irregular exchange between performing one is duty and benefits <EOS>
<SOS> according to this an enterprise may give funds to a scientist for research purposes if no counter performance exceeding the research is associated with this <EOS>
<SOS> however it makes a difference if the scientist has to show his appreciation by influencing economic decisions of the clinic in favor of the enterprise <EOS>
<SOS> in case of such an injustice it is under the new law no longer important if the benefit is destined for the scientist himself or for another person or organization <EOS>
<SOS> thus it is in the interest of both research and industry to avoid the suspicion of corruption in the first place <EOS>
<SOS> a prerequisite for this is the strict observance of the legal and administrative regulations concerning projects financed by third party funds <EOS>

<SOS> paragangliomas of the glomus caroticum are relatively rare but highly vascularized neoplasmas which develop from chemoreceptors <EOS>
<SOS> they can be develop at anyage but most often in the third or fourth decade of life <EOS>
<SOS> paragangliomas grow very slowly and are most always of benign origin <EOS>
<SOS> there is a familial predisposition and an autosomal dominant transmission is presumed <EOS>
<SOS> they are commonly located in the jugular region in rare cases a polytopic manifestation is found <EOS>
<SOS> we describe the case of a 47 year old male patient who was referred to our department because of a progressive swelling of the neck on both sides <EOS>
<SOS> contrast enhanced computed tomography had displayed soft tissue tumors in the jugular regions <EOS>
<SOS> we performed an operative exploration which showed a highly vascularized tumor <EOS>
<SOS> histopathologic analysis revealed the diagnosis of a paraganglioma <EOS>
<SOS> an angiography of the neck and thoracic region furthermore revealed an additional paraganglioma in the anterior mediastinum <EOS>
<SOS> using a surgical approach via lateral cervicotomies and thoracotomy the paragangliomas were extirpated <EOS>
<SOS> our case report demonstrates the rare polytopic manifestation of paragangliomas <EOS>
<SOS> this perivascular neoplasms have to be removed before haemodynamic complications develop <EOS>
<SOS> the extent of this tumors is clearly illustrated by use of an angiography <EOS>
<SOS> because of the familial predisposition clinical and radiological examinations of relatives are mandatory <EOS>
<SOS> in more than <NUM> years of development of intensive care medicine icm our speciality has acquired moral and ethical standpoints although not without public pressure and discussions <EOS>
<SOS> special commissions dealing e g with brain death terminal care ethics of foregoing life sustaining treatment in the critically ill withholding or withdrawing mechanical ventilation and other issues have meen formed in a number of medical societies <EOS>
<SOS> international consensus conferences have helped to clarify some of the issues <EOS>
<SOS> with increasing experience a multitude of ethical problems have arisen in icm that have to be dealt with such as the issue of quality of life <EOS>
<SOS> what is an unworthy life <EOS>
<SOS> are we allowed to make judgments for our patients <EOS>
<SOS> what is cost effectiveness in icm <EOS>
<SOS> other restrictions include bed and equipment shortages in the intensive care unit icu the necessity for triage undisputed in catastrophe medicine and how one should proceed in managing elective patients <EOS>
<SOS> in situations of limited icu bed availability sicker patients will be admitted sparing out patients who are less ill for observation and those with poor quality of life and poor prognosis <EOS>
<SOS> for the future it will likely be necessary to define the patients who should be admitted to an icu more than those who should not be admitted <EOS>
<SOS> an icu treatment entitlement index would be directly proportional to the probability of successful outcome and the quality of the remaining life and would be inversely related to costs for achieving success <EOS>
<SOS> the icu outcome with survival hospital mortality and follow up of icu patients is considered <EOS>
<SOS> dnr do not resuscitate the dying patient terminal care terminal weaning dnt do not treat active and passive euthanasia living wills quality of life and cost effectiveness for icu patients are defined <EOS>
<SOS> their application in the icu will be discussed and problems pointed out <EOS>
<SOS> outcome predictions using scores apache ii saps ii mpm have been developed based on previous experience but should only be applied to patient groups and for quality assurance in icus <EOS>
<SOS> the most frequent and difficult problem in the icu is the vegetative state which requires an exact diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> the differential diagnosis from other comatose states such as coma brain death and locked in syndrome is depicted <EOS>
<SOS> the ethics of interrupting life sustaining treatment in critically ill patients have been worked out by a task force on ethics of the society of critical care medicine 1990 <EOS>
<SOS> a consensus was found that the patient may judge to forego therapy ethically it is then appropriate to withhold or withdraw therapy <EOS>
<SOS> according to the consensus withdrawing an already initiated treatment should not necessarily be regarded as more problematic than a decision not to initiate treatment <EOS>
<SOS> in my mind however there is a great difference between withdrawing or withholding e g ventilation <EOS>
<SOS> a dissentive opinion by some members of the task force stated that hydration and nutrition other than high technology or parenteral nutrition are key components of patient care and should not be equated with medical intervention <EOS>
<SOS> the ethical problems associated with active euthanasia physician assisted suicide or death as practised in the netherlands are also discussed <EOS>
<SOS> in most countries this practice seems unacceptable <EOS>
<SOS> from <NUM> years experience in icm there are many more ethical questions and case reports without clear solutions <EOS>
<SOS> care decisions for single patients in unacceptable situations should be made after medical evaluation by the intensivist with the medical team and if possible by the patient and or his or her surrogate <EOS>
<SOS> legislation and solutions cannot be expected for single patients but ethics committees could be helpful in decision making <EOS>

<SOS> the principle of photodynamic therapy pdt for rheumatoid arthritis consists in specifically concentrating a drug photosensitizer in the synovium <EOS>
<SOS> subsequent activation of the photosensitizer by means of a laser leads to a cytotoxic effect <EOS>
<SOS> the practicability of pdt was tested in an animal model of igg induced arthritis in rabbits <EOS>
<SOS> photosan 3 5 aminolevulinic acid and bpd ma were administered intraarticularly or intravenously <EOS>
<SOS> in this model concentration of the photosensitizer in the synovial lining cells the lymphoid infiltrate and the skin was seen <EOS>
<SOS> after laser irradiation a selective demarcation and destruction of the synovium by prior administration of photosan 3 not constant by bpd ma and without therapeutic effect by 5 aminolevulinic acid was observed <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast bradytrophic tissues such as cartilage meniscus and ligament structures were changed neither macroscopically nor microscopically in all series <EOS>
<SOS> pdt thus offers ideal preconditions for minimal invasive treatment of chronic inflammatory joint diseases because of its selectivity and efficacy <EOS>
<SOS> photodynamic laser therapy can be considered a new method in the surgical treatment of inflammatory disease of the synovial membrane <EOS>

<SOS> enlargement of the prostate is an age related physiological process that is unique in human tissue <EOS>
<SOS> the prostate gland is the most common site of neoplastic disorders in men <EOS>
<SOS> despite the growing impact of the various prostate diseases in terms of morbidity and mortality the pathogenesis of benign prostate hyperplasia bph and prostate cancer remains poorly understood <EOS>
<SOS> this reflects the complex composition of the gland with different anatomic cellular and functional compartments that are differentially involved in benign and malignant disease processes <EOS>
<SOS> the present review summarizes new concepts on the morphogenesis of normal and abnormal growth in the human prostate <EOS>
<SOS> there is increasing evidence that prostatic stem cells are located in the basal cell layer that is basically involved in normal growth and the development of glandular hyperplasia and prostate cancer <EOS>
<SOS> high grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia is considered the most likely precursor of clinically important cancer of the peripheral zone <EOS>
<SOS> severe differentiation and proliferation abnormalities occur during malignant transformation of the prostatic epithelium <EOS>
<SOS> these premalignant changes are associated with abnormal expression of growth factor receptors oncogene and suppressor gene products and genetic instability <EOS>
<SOS> during the process of stromal invasion the transformed cells lose their basal cell phenotype and produce basement mem brane like matrices <EOS>
<SOS> common prostate cancer is mainly composed of exocrine cell types that remain androgen responsive even in hormone independent disease <EOS>
<SOS> the frequent occurrence of neuroendocrine differentiation in common prostate cancer reflects the differentiation potency of its stem cells <EOS>
<SOS> the endocrine phenotype derives from exocrine tumor cells via intermediate amphicrine cell types <EOS>
<SOS> neuroendocrine tumor cells consistently lack the nuclear androgen receptor and represent an androgen insensitive cell population in prostate cancer <EOS>

<SOS> it is therefore very useful for detecting alcoholism and controlling compliance of alcohol withdrawal <EOS>

<SOS> apoptosis or programmed cell death plays an essential role in specific cell deletion during normal embryonal and adult development <EOS>
<SOS> apoptotic cells are characterized by fragmentation of nuclear dna and formation of apoptotic bodies <EOS>
<SOS> molecular genetic analysis has revealed the involvement of several deaths and survival genes that are regulated by extracellular and intracellular factors <EOS>
<SOS> there are multiple inducers and inhibitors which interact with target cellspecific receptors and transduce signals involved in cellular proliferation cell cycle progression and programmed cell death <EOS>
<SOS> the elimination of tumor cell populations by applying lethal doses of chemotherapeutic agents or radiation is a well established strategy in cancer therapy <EOS>
<SOS> although improved cytotoxic chemo and radiotherapy regimens are available the efficacy of these strategies is still disappointing with regard to many solid tumors <EOS>
<SOS> better understanding of the molecular mechanism of apoptosis including death genes death signals receptors and signal transduction pathways will provide new approaches in the development of strategies to regulate malignant cell survival and death <EOS>
<SOS> recent discoveries in the field of apoptotic cell death promise to have a significant impact on antitumor therapies <EOS>
<SOS> apoptosis is known to be an active process which can be artificially manipulated by several molecular pathways <EOS>
<SOS> this information concerning the regulation and induction of programmed cell death might lead among otherthings to the development of new powerful means to eliminate malignant cell populations of otherwise resistant genitourinary tumors such as prostate cancer <EOS>
<SOS> we report on a 63 year old female patient with muir torre syndrome mts <EOS>
<SOS> in the course of this disease two carcinomas of the colon a kerato acanthoma and multiple sebaceous gland tumours including four sebaceous gland tumours including four sebaceous carcinomas appeared <EOS>
<SOS> this case is thought to be a heriditary form as one of daughters was also found to have a sebaceous epithelioma <EOS>
<SOS> mts is a mostly autosomal dominant disease with the association of sebaceous gland tumours and internal carcinomas <EOS>
<SOS> as the malignant tumours only show slight aggressiveness the prognosis is quite favourable <EOS>
<SOS> oral isotretinoin therapy was successfully used for the inhibition of sebaceous gland proliferation <EOS>
<SOS> a narrower definition is presented and an updated survey of the published cases is given <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore the histopathologic peculiarities of sebaceous gland tumours especially of sebaceous gland carcinomas are discussed and compared to sebaceous gland tumours not connected with mts <EOS>
<SOS> a total number of <NUM> of the <NUM> published cases of mts were included and analysed regarding sebaceous gland tumours and other skin tumours <EOS>
<SOS> the data on internal carcinomas were taken from the work of cohen et al <EOS>
<SOS> 1991 and <NUM> current cases were added <EOS>
<SOS> the rapid development of modern endovascular microsurgical and radiation therapies has considerably expanded the treatment options for encephalic arteriovenous malformations avms <EOS>
<SOS> surgery has the longest history <EOS>
<SOS> single or staged intravascular procedures embolizations using fast acting glues sclerotic agents and thrombogenic coils serve to reduce the size of avm to that suitable for extirpation and may reduce the risk of surgery <EOS>
<SOS> radiation gamma knife therapy most frequently used in small non operable avms is also viewed by some authors as an alternative or even superior tool in small operable malformations <EOS>
<SOS> partial embolization to reduce the mass effect of space occupying avms to reverse diaschisis and to treat avm related seizure disorders is being discussed and practiced <EOS>
<SOS> given the in part competing or even controversial options the selection of optimal treatment for avm patients is becoming increasingly difficult <EOS>
<SOS> current management is impeded by the paucity of information on the exact risks of invasive therapies and by insufficient criteria for identifying patients at risk of spontaneous bleeding during the natural course including the seriousness of such hemorrhage <EOS>
<SOS> a new all in one sensing device was developed for continuous transtracheal intraoperative monitoring and in situ detection of the recurrent laryngeal nerve rln during thyroid surgery <EOS>
<SOS> patients and methods the new system is based on a double balloon endotracheal tube with integrated atraumatic stimulating and tracing electrodes <EOS>
<SOS> the recurrent laryngeal nerve is stimulated transtracheally and compound action potentials are recorded from the laryngeal muscles <EOS>
<SOS> fifty five patients were introduced into a phase one clinical trial <EOS>
<SOS> thirty five patients with primary thyroid operations <NUM> patients with reoperations <NUM> of whom had neck dissections <EOS>
<SOS> all patients were evaluated laryngoscopically and phoniatrically by an ent specialist before and after surgery <EOS>
<SOS> results compound muscle action potentials were recorded continuously during the whole operation and responded sensitively to tension and pressure to the nerve <EOS>
<SOS> there were no accidental permanent rln palsies <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion the new system offers five advantages 1 it is atraumatic 2 it is easy to use 3 it can monitor continuously with an audio feedback to the surgeon 4 it works outside the operation field and 5 it is highly sensitive even indicating reversible irritation to the nerve <EOS>
<SOS> the diagnosis of primary malignant bone tumors which only account for 1 of malignancies in humans represents quite a challange for the pathologist <EOS>
<SOS> apart from the often overlapping morphology between different entities heterogeneity within one and the same tumor has to be kept in mind <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore in most cases the diagnosis must be established based on small biopsy specimens and occasionally even on frozen sections <EOS>
<SOS> in this context detailed clinical information including the patient is age and exact localization of the tumor as depicted by x ray or mri are essential requirements for a correct diagnosis <EOS>
<SOS> in addition multiple biopsies from different tumor sites may be of help <EOS>
<SOS> for example 25 of osteogenic sarcomas osa are chondroplastic <EOS>
<SOS> others may contain areas similar to fibrosarcoma fsa or malignant fibrous histiocytoma mfh <EOS>
<SOS> since 90 of osa occur in the second decade of life whereas chondrosarcomas fsa and mfh usually manifest after the age of <NUM> years a biopsy solely composed of malignant chondromatous tissue obtained from a tibial lesion of a 10 year old child should most likely be considered as part of an osa <EOS>
<SOS> in the differential diagnosis of the so called small round cell tumors which include ewing sarcoma malignant lymphoma and small cell osa immunohistochemical staining of the paraffin embedded material and a molecular biological genetic work up of frozen material are most helpful <EOS>
<SOS> in this paper the histomorphological characteristics and criteria for differential diagnosis of the most common primary malignant bone tumors are discussed <EOS>
<SOS> the care of the patient after primary treatment is very important for both tumor control and patientsi compliance <EOS>
<SOS> the aim of this care concept should be the early detection of local recurrences so as to have better secondary treatment maybe cure options <EOS>
<SOS> if expensive diagnostics are needed to get this information it is reasonable to order them <EOS>
<SOS> if there is no benefit for the patient regarding survival or with respect to quality of life clinical anamnesis and examination should be preferred <EOS>

<SOS> shampoos have primarily been products aimed at cleansing the hair and scalp <EOS>

<SOS> in industrialized countries the rate of sudden cardiac death remains unchanged <EOS>
<SOS> the most frequently encountered structural heart disease in these patients is coronary artery disease <EOS>
<SOS> despite the era of thrombolytic therapy of acute myocardial infarction patients carry an increased risk of sudden cardiac arrhythmogenic death within a time period of one to two years following the acute event <EOS>
<SOS> therefore risk stratification post mi before patient discharge is furthermore mandatory <EOS>
<SOS> dysphagia is related to the impairment of food passage from the mouth to the stomach <EOS>
<SOS> globus pharyngis implies the frequent and often painful sensation of a lump in the throat that usually does not interfere with swallowing and may even be relieved by food intake <EOS>
<SOS> the diagnosis is based upon a careful history clinical examination endoscopy dynamic imaging videofluoroscopy cinematography videosonography and electrophysiologic procedures including pharyngoesophageal manometry electromyography and ph determinations <EOS>
<SOS> structural lesions of the cervical spine such as diffuse idiopathic skeletal hyperostosis are rare causes of dysphagia <EOS>
<SOS> dysphagia following anterior cervical fusion as well as globus and dysphonia due to dysfunction of the vertebral joints are more likely <EOS>
<SOS> symptoms with swallowing fluids indicate a neurogenic origin <EOS>
<SOS> dyscoordinated swallowing nasal reflux dysphonia or general weakness may also occur <EOS>
<SOS> chronic aspiration with respiratory compromize is the main consequence in a variety of neurological disorders as well as in cases of postsurgical dysphagia <EOS>
<SOS> relaxation of the upper esophageal sphincter indicates coordinated muscle movement between the pharynx and esophagus <EOS>
<SOS> dysfunction of the pharyngoesophageal segment may lead to cricopharyngeal achalasia <EOS>
<SOS> a dyskinetic sphincter commonly represents an extrapharyngeal cause i e disease associated with gastroesophageal reflux <EOS>
<SOS> disorders of the esophageal phase of deglutition can produce retrosternal pain heartburn regurgitation and vomiting as well as laryngeal and respiratory signs <EOS>
<SOS> esophageal motility disorders include lower achalasia tumors peptic strictures inflammatory diseases drug induced ulcers rings and webs <EOS>
<SOS> motility disorders present with aperistaltic spontaneous contractions diffuse esophagospasm or a hypermotile esophagus <EOS>
<SOS> gastroesophageal reflux with esophagitis must always be excluded especially in patients with a globus sensation <EOS>
<SOS> the multiple features of the appearance of the symptoms of dysphagia and globus makes multidisciplinary approach necessary in order to establish a diagnosis and begin effective treatment <EOS>
<SOS> different pest arthropods and dermatophytes occurring primarily in farm animals may be transmissible to man and produce human dermatoses <EOS>
<SOS> the movement and cutaneous penetration habits of external parasites often cause crusted papules severe itching and dermatitis or may damage their hosts by blood sucking or by sensitizing them to their saliva <EOS>
<SOS> furthermore different dermatophytes should be considered a possible cause of human skin lesions <EOS>
<SOS> farm animals cattle pig poultry and rabbit can transmit external parasites ticks ixodes ricinus argas reflexus fleas ceratophyllus gallinae spilopsyllus cuniculi and mites sarcoptes scabiei var <EOS>
<SOS> bovis sarcoptes scabiei var <EOS>
<SOS> suis dermanyssus gallinae cheyletiella parasitovorax and dermatophytes trichophyton sp and microsporum sp <EOS>
<SOS> people who have close contact to infested farm animals are more often exposed to epizoonotic infections <EOS>
<SOS> certain professions such as farmers and veterinarians are especially vulnerable <EOS>

<SOS> immunologial complications frequently occur during the clinical course in patients with multiple injuries <EOS>
<SOS> the increased release of pro inflammatory mediators during the immunological response to trauma may lead to the systemic inflammatory response syndrome sirs and furthermore to multisystem organ failure mof which is associated with a mortality of up to 80 <EOS>
<SOS> the development of multiple organ failure following major trauma is associated with remote organ failure the dysfunction of organs which were not initially affected by the traum <EOS>
<SOS> this manuscript reviews recent data in experimental trauma research and offers a more detailed evaluation of the immunological findings in trauma patients <EOS>
<SOS> in particular the role of pro and anti inflammatory cytokines in the development or sirs mof and rof is discussed <EOS>
<SOS> despite the enormous progress in clinical immunology and the available data on trauma induced immune dysfunction a large number of questions still remain to be answered before the immunological alterations following severe trauma can be beneficially influenced by immunomodulatory therapeutic efforts <EOS>

<SOS> a case of delayed death after a low voltage accident is presented <EOS>
<SOS> at first an obvious source of electricity was not found <EOS>
<SOS> however electric marks were found on the fingers <EOS>
<SOS> the identification of the conductor was performed by analysis of the metallisation of the electric marks <EOS>
<SOS> the location of the probable conductors in a boiler under the hand basin and the discovery in a standing position prior to collapse in a bathtub indicates that the capability to act was preserved for a short time period <EOS>
<SOS> in such rare cases death seems to be a result of cardiac arrhythmia resulting in ventricular fibrillation <EOS>
<SOS> a 53 year old man presented a melanotic lung tumor which was based in the bronchus of the left lower lobe and closed the left main bronchus <EOS>
<SOS> after laser therapy left lobectomy with sleeve resection was carried out <EOS>
<SOS> complications after the surgery required resection of the rest of the left lung and thoracoplasty <EOS>
<SOS> based on the histological and immunohistochemical findings the tumor was classified as a malignant melanoma <EOS>
<SOS> there was no past history of an excision or a fulguration of a cutaneous mucous membrane or ocular lesion <EOS>
<SOS> examination of the skin and the eyes did not yield any evidence of another primary tumor <EOS>
<SOS> we conclude that the lesion represents a primary malignant melanoma of the respiratory tract a rare neoplasm of which only <NUM> cases have been confirmed <EOS>
<SOS> the patient does not have any evidence of tumor in the relatively short follow up period of <NUM> months <EOS>
<SOS> background to find out the incidence of spontaneous pubertal development in girls with turner syndrome we investigated patients with a bone age of at least eleven years <EOS>
<SOS> results <NUM> out of <NUM> patients showed spontaneous puberty <EOS>
<SOS> there exists no clear correlation between karyotype and phenotype on the one hand and incidence of spontaneous puberty on the other <EOS>
<SOS> basal as well as stimulated gonadotropin levels in the late childhood could better indicate spontaneous puberty in turner syndrome <EOS>
<SOS> conclusion in contrast to the generally held opinion spontaneous pubertal development is not rare in girls with turner syndrome <EOS>
<SOS> therefore estrogen replacement therapy should be started only after it became certain that there will be no spontaneous puberty <EOS>

<SOS> hypertrophic cardiomyopathy is a disorder which primarily affected the myocardium <EOS>
<SOS> it is characterized by a hypertrophic left ventricle that shows normal systolic function but impaired diastolic relaxation <EOS>
<SOS> the most important complication of hcm sudden cardiac death is mainly responsible for a mortality of approximately 3 5 in childhood <EOS>
<SOS> while most patients remain asymptomatic for years there are some reports about patients progressing from hypertrophic cardiomyopathy to a dilative form within years <EOS>
<SOS> a prospective study was performed on <NUM> patients with osteochondritis dissecans od of the knee and ankle to compare plane radiography mri and arthroscopy before therapeutic procedures <EOS>
<SOS> special interest was placed on the assessment of fragment stability with radiological methods for staging related therapy <EOS>
<SOS> od was localized in <NUM> cases on the femoral condyle and in <NUM> cases on the talus <EOS>
<SOS> radiological methods were performed simultaneously and shortly before definite arthroscopical therapy <EOS>
<SOS> using conventional radiography od of the condyles was staged according to the classification of rodegerdts and gleissner and od of the talus suggested by berndt and harty <EOS>
<SOS> mri staging was performed by morphology of the interface of the od <EOS>
<SOS> arthroscopical staging based on the classification of guhl <EOS>
<SOS> there was an excellent correlation between the stages in mri and arthroscopy showing correct prediction of stable and unstable fragments in 92 <EOS>
<SOS> in contrast fragment stability could not be efficiently assessed by conventional radiology because fragments could be stably fixed in cases of bony separation <EOS>
<SOS> mri is indicated before performance of staging related therapy of od to select patients with stable fragments for conservative therapy and those with unstable od for surgical therapy <EOS>

<SOS> ct revealed a diagnosis of diaphragmatic rupture with intrathoracic liver dislocation <EOS>
<SOS> the liver was replaced and the extended dorsal diaphragmatic rupture was closed primarily via an abdominal approach <EOS>
<SOS> problems of diagnosis and operative procedure in rare cases of fresh right sided blunt traumatic diaphragmatic ruptures are discussed <EOS>
